description: The Gospel According to Tolkien, A public lecture exploring the Christian themes and allegorical meanings within J.R.R. Tolkien's epic fantasy, The Lord of the Rings. Discover how his deep faith influenced his world-building, characters, and narrative arcs. This is a fascinating and insightful talk for fans of Tolkien and students of theology alike.

description:
'TONES OF SILENCE' - FUTUNA CHAPEL IN B&W - PUBLIC TALKS, ‘TONES of SILENCE’ – FUTUNA CHAPEL in BLACK and WHITE
PUBLIC TALKS START AT 2:00PM
The Trust looks forward to welcoming architects, designers, graduates, students and interested members of the public to attend this event and support the Trust in its work
Sunday 19th October.  Talks by Catherine Hammond and John Walsh
Sunday 2nd November. Talks by Malcolm Doidge and John Grace
BOOKINGS ARE PREFERRED TO ATTEND THIS EVENT
PRESENTERS
Catherine Hammond - Director Collections and Research, Auckland Museum
John Walsh – Writer – Walking Guides (Christchurch, Auckland, Wellington) 
John Grace – commercial lawyer and amateur B&W photographer
Dr. Malcolm Doidge - sculptor, video artist, photographer
CATHERINE HAMMOND - SUNDAY 18TH OCTOBER
Catherine Hammond is Director of Collections and Research at Auckland War Memorial Museum Tāmaki Paenga Hira, has worked in leadership roles in the arts and cultural sector in Aotearoa New Zealand for over two decades including Hocken Librarian at the University of Otago, and Research Library Manager at Auckland Art Gallery Toi o Tāmaki. Catherine is a trained librarian and published writer, editor, and curator, and has led the development of award-winning cultural heritage websites. Her research interests centre around the intersection of archives and Aotearoa art histories. She is Chair of the Guardians Kaitiaki of Alexander Turnbull Library and a Trustee of UNESCO Memory of the World Aotearoa New Zealand.
 Title of Catherine's talk
A Thousand Words: Photographic Archives in Aotearoa
Catherine will discuss the recent book and touring exhibition, A Different Light: First Photographs of Aotearoa and the role and impact of photographic archives as sites of research.
JOHN WALSH - SUNDAY 18TH OCTOBER
John Walsh is a leading New Zealand architecture writer. He edited Architecture New Zealand magazine for a decade, and has written numerous books on New Zealand architecture, among them the newly revised Auckland Architecture: A Walking Guide, which features photographs by Patrick Reynolds. (taken from AUCKLAND WRITERS FESTIVAL website)
JOHN GRACE - SUNDAY 2ND NOVEMBER
A selection of John's photographs make up the exhibition and he will also present a public talk about the photos, the vintage camera and equipment he uses, the history of photography and cameras used.
"Experiencing the chapel means interacting with it. From a photographic point of view, that means interacting optically and chemically to turn a solid, three-dimensional art form into a two-dimensional interpretation made up of tones of black, white and grey." John Grace - email- 18/06/25
DR. MALCOLM DOIDGE - SUNDAY 2ND NOVEMBER
Dr. Malcolm Doidge undertook a 360 time-lapse photography in the Chapel interior during the equinoxes and solstices of 2023 - 2024.  He produced a 2 – 3minute video of the timelapse project and this will be screened in the Chapel as part of the exhibition.  Malcolm will also give a presentation of his work and explore the digital processes involved in its production. He is an interdisciplinary sculptor and spatial designer. He uses digital time lapse and photogrammetry images for film poetry.
The Futuna Trust is a charitable organisation and all koha received from the exhibition events will go towards the ongoing care, maintenance and operation of Futuna Chapel and also to support various initiatives undertaken by the Trust.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
2:22 A Ghost Story, 2:22 A Ghost Story
Do You Believe in Ghosts?

In a rapidly gentrifying part of London, a married couple are renovating their new home. But something strange and frightening can be heard at the same time every night. What forces have they disturbed? Jenny has become convinced the house is haunted. Husband Sam isn’t having a bar of it. Tension builds throughout a housewarming dinner with friends as the clock ticks closer to 2:22… when a shocking truth will be revealed.

📣 “Sharp, quick, and cleverly layered with clues – a thunderous fright night.” - The Guardian

Spine-chillingly funny, scary and filled with suspense, Join us for the New Zealand premiere of Danny Robin's West-End smash hit, directed by stage and screen legend Peter Feeney. Starring the unparalleled talents of:

⭐ Regan Taylor
⭐ Pamela Sidhu
⭐ Jack Sergent-Shadbolt
⭐ Serena Cotton

With otherworldly design by Chris Reddington, Marcus McShane, Daniel Elliott and Shiloh Dobie, 2:22 A Ghost Story is set to be the most spook-tacular event of the year! BOOK NOW!

2:22 A GHOST STORY
🗓️ 13 Sep - 11 Oct | Preview 12 Sep
⏰ Tues – Thurs 6.30pm, Fri – Sat 8.00pm, Sun 4pm
📍Circa One

Bookings:
1 Taranaki Street, Wellington, 04 801 7992
Circa.co.nz

description:
Gin and Clay emerald green and turquoise blue wall art, Gin and Clay emerald green and turquoise blue wall art
FULLY BOOKED. This event is now full and I am running another magical blue tile and gin workshop on November 15! (Link to book: )

Or if you'd like to go on a waitlist for this one please contact me: . ❤️

A fabulous and fun workshop that combines creativity and gin tasting for a unique experience.

Create one stunning large wall art piece or two smaller pieces that will be fired and glazed in either a striking emerald green or a vibrant blue around 5 weeks after the session, making it perfect for displaying in your home or as a thoughtful gift.

Alongside that sip 3 delicious Gin samples from the Bond Store distillery where we will be working.

My clay classes are suitable for complete beginners or those with experience and are a wonderful way to relax, replenish and have fun.

Working with clay is good for the soul! Immersing in a gentle creative activity helps to switch off a busy mind, and making tiles is fun and achievable even if this is your first time using clay.

All materials are provided so all you need to do is turn up ready to have some fun and creativity.

Booking is essential so please use the ticket link provided or email .

$105 per person which includes all materials, glaze, double kiln firing and a gin tasting tray with 3 gins from The Bond Store.

Completed pieces are ready to collect from Normandale, Lower Hutt or The Bond Store. For those unable to collect, I offer the convenience of postal delivery for an additional fee.

description:
'TONES OF SILENCE' - FUTUNA CHAPEL IN B&W - EXHIBITION, ‘TONES of SILENCE’ – FUTUNA CHAPEL in BLACK & WHITE - EXHIBITION
The ‘Tones of Silence’ -explored through B & W photography taken with vintage camera and lenses to give another way of viewing and experiencing the Chapel. This exhibition will explore the tones, textures, composition and forms of the Chapel in black and white with many shades of grey.
"Generally, the older the equipment, the greater the personal input of the photographer is required and therefore the greater the commitment and individuality. Often, you can look at a 19th-century photograph and tell who the photographer is. You certainly can't do that today. It isn't only the camera and lens, but also the type of film (or in those days, glass plate), the developer used and how the print is made onto particular types of paper. Each gives a distinct interpretation".
John Grace - email - 18/06/25
The Trust looks forward to welcoming architects, designers, graduates, students and interested members of the public to attend this event and support the Trust in its work.
The Futuna Trust is a charitable organisation and all koha received from the exhibition events will go towards the ongoing care, maintenance and operation of Futuna Chapel and also to support various initiatives undertaken by the Trust.  Please register
BOOKINGS ARE PREFERRED TO ATTEND THIS EVENT

description:
(Re)generation next: The Poet Laureate steps down, Aotearoa New Zealand Poet Laureate Chris Tse marks the end of his term in this exciting evening with fellow poets Ken Arkind, Cadence Chung, Gregory O’Brien, Chris Price, and Ruby Solly.
Reflections on the future
Join Chris at the National Library to mark the end of his time in the role with his reflections on the future of Aotearoa New Zealand poetry and readings from special guests.
"I left the doors to the past and the future unlocked ... "
Chris Tse’s three-year term as Aotearoa New Zealand Poet Laureate ends on Phantom Billstickers National Poetry Day, when the next Poet Laureate will be announced: https://www.nzbookawards.nz/nat.../2016-national-poetry-day/
About the speakers
Chris Tse (he/him) was born and raised in Lower Hutt, New Zealand. He studied film and English literature at Victoria University of Wellington, where he also completed an MA in Creative Writing at the International Institute of Modern Letters. In 2022, he was named the 13th New Zealand Poet Laureate. His poetry, short fiction, and non-fiction have been recorded for radio and widely published in numerous journals, magazines and anthologies. He has published several collections of poetry and his latest book Super Model Minority (2022) was longlisted for the Ockham New Zealand Book Awards 2023.
Ken Arkind is an American poet, author, performer, and educator originating from Steamboat Springs in Colorado. He holds the 2006 title of the American National Poetry Slam Champion and the 2010 title of Nuyorican Poets Cafe Grand Slam Champion. Ken now resides in Auckland and is a recent graduate from the Manukau Institute of Technology’s Creative Arts Programme.
Cadence Chung (she/they) is a poet, student, and musician from Wellington, currently studying at the New Zealand School of Music. Her poems started being published in her junior years of high school, and her debut chapbook anomalia was published by We Are Babies Press in April 2022. Her writing takes inspiration from antique stores, Tumblr text posts, and dead poets.
Gregory O’Brien is a poet, painter, author, curator, and editor. His most recent poetry publication is a collection of poems and paintings, House and contents (2022). Other recent publications include a book-length meditation on the Pacific, Always song in the water (2019) and the Ockham award winning book Don Binney: Flight Path (2023).
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Paraparaumu West Community Response Practice: DIY Workshop, Discover practical, low-cost, and creative ways to prepare for emergencies at your local Community Emergency Hub.

This hands-on workshop will show you how everyday items can be turned into simple tools to help you, and your neighbours get through a natural disaster. You'll also learn more about community emergency hubs, a place where you and your neighbours can go to help each other in a major emergency.

See demonstrations and take home easy “make-it” guides for:

• DIY washing machines
• Headlamp lanterns
• Sand “battery” heaters
• Clay pot refrigerators for vegetables
• Solar ovens

Everyone who comes along will go in the draw to win a 200L water tank worth $129!

Join us at the Paraparaumu East Community Emergency Hub and find out the many ways you can help your community thrive in tough times.

Part of Kāpiti Coast District Council’s Sustainable Spring programme: https://www.kapiticoast.govt.nz/explore-kapiti/things-to-do-in-kapiti/key-council-events/sustainable-spring
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Artists for Nature: Imaginal Disc, Enter a portal to a realm where insects meet art. Here, each insect is cherished for their unique beauty, their importance to the ecosystem and their marvelous life processes.

Through their dazzling video artworks, local artist Em Flux shares their queer, autistic worldview of the invertebrate world. They will be sharing a number of invertebrate-based video artworks and discuss the queer ecologies of insects, posthumanism and how art can be a tool to celebrate biodiversity. In these artworks, even the least appreciated creatures get a chance to shine!

This event will be held in the Rātā Cafe Balcony on the second floor of the Visitor's Centre. Doors Open 5.15pm, overflow parking is available on Birdwood Street.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Astro Photo Talk with Keith Molloy & JM Beltran, Join Wellington astrophotographers Keith Molloy & JM Beltran as they share tips and tricks on capturing the beauty of Aotearoa’s night skies.
Free to attend with a valid ticket to the World Press Photo Exhibition & Aotearoa Photography Showcase.
──────
About the speakers:
Keith Molloy
Wellington-based photographer passionate about capturing the beauty and diversity of New Zealand’s night skies and landscapes. He specialises in Milky Way scenes and celestial events, blending technical precision with creativity. Keith founded the Wellington Night Shooters Facebook group, has run workshops with the Wellington Photographic Society, and has been recognised through NZIPP NZAPA awards. His work is on display at the Tākina retail store during the World Press Photo Exhibition.
JM Beltran
Wellington-based landscape and nature photographer whose work captures Aotearoa’s wild beauty in colour and detail. His photography has been recognised internationally, including as a finalist in Australian Photographer of the Year 2024 and winning a Silver Award at NZIPP NZAPA 2024. JM volunteers at Zealandia Te Māra a Tāne, and his Wild Pōneke collection is on display at the Tākina retail store during the World Press Photo Exhibition.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
August's Nomadic Speaker: Rachel Young, Rachel Young is a freelance graphic designer, traveller, and occasional van-dweller who’s spent the last few years navigating the messy, beautiful reality of creative nomad life.
For Rachel, being a ‘nomad’ has never been just about travel, but a mindset. Since leaving her home in the UK in 2019, she’s moved across the world, worked remotely from a van, taught graphic design in China, and rebuilt her creative career more than once.
Today, she blends her love of design with a passion for helping other creatives navigate the highs, lows, and mindset shifts of freelance life, while inspiring those around her to pursue their own dreams.
In this Friday's talk, she shares the unfiltered truths of freelancing on the move - from creative burnout to financial uncertainty - along with the mindset tools that can make the journey not just survivable, but meaningful and joyful.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Bonfire, Created and directed by Matías Avaca

Bonfire is an intimate storytelling ritual where performers gather around the fire to share tales shaped by culture, memory, and imagination. Rooted in ancestral echoes, each story is poetic, powerful, and fleeting; never to be told the same way twice.

Inspired by the workshop The Stories That Made Us, the show blends magical realism, oral tradition, and ensemble connection.

With previous presentations in Auckland and Brisbane (as part of the 2025 Brisbane Improv Festival), Bonfire now arrives at the New Zealand Improv Festival, inviting audiences into a space of warmth, wonder, and shared humanity.

This show may include content related to family, identity, cultural heritage, and emotional themes. While performers are encouraged to approach these with care and sensitivity, the improvised nature of the show means themes may vary each night. The show may contain voluntary audience interaction, such as giving a suggestion for a scene.

description:
Book Launch: Hoods Landing by Laura Vincent, Book Launch: Hoods Landing by Laura Vincent
Join Āporo Press at Unity Books for the mystical book launch of ‘Hoods Landing’ by Laura Vincent.

About this Event

Join Āporo Press at Unity Books Wellington on Halloween, 31 October, to celebrate the debut novel by Laura Vincent.

🎃 Friday 31 October, 6pm
🎃 Unity Books Wellington
🎃 All welcome!

Rita considered the dead. Shut her eyes. Rolled their names around her brain. Stacked each person in order like folded laundry, warm and crisp from the sun. She wondered how her name would sound amongst them.

In the rural reaches of Auckland, the women of the eclectic Gordon family gather for Christmas. They may push each other’s buttons, but know precisely when to offer tea (or a tipple). Rita, the 50-year-old baby of the family, is planning to tell them she has cancer. Drifting between past and present, she considers the lives of women in their community and reckons with what it all means for her future and her family.

Featuring elderly lesbians, twins who aren’t twins, and several dogs named Roger, Hoods Landing is about shoddy pasts, ambiguous futures and the imperfect bonds that tie family together.

About the author:

Laura Vincent (Ngāti Māhanga, Ngāpuhi) is an author whose work spans fiction, poetry and food writing. She has written the food blog hungryandfrozen.com since 2007, and her debut cookbook was published by Penguin Random House in 2013. Laura’s poetry has appeared in anthologies published by Āporo Press, Auckland University Press and Muswell Press, and she completed her Master of Creative Writing at Auckland University of Technology in 2022. Born in Waiuku, Laura currently lives in Tāmaki Makaurau. Hoods Landing is her first novel.
label: Arts & Theatre

This exciting event is perfect for kids who love music, dancing, and creativity.

Tickets include all activities, games, and take-home crafts.

Please note that we are not registered childcare providers, which means an adult responsible for each child must remain on the premises. However, we will have a breakout cuppa room on site for parents to relax in.

description:
Bull Rush, THIS SHOW IS R13.

With a roster of Tāmaki Makaurau's best and brightest performers, expect spit-take-worthy gags, epic stories, heartbreaking tales, and live improvised music at Bull Rush.

So gather your mates for a night of never before seen, totally made up, improvised comedy.

Mess with the bull, feel the rush.

Since 2020, Bull Rush has been making it up as they go. With several seasons (Jingle Bull(Rush), Ghoul Rush, Bull Rush (1822) under their belt, these self-professed improv nerds know how to put on a bloody good show.

Winners of Best Improv Group at the 2024 NZ Comedy Guild Awards, among other accolades (not to brag).

“From start to finish, the show kept me laughing, and by the end, I found myself not only impressed by the performers' quick wit and timing but also rediscovering my appreciation for the art of theatre.”

95bfm.com

R13 - This show may contain potential references to sex, violence as death. As this show is improvised, we cannot guarantee the presence or absence of specific content or themes beyond what is in the description above. The show may contain voluntary audience interaction, such as giving a suggestion for a scene.

Image credit: John Rata
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
BOOK LAUNCH! Downstream from Nowhere by Johnny Crawford, Join 5ever books for the celebration and launch of Johnny Crawford's 'Downstream from Nowhere'!
Trades Hall, 124 Vivian Street
Friday 29 August 2025
6:30PM - whenevz
Free entry, all welcome, nibbles and drinks available, accompanied with sentimental words and live serenades.
~~~~~~
In the two centuries since the first Pākehā set foot in what would go on to be known as the Messines Valley, it has seen its fair share of history. Music Festivals. Failed settlements. Paranormal phenomena.
As the stolen land passed through the hands of church and state and capital, each left its mark. ‘Downstream from Nowhere’ follows this course through the eyes of the valley’s least reputable visitors.
~~~~~~
"Crawford sends us running straight into a tornado of intergenerational colonial mindsets, jingoistic historicism, and pop-cultural epochs, with a goat's head in one hand and a kebab in the other" - Jordan Hamel
Art by Miriam Collins, Sam Low and Nabilah Husna Binte Abdul Rahman. Cover designed by Achille Segard.

Join us at the Chinese Corner on November 8th to explore the rich flavors and traditions of Chinese culinary culture! Learn about famous Chinese dishes, dining etiquette, and the stories behind them. Get a hands-on experience of making your own tanghulu (candied fruit) —sweet, crispy, and fun!

Whether you're a food lover or curious about Chinese culture, this event is perfect for you. Don’t miss this tasty experience!

See you there!

description:
Christmas in October, Christmas in October
Presented by the New Zealand Improv Festival

It's nowhere near beginning to look anything like Christmas, but if October in Wellington is true to form, the weather outside is probably frightful, so we're celebrating anyway. Wear your best ugly sweater for this celebration of the Christmas season, featuring gifts (real), eggnog (imaginary) and warm feelings (both).

Featuring a found family of amazing performers from across the Festival, together on stage for the very first time.

“If you want to laugh till your belly hurts, watch wizards weave worlds out of thin air, and be a part of something special, inimitable, then catch as many NZIF shows as you can.” - Regional News

description:
Charlotte Grimshaw: The annual NZSA Janet Frame Memorial Lecture, In her 2025 NZSA Janet Frame Memorial Lecture, Charlotte Grimshaw will report from the frontlines of fiction and memoir, discuss veracity, integrity and clarity in a so-called “post-truth world,” and share ideas she’s formed about authenticity after a whole life lived in fiction.

Grimshaw will describe her ongoing quest for answers, including a recent personal discovery of material in the Turnbull Library archive that shattered some final illusions, and fuelled her determination to go on expressing ideas and writing accurate human stories, no matter what. Don't miss this one-off, very special event.

Presented in partnership with New Zealand Society of Authors Te Puni Kaituhi O Aotearoa (PEN NZ) Inc, and National Library of New Zealand Te Puna Mātauranga o Aotearoa.

This event is free to attend, and will be followed by supper and light refreshments. Please register to secure your place. All welcome.

Charlotte Grimshaw spent two decades publishing fiction after growing up in the family of a writer. In 2021 she published a bestselling memoir, The Mirror Book, about her experiences in the literary family. She described this as an account of the creation of her authentic self.  In her latest novel, The Black Monk (March, 2026), she has continued her exploration of authenticity, blending the “micro” interior world of guilt, truth and lies with the “macro” world of geopolitics and history. Charlotte is the critically acclaimed author of eleven works, including novels, two outstanding collections of linked stories, a best-selling memoir, journalism and book reviewing.

Charlotte Grimshaw is The NZ Society of Authors Te Puni Kaituhi o Aotearoa 2025 President of Honour. This prestigious honour is bestowed on a senior writer and long-serving NZSA member in recognition of their contribution to writing, writers and the literary arts sector in Aotearoa. Each year the NZSA President of Honour delivers the Janet Frame Memorial Lecture.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Confessions Booth, ✨ Confessions Booth - Hosted by a Fabulous Drag Host ✨
Wellington, it’s time to spill your secrets… or just sip and enjoy everyone else’s! 👀
Step into the Confessions Booth for a cheeky, interactive night of cocktails, laughs, and anonymous confessions, hosted by a fabulous drag MC. Part comedy, part interactive theatre, part party - guaranteed to keep you laughing, sipping, and maybe confessing…
Here’s how it works:
On arrival, grab a drink and submit a confession on a card or via QR code. Totally optional - sipping cocktails is a perfectly valid choice!
Confessions must be about you only - keep other people’s skeletons in their closet.
You can submit anonymously, or add your name for a little extra spice and interaction with the host (and a chance to win a price).
Selected confessions will be read aloud by our drag MC, who will add cheeky commentary, playful roasts, and audience Q&A.
Not every confession will make it to the stage, but every secret counts and contributes to the fun.
Between confession sets, enjoy music, cocktails, and mingling. After the main show, the party continues with a pop, disco, and house playlist.
Ticket Tiers:
GA - $25: Entry only.
Upgraded - $35: Entry + welcome bubbly 🥂
VIP - $55: Entry + welcome drink (cocktail, wine, beer or Pal) + charcuterie cup + priority seating.
📍 Where: Whisky & Wood, Wellington
📅 When: Thursday 23 October, 7:00pm
Sip. Spill. Repeat. Whether you’re confessing your darkest secrets or just watching the chaos unfold, this is a night of laughs, drinks, and drama you won’t forget.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Declarations of Love (And Other Useless Things) - BATS Theatre, Created by Tempest Theatre Co

Back for its five year anniversary, Emma Maguire and Hamish Boyle run the gauntlet of sketch comedy, performing 15+ sketches about love, sex, queerness and rom-coms in 55 minutes.
It's delirious, it'll get your blood pumping (not like that), and maybe we'll all come out of it satisfied.

Think parodies of Fifty Shades of Grey and the manosphere.
Interrogating love languages and horoscopes.
A lot of ~intimate eye contact~.
Maybe some touching.

The works.

“Take your friends. Take your lovers. This show IS a love story. And it’s totally for everyone.”
Theatreview

Created and Performed by Emma Maguire & Hamish Boyle
Facilitation & dramaturgy by Jo Marsh
Lighting design and operation by Ezra Jones-Moki
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Echoes of the Past, Echoes of the Past
Presented by Best on Tap

In keeping with the theme of the festival, Best on Tap ponders what has led us to 'be here now'?

What people, actions, and objects have combined to shape this place we know as Wellington/Te Whanganui a Tara?

What paths have led us to make this our home?

What decisions, genes, and character traits echo through generations to make us who we are today?

This show will traverse time to explore these rich themes, all with a good helping of Best on Tap truth-based, grounded, spontaneous theatre.

After all, what were our ancestors doing if not improvising?

Inspired by Felipe Ortiz (Colombia)

Best on Tap is a Wellington-based improvisation troupe who use truth-based play to create compelling and satisfying narratives. This is spontaneous theatre that honours and entertains.

As this show is improvised, we cannot guarantee the presence or absence of specific content or themes beyond what is in the description above. The show may contain mature themes and language, but not gratuitously. The show may contain voluntary audience interaction, such as giving a suggestion for a scene.

description:
Hurdle Film Screening, This spring from the 28th of August to the 2nd of October we will be screening a series of excellent Palestinian films, old and new, every week at two/fiftyseven on Willis Street, with ticket sales going to the Gazan mutual aid group The Sameer Project.
The Sameer Project is an on-the-ground aid organisation organised by Palestinians in the diaspora, which crowdfunds in order to provide tents, medical care and direct cash aid to those most affected in Gaza. They can be found on Instagram at @thesameerproject.
More information about Hurdle, screening on the 28th of August can be found at https://www.hurdlefilm.com/.
label: Film & Media

description:
Eddie Izzard — The Remix: The First 35 Years, Ever wondered what became of Darth Vader and Mr Stevens, or the monkey in the tree, and did the pears ever ripen? English comic Eddie Izzard has been spinning wildly funny and surreal tales for 35 years. Her huge and devoted fan base is in for a treat as she embarks on a tour. In Eddie Izzard — The Remix: The First 35 Years, she reimagines some of her favourite comedy highlights. She delves into material from the touring show The Ambassadors (1993) through to Wunderbar (2019). For the audience, it’s a glorious chance to hear a new take on classic material and hear another new mad-capped twist to the story. As always, with Eddie, there will be unexpected tangents and hilarious interludes. No night will be the same. 
This show promises to be a beautiful, hilarious journey spanning a 35-year career. It will be thought-provoking, intelligent and suitably surreal. Who could resist?
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Fresh Produce, Fresh Produce
Presented by the New Zealand Improv Festival
Directed by Guanny Liu-Prosee
Performed by graduates of the NZIF Youth Programme

Check out the future of New Zealand improv as these young whippersnappers vie for your laughs. Fresh on the scene, the graduates of the New Zealand Improv Festival Youth Programme are here to show you what they’ve got.

For the past week, they have immersed themselves in the joy of improv, and now they’re ready to impress you with their newly honed acting chops over two nights of high-energy hilarity.

Born in 2008, now in its 16th year (don’t think too hard about the maths), NZIF is a whirlwind celebration and showcase of improvisation from around Aotearoa and the world.

The NZIF Youth Programme brings together young people from around the Te-Whanganui-A-Tara region for a week of improv training and joy. For more information please email

We are grateful for the support of Insight to Action Consulting and the Performing Arts Foundation.

As this show is improvised, we cannot guarantee the presence or absence of specific content or themes beyond what is in the description above. The show may contain mature themes and language, but not gratuitously. The show may contain voluntary audience interaction, such as giving a suggestion for a scene.

description:
El Jaguar presents : Book (Fight) Club!, It's a book club.

It's a fight club.

It's a book fight club.

"...this show is too clever and too funny to stick to the rules." - Theatreview

8 books are welcomed into the literati ThunderDome to fight to the death for our entertainment, but first we need to discuss them like the civilised consumers of culture that we are.

"...a rip roaring show of immense proportions!" - Theatreview

As seen at the NZ International Comedy Festival, Melbourne International Comedy Festival, Adelaide Fringe, Auckland Writers Festival, and World Buskers Festival, El Jaguar is back hosting the most hilarious and unusual book club you've ever joined.

"I laughed so much. I laughed so hard at one point I nearly threw up." - Libel Music
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Friday Laughs with Booth the Clown and Wilson Dixon, Friday Laughs at Cavern Club brings some of your favourite local and national comedians to the capital's coziest comedy club.

September's show stars headline act Wilson Dixon
Hailing from Cripple Creek Colorado, country music legend, Wilson Dixon’s melodic philosophies on life have seen him become one of the most loved characters on the Aust, UK and NZ circuit.
He has had sold out season’s at The New International Comedy Festival and has won awards for Best Show and in 2010 he won the supreme Festival Award The Fred for outstanding artistic achievement.
Before sweeping the New Zealand International Comedy Festival his show ”Wilson Dixon’s American Dream” played to rave reviews at the Edinburgh Fringe and Melbourne International Comedy Festival. Directly after the Edinburgh Fringe Wilson went on to appear in his own 4 part radio series for the BBC – The Wilson Dixon Line.
An unmissable act!

And feature act Booth the Clown
2025 Billy T Award nominee, Booth has entertained audiences around the country with a mix of storytelling, mime, and general tomfoolery
"delightfully silly" - Regional News

More acts to be announced.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Cathedral Young Adults: Spring 2025, Cathedral Young Adults: Spring 2025
Cathedral Young Adults – Spring 2025
Join us after the 10am service for a season of food, fun, and fellowship. Whether you’re a regular or new to the Cathedral, these events are a great way to connect, share a meal, and grow together.

August 24 – WOAP Burgers & Believers
Celebrate Wellington On a Plate with gourmet burgers and great conversation.

September 14 – Putt Your Faith in God
Mini golf, good company, and a little friendly competition.

September 21 – Breaking Bread

A tasting adventure of flavours from around the world, shared with friends.

Come for the service, stay for the fun!

description:
Friday Laughs with Itay Dom and El Jaguar, Friday Laughs is a comedy showcase featuring top local and national comedians at the capital's favourite comedy venue

Featuring headline act - El Jaguar
Canadian comedy act El Jaguar is coming to wrestle his way into hilarity. From Canada, to New Zealand, and throughout Australia, El Jaguar is making a name for himself on the comedy scene using only his fast wits and tight lycra.
From the dusty streets of central America, rising triumphant as the luchador everyone wanted to be in the World Wrestling Federation circa 1990, then into obscurity: El Jaguar is making a comeback… and it’s going to be hilarious.

With MC Itay Dom
As seen on Guy Mont-Spelling Bee and The Bachelorette New Zealand, brings his signature mix of laidback crowd work and observational comedy to the stage.
Itay has cemented his reputation as one of New Zealand’s brightest comedic talents. In 2024, he won the Breakthrough Act award at the NZ Comedy Guild Awards, following his 2023 win for Best MC. His sharp humor and quick wit have delighted audiences across the country, from opening for top acts like Joe Daymond and Ray O’Leary to his appearances on Guy Mont-Spelling Bee and writing for 7 Days.
“Feeds off the energy of the crowd with quick wits” - The Post

Support from:
Brent McGuinness
Jenice Goveas
Jundas Capone
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Cringeworthy: The 90's, Cringeworthy – 90s!
A high-octane explosion of ‘90s nostalgia!
Written and devised by Andrea Sanders
Produced by Beatgirl Productions
Starring Andrea Sanders, Devon Neiman, Jared Pallesen and Emma Katene
Following the success of Cringeworthy ’60s, ’70s and ’80s, this show pays homage to NZ music and culture in the last decade of the 20th century. Expect a ‘rad’ mix of local and international hits delivered with snappy dance moves, scintillating vocals and a generous dollop of cheesy comedy.
The 90s was a decade bursting with diverse musical genres, from boy bands and girl groups to MMMBop and hip hop, the swing revival (Mambo No. 5), country (Achy Breaky Heart), The Macarena and re-releases of iconic hits such as To Sir With Love, Silly Love Songs, Unchained Melody and Get Down on It (can you dig it??).
On the local scene, legends such as Crowded House, Dave Dobbyn, The Exponents, Margaret Urlich, Supergroove, True Bliss, Ardijah, South Side of Bombay and The Chills gave us heavenly pop hits that have become Kiwi classics.
In some ‘fly’ outfits, Cringeworthy – the ’90s packages the hits of the decade (including Can’t Touch This, Weather With You, Love Shack and How Bizarre) with some unforgettable fashion trends including flannel shirts, baggy jeans, tracksuits and chokers. These energetic styles are woven together with a witty narrative reflecting the lifestyle, news events and culture of the time – smelling like Teen Spirit!
What’s the time Mr Wolf? Time to grab your ticket to ride this retro rollercoaster! Nostalgia invites you to relive a decade that still resonates today. Get ready to party like its 1999!
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
The Inevitabilism Panel, We're told AI is Progress, progress that cannot be stopped, that it will change the way we work and live, from business to education and the commons. But who says? Whose progress and whose AI is it anyway? Is societal progress really bound to technological innovation, or are there other ways of reading - and even shaping - positive social change?
Technological Determinism is described as the belief system that social progress is driven by technological innovation, which in turn follows an "inevitable" course." This panel will take a good hard look at this 'inevitabilism' - its forces and politics - with a view to our shared future in Aotearoa and the Pacific.
Join us for a rigorous evening of discussion with a view to how we might gain more understanding - and more say - as to the reach and influence new technologies have over our autonomy, dignity, communities and cultures.
label: Business & Networking

description:
Friday Laughs with Lesa Macleod-Whiting and Kura Forrester, Friday Laughs is a two hour comedy showcase of some top Kiwi talent, right in the heart of Wellington.
With headline act, Kura Forrester
Kura Forrester is an actor, writer and comedian, a face you have definitely seen on the telly including Kiwi shows such as: Golden Boy, Shortland Street, Super City and The Adventures of Suzy Boon.
Winner of the 2019 Billy T Award, Kura is fast becoming one of the standout comedian actors of New Zealand.
And MC Lesa Macleod-Whiting - 2025 Billy T Award nominee
Lesa is a Wellington-based writer, improviser and comedian. She has been a regular on the Wellington improv scene since 2016 and began doing stand-up in July 2020, going on to nab the Runner Up spot at the Wellington Raw Comedy Quest. She has a penchant for characters, accents and fast-paced silliness.
Winner – Best Newcomer – 2020 Wellington Comedy Awards Nominated – Best Newcomer (Lower North Island) – 2020 NZ Comedy Guild Awards
Along with
Sandy Burton
Alayne Dick
Leki Lyons
and Mike Fowler

Swingvasion IV (2026), Swingvasion IV (2026)
It’s the return of Swingvasion. Again. 🛸

Save the date for Swingvasion IV: March 6th - 8th 2026! 👾

We’re stoked to be bringing you our famous Swingvasion shenanigans, and some exciting new things - including an intensive on Friday afternoon! 🤩✨

Full details for the event and intensive will be coming soon! Hit ‘going’ on the Facebook event, so you don’t miss out on any of our exciting announcements! 🥳👽
label: Community & Culture

description:
George Fenn is: Sexy Ghost Boy, Sexy Ghost Boy is a wordless interactive comedy that came from the challenge to make work exploring consent without using words. Thematically this show is a celebration of the micro-neurosis and little rituals we have around sex and appearing sexy. It is an uplifting and exciting show, which is satirical in its burlesque and invigorating through its clown. It is very, very funny.
The performer’s approach to interaction and participation is gentle, with a focus on ensuring the audience is enthusiastic consenting to each action. George Fenn is an interactive theatre comedian with decade of experience. This is not an experimental show. This is a weird show. A very good, weird show.

Official and unofficial praise Sexy Ghost Boy:
Organised Chaos Award at Auckland Fringe / 2024
Bizarre and Charming Award / Hasting Fringe Festival 2024
Nominated for Outstanding Performer / Dunedin Fringe 2025
“A theatrical alchemist, Fenn has the rare talent to create something utterly ridiculous yet very clever…he worms his way into our brains making it crazy, yet safe. There’s an element of consent in the interaction that is miles away from the experience of sitting in the front row of some stand-ups.” - Rosheen Fitzgerald, Theatreview
"but we both feel so… I don’t even know how to describe it. I feel like I’m floating while simultaneously feeling grounded, I’m ecstatic while also very chill. Maybe it’s the full moon, or maybe I’m just a little bit possessed by the Sexy Ghost Boy." - Laura Ferguson, Art Murmurs
"... Like Mr. Bean, but Sexy." - Audience member
"What the **** that was incredible." - Audience member
The show is strictly R18. It contains sexual themes and nudity up to underwear.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Ginge & Minge's Redemption, Ginge & Minge's Redemption
Presented by Ginge & Minge (with special guests)

The road to redemption is often paved with chaos. Local favourites Ginge & Minge are here to give failed comedy ideas a second chance.

With the help of a cast of ready and game players, hopeful redeemables will bring their pitches for shows, scenes and sketches that deserve a second chance at life. They'll direct their dream scenes and you, the audience, will decide which are redeemed and which are better off left in the bin.

Featuring:

MCs - Ginge & Minge (Nina Hogg & Megan Connolly)
Lesa MacLeod-Whiting
Ralph Hilaga
Austin Harrison
Lia Kelly

“Ginge & Minge are experienced performers, and it shows [...] they know how to play the audience and each other.” - Art Murmurs

“...The duo’s chemistry, creativity and charisma ushers in a new era of comedy” - Wellyott

label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Paint and Wine Night in Wellington - Magical Dragonflies, The concept is simple - take a brush in one hand, a drink in the other and let’s paint a masterpiece!

Join us for a creative night of drinking and painting in the heart of Wellington! No previous painting experience necessary. Get your creative juices flowing and your brush strokes going!

Drinks: NO DRINKS are included in the ticket price, but drinks are available for purchase.

Food: A delicious menu will be available to purchase throughout the event.

What is Paintvine?
It’s a fun social painting class where our artists will run you through step-by-step instructions on how to create your very own masterpiece in a fun and relaxed bar setting. Perfect for dates, catching up with mates or for meeting new friends!

We provide all the materials you need (high-quality canvas, acrylic paint, brushes). All you need to bring is your creative spirit (or find some at the bottom of a glass). At the end of the night you will leave with your own painting ready to hang up on your wall.

For tickets, future events, FAQs and more info head to the Paintvine website.
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Fresh Produce, Fresh Produce
Presented by the New Zealand Improv Festival
Directed by Guanny Liu-Prosee
Performed by graduates of the NZIF Youth Programme

Check out the future of New Zealand improv as these young whippersnappers vie for your laughs. Fresh on the scene, the graduates of the New Zealand Improv Festival Youth Programme are here to show you what they’ve got.

For the past week, they have immersed themselves in the joy of improv, and now they’re ready to impress you with their newly honed acting chops over two nights of high-energy hilarity.

Born in 2008, now in its 16th year (don’t think too hard about the maths), NZIF is a whirlwind celebration and showcase of improvisation from around Aotearoa and the world.

The NZIF Youth Programme brings together young people from around the Te-Whanganui-A-Tara region for a week of improv training and joy. For more information please email

We are grateful for the support of Insight to Action Consulting and the Performing Arts Foundation.

As this show is improvised, we cannot guarantee the presence or absence of specific content or themes beyond what is in the description above. The show may contain mature themes and language, but not gratuitously. The show may contain voluntary audience interaction, such as giving a suggestion for a scene.

Photography: Nicolette Hurnen
label: Arts & Theatre

description: Breakfast Club, For one morning only – Loosie’s Superette is opening for breakfast, serving a comfort-filled menu with banging tunes and endless caffeine. Think trayfuls of fluffy pancakes, bacon and egg muffins, crispy hash browns drowned in maple syrup, and bottomless drip coffee to keep things rolling. Add a cheeky mimosa or two, and you’ve got the perfect start to your weekend. Whether you’re with your brunch crew, shaking off a hangover, or chasing the crispy bits, this is a morning made for indulgence. It’s all about good food, loud laughs, and that first sip of something strong with your best mates by your side. No rules, no rush - just tunes pumping, trays piling up, and that warm, familiar feeling of a proper brunch done right.
label: Food & Drink

description:
Glimmers of Gold | Embroidery by Jo Dixey, A gorgeous new exhibition pops up in Old St Paul's vestry this September featuring 79 hand embroidered golden humans.
Embroiderer Jo Dixey is constantly fascinated by the short interactions we have as humans that leave us with calm or happy feelings; feelings that can last for the rest of the day or sometimes much longer.
'This can be sharing a smile with a stranger on a beautiful day or even in the rain, chatting with people in a long queue, collectively watching a great movie. Being open to these moments enhances our lives and the lives of those around us,' Dixey says.
'In psychology, these tiny moments that stimulate positive feelings are called glimmers.'
Gold is a chemical element with the symbol Au and atomic number 79.
'Welcome to Glimmers of Gold.'
About Jo Dixey
Dixey is a Royal School of Needlework trained embroiderer. She teaches small groups a variety of embroidery techniques, works on commissions which have included large altar cloths, university banners and work for the fashion and movie industries, and repairs old embroideries. She holds exhibitions of her embroidered pieces every few years.
In 2017, Dixey published her first book Stitch People, which was later re-released as Creative Thread.
Her work is held in private and public collections in New Zealand and overseas.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Hot Spot September - Featuring Alex Wilson, Hot Spot September - Featuring Alex Wilson
Our funny friend who moved away is BACK and he’s bringing the laughs!
This month we’re thrilled to welcome Alex Wilson!Alex is a Director, actor, and improviser who has trained at fancy schools, toured internationally, and picked up awards all across New Zealand.
He's wild, out of the box and SO SO funny! Like a cartoon character come to life.

Catch him at Hot Spot for a night of comedy, chaos, and pure fun. Our Fanciest friend has come back to play!

Date: September 12th
Venue: Globe Theatre
Tickets: On sale now!

Don’t miss this one! Alex is only here for a short time, and you’ll want to say you saw him at Hot Spot first!
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Out in the Pool 🌈, Out in the Pool 🌈
Our Out in the Pool sessions are regular monthly sessions for all queer, transgender, gender diverse and non-binary folks 🌈

We invite the LGBTQI+ community and allies to dive in and swim in a safe and welcoming environment at Keith Spry Pool. These sessions are held on the first Sunday of every month and run 6pm-8pm.

Out in the Pool evenings at Keith Spry have:
🥽 Gender neutral changing rooms and bathrooms, as well as our Men's and Women's changing facilities.
🦄 Recreation lanes with inflatables, as well as the Dive board open (as staffing allows).
🏊‍♀️ Lane space will be available to swim some lengths or aqua jog, and the teaching pool will be open as staffing allows.
😎 Spa and Sauna available
🎶 Music, swimming and good vibes only.

There is no additional cost for these sessions, simply turn up and pay our regular pool entry fees. There is no need to register, just come on down!
label: Community & Culture

description:
Ginge & Minge’s Redemption, Presented by Ginge & Minge (with special guests)

The road to redemption is often paved with chaos. Local favourites Ginge & Minge are here to give failed comedy ideas a second chance.

With the help of a cast of ready and game players, hopeful redeemables will bring their pitches for shows, scenes and sketches that deserve a second chance at life. They'll direct their dream scenes and you, the audience, will decide which are redeemed and which are better off left in the bin.

Featuring:

MCs - Ginge & Minge (Nina Hogg & Megan Connolly)
Lesa MacLeod-Whiting
Ralph Hilaga
Austin Harrison
Lia Kelly

“Ginge & Minge are experienced performers, and it shows [...] they know how to play the audience and each other.” - Art Murmurs

“...The duo’s chemistry, creativity and charisma ushers in a new era of comedy” - Wellyott

As this show is improvised, we cannot guarantee the presence or absence of specific content or themes beyond what is in the description above. The show may contain mature themes and language, but not gratuitously. The show may contain voluntary audience interaction, such as giving a suggestion for a scene.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Improv on a plate, Welcome to Improv on a Plate, the comedy tasting menu no one ordered and everyone regrets.
In this unholy fusion of high-stakes improv and low-stakes judgment, three deranged guest chefs (aka format-pitchers) take the stage with one mission: serve up the most unhinged, impossible improv formats they can dream of. Enter Wellington comedy trio, Catfish Trifecta — your unsuspecting improv victims — who must swallow each cursed format whole and perform it on the spot.
No script. No escape. Just raw, unfiltered chaos served à la mode.
The pitchers then get to sit back, relax, and judge the madness they’ve unleashed. It’s improv. It’s pain. It’s Improv on a Plate.
One night only. No refunds. BYO palate cleanser.
---
Catfish Trifecta will also be joined by two opening acts.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Homicidal Pacifist - Dust Off Your Guillotines, Created and performed by Sameena Zehra

This sold-out Pōneke favourite returns for one night only at Hannah Playhouse!

Three haunted sock puppets leading government. Shit-for-brains liberals peddling ‘both sides’ fucknuggetry as the people march for peace and their governments pour gasoline on fire. And WT actual F is a ‘lesser’ evil? Sameena Zehra is back to explore whether it's time to dust off your guillotines (even for a pacifist, it’s definitely time) with dark comedy and delicious storytelling that will make you gasp and guffaw as you channel your inner homicidal pacifist to pen a culling list of your own.

“As a piece of political theatre, this is one of the more entertaining and potentially moving with a flair for the dramatic... a remarkable raconteur with amazing stories to tell…” - Nicholas Holm, The Post

Audience care and considerations: This show is accessible to blind and low vision audiences without the need for audio description. The venue is fully accessible. Sameena may occasionally raise her voice, but won’t shout. There is some direct audience interaction, but if you avert your gaze or shake your head, you will not be engaged directly. Contains adult themes, political and confrontational material, and coarse language.

General admission - choose your price: $8 - $100
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
James Nokise: One Right Rant | Wellington, James Nokise: One Right Rant | Wellington
Irreverent, incorrigible, and just ever so outraged, award-winning comedian James Nokise lets loose in Wellington for one night only!

About this Event

Politicians, policies, preachers, and protests are all in the line of fire as Nokise brings his fast paced, semi-chaotic, always cathartic, blend of humour and hot takes back to NZ for a hilarious hour of big laughs and the occasional frustrated scream.
One Night Rant is political comedy at its sharpest. From parliament scandals to global chaos, Nokise rips into the news cycle, mixing big laughs with bite-sized truths. This is a one-hour comedy special designed for anyone who’s ever shouted at the TV, despaired at the headlines, or secretly enjoyed watching politicians squirm.

About James Nokise
A multi-talented comedian, playwright, columnist, podcaster, theatre maker, and social commentator, James Nokise is known for his fearless approach and his ability to give a voice to underrepresented issues.
Over the course of his illustrious career James has been nominated twice for the Billy T Award (2005, 2006) and the Fred Award for Best New Zealand Show (2013), which he subsequently took out in 2019 for his show God Damn Fancy Man. He won Best Male Comedian at the NZ Comedy Guild Awards (2013), Spirit of the Festival at the 2021 NZ Comedy Fest and the Topp Prize (2024). James was also the winner of best documentary at the 2025 NZ radio awards for his series The Last Voyage of the Rainbow Warrior, and winner of the Best International Podcast at the 2025 Asia Podcast Awards.
James has an extensive touring career, including over a decade of shows in the NZ International Comedy Festival and multiple Comedy Gala performances, as well as years on the international Fringe Festival circuit, performing successful seasons in Edinburgh, Perth, and New York.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Untutored Life Drawing - Term 4, Join us for our untutored life drawing sessions in the historic Inverlochy House on Tuesdays from 10am-1pm.

Inverlochy Art School provides the model organised by Denise Durkin, easels and or drawing horses and an amazing space to create in.

A 6 trip clip ticket is offered at $120.00 ($20 per session) and Casual attendees will pay $25 each session on the day via eftpos or cash in the office.

Bring your own materials.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
John Bishop — 25 Years of Stand-up Tour, English comedian, presenter, and actor John Bishop is heading to Wellington with a milestone to shout about. The Liverpool-born comic is celebrating 25 years in the business. His material usually draws from life experiences, and previous stand-up has covered observations about fatherhood, cycling around the world, playing semi-professional football, and his time working as a nightclub doorman. His Michael Fowler Centre show will undoubtedly showcase his famous natural charm and humility while delivering hilarious observations. 
“I can’t believe it will be 25 years since I first performed at the Frog and Bucket in Manchester. It’s been a rollercoaster!” says John. On top of stand-up comedy, he has found fame as a presenter. Among his many television appearances is ‘John Bishop: In Conversation With…’ This series saw him chatting with some of the biggest names in entertainment, music and sport. He has also fronted multiple documentary-style shows.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
The Rock Orchestra by Candlelight, When you think of hard rock and metal, you might not naturally connect them to the refined sounds of classical music. The Rock Orchestra by Candlelight has done just that. After entertaining 700,000 people across the UK, USA and Europe, it’s coming to Wellington. 
Prepare for a spellbinding 90-minute spectacle infusing rock and metal anthems with beautiful orchestral energy. A band of 13 classical musicians will accompany the fiery tunes. Through a wall of distortion, you’ll witness the unexpected union of classical and metal music. 
In an ethereal candlelit setting, you’ll experience the music of famous bands. Hear Metallica, AC/DC, Rage Against the Machine, My Chemical Romance, Linkin' Park, SOAD, Guns N’ Roses, Evanescence, Aerosmith, The Cranberries, and more.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
KIKI NIGHT by KIWI & K-CI MARAMA — Fri 19th Sep, It's a Fem Queen takeover! Kiwi and K-Ci Marama are proud to present the 'KIKI NIGHT by KIWI & K-CI MARAMA'
WHEN Friday 19th Sep (2025) 9.30pm
Doors open from 9.30pm, Categories start from 10.00pm.
WHERE Ivy Bar & Cabaret, Wellington (NZ) R18+ 
TICKETS
GA $20 + Online Fees (LIMITED)
Extra Aroha Tickets $25 (min.) + Online Fees (LIMITED)
$25 Door Sales until Midnight (LIMITED) Cash or Eftpos.
JUDGES, COMMENTATOR, MC & DJ
FQ K-CI MARAMA
SPHYNX MARAMA
LAKILUA MARAMA
MOTHER ROMÉ MARAMA (Commentator)
MOTHER KARAMERA MARAMA (MC)
MIAMIA (DJ)
CATEGORIES
DRAGS FACE x1 🏆 + Ivy Bar Voucher
No Theme.
Beat, Beat, Beat! Calling all drags face girls, guys and theys! Show us your makeup skills in a show-stopping beat that even the gods can’t handle.

REALNESS — FQ x1 🏆 TM x1 🏆 + Ivy Bar Voucher
Theme: Everyday Realness
Bring it in your everyday realness, whether you’re a working girl or a stay at home baddie, bring your everyday realness to the floor.
This category is only open to Fem Queens and Trans Men.

RUNWAY WITH A PROP x1 🏆 + Ivy Bar Voucher
No Theme.
Strut, Walk, Pose! Show us your walk, spins and pivots and command the runway in any attire you choose, with a prop to complement.
No weapons allowed.

LIP-SYNC PERFORMANCE x1 🏆 + Ivy Bar Voucher
Theme: Let’s have a Kiki with RIRI.
Serve your best Rihanna fantasy in this lip-sync category. Shine bright like a Diamond, bring the Wild Thoughts, and make the judges scream Where Have You Been all their lives! You will be judged by the delivery of the words in the song and your performance. 
See Rihanna song lists at the bottom.

CAT IN THE HAT x1 🏆+ Ivy Bar Voucher
No Theme.
It’s time to break it down and shake things up! Get your tens by picking out one of the mysterious categories from the hat, and then wake up it up in battles until you are the last one standing.
All categories inside the hat are specific to vogue fem.
Categories:
Hands Performance
Catwalk
No Dips
Spins & Dips
Vogue to a Non-Vogue Beat
LIP-SYNC PERFORMANCE, RIHANNA SONGS LIST:
Tens:
Umbrella
Kiss It Better
Only Girl
California King Bed
Diamonds
Wild Thoughts
Battles:
Thug In My Life
Pon De Replay
SnM
Please Don’t Stop The Music
Sex With Me
Work
Final Battle: Shut Up and Drive
Follow our Instagram @houseofmarama to keep up to date with our events.
--------
Ballroom is a safe space created in the 1960's, forged by the Black, Latinx and queer Americans in protest against the racism and queerphobia that they faced from the non-queer community and white queer community. It is a space held to protect trans womxn of colour, so as guests and participants within this culture it is imperative that we all do our best to respect and honour this sacred space. Homophobia, Transphobia, and any discriminatory language and/or beliefs will not be tolerated. Remember to check your privilege at the door.
To learn more about the culture of Ballroom check out this link: 
https://artsandculture.google.com/project/ballroom. 
The HOUSE OF MARAMA honours the whenua in which this event is able to take place on, belonging to the true sovereigns: 
Te Ātiawa iwi. We also stand in solidarity with indigenous peoples across the world facing injustice. 
TOITŪ TE TIRITI
FREE PALESTINE
FREE CONGO
FREE WEST PAPUA
FREE KANAKY
FREE INDIGENOUS PEOPLE EVERYWHERE. 
LAND BACK.
Be sure to check out the growing Wellington Ballroom scene and community by following @houseofmarama and @ova_collective on Instagram.
Please do not hesitate to contact us via houseofmarama@gmail.com or on any of our socials for any questions or concerns you may have.
---------
BALLROOM TERMINOLOGY*
OTA = Open to All, not limited to a specific gender identity/expression, or category style.
SHAKE VS SHAKE = We wanna see you shake that ass, shake that hair, shake those thighs. We want to see why YOU have the best shake.
FACE = Serve FACE, highlighting your structure, eyes, teeth, skin and nose. Makeup allowed.
BODY =The ability to sell your confidence in yourself, specifically through your body (not through sex appeal).
PERFORMANCE = Performing and battling in a style of Vogue (Old Way, New Way, or Vogue Fem).
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Kotahitanga: Artist Series - Riki Gooch and Bennett Pomana, Join Te Waka Huia for the final Kotahitanga event featuring a collaborative response to He Kura Toi Tangata from Wellington taonga Riki Gooch and Bennett Pomana.

Be prepared for textured sound and thought gymnastics with Riki on the drums and Bennett on the mic, closing out the series with one epic jam from these two legends.

5:30pm Doors open, bar open
6pm Artist response begins
6:30pm Interval
6:45pm Artist Q&A
7pm Closing Karakia and time to explore He Kura Toi Tangata exhibition
8pm Bar closes, event ends

About Riki Gooch

Dr Riki Neihana Gooch lives in Te Whanganui-a-Tara, Aotearoa. His work spans multiple disciplines, including composition, performance, sound art, production, and academic research. He has led and conducted large-scale ensemble projects, performed in a wide range of collaborative settings, and created work for both recorded and live contexts. His ongoing projects include solo and group performances, conduction ensembles, DJ sets, and sound-based installations. He is also involved in cultural leadership and mentorship roles, holding wānanga and contributing to intergenerational knowledge exchange within the arts.


About Bennett Pomana

Bennett Pomana (Te Aitanga-a-Māhaki, Ngāi Tāmanuhiri) is a musician raised in Upper Hutt, with roots in Tūranganui-a-Kiwa. A longtime contributor to Aotearoa’s hip hop legacy, he has been part of pioneering groups including Upper Hutt Posse and Dam Native. His work is deeply influenced by his Māori identity, drawing inspiration from whakapapa, lived experience, and the ongoing pursuit of justice and expression through sound.


This event has been developed by Te Waka Huia Wellington Museum and is presented in collaboration with our programme partner Kāhui Legal.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Composers Competition 2025, The annual Lilburn Trust NZSM Composers Competition is a major event in the School Calendar.
Each year, a selection panel chooses works by currently enrolled NZSM students, composed within the previous twelve months, to be performed in a concert by fellow students and alumni.
The finalists will have their compositions performed at this concert.
Works by: Sara Arain, Francois Asuncion, Nathan Carter, Lauren Doherty, Mallory Elmo, Caoimhe Lane, Skye Lynch, Chester Nevil, Joshua Old, Estella Wallace
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Kotahitanga: Artist Series - Tusiata Avia, We are honoured to host acclaimed poet; Tusiata Avia who will be opening Kotahitanga with her response to He Kura Toi Tangata.

Expect nothing less than the power of the word steeped in truth and machete-sharpened wit from this New Zealand Samoan poetry pantheon.

5:30pm Doors open, bar open
6pm Artist response begins
6:30pm Interval
6:45pm Artist Q&A
7pm Closing Karakia and time to explore He Kura Toi Tangata exhibition
8pm Bar closes, event ends



About Tusiata Avia

Tusiata Avia MNZM is a poet, writer and performer. She has published 5 books of poetry, children’s books, short film, radio documentary. Her iconic play Wild Dogs Under My Skirt showed Off-Broadway in 2020, where it won the Fringe Encore Outstanding Production of the Year. Her most recent play, The Savage Coloniser Show won Best New Play at Wellington Theatre Awards 2024. Both plays are based on books of poetry of the same name.

Tusiata was awarded a Member of the New Zealand Order of Merit for services to poetry and in 2024, the Prime Ministers Award for Literary Achievement: Poetry.


This event has been developed by Te Waka Huia Wellington Museum and is presented in collaboration with our programme partner Kāhui Legal.
label: Arts & Theatre

He is also involved in cultural leadership and mentorship roles, holding wānanga and contributing to intergenerational knowledge exchange within the arts.


About Bennett Pomana

Bennett Pomana (Te Aitanga-a-Māhaki, Ngāi Tāmanuhiri) is a musician raised in Upper Hutt, with roots in Tūranganui-a-Kiwa. A longtime contributor to Aotearoa’s hip hop legacy, he has been part of pioneering groups including Upper Hutt Posse and Dam Native. His work is deeply influenced by his Māori identity, drawing inspiration from whakapapa, lived experience, and the ongoing pursuit of justice and expression through sound.

Tusiata Avia MNZM is a poet, writer and performer. She has published 5 books of poetry, children’s books, short film, radio documentary. description:
Legally Blonde The Musical, Legally Blonde The Musical
Coasters Musical Theatre presents "Legally Blonde the Musical" from October 2-12, 2025 at Southwards Theatre, Paraparaumu. This uplifting musical comedy follows Elle Woods' incredible journey from fashionable sorority queen to Harvard Law student, filled with catchy songs, dazzling choreography, and plenty of pink power.

Based on the beloved hit movie starring Reese Witherspoon, the show delivers an empowering message about believing in yourself, breaking stereotypes, and discovering your own strength and intelligence. Lauren Loghry makes her exciting Kapiti debut as the determined and vivacious Elle Woods in this feel-good production that promises to entertain and inspire audiences of all ages.

Tickets are $35, available at www.coastersmusicaltheatre.com.

About Riki Gooch

Dr Riki Neihana Gooch lives in Te Whanganui-a-Tara, Aotearoa. His work spans multiple disciplines, including composition, performance, sound art, production, and academic research. He has led and conducted large-scale ensemble projects, performed in a wide range of collaborative settings, and created work for both recorded and live contexts. His ongoing projects include solo and group performances, conduction ensembles, DJ sets, and sound-based installations. Let’s Get Visual! (A NZSL-interpreted show), Let’s Get Visual! (A NZSL-interpreted show)
Presented by Riley Harter

Join us for a spontaneous show inspired by you, our audience, and a unique combination of creative improvisers (performing together for the first time!). With NZSL interpreters incorporated and sign language celebrated, it will be a playful exploration of storytelling, games and scenes with a visual twist.

Discover the space where comedy and theatre can be a universal language as we welcome everyone to come and experience this joyful show together.

Directed by Riley Harter
Cast from NZIF participants
In collaboration with a Deaf Consultant and NZSL interpreters

The show may contain mature themes and language, but not gratuitously. The show may contain voluntary audience interaction, such as giving a suggestion for a scene.

Photo by Criss Grueber

description:
Manage Your Expectations, Created and Performed by Eliza Sanders
Produced by House of Sand
Directed by Charley Allanah

You decide the ending…

Solo performer Eliza Sanders has a simple task: to tell you everything that will happen in the show, so you can decide if you would like to see it. Nothing is ever so simple.

This genre-defying work of dance, theatre, live film, clown and absurd philosophising takes the idea of the ‘trigger warning’ to its absurdist extreme to question how ‘informed’ consent can really be, and asking ‘How much do you really want to know?’

Created and performed by multi-award-winning maverick of the stage Eliza Sanders, Manage Your Expectations helps us to see the limits of the power to communicate and our failures to say what we mean. Through movement, multimedia, and razor-sharp wit, it examines the impossibility of perfect communication, musing on the influence of context, identity and personal history while creating something beautiful from our collective mess.

“Clever, witty, evocative, subversive, immersive, despairing, poignant, personal and universal” — Deirdre Tarrant, Theatreview

“Beautifully vulnerable” – Chloe Jaques, Theatreview, 2024

Full of vigour, energy, chaos and a hint of confrontation, Manage Your Expectations is a mind (and body) bending show about how we connect in an increasingly complex world. And you decide the ending…

Content warning: this show contains explicit content, mild coarse language, heavy nudity, themes of abortion and rape.

WINNER: Best Performer, Whangārei Fringe 2024
WINNER: Outstanding Solo Performance, NZ Fringe 2024
WINNER: San Diego Tour Ready, NZ Fringe 2024

description:
MAMIL 2: GOMIL, MAMIL 2: GOMIL
The Lycra is back: GOMIL – the hilarious new sequel to MAMIL hits the road across New Zealand!

One of New Zealand’s biggest theatrical success stories is back in the saddle! Following the phenomenal popularity of MAMIL (Middle Aged Man in Lycra), which played to over 70,000 people across the country, comes its laugh-out-loud sequel: GOMIL – Grumpy Old Man in Lycra. And this time, it's going national.

From the comedic genius of writer and director Gregory Cooper (MAMIL, That Bloody Woman) and starring Kiwi acting royalty Mark Hadlow ONZM (King Kong, The Hobbit, SNAG), GOMIL is primed to bring a fresh wave of laughter, Lycra, and life’s mid-life absurdities to 14 cities throughout New Zealand in a major national tour kicking off this September.

After a critically acclaimed, sold-out debut season in Ōtautahi Christchurch, GOMIL is shifting gears and going full speed ahead across Aotearoa. Audiences who laughed (and winced) along with the unforgettable antics in MAMIL will now follow the journey of our favourite cyclist as he faces a new life stage: grumpier, greyer, and still clad in way too much Lycra.

Hadlow, one of the country’s most beloved performers, reprises his role with impeccable comic timing and emotional depth, bringing to life a story that’s not only hilarious, but also touching, timely, and unashamedly relatable.

Whether you're a weekend warrior, a reluctant spouse, or just someone who enjoys watching others sweat the small (and stretchy) stuff, GOMIL is a must-see. This show digs deep into the world of ageing men, fragile egos, friendship, family, and the undeniable need to keep moving—no matter how creaky your knees may be.

Get ready to laugh, reflect, and maybe even wince in recognition as GOMIL pedals its way across the country this spring. It’s more than a show—it’s a celebration of growing older (and slightly wider) with humour, heart, and a healthy dose of spandex.

Don’t miss the next chapter in this iconic Kiwi comedy saga. GOMIL is coming to a theatre near you - lycra, laughter and all.

--
For accessibility seating information and wheelchair space bookings please email or call 04)9740535 during office hours.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Made to bloom, exhibition by Josefine Gronkrans, We have a solo exhibition coming up from one of our ceramic artists Josefine Gronkrans
The opening night is 14th October, Tuesday at 5:30 pm
Vincents gallery : Willis St Village
5/148 Willis St
Wellington
14th October - 4th November
Pencil the date.
Nau mai haere mai.
Josefine Gronkrans bio
I'm a ceramicists from a rural part of Wellington who take inspiration from the beauty of Creation. I moved to beautiful Aotearoa from Sweden a few years ago, and my journey with ceramics started in 2023 and I've been elbows deep in clay ever since. I use flora found all over the world, and outside my doorsteps, to shape my artwork. My ceramic pieces are all hand made and no piece will be the other alike. I mainly throw a shape on the wheel and then let it tell me what it wants to become.
This exhibition is guided by Ecclesiastes 3:1-11. I think life is beautiful in it's times of joy, but also in the times of struggle, where we can grow and learn.
A Time for Everything
There is a time for everything,
and a season for every activity under the heavens:
a time to be born and a time to die,
a time to plant and a time to uproot,
a time to kill and a time to heal,
a time to tear down and a time to build,
a time to weep and a time to laugh,
a time to mourn and a time to dance,
a time to scatter stones and a time to gather them,
a time to embrace and a time to refrain from embracing,
a time to search and a time to give up,
a time to keep and a time to throw away,
a time to tear and a time to mend,
a time to be silent and a time to speak,
a time to love and a time to hate,
a time for war and a time for peace.
What do workers gain from their toil? I have seen the burden God has laid on the human race. He has made everything beautiful in its time. He has also set eternity in the human heart; yet no one can fathom what God has done from beginning to end.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Monument, Sculpting the future of our nation

“Succession meets Barbie” -Showcase Victoria
Edith Aldridge is the youngest woman to be elected leader of her country. In a lush presidential suite, she has just ninety minutes to get ready for the most monumental day of her life. But things are not going to plan. Due to heavy fog, her team is stuck in another city. Enter Rosie, a twenty-two year old makeup artist from the David Jones counter, sent last minute to help Edith get camera ready.
From very different worlds, these two women, though face to face, do not see eye to eye in this provocative, slick and funny play that is “sparkling fresh and urgently of the now”.

The team that brought you PRIMA FACIE, brings you this dynamic new work that “explores the role that makeup and fashion play in how we perceive and receive women in power.” -review quotes from Arts Hub & Australian Arts Review.


Written by Emily Sheehan
Produced by Kavanah Productions & BRAVE Theatre
Directed by Lyndee-Jane Rutherford

description:
New Zealand International Comedy Festival, Every May, the capital comes alive with laughter, thanks to the New Zealand International Comedy Festival (NZICF). New Zealand’s homegrown talent shares the stage with some of the world’s most exciting comedians. You could catch a big-name international artist, or discover a new local rising star. 
Since it began in 1993, the aim of the festival has been to champion the craft of comedy so everyone can share a laugh. Every year, a huge group of comedians descend on Wellington from local shores and beyond to deliver three weeks of merriment. 
The festival offers a diverse range of high-quality laughs. It showcases the best of local comedy and gives audiences a taste of some of the world’s best acts. Catch over 100 comics performing at The Opera House, BATS Theatre, Fringe Bar, San Fran, and more.
