description:
Over and Out @ TAHI Festival, Over and Out @ TAHI Festival
"NEVER become a truck driver!" - A young Jackson Burling took that advice, avoiding the fork in the road, but now, after a long and gruelling two year slog in the arts industry he must confront that age old question: "why not, Dad?" - and take us along for the ride.

In ‘Over and Out’, premiering at the 2025 TAHI Festival, he’ll bring you a REAL interview, a BIG character, and even bigger QUESTIONS to the stage. One actor. 50 minutes. Countless emotional potholes ‼️

Along the way, we get a rare look into the gritty, heartfelt, and often-overlooked life of one of Aotearoa’s essential workers — the truck driver 🚛

Is the open road calling — or is the stage his true destination?

Buckle up. This is verbatim theatre with serious mileage.

Created and Performed by Jackson Burling
Directed by Simon Leary | Produced by Tom Smith
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Mother Tongue- Opening Event, Join us to celebrate the opening of Mother Tongue, opening event 27th of August, Wednesday 5.30pm
The exhibition with run till September 20th
Wednesday to Friday 11-2pm
Weekends 11-4pm
Mother Tongue is a love letter written in paint. Three mixed-race artists from across Te Ika-a-Māui — Carmel Aroha Salmanzadeh, Jessica Miku and Anthony Zemke — trace the echoes of matrilineal language and culture, reaching for words that live in their mothers’ voices but not their own. The show speaks to the intricacies of love, loss, grief and gratitude. To inherit a tongue but not its fluency is to stand at the threshold of intimacy — close enough to hear it, yet unable to fully enter. At its heart are nine paintings that pursue a multifaceted visual language that expresses the artists’ ability (or inability) to connect without language.
To love without saying “I love you” – “ka nui taku aroha ki a koe” / ”دوستت دارم” / “いつもありがとう”
Anthony Zemke (b. 1998, Aotearoa) is an Iranian-Pākehā illustrator and painter based in Tāmaki Makaurau.
Working within a conceptual framework guided by the Baha’i teachings, Eastern mysticism, and Continental philosophy, Zemke’s practice sees abstraction as the ideal vehicle for communicating psychosocial and spiritual realities. His works explore the boundaries of language, the dialectic of human oneness and diversity, and the various dimensions of radical compassion.
Carmel Salmanzadeh (b. 2002, Tāmaki Makaurau) is of Māori, Iranian, Samoan and Chinese descent. He uri tēnei nō Ngāti Hauaa, Waikato, Te Aitanga-a-Hauiti, Ngāti Ira me Ngāti Porou. Salmanzadeh traces links
between the pictorial languages and motifs used in the traditional and indigenous practices of her multiethnic
whakapapa; exploring how visual narratives transcend cultural boundaries. Manifested in large-scale pieces, their works are influenced by the structure and design of Persian carpets, Samoan siapo and Māori taniko.
Jessica Miku (b. 2000, Whangārei) is a Japanese/Pākehā artist based in Te Whanganui-a-Tara. Using the Japanese cultural anthropological concept Hare-Ke, which harmonises the fantastical with the mundane, they produce paintings of imagined female figures within ecological fantasy. These portals of otherworldliness are used to explore notions of tenderness—in heart, soul, and flesh.
Promotional Design by Tamara Irvine
This exhibition will be accompanied by a written work by Yue Pibrow
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
The King's Singers, C L O S E H A R M O N Y
For over half a century, The King’s Singers have been synonymous with impeccable blend, radiant tone, and joyful music-making. Formed in 1968 by six choral scholars from King’s College, Cambridge, the group quickly earned an international reputation for their unique approach to “close harmony” — a seamless weaving of voices across centuries and styles. Today, their performances continue to enchant audiences from London to Los Angeles, and now, back in Aotearoa.
This bespoke programme, created especially for their March 2026 tour, offers a journey through The King’s Singers’ remarkable musical history. Beginning with their earliest repertoire from the late 1960s, the evening will move through Renaissance sacred music, English folksong, jazz standards, pop classics, and contemporary works. Expect Byrd alongside Billy Joel, madrigals alongside The Beach Boys, Disney magic alongside dazzling new arrangements from the songwriters of today.
The concert also carries a special significance — it will be one of the final New Zealand appearances for long-standing baritone Chris Bruerton. A proud Kiwi, Chris has been a cornerstone of The King’s Singers for over a decade, touring the world and helping shape their modern sound. His farewell tour offers Wellington audiences a rare chance to celebrate his artistry on home soil.
A highlight of the night will be the “Something Borrowed” segment, where the ensemble will present a pair of songs chosen especially for Wellington — a personal gift to the local audience, performed in their signature style.
With wit, warmth, and unparalleled musicianship, The King’s Singers promise an evening that is both a celebration of their legacy and a showcase of their continuing innovation. Whether you’ve followed their journey for decades or are hearing them for the first time, Close Harmony at Wellington Cathedral will be a night to remember.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Party Pigs!, When: 20th – 26th September 2025
Monday - Saturday 10am
No shows on Sundays
Created By Internationally-renowned theatre puppeteer Peter Wilson.
Surprise – it’s one little piggy’s birthday!
Party Pigs! is a delightful puppetry story set around the excitement and anticipation
of a child’s birthday party – piggy style!
After accidentally spoiling one little piggy’s birthday, nine little piggies decide to throw
a surprise party for their friend. Working together, the excitement builds until they just
can’t wait any longer. This joyous family friendly play reflects a world of fun and
games, whether real or imaginary, and reminds us as adults not to take life too
seriously.
Performer: Kenny King
Director: Jacqueline Coats
PARTY PIGS! by Peter Wilson
By arrangement with Playmarket

Prices are just $15.00 per person
Under 2's are free
Special $7 preview show on Saturday September 20th 2025!
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Over and Out @ TAHI Festival, Over and Out @ TAHI Festival
"NEVER become a truck driver!" - A young Jackson Burling took that advice, avoiding the fork in the road, but now, after a long and gruelling two year slog in the arts industry he must confront that age old question: "why not, Dad?" - and take us along for the ride.

In ‘Over and Out’, premiering at the 2025 TAHI Festival, he’ll bring you a REAL interview, a BIG character, and even bigger QUESTIONS to the stage. One actor. 50 minutes. Countless emotional potholes ‼️

Along the way, we get a rare look into the gritty, heartfelt, and often-overlooked life of one of Aotearoa’s essential workers — the truck driver 🚛

Is the open road calling — or is the stage his true destination?

Buckle up. This is verbatim theatre with serious mileage.

Created and Performed by Jackson Burling
Directed by Simon Leary | Produced by Tom Smith
label: Arts & Theatre

Featuring an hour and 15mins of hot improvisers, long-form narrative work and more laughs than you have lung capacity for, this show is sure to have you “frequently laughing so hard [your] chest hurts” — Wellingtonista. Seated cabaret style in the iconic Circa Bar, PopRox is the perfect way to end your week with a laugh! Be sure to book early as shows will sell-out.

description:
Pub Choir - Wellington, Aotearoa - Michael Fowler Centre (Average at Best Tour), Pub Choir - Wellington, Aotearoa - Michael Fowler Centre (Average at Best Tour)
Do you have the best singing voice in the world? Unlikely. But do you have the WORST singing voice in the world? EQUALLY UNLIKELY. Your voice is probably average (at best), and at Pub Choir: we think that’s great!

Now in it’s 8th year, Pub Choir is the easiest, funniest, largest music lesson in the world. Created and led by the human rubber band Astrid, be snapped into shape and flicked by her quick humour as she teaches everybody how to make a BRAND NEW PIECE OF ART TOGETHER.

What will happen at the show? An entirely improvised, comedy music lesson, where you are the main attraction. Astrid will teach you one song (yep, just the one) in 3-part harmony, and you will do your best to follow her instructions and not to cry.

Generally, you should prepare yourself to learn something new and to not be a dickhead in public. But what should you specifically prepare? Nothing. It’s not that kind of choir. There’ll be no auditions and no homework. Just bring your mouth and we’ll do the rest.

So come and bring your average-at-best self, and your average-at-best friends, and let’s try to worry less and feel better. Also worth mentioning, Astrid wrote a book, and it’s called Average At Best and signed copies will be available for pre-order purchase with Pub Choir tickets, to be collected at the show. Vocal health depending, Astrid plans to sit at the merch desk and sign these books after every show until her audience grows tired of her.

This show is 18+ Please be aware that this event will be filmed & photographed. By purchasing a ticket and attending this event, you are giving your consent to be filmed & photographed during this event.

Tickets on sale here 10am local time 3 July 2025:
https://www.ticketmaster.co.nz/event/240062D286A9097D
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
KOHA SUNDAY YOGA - Heated Flow, KOHA SUNDAY YOGA - Heated Flow
Join us EVERY Sunday for a 90 minute Heated Flow for koha entry (ie, give what you can)! Proceeds are donated to a different charitable organisation each month that's committed to supporting the wellbeing of Aotearoa!

This weekly class is open to everyone, regardless of yoga experience - haere mai!

BYO mat or hire for $2; towels available for $3 and make sure to bring a big water bottle!

To book: Download the AWHI app to view the timetable, or simply show up in good time on Sunday!

WHAT IS 'KOHA'? Koha loosely translates to 'gift' or exchange. In other words, pay what you can for the class!

For more information about our studio, visit our website at awhiyoga.co.nz

description:
ROADKILL: The Uber-cool Musical - TAHI Festival, Hey everyone- we have a little change of plans!
Unfortunately, ROADKILL: The Uber-Cool Musical won’t be happening this time around, but we’re already cooking up something even better for the future. All ticket holders will receive a full refund and we can’t wait to welcome you to our next big adventure.
Thank you for your excitement and your support.
ROADKILL The Uber-Cool Musical takes you on a wildly immersive journey through love, life and rock ’n’ roll — all from the back seat of a van. This intimate one-man musical combines humour, heart and unforgettable tunes for an experience like no other.
Strap in for the rollercoaster ride of your life as we take a regular mundane occurrence of driving in an Uber and blow wide open the private life, memories and miss happenings of our hero, and driver, Terry.

Carpool karaoke meets intense love story meets wild murder mystery.

Much more than a musical, its an experience, its a journey and an attraction!

In the space of a usual cabaret show and with the help of the passengers in the van, you will witness and be part of, childhood dreams, births, deaths and marriages, high drama, dark comedy, all sung live with a kickass, original, meatloaf-esque rock soundtrack. Surprises and magic ensues as we push the van, and Terry, to the limits of what is possible.

This will be an intimate, sensory overload, in a van. A full grand musical with all the bells and whistles.

With only 9 seats available each ride, grab your mates and have a private experience in the fast lane!
The hottest ticket in town- be sure to experience the ride of your life!

The show is in the style of a musical crossed with karaoke songs you have never heard before...

The van will be stationary and parked for this initial season.

Winner of BEST IN FRINGE and EMERGING ARTIST OF THE YEAR at the Dunedin Fringe and Winner of MOST INNOVATIVE at the NZ Fringe awards this year!
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Red!, Red!
Step into a world where fairy tales come alive with imagination, music, and creative collaboration. Lucy Mulgan’s Red! The Opera—a fresh and engaging retelling of Little Red Riding Hood—invites audiences of all ages to experience opera in a new, interactive way.

This vibrant one-act opera takes the well-loved story and gives it a bold, modern twist. Red is no longer a passive heroine but a spirited and resourceful young girl who learns to stand up for herself. Along the way she encounters a mischievous Wolf, a feisty Granny, and a host of colourful characters who bring the forest to life with humour, warmth, and plenty of surprises.

At the heart of Red! is participation. Children take an active role in shaping the performance—creating sound effects, movements, and responses that become part of the show. Their voices blend with professional singers and musicians, making every performance unique and alive with energy. The result is a joyful celebration of music, storytelling, and community.

Mulgan’s score is witty, playful, and sophisticated, full of catchy rhythms, lyrical arias, and imaginative textures. It captures the drama and comedy of the tale while remaining approachable and fun for newcomers to opera. Both seasoned opera-goers and first-time audiences will find themselves swept up in the sparkle and charm of this inventive work.

With its empowering message, interactive spirit, and musical brilliance, Red! is an opera for today’s families—offering laughter, excitement, and a reminder that even the smallest voices can make themselves heard.
label: Arts & Theatre

description: Spring Equinox, Come celebrate the Spring Equinox with us! Enjoy the sunset from within the henge (if possible), learn about how your ancestor viewed the equinox then enjoy exploring the night sky.

description:
Roger Hall’s Easy Money -final night, Roger Hall’s Easy Money -final night
A comedy plot driven farce loosely based on Ben Johnson’s Jacobean Tale The Alchemist, set in the current day. A laugh a minute tale of greed, described by Hall as having “no moral, no message – just entertainment”

An Australian couple is based in a swanky Auckland harbourside Airbnb, armed with a loose plan to shake down as many self-satisfied cashed-up “neighbours” as possible; in the hope of a quick payday and an early retirement. All about greed and how a fool and their money are soon parted; with double crosses, dirty tricks and dodgy dealings….It’s so audacious, you can see the dollar signs flickering in the eyes of their marks.

(Revised in 2022 to update and change ethnicity)

DATES
Wed 27 Aug 2025 - Sat 6 Sep 2025
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Rory Lowe: NZ Tour (Petone), Rory Lowe: NZ Tour (Petone)
Award-winning Australian comedian Rory Lowe is bringing the chaos to New Zealand!
Fresh from sold-out tours across Australia and Asia—and with his first comedy special about to be filmed—Rory hits NZ for the very first time with an hour of wild stories, razor-sharp crowd work, and unfiltered laughs.

From getting arrested for terrorism, to snitching on a meth head, to getting married and failing miserably at quitting the party life, Rory’s real-life tales are as ridiculous as they are hilarious. Expect raw, real, and unpredictable comedy from one of the most exciting voices in stand-up today.

Critics and audiences can’t get enough:

★★★★★ – What’s On In Adelaide:
“Comedy at its finest! Lowe draws us in with his unique stories and larger-than-life personality… absolutely guarantees a f*ing funny hour of laughs!”


★★★★½ – Fourth Wall Media:
“Rory Lowe is absolutely killing it in the comedy scene… Fast-paced and non-stop, the jokes are funnier every year and the crowd interaction is spot on.”


★★★★ – The AU Review:
“Time flies when watching Rory, a non-stop comedian, with ready-made jokes and quick wit to keep the crowd on its toes.”

With over 2.2 million YouTube subscribers as part of YeahMad, 475K TikTok followers, and a reputation for high-energy, off-the-wall shows, Rory Lowe is ready to take New Zealand by storm.

One man, one mic, and an hour of absolute mayhem—get ready for Rory Lowe unleashed.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Running into the Sun - Te Auaha, Wellington, Running into the Sun - Te Auaha, Wellington
https://www.teauahaevents.com/home/running-into-the-sun

After winning Best Theatre at the Melbourne Fringe, Running into the Sun comes home to Pōneke for the first time. The 10 creatives in a2 Company create an “exhausting but exhilarating” story of what it means to be alive right now with live music, dance and theatre.

The story follows Ash (Ben Ashby), Morris (Ethan Morse) and Mary (Jasmine Susic), at their university graduation house party. As they deal with personal heartbreaks, surprises and betrayals they must also reckon with a climate disaster unfolding in their hometown and a global future filled with war and political unrest. Dance, Clown, Live Music, Film and Physical Theatre weave together to catch the feeling of hope in the face of oncoming doom.

Running into the sun was developed by a2 Company; The Dance & Theatre production house co-directed by Nadiyah Akbar (Footnote NZ Dance, Joel Bray Dance) and Ben Ashby (Artistic Director of Long Cloud Youth Theatre 2020-2023).

“messy, joyous, heartfelt and completely off the chain.” - Melbourne Fringe Festival: Judges’ Picks.

“...suffocating and comforting …exhausting but exhilarating” - My Melbourne Arts

https://www.teauahaevents.com/home/running-into-the-sun

Credits

Ben Ashby - Writer, Director, Producer, “Ash”

Nadiyah Akbar - Choreographer, Rehearsal Director, Dancer

Ethan Morse - “Morris”

Jasmine Susic - “Mary”

Alec Katsourakis - “Jack”

Luke Romero - Dancer

Toby Leman - Composer, Saxophone, Synths

Seth Boy - Double Bass

Lennox Grootjans - Composer, Drums

Asha Barr - AV, Cinematography, Stage Design, Technical Stage Manager

Cleo Copplestone - Graphic Design
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Jamie and The Numbers at The Rogue, Jamie and The Numbers are playing live at The Rogue and Vagabond!
For five years, we've been playing the music we love, often favouring Northern Soul. What started as a one-off recording project has turned into a passion for playing moving originals and energetic covers in our own, unapologetically loud and soulful way.
Join Jamie Musuvā (lead vocals), Elliott Fuimaono, and the Lerwill brothers (Geoff, Craig, and Mark Lerwill) for a loud night out at the iconic Rogue and Vagabond.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Confessions Booth, ✨ Confessions Booth - Hosted by a Fabulous Drag Host ✨
Wellington, it’s time to spill your secrets… or just sip and enjoy everyone else’s! 👀
Step into the Confessions Booth for a cheeky, interactive night of cocktails, laughs, and anonymous confessions, hosted by a fabulous drag MC. Part comedy, part interactive theatre, part party - guaranteed to keep you laughing, sipping, and maybe confessing…
Here’s how it works:
On arrival, grab a drink and submit a confession on a card or via QR code. Totally optional - sipping cocktails is a perfectly valid choice!
Confessions must be about you only - keep other people’s skeletons in their closet.
You can submit anonymously, or add your name for a little extra spice and interaction with the host (and a chance to win a price).
Selected confessions will be read aloud by our drag MC, who will add cheeky commentary, playful roasts, and audience Q&A.
Not every confession will make it to the stage, but every secret counts and contributes to the fun.
Between confession sets, enjoy music, cocktails, and mingling. After the main show, the party continues with a pop, disco, and house playlist.
Ticket Tiers:
GA - $25: Entry only.
Upgraded - $35: Entry + welcome bubbly 🥂
VIP - $55: Entry + welcome drink (cocktail, wine, beer or Pal) + charcuterie cup + priority seating.
📍 Where: Whisky & Wood, Wellington
📅 When: Thursday 23 October, 7:00pm
Sip. Spill. Repeat. Whether you’re confessing your darkest secrets or just watching the chaos unfold, this is a night of laughs, drinks, and drama you won’t forget.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Saturday Laughs with Samantha Hannah and Wilson Dixon, Saturday Laughs at Abandoned Taproom Petone is a showcase of some of your favourite comedians in the heart of Petone

September features guest headline act, Wilson Dixon
Hailing from Cripple Creek Colorado, country music legend, Wilson Dixon’s melodic philosophies on life have seen him become one of the most loved characters on the Aust, UK and NZ circuit.
He has had sold out season’s at The New International Comedy Festival and has won awards for Best Show and in 2010 he won the supreme Festival Award The Fred for outstanding artistic achievement.
Before sweeping the New Zealand International Comedy Festival his show ”Wilson Dixon’s American Dream” played to rave reviews at the Edinburgh Fringe and Melbourne International Comedy Festival. Directly after the Edinburgh Fringe Wilson went on to appear in his own 4 part radio series for the BBC – The Wilson Dixon Line.
An unmissable act!

With MC Samantha Hannah
From her homeland in Scotland to her new home in NZ, Samantha has had audiences laughing around the globe. A class act.
Host of award-winning podcast Are We Pals? and as seen on the NZ Comedy Gala
“a talented raconteur” - Fringe Biscuit “Expert stand up throughout“ - Chortle “One of the funniest ladies on the planet” - Remote Goat

More acts to be announced

May's show sold out, best to book now to avoid disappointment
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Sophie Thorn – Victoria University Photography Collection, A tour of the photographs from Ngā Puhipuhi o Te Herenga Waka—Victoria University of Wellington Art Collection
Te Herenga Waka—Victoria University of Wellington holds a nationally significant collection of works of art which is under the care of Te Pātaka Toi Adam Art Gallery. Known as Ngā Puhipuhi o Te Herenga Waka, or 'the feathers which adorn the waka', over half of this collection can be found on display in the various buildings on the university campuses at any one time.
For this special outing, join the gallery’s Kaiwhakarākei, Curator Collections, Sophie Thorn, for an afterhours tour of the Hunter Building focusing on the photography in the collection.
We will see photographic works by Lucien Rizos, Ans Westra, Peter Preyer, Joyce Campbell, Fiona Pardington, Ann Noble and Chris Corson Scott.
We are meeting at the foyer of the Hunter Building. This is the big set of glass doors off gate 2 between the two sets of lights on Kelburn Parade.
As the tour begins at 6pm we would suggest,that people park in the Hunter Building carpark (coming in Gate 1 (right at the bend between Salamanca Road and Kelburn Parade). While these are reserved spaces for staff after 5:30pm parking is a bit of a free-for-all on campus after hours.
Thursday, 11 September, 6:00pm start, Meet at Hunter Building (Main Entrance off Kelburn Parade)
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Workshop: Stitching with Nature, Come and join us for a creative workshop hosted by The Wellington Embroiderers’ Guild. The workshop supports the exhibition Petals and Threads: Patterns in Nature and Needle, a collaboration between plant artist and ecologist Kate Mc Alpine and The Wellington Embroiderers’ Guild.
In this workshop you’ll be using nature as a resource, including seeds, seed pods and leaves. Participants will explore techniques for combining traditional embroidery with natural materials to make one-of-a-kind textile art pieces.
All materials will be provided and the workshop is koha.
Register Here: https://weg.org.nz/registration-form/
Any questions email: PetalsAndThreads2025@gmail.com
Or check out Kate McAlpine’s site: https://plantart.nz/.../petals-and-threads-patterns-in.../
Alongside the Workshop:
The Exhibtition: Petals and Threads: Patterns in Nature and Needle Exhibition
Online Auction: Bid on all 44 artworks during the exhibition period.
Another Workshop at Te Auaha:
Hands-on Plant Art – 1pm 27 September
Register to save your seat below!
Calendar: A beautifully designed 2026 calendar featuring 12 pairs of selected works, available for purchase via Trade Me and in person. More details to come!

description:
Saturday Laughs with Michael Macaulay and Lana Walters, Saturday Laughs is a comedy showcase with top Kiwi comedians from around the country, right in the heart of Wellington at Fringe Bar!

This month features headline act Lana Walters
Winner of the Billy T award, Lana is a fabulous standup comedian, television writer and improviser. A regular panelist on 7Days and The Project, you may have also seen her in the Best Foods Comedy Gala or The Great Comedy Debate. As well as all this, Lana is a mum of two young kids giving her endless material and sleepless nights.

With MC Michael Macaulay
Michael started in comedy in the late 90s, eventually winning the Becks Beer award for Best Newcomer at the Edinburgh Fringe Festival in 2001. After a nearly 20 year hiatus he returned to comedy in a totally different country and having learned no life lessons at all.
Since then he has twice been nominated for ‘Best MC’, in the Welly Awards; won his own Welly in 2020 for being an all-round nice person; and performs up and down Aotearoa.

Also featuring
Gabby Anderson
Ralph Hilaga
and more!
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Enjoy Singing? Open Night with Hutt City Chorale, Join us for a fun night of choral singing. Come along to our open night at St Marks Church, 58 Woburn Road, Lower Hutt. You will be very welcome to join us in our warm ups and singing.

We’ll provide you with music for the evening. Meet our fun and creative Music Director Jonathan Berkahn and talented pianist Phillip O’Malley plus our friendly choir, for an enjoyable evening of singing.

We start the evening with our vocal warm ups at 7.15pm, sing beautiful music together, stop for a delicious supper half way through, then continue singing until 9.15pm. If you would like to return, you can join us for up to four free visits. After that time, you can decide whether you would like to join Hutt City Chorale as a member.

We welcome new members and invite you to join us in 2025. Contact Prue, our chairperson, with any questions huttcitychorale@gmail.com or visit www.facebook.com/HuttCityChorale. We look forward to seeing you there and singing together. Join us for an enjoyable evening.
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Mums and Bubs Yoga in Wellington, Mums and Bubs Yoga in Wellington
Your first step back to movement after birth, gentle, nourishing, and designed especially for new mothers.
In this class, we focus on core and pelvic floor reconnection, body balancing, and breath - creating a safe, solid foundation before returning to any other type of exercise.
Babies are lovingly nurtured in this space while you care for yourself.

Swingers, Presented by Liz Butler and Ben Jardine

Swingers features real improv power couples from Aotearoa and beyond, performing with other improv power couples.

You’ll see real couples perform together, then switch partners, then perform in one big group scene. They fell in love with each other and now you get to fall in love with them.

description:
Sophie Thorn – Victoria University Photography Collection, A tour of the photographs from Ngā Puhipuhi o Te Herenga Waka—Victoria University of Wellington Art Collection
Te Herenga Waka—Victoria University of Wellington holds a nationally significant collection of works of art which is under the care of Te Pātaka Toi Adam Art Gallery. Known as Ngā Puhipuhi o Te Herenga Waka, or 'the feathers which adorn the waka', over half of this collection can be found on display in the various buildings on the university campuses at any one time.
For this special outing, join the gallery’s Kaiwhakarākei, Curator Collections, Sophie Thorn, for an afterhours tour of the Hunter Building focusing on the photography in the collection.
We will see photographic works by Lucien Rizos, Ans Westra, Peter Preyer, Joyce Campbell, Fiona Pardington, Ann Noble and Chris Corson Scott.
We are meeting at the foyer of the Hunter Building. This is the big set of glass doors off gate 2 between the two sets of lights on Kelburn Parade.
As the tour begins at 6pm we would suggest,that people park in the Hunter Building carpark (coming in Gate 1 (right at the bend between Salamanca Road and Kelburn Parade). While these are reserved spaces for staff after 5:30pm parking is a bit of a free-for-all on campus after hours.
Thursday, 11 September, 6:00pm start, Meet at Hunter Building (Main Entrance off Kelburn Parade)

Vinyasa yoga flow class & social coffee catch up, Vinyasa yoga flow class & social coffee catch up
Join me for Vinyasa flow Saturday Yoga class 🙂
Come along to Ale's yoga classes for some fun and accessible weekend movement
Ale offers a vinyasa flow style class that caters to all levels of ability with supportive modifications and encouraging amplifications.
Open to everyone. All levels welcome
Bring your mat or Mats are also available if you are in need.

description:
Tarot, Directed by Jennifer O'Sullivan

The Lovers. The Fool. The Hanged Man. The Tower.

Judgement.

The art of Tarot blends self-reflection, interpretation and mysticism to offer guidance on our personal situations. Offer your questions to our players as they step into the possibilities laid out by the cards, and explore what could happen if we followed their wisdom... and if we don't.

Cast

Katherine Weaver
Christine Brooks
Brendon Bennetts
Jason Geary

Featuring Jean Sergent as our Tarot guide

As this show is improvised, we cannot guarantee the presence or absence of specific content or themes beyond what is in the description above. description:
Split Bill: Friends to the End & Living is Like, Split Bill: Friends to the End & Living is Like
THIS SHOW IS R16.

Friends to the End - Presented by Wiremu Tuhiwai & Brendon Bennetts

Join Wiremu and Brendon as their friendship is tested by an alien invasion, or a robot uprising, or a zombie outbreak, or whatever else the audience might suggest.

Inspired by movies like Shaun of the Dead, The World’s End, and Scott Pilgrim vs the World, prepare for a show that mixes sincerity and over the top action into a joyful improvisational maelstrom. After all, the real apocalypse is the friends we make along the way.

Living is Like - Directed by Andrea Ferpo

Once upon a time, there was someone who felt growing up was like constantly being at university, another for whom falling in love was like playing roulette in a casino, and another whose jealousy was like eating spicy food every day.

Living Is Like harnesses the power of metaphor to unleash the hidden emotions behind our everyday actions, the way we think about ourselves, and how we view each other.

R16 - As this show is improvised, we cannot guarantee the presence or absence of specific content or themes beyond what is in the description above. The show may contain mature themes and language, but not gratuitously. The show may contain voluntary audience interaction, such as giving a suggestion for a scene.

description:
The Dictionary of Moments, The Dictionary of Moments
Directed By Jason Geary

This isn’t your ordinary dictionary.

Here, you won’t find dry definitions — instead, every word unlocks a moment from a story that brings its meaning to life.

Drawing from his acclaimed short story podcast of the same name, Jason Geary reinvents storytelling onstage with this bold hybrid of live-written tales and spontaneous scenes. Each performance is a one-of-a-kind experience where language leaps off the page and into vivid, unscripted life.

Part literary experiment, part theatrical adventure — words have never been this alive.

As this show is improvised, we cannot guarantee the presence or absence of specific content or themes beyond what is in the description above. description:
The Life of Henry the Fifth, A young man, once revelling in freedom and reckless camaraderie, is thrust into the role of a king, burdened with the fate of England.
Victory or ruin rests on his shoulders, yet his newfound power isolates him, leaving him lost, uncertain, and deeply unsettled.
Betrayed by friends, mistrusted by his men, and taunted by those who seek his downfall, Henry’s journey is both severe and profoundly relatable.
Shakespeare crafts a world where soldiers fight without knowing why, where the battlefield sees vagrants and children stand shoulder to shoulder, where uncertain rulers navigate a landscape devoid of guidance from the past. It is a world that, despite its historical setting, feels unnervingly close to our own.
With only ten dynamic performers, this is Henry the Fifth like never before: stripped back, sharp, and driven by the raw intensity of Shakespeare’s text.
Expect fast-paced storytelling, immersive staging, and a production that puts the audience at the heart of the battle.
Full show duration: 95 min including a 15 min intermission.
“This production epitomises what can be achieved when talent, teamwork, hard work, opportunity and passion combine.’”
NZ Herald on The Tragedy of Macbeth
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
APPA Roadshow 2025 - Wellington, Join Us for the APPA Roadshow Corporate Gifting Unwrapped 2025 – Wellington!
Get inspired ahead of the busiest time of year! The APPA Roadshow is here to power your summer campaigns, festive gifting strategies, and recognition and reward programs, connecting distributors with leading suppliers to explore innovative branded merchandise and business services.
What is the APPA Roadshow?
This must-attend event brings suppliers, distributors and industry pros together to:
• Explore innovative gifting ideas, branded merchandise and business services.
• Meet multiple suppliers, decorators, and service providers — all in one location.
• Discover creative gifting solutions for end-of-year celebrations and campaigns.
• Build connections that spark opportunity and collaboration.
Sky Stadium
105 Waterloo Quay, Pipitea, Wellington
10:00am – 2:00pm |
Wednesday, 10 September 2025
Pricing
• APPA Distributor Members: FREE
• Distributor Non-Members: $30 NZD
Get ready to make your next campaign unforgettable. Register now: https://apparoadshow.com/
label: Business & Networking

description:
The Art of Ikebana exhibition, The Art of Ikebana exhibition
Step into a world of elegance and precision at The Art of Ikebana Exhibition, presented by Ikebana Wellington. This two-day showcase celebrates the centuries-old Japanese art of flower arranging, where every stem, leaf, and bloom is placed with care and intention.

Wander through the Begonia House and enjoy a stunning display of spring arrangements that combine natural beauty with artistic expression. Members of Ikebana Wellington, a passionate group connected through the Wellington Sogetsu Teachers’ Association, will be on hand to share their love for this timeless craft.

Free public demonstrations:
Saturday – 11:30am & 1:30pm
Sunday – 1:30pm

Whether you’re an avid gardener, an art lover, or simply curious, this is a chance to slow down, be inspired, and experience the quiet artistry of Ikebana.

This event is part of the Wellington Gardens Te Wā o te Kōanga - Spring Festival 2025. Join us in celebrating spring with free events throughout September. Full line-up on our website.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
The Satire We Deserve: Brannavan Gnanalingam and Duncan Sarkies | Writers on Mondays, Two novelists take the pulse of life in Aotearoa and diagnose a hilarious and dangerous arrhythmia.
Brannavan Gnanalingam's The Life and Opinions of Kartik Popat takes the gloves off to better prod the weeping sores of our body politic and social media.
Duncan Sarkies depicts the farcical and chilling demise of democracy within an alpaca breeders' association in Star Gazers.
Join Pip Adam as she asks both writers about the serious intent behind the hijinks, and why it's a good time to wield the satirical scalpel.
Writers on Mondays is presented by the International Institute of Modern Letters and Te Papa Tongarewa. The 2025 series will run from 12.15—1.15 pm each Monday from 7 July to 29 September at Te Papa Tongarewa and Circa Theatre, with two special evening sessions at Meow. Admission is free and all are welcome. The series is supported by the Letteri family.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
The Māori Sidesteps, Māori made mischief

Contemporary showband The Māori Sidesteps are serving crooning and comedic goodness. With soulful harmonies, satirical skits, and superb song parodies, these fullas have won rave reviews, alongside their hit webseries and TV show – and now you can catch them live on stage at Circa Theatre!

The Sidesteps flip comedic nostalgia on its head and weave stunning harmonies with theatrical play, skewering social idioms and shining a cheeky light on what it means to be Māori in 2025.

Celebrating connection and the richness of our differences, The Māori Sidesteps bring pride in identity, the strength of mana motuhake, and the reminder that joy is the best antidote to division. From government blunders to policies ripe for the picking, these top-notch entertainers take aim at the kaupapa of the moment. Expect fearless satire, wickedly subversive humour, and a refreshing dose of truth-telling disguised as hilarity.

If you’ve ever wished someone would sing what you’ve been thinking about the current political climate, The Māori Sidesteps are here to deliver Māori made mischief through waiata that wink!

Reviews:
“Never did satire and self-deprecation go hand in hand and so cleverly and entertainingly” Alan Scott – Theatreview
“A night of whakawhanaungatanga – aroha, not (too much) hōhā.” Flat City Field Notes

Tuesday 28th October – Saturday 1st November (5 shows only)
$25 – $49
Circa One
Age Recommendation PG
Audience Care: Occasional strong language & themes
Runtime: 95mins plus interval

Performances:
Tuesday 28 October 6.30pm
Wednesday 29 October 6.30pm
Thursday 30 October 6.30pm
Friday 31 October 8.00pm
Saturday 1 November 8.00pm

Cast and crew:
Writers: The Māori Sidesteps Collective
Director: Jonathan Hendry
The Māori Sidesteps Collective Cast:
-Jamie McCaskill
-Cohen Holloway
-Jerome Leota
-Cameron Clayton
Photo credit: Roc+ Photography
Audio Engineer: Gililan Boyd
Lighting: Sonia Hardie
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
The Wedding Singer - The Musical, The Wedding Singer - The Musical
💍✨ The Wedding Singer – The Musical ✨💍
📅 1–18 October 2025 | Hutt City Musical Theatre

🎤 It’s 1985. Robbie Hart is New Jersey’s favorite wedding singer — until his fiancée leaves him standing at the altar. Heartbroken (and hilariously bitter), he crashes every wedding he sings at… until he meets Julia, a sweet waitress who might just be the one. Only problem? She’s engaged to the wrong guy.

Packed with outrageous 80s fashion, big dance numbers, and a soundtrack of catchy, over-the-top hits, this feel-good musical comedy will have you laughing, dancing, and rooting for love to win. 💃🎶❤️

⚡ Early Bird Tickets 18–31 August ONLY ⚡
Save money and secure your seats before they’re gone!

👉 Don’t miss the party of the year – book now:

description:
GDNZ 2025 Shelly Bay Cleanup, Join Ghost Diving New Zealand for a community cleanup!

This will be an ocean and shore based clean up targeting rubbish in and around the Wellington foreshore.

Scuba divers, free divers and shore crew all needed! Be prepared to get wet and dirty!

DATE: Saturday October 11th 2025

TIMES:
9.00am - Registrations open
9:45am - Briefing
10.00am - Divers in the water
2.00pm Clean-up and pack down

LOCATION: Shelly Bay - look for the GDNZ signs.

Scuba Divers who wish to participate must have a minimum of 30 logged dives and be comfortable working in low / zero visibility.
Scuba and Free Divers must provide their own gear and tanks. If you also have your own catch bag(s) or float boat for collecting rubbish, please bring this along and ensure they are named.
If you would like to join in the fun and participate as part of the shore crew, you will need to make sure you are wearing fully covered shoes and bring a pair of gardening gloves... also be prepared to get dirty!

ALL PARTICIPANTS, SHORE CREW AND DIVERS MUST REGISTER ON ARRIVAL.

PLEASE NOTE:
• This is a free, family friendly event, but children must be supervised at all times by an adult.
• Closed toe footwear must be worn for safety.
• Please bring your own hand protection (gardening gloves or similar).
• Don’t forget your own water bottle and bring sunscreen if it’s a warm day.
• Dress for the weather (warm clothes and jackets)
• There will also be plenty of work for non-divers to get involved.
Should the event be cancelled due to circumstances out of our control, notification will be given on the Facebook page the night before. Please remember to check prior to the event.
We look forward to seeing you there!
label: Conservation & Environment

description:
1st Joint SETAC AU & ACTRA Conference, We are excited to invite you to join us in Te Whanganui-ā-Tara Wellington, Aotearoa New Zealand from 25-28 August 2025 to experience the first ever joint Society of Environmental Toxicology and Chemistry Australasia (SETAC AU) and the Australasian College of Toxicology & Risk Assessment (ACTRA) conference.
The theme of this year’s conference is:
“Building a lasting legacy: Our choice, their future”
What legacy will our work leave for future generations?
Rooted in an understanding of the impacts of chemicals and emerging challenges, this conference will explore how diverse knowledge systems, collaborations, and innovative educational and engagement strategies can secure a better outlook for generations to come.
Scientists, knowledge keepers, practitioners, and end-users from diverse fields will share their research, insights, and strategies, fostering collaboration for improved environmental outcomes.
Hosted by The Environmental Protection Authority Te Mana Rauhī Taiao
https://www.epa.govt.nz/
label: Business & Networking

description:
AI Forum NZ Launch: AI Governance Refresh,  Join us to celebrate the relaunch of our AI Governance website —fully refreshed for today’s fast-moving AI landscape. Since 2023, this free resource has helped organisations adopt AI responsibly. The new edition brings together global expertise with a distinctly Aotearoa New Zealand focus: updated frameworks, guidance, templates, and real world insights from experts who have been there.
What you’ll get
A guided tour of the refreshed website
Practical takeaways you can apply immediately
Expert panel on governance, assurance, and change
Light networking over refreshments
Who should attend
Leaders, board members, and advisors
Risk, compliance, security, and data leaders
Delivery, product, and AI/ML practitioners
Public, private sector and NGOs
Panellists will include: 
Madeline Newman (AI Forum NZ) 
Colby Raley (Microsoft)
Alex Bagley (G4 Governance) 
Supported by:
G4 Governance, Microsoft and Fraxional

description:
1st Joint SETAC AU & ACTRA Conference, We are excited to invite you to join us in Te Whanganui-ā-Tara Wellington, Aotearoa New Zealand from 25-28 August 2025 to experience the first ever joint Society of Environmental Toxicology and Chemistry Australasia (SETAC AU) and the Australasian College of Toxicology & Risk Assessment (ACTRA) conference.
The theme of this year’s conference is:
“Building a lasting legacy: Our choice, their future”
What legacy will our work leave for future generations?
Rooted in an understanding of the impacts of chemicals and emerging challenges, this conference will explore how diverse knowledge systems, collaborations, and innovative educational and engagement strategies can secure a better outlook for generations to come.
Scientists, knowledge keepers, practitioners, and end-users from diverse fields will share their research, insights, and strategies, fostering collaboration for improved environmental outcomes.
Hosted by The Environmental Protection Authority Te Mana Rauhī Taiao
https://www.epa.govt.nz/

description:
Achieving Cashflow Freedom, Cashflow freedom means your business delivers sufficient cash for you to live your desired lifestyle. In turbulent times, this can feel increasingly unattainable, but there are many things you can take control of to increase the odds.
By attending this seminar you’ll:
Learn how a tougher economy could impact your business
Understand how to better plan for the ‘what ifs’
Discover multiple ways to increase sales outcomes
Understand how measurement improves management
Learn the processes required to boost your cash levels
Following the webinar, we’ll send attendees a Guide to Cashflow and Cashflow Health Check to ensure you take control of your cashflow and achieve cashflow freedom.

This comedy workshop gives the performers a chance to road-test their sharpest material, while the audience gets a rare behind-the-scenes look at the process.

description:
Analytics Forum: Social Investment (Wellington, Tue 14 Oct 25), Join us for an NZ Data Science + Analytics Forum event, hosted by the Social Investment Agency / Toi Hou Tāngata (SIA). This event will cover the Agency’s work using data and analytics to support evidence-based decision-making across the social sector, with four speakers each sharing their work, with opportunities for Q&A and networking.
This is a great opportunity to hear direct from SIA and connect with your peers in the Data Science and Analytics field, to learn from some of the leading voices in analytics, data engineering, evaluation, data-driven outcomes, and economic modelling.
Thanks to the Social Investment Agency for hosting this event.
Welcome and Introductions
Sara van der Velde, Chief Executive Officer (Acting), Nicholson Consulting, and Christopher Reid, Manager Pae Ora Data & Insights, Ara Poutama Aotearoa, for NZ Data Science & Analytics Forum
Kylie Reiri, Deputy Chief Executive – Transformation, Technology and Enabling Services, opening remarks for SIA
Speakers
1. Louise Pirini - Manager, Evidence and Insight service
Social Investment and data driven decision making
Explore why data is the power behind social investment – – and how evidence, outcomes, and impact measurement are driving better insights for decision-makers.
2. Peter Holmes - Data Engineer
Feedback loops and data tools
The importance of feedback loops in developing and delivering useful data products such as the Regional Data Explorer.
3. Dan Young - Senior Analyst, Data Science
Analysis and accelerators
Discover how automation and tools like cost-benefit analysis are accelerating evidence-based decisions across the social sector, drawing on linked data using the Stats NZ Integrated Data Infrastructure (IDI) and beyond.
4. Andrew Webber - Chief Economist
Learning and impact measurement
Exploring how the Social Investment Fund is moving from burdensome reporting to practical learning conversations that generate more useful insights for decision-making and provide a clear view of causal impact.

The New Zealand Data Science + Analytics Forum events are free to attend (with an Eventbrite ticket) and open to anyone that has an interest in Data Science and Analytics. Please note that SIA have an in-person event capacity cap of 65 tickets so those getting tickets early will get priority access. This is an in-person only event to allow for discussion and questions.
For more information on the New Zealand Data Science + Analytics Forum, check us out at https://analytics.org.nz/. Sign up to receive notifications of our future events!

description:
Hogsnort Bulldogs Goodtime Band, Hogsnort Bulldogs Goodtime Band are back with a new show featuring more of their skiffle-pop n’ jug music!

The band, that includes original stars from the sixties and seventies hit bands, Hogsnort Rupert, Bulldogs Allstar Goodtime Band and Dave and the Dynamos, is excited to be back on the Kāpiti coast to perform their energetic and fun-filled show.

Founding members, Dave Luther, Kevin Findlater and Neil Worboys, have collaborated with other great Wellington musicians to develop the “Hogsnort Bulldogs Goodtime Band”. During their two hour show the band perform all their great chart-topping hits from the era including ‘Pretty Girl’, ‘Miss September,’ ‘Aunty Alice Bought Us This’, ‘Everyone Knows’ and ‘Life Begins at Forty’. Other well-known skiffle and jug band songs, blues and popular standards are also featured. After very successful shows across 2023 and 2024, the guys are looking forward to performing once again on the Kāpiti Coast in 2025.

Videos featuring many of the songs they’ll be performing can be viewed on the band’s website: www.hogsnortbulldogs.co.nz and on YouTube.

Support act, Andrew and Kirsten London, are celebrated Kāpiti musicians and entertainers who’ve played everywhere from Dubai to Dannevirke. They have released a number of very successful albums of original material with a humorous focus on the unpredictable nature of day to day life.

--

For accessibility seating information and wheelchair space bookings please email kiaora@teraukura.nz or call 04)9740535 during office hours.

description:
Thorburn 1K - Community Weeding Competition, Kia ora e te whanau!
We kick off the community weeding season with a competition: The Thorburn 1k. Evergreen buckthorn - or Rhamnus alaternus - is a big threat to te taiao on Te Raekaihau. It prevents native plants from establishing by forming dense stands of salt and wind tolerant bushes that grow on steep escarpments. Join us to help remove 1000 of these plants across two weeding sessions! A point schedule helps you to get motivated and compete for the highly coveted Thorburn 1k medal.
Please meet at the intersection of Te Ranga-a-Hiwi and Ruru tracks. We will provide tools and gloves but please bring your own if you have some. We will finish at the Alice Krebs lodge for hot drinks and kai and there will be time for community consultation.
In the event of bad weather forecast, the day will be moved forward to Saturday.

description:
Parent Support Group - Kapiti Coast, Parent Support Group - Kapiti Coast
Grab a free coffee and chat with other parents and carers who know what it’s like to care for a disabled child, a neurodivergent child, or a child with health impairments.


Parent to Parent hosts regular Parent Support Groups in Kapiti Coast to support carers and parents just like you. These groups are a safe space for family and whānau to share their experiences, their challenges, their triumphs, and to learn from each other in an open and 100% judgement-free environment. No topic is too ‘weird’, no question too ‘out there’. We get it, and we are here to help.


So if you’d like to share a struggle, celebrate a success, raise a concern, or simply have a cuppa and chat with other parents and carers in your area, you are always welcome at our Parent Support Group. Drop in for as long or as short a time as you want.


Contact Meredith Dyer for more information:
| 027 808 3947
label: Health & Wellness

description:
BIMinNZ Wellington: Project Spotlight - Digital Workflows on Heke Rua, Pōneke — Mark Your Calendars!BIM in NZ is thrilled to announce our next Wellington event.
Join us on Thursday, 28 August at GHD for a Project Spotlight on the digital delivery of Heke Rua Archives — one of Aotearoa’s most ambitious façades, and a truly industry-leading example of BIM in action.
Hear from Revizto, Thermosash, Warren and Mahoney, and WT as they share how digital technology helped overcome the project’s extraordinary complexity — enabling seamless collaboration and unified digital workflows that crossed traditional disciplinary boundaries.
Revizto will kick things off with a short sponsor presentation, highlighting how their platform supported project delivery from design through to construction.
Roja from Thermosash will share how their team continues to evolve digital workflows to meet the demands of an ever-changing, collaborative landscape — and the unique challenges of delivering a façade of this scale.
Finally, Alex and Anton — fresh off a headline talk at DigiComm25 — will dive into the BIM coordination process and digital twin, exploring how this project sets a new benchmark for digital delivery in Aotearoa.

description:
Waikanae drop-in session | Reserve Management Plan, Waikanae drop-in session | Reserve Management Plan
Drop- in to Waikanae Park by the old skatepark to chat to us about the Reserve Management Plan.

Council manages over 130 parks and reserves on your behalf – from playgrounds, sports grounds, and esplanades to scenic and native reserves.

We’re drafting an omnibus Reserve Management Plan to set out objectives, polices and rules that guide their use, management, protection and development and want your help. Tell us what you value about your favourite parks and reserves, what might impact their use, protection and enjoyment, and what ideas do you have for their future.

There's lots of ways to have your say - online, on paper and in person.

Come and chat to our Open Space Planning team
Thursday 28 August, 4pm–7pm, Coastlands Shopping Centre
Saturday 30 August, 9am–1pm, Maclean Park, skatepark
Saturday 6 September, 9am–1pm, Waikanae Park, old skatepark
Sunday 14 September, 9am–1pm, Ōtaki Centennial Park

Further information and ways to provide feedback can be found at haveyoursay.kapiticoast.govt.nz/RMP

description:
Best Practice Guidelines Workshop - Wellington, This interactive session will help you effectively manage volunteers at your organisation. The Volunteer Best Practice Guidelines provide a framework to consider and review your own practice, and learn from others.
The session includes insights into managing challenging behaviour and problem solving, and is aimed at novices right through to experts in volunteer management.
We will explore the practice areas:
Recruiting and engaging volunteers
Welcoming and onboarding volunteers
Volunteer support, leadership, and management
Train and grow volunteers
Feedback and recognition
Celebrate volunteer impact
Exiting Volunteers
We will be learning from everyone in the room, including you!
The workshop will be based on the Volunteering New Zealand's 'Best Practice Guidelines.' You can access these 
on our website here.
We will provide you with morning tea and a light lunch. You'll be asked your dietary requirements when you register.
Registration is from 9:15am. Entry to venue from Featherston Street.
What previous attendees have said:
"I just wanted to say thank you for the opportunity to attend that workshop. It was lovely talking to other people in the charity sector which I haven’t had the chance to do yet. Great discussions and ideas."
"I am very much enjoying your workshops, and have implemented some of the learnings already."
About your facilitator:
Alison Marshall is about helping others build capability through learning and development.
Ali has over 25 years’ experience in learning and development at a senior level. She has worked in a broad range of industries that includes oil and gas, professional services, retail, education and hospitality. She has worked for large global organisations, start-ups and government. Her talent is being able to build relationships across all levels of the organisation.
Alison Marshall

BootyBasics will bring out your confidence and the inner baddie that's inside all of us! This workshop will have you embracing your body and feeling STRONG from the inside out.

Terms & Conditions
In attending my classes, i trust that you are in a good health condition and that you know of no medical or other reason why you cannot or should not engage in active or passive exercise. If you do not let me know you do not wish to be filmed, by accepting this agreement, you allow me the unrestricted right and permission to use your image in printed or digital promotional materials including, but not limited to: websites, social media, flyers, banners and videos. Although my main target audience is female please note my classes are for all genders.

Molly xx

description:
Careers on the Move, Careers on the Move
What’s next for the world of work in Aotearoa New Zealand?
Careers no longer follow a straight line - they’re portfolios, pivots, and possibilities. From flexible work to non-traditional paths, success today looks very different from the past, and so do the expectations of employers and employees alike.

Why be part of this session?
We’ll explore the major shifts shaping the job market in Aotearoa New Zealand and share practical insights on the hiring journey: where hidden talent is, what inefficiencies are costing you, and smarter, more human ways to connect with future employees.
Whether you’re building your own career or building the teams of tomorrow, this is a conversation you won’t want to miss.

This event is part of a new 3-part series: Future Fluent - Navigate What’s Next.
A practical, thought-provoking speaker series for professionals who want to stay ahead - not just keep up.

Who are the speakers?
Nicole Williams – Head of Jobs, Trade Me
Ben Stevenson – Managing Principal Consultant, JacksonStone & Partners
Final speaker to be announced

What’s in-store:
4:00pm – Arrival/networking
4:30-5:15pm – Speaker session
5:15-5:30pm – Q&A
5:30-6:00pm – Networking with drinks & nibbles

description:
Compliance made SME-asy: Employment basics with ATH Consulting, Are you confident in navigating the complexities of employment relationships in today’s ever-changing workplace? Join us for a comprehensive workshop designed for managers, employers, and business owners who want to deepen their understanding of employment fundamentals and people management best practices.
What You’ll Learn:
Foundations of Employment Relationships:
Explore the essential components that shape every employment relationship, including relevant legislation, terms and conditions, and the pivotal role of workplace policies and procedures.
Understanding Employment Types:
Distinguish between permanent, full-time, casual, and seasonal roles, and learn how each type impacts your obligations and management strategies.
Employment Legislation Essentials:
Get a practical overview of the 10 key employment laws that influence your workplace, ensuring you stay compliant and informed.
Good Faith and Agreements:
Discover the importance of acting in good faith and the differences between Individual Employment Agreements (IEA) and Collective Employment Agreements (CEA), including mandatory clauses and recommended “nice to have” terms.
Managing Change:
Learn best practices for handling variations to employment agreements and implementing effective workplace policies and procedures.
People Management Mastery:
Gain insights into the employee lifecycle, building a strong employment brand, and managing common workplace issues such as performance improvement plans (PiP), disciplinary processes, attendance, and health and wellbeing.
Leadership and Succession:
Identify the hallmarks of poor leadership and develop strategies for effective succession planning to future-proof your team.
Support Systems:
Know where to get help—learn when to trust your gut, when to rely on facts, and how to access the right support at the right time.
This workshop is your opportunity to build confidence, reduce risk, and enhance your leadership toolkit. Whether you’re new to managing people or looking to refresh your knowledge, you’ll leave with practical insights and actionable strategies for every stage of the employment relationship.
Don’t miss this chance to strengthen your employment management skills and connect with peers facing similar challenges. Register now and take the next step toward becoming a more effective, knowledgeable, and resilient leader.
When: Wednesday 10 September 9.00 am - 11.00 am
Where: Carterton Community Courthouse (next to Events Centre) Holloway Street, Carterton
Cost: Members $65 + GST, Non-Members $120 +GST
This workshop needs a minimum of 15 attendees to go ahead.

description:
Cultivating a Positive Workplace Culture for High-Performance Teams, This course is designed for leaders, managers, and organisational change agents who want to foster a positive workplace culture that drives high performance, collaboration, and employee wellbeing. Participants will explore the essential principles of creating an environment that nurtures trust, accountability, inclusivity, and engagement. Through practical strategies, case studies, and interactive discussions, participants will learn how to develop a culture that motivates teams to excel, encourages open communication, and supports professional growth.

Key Topics Include:
• Building a culture of trust and psychological safety
• Fostering open communication and feedback loops
• Aligning values and purpose with organisational goals
• Promoting inclusivity, diversity, and belonging
• Recognising and celebrating achievements
• Encouraging work-life balance and wellbeing
• Developing strategies for conflict resolution and collaboration
By the end of the course, participants will have the tools and insights needed to create a workplace environment that not only supports but accelerates the success of high-performing teams, driving both individual and collective achievement.

Key audience:
This course is designed for leaders, managers, and anyone responsible for shaping the culture within their teams and organisations.

Learning outcomes:
Implement strategies to cultivate trust, psychological safety, and high performance within their teams.
Lead teams that foster open communication, collaboration, and inclusivity.
Align team goals with organisational values and objectives, ensuring a shared sense of purpose.
Develop effective strategies for conflict resolution and team cohesion.
Create a workplace culture that encourages growth, well-being, and work-life balance.

If you would like to register with Business Central directly and receive an invoice for payment, please contact our training team via training@businesscentral.org.nz.

Course details:
Duration: Full day, in person.
Time: 9am – 4pm
Course includes
Workbook, arrival tea or coffee, morning tea, lunch, afternoon tea.
To view our Terms and Conditions click here.

description:
Customer Service Essentials, This course will cover the importance of creating a customer service mindset when dealing with your most important asset in a business, your customers. It introduces the key requirement to have a strong product knowledge, effective communication and listening skills, and polished customer service etiquette.

Key audience:
This course is suitable for employees who interact with customers on a regular basis, whether by phone or in person, and people who would like to gain a strong, foundational level of knowledge about how to deal effectively with customers.

Learning outcomes:
Understand the importance of a customer service mindset.
Learn about customer service etiquette and how it’s unique for each business.
Explain the requirement for a strong product and service knowledge.
Demonstrate the pivotal role of good communication and listening skills.

If you would like to register with Business Central directly and receive an invoice for payment, please contact our training team via training@businesscentral.org.nz.

Workbook, arrival tea or coffee and morning or afternoon tea.

description:
The Enchanted Ale Quarter, Enter the magical realm of The Enchanted Ale Quarter, a fairytale-inspired pop-up tavern where whimsy, wonder and craft beer collide.

Step into a storybook setting, with twinkling lights, woodland decor, and forest-fantasy touches around every corner. Feast on gnome and fairy-themed comfort food like the solstice salad, loaded forest fries, sirens & ships fish & chips, and a decadent dark forest brownie, all paired with enchanted brews and mythical tipples.

Cosy, curious, and otherworldly, The Enchanted Ale Quarter brings a little magic to Wellington’s winter nights. Dust off your wings and join us for a pint, some sustenance or a potion, no quest required.

description:
Digital experiences that truly matter, Note: This is a Hybrid Event:
In-Person Location: Level 1 , 107 Customhouse Quay, Wellington
Online: The Zoom link will be sent out the day before the event.
About this event:
About this event:

This highly interactive session will have engaging discussions that will uncover practical insights into creating user – focused, unified digital services that genuinely enhance customer experiences. We will discuss the complexities of web design and development, exploring them from a project delivery perspective, with a focus on building effective and impactful digital solutions.
About the Presenter:
About the Presenters:
 Pikselin: Pikselin is a New Zealand based consultancy and solution provider in the digital engagement and application development space. As a digital agency, they create user-focused digital experiences that are both functional and visually engaging. Pikselin delivers responsive websites, intuitive interfaces, and inclusive digital services for clients across government and private sector. Their expertise lies in simplifying complex information through thoughtful, user – centred design. As an approved supplier on New Zealand’s Government Marketplace, they have led key projects for a range of clients across the public and enterprise sectors. Pikselin is known for its collaborative approach and commitment to elevating digital experiences that truly serve New Zealanders. 

Steve Barnard Managing Director Steve leads client and partner collaborations at Pikselin, overseeing projects from marketing to post-development support with over 30 years of experience in New Zealand's IT industry.

James Guthrie Tech Lead James transforms complex design requirements into maintainable accessible code specializing in real-time data visualization interactive mapping, and fully accessible cross device websites.

Brian Smith Design Director Brian leads Pikselin's creative vision collaborating with clients and the creative team to deliver exceptional products and services.

• Ways of Working - 0.5 PDU's
• Power Skills - 0.5 PDU's

description:
ECD Emotional Leadership Development Course 20th November - Central Wellington, ECD Emotional Leadership Development 1 Day Certification Course
Become a Certified Emotional Culture Deck Leadership Practitioner
This course is designed to enhance leadership development by equipping leaders with the tools to understand and manage emotional drivers and dynamics within themselves, their people and their teams. The course focuses on developing emotionally aware leaders who can effectively foster a positive workplace culture. Participants will engage in practical activities that promote self-awareness, team cohesion, and emotional intelligence, all grounded in The Emotional Culture Deck framework.
"Emotional culture is shaped by how all employees—from the highest echelons to the front lines—comport themselves day in and day out. But it’s up to senior leaders to establish which emotions will help the organization thrive, model those emotions, and reward others for doing the same. Companies in which they do this have a lot to gain." – Sigal Barsade & Olivia O'Neil, Manage Your Emotional Culture

Why this course is a Game-Changer

In today’s fast-paced and complex business environment, the ability to lead with emotion is more critical than ever. Our ECD Emotional Leadership Development Course is designed to transform the way leaders understand and harness the power of emotions to foster a more dynamic and responsive workplace.
What to expect
This hands-on one-day course is designed for immediate application, ensuring that you can translate insights into action as soon as you return to your team or clients. 
What to expect from this 1 day course experience:
Understanding the power of emotions in leading others effectively
Development of effective emotion-led leadership strategies. 
Learning how to use and embed our ready-made Emotional Culture Deck Leadership Tools
Active learning through interactive activities and group discussions.
Exploration of personal leadership and team leadership.
What's included in this course?
Enrol in the ECD Emotional Leadership Development Course and unlock a wealth of resources including:
ECD Emotional Leadership Development Toolkit - Valued at 175 NZD: Get this invaluable toolkit filled with a robust selection of physical and downloadable resources designed for immediate impact. Its comprehensive nature will extend your learning and application of the course content well beyond the Course.
1x Emotional Culture Deck  - Valued at 155 NZD: Receive your personal ECD, an essential tool for applying courseprinciples in real-world settings, adding even more value to your toolkit.
Exclusive 60-Minute Group Coaching Call: Enhance your course experience with a group coaching call, scheduled six to eight weeks post-course. Hosted via Zoom, this session provides an opportunity to solidify your learning, address any questions, and ensure you're applying your new skills effectively. Whether you attend live or watch the replay later, this call is a key step in your continued development.
Continued Learning Discount: Enjoy a 50% discount on future purchases of The Emotional Culture Deck to support your ongoing practice.
ECD Emotional Leadership Certificate of Practice: A formal acknowledgement of your dedication to enhancing your Emotional Culture Deck skills. This certificate serves as a testament to your commitment to emotional leadership and amplifying human conversations about what really matters in the workplace
90-Day All Access Pass to our Online Elephant Rider Community: By enrolling, you gain access to an ECD Emotional Leadership package with resources, expertise, and continued support, all designed to flip the traditional approach to leadership development
Gain access to an ECD Emotional Leadership package with resources, expertise, and continued support, all designed to flip the traditional approach to leadership development.



Is this course right for you?
This course is great for executives, leaders and managers within organisations as well as those who consult or coach on leadership, culture and emotional intelligence. 
The course is ideal for:
HR Professionals: Who aim to enhance leadership qualities and traits and train their leaders to develop emotional intelligence within the workplace.
Leadership Coaches: Dedicated to developing emotionally smart leadership practices in diverse environments.
Organisation Development Managers: Focused on building adaptable, resilient organisational cultures through effective leadership.
Coaches and Consultants: Specialising in personal and professional and personal leadership development.
Project Leaders: Committed to managing project teams with empathy and emotional insight.
Team Leads and Supervisors: Looking to improve team cohesion and performance through emotional awareness.
Aspiring and experienced leaders: You could be a developing leader OR if you are an experienced leader who wants to develop in the emotional leadership space then this course is for you.
Whether you are leading initiatives within your organisation or providing expert advice to others, the Emotional Leadership Development Course provides the tools and insights necessary to develop more effective, emotionally aware leaders and teams.
What previous participants had to say about this workshop.
10/10 - "Giving everyone regardless of their emotional literacy a way to express themselves and to form authentic connections is genius! Learning how to use this to help teams and organisations change their emotional culture in an intentional way is super exciting! Lotty was an amazing facilitator. Her energy and passion were 100% contagious. Her approach gentle and inclusive. I’d do it again in a heartbeat!" - Cordula Plassmann
9/10 - "This course opened my eyes to how emotions can be surfaced and navigated in leadership. A key takeaway was that we all have emotions, it's how we surface and leverage them." - Julia Anderson
10/10 - "A wonderful investment! Highly recommend this course to anyone looking to strengthen their collaboration and people leadership skills. Great fun, very practical and helpful tools to use in a wide variety of situations." - Rosaleen Smith
10/10 - "This course was truly inspiring and deeply motivating. Its mission to rehumanise workplaces and life really resonates with me and I’m excited to put these learnings into action.  Lotty was amazing - She has a very special way of explaining things. I was massively inspired and very empowered." - Phoebe Edge
10/10 - "Lotty was (and is) amazing, the size of the group was perfect for me, the amount of content and the explanations of how and when to use them was explicit, doing an in-person workshop was so much more useful to me personally. I've gained a load more confidence and I am excited to share what I learned." - Kelley Oliver
10/10 - "Extremely meaningful and engaging - a wonderful opportunity to first look internally at how I lead myself in order to focus on and improve how I achieve and support effective emotional leadership of my team." - Karinna McDonald
10/10 - "Absolutely loved it. I now feel informed and equipped to facilitate emotional culture conversations and workshops. Such important and powerful stuff - I believe every leader should know about and understand the difference between cognitive and emotional culture, in order to enable a truly thriving workforce. Lotty is an incredible facilitator - bringing energy, insight, kindness, and passion" - Teressa Betty
What is the Emotional Culture Deck?

The Emotional Culture Deck (ECD) is the number one game in the world for better workplace culture designed and created by Jeremy Dean of riders&elephants.
The ECD is currently used by over 400,000 people in over 55+ countries, it is a uniquely powerful way to create human conversations about what really matters in the workplace. 
The game facilitates face-to-face human conversations about what matters. It nudges vulnerability. Builds empathy. Creates connections and fosters trust within teams.
It's the ultimate card game toolkit for more successful and human workplaces.
Click here to learn more about The ECD and watch the origin story video below of the founder of riders&elephants sharing the story behind the game.
Join Lotty and learn how to use the Emotional Culture Deck to enhance your leadership
Learn from one of the worlds most experienced Emotional Culture Deck Consultants and Facilitators - Lotty Roberts, Founder of MiND.U, Master Elephant Rider and Certified ECD consultant .
Lotty Roberts is an Emotional Culture Coach, Consultant and Facilitator. Since completing the ECD Masterclass Course in 2018, Lotty has become one of the most experienced Emotional Culture Deck consultants in the world and the first to ever become a Master Level Certified ECD Consultant. Lotty has delivered over 200 Emotional Culture Deck client workshops, as well as dozens of 1:2:1's, helping teams of all sizes, in a variety of industries create more healthy and high performing cultures. 
Lotty is also a regular on the speaking circuit delivering talks and presentations on all aspects of emotional culture including change, leadership and resilience.
Lotty's speciality and passion is all about helping leaders, teams and cultures to thrive, flourish and flow in a fast paced world, through the power of mindfulness and embracing emotions.
Lotty is the founder of her business, ‘MiND.U’, where she is devoted to helping companies and individuals build the emotional capability, resilience and wisdom to navigate the ever changing, complex and dynamic world we find ourselves in.
Will refreshments be provided during the workshop?
Coffee, tea, water and some light snacks will be available during the morning tea break but you will need to bring or buy your own lunch.
What's the refund and cancellation policy?
Unfortunately, ECD Certified Consultants don’t offer refunds for this workshop experience. 
However, you may send someone else in your place to this workshop if you cannot attend for any reason.
You must notify your Workshop host that you will not attend the workshop and the name of the person that will attend in your spot.
If you cannot attend the workshop, and no one attends in your place, the workshop organiser will post your ECD Emotional Leadership Development Workshop Kit to you (Value 330 NZD) – so you don’t miss out completely.
If the Workshop Host cancels this workshop, you will be transferred to the next available workshop. You can contact the Workshop host for a refund if you cannot attend the revised workshop date.

description:
Electra Business After Five - MONDAY 22 September 2025, September Electra BA5 Showcase 
Woodhaven Gardens 
Join us for an exclusive behind-the-scenes experience at Woodhaven Gardens, one of Horowhenua’s largest and most community-minded businesses.

Join us for a rare behind-the-scenes look at Woodhaven Gardens, one of Horowhenua’s largest and most innovative businesses.
Founded in 1978, Woodhaven now spans 1,800+ hectares, grows over 20 vegetable varieties, and employs 250+ staff. 
Discover how they combine tech innovation, sustainability, and community investment to contribute $30–35M annually to Horowhenua’s GDP.

Speakers:
Emma Clarke – Woodhaven Gardens: Innovation, sustainability, and community impact.
Deborah Manning ONZM – Founder of KiwiHarvest & NZ Food Network: Transforming NZ’s food rescue and sustainability landscape.
You are invited to view Woodhaven's operations from 5.30-6 pm before the speakers begin. 
Deborah Manning ONZM, Lawyer turned social entrepreneur who is a trailblazer in sustainability and food security, transforming New Zealand’s food rescue landscape through her venture KiwiHarvest, and the New Zealand Food Network. In 2025, Deborah was awarded the New Zealand Sustainability Leader of the Year Award at the Kiwibank New Zealander of the Year Awards.
Horowhenua Mana Kai Network, born from a January 2025 hui on rising food insecurity, the Mana Kai Network connects local kai initiatives to create long-term change. Hear how this community-led, Council-supported collaboration is improving food access and equity across Horowhenua.
WOODHAVEN GARDENS
44 Joblins Road, Levin
Monday 22nd September 2025
5.30-7 pm  

This event is in partnership with Woodhaven Gardens, Horowhenua District Council, Mana Kai and Muaūpoko Tribal Authority.

Tickets $10pp
(No door sales. High-vis vests provided – no high heels please.)
