description:
Export Ready: Strategies and Lessons for International Growth, Whether you're exploring new markets, refining your export strategy, or preparing to scale globally, this practical workshop will equip you with the tools, insights, and confidence to take your business international
What’s in store
Join export expert Pete Torrington for an interactive, 2.5-hour workshop designed specifically for local producers and manufacturers. Drawing on over 30 years of global experience, Pete will guide you through the essential steps to becoming export ready.
You’ll learn how to:
Assess your export potential and avoid common pitfalls
Choose the right international markets for your product
Build effective distribution and retail strategies
Navigate food safety, packaging, and compliance requirements
Price and promote your product for global shelves
Whether you're just starting your export journey or want to sharpen your approach, this workshop offers real-world advice and actionable strategies to help you succeed.
Who should attend
Food and beverage producers
Consumer goods manufacturers
Agribusinesses and primary sector entrepreneurs
Anyone considering export as a growth strategy
About the Facilitator
Pete Torrington is the founder of Ask Pete Advisory and brings over 30 years of international commercial experience in food and consumer goods, including senior roles at Colgate-Palmolive across Europe, Asia, and Australasia. He now works with New Zealand manufacturers and producers to help them grow in overseas markets.
More information: www.askpete.co.nz

Employment Law Session - Casual Employment & Trial Periods | Marlborough, Following on from our Disciplinary Process Workshop in 2024, we are pleased to bring you another practical and informative session designed to support employers in navigating the complexities of employment law. Join us for Employment Law 101, where we’ll cover the essential elements of starting the employment relationship on the right foot. 
This workshop will provide clarity around: 
When and how to use trial periods lawfully 
What defines casual employment and how to manage it correctly 
Best practice for offering employment and ensuring your documentation is spot-on 
Common pitfalls employers face in the hiring process and how to avoid them 
This session is ideal for business owners, managers, and anyone involved in hiring or managing staff. Whether you're new to employing or just need a refresher, you’ll walk away with greater confidence and a clearer understanding of your obligations.
The workshop will be delivered by Tim Blake, General Counsel for Hospitality New Zealand, and includes time for questions and discussion.
Don’t miss this opportunity to strengthen your employment practices and stay on the right side of the law.

description:
Journey into Om, Yoga without mantra is a bit like cake without the icing !
By now we all know that everything essentially is vibration. Yoga knew this 1000's of years ago, that is why sound is the first tool of Yoga.
Learn about the pranavah mantra ( om) as it relates to your Yoga Practice.
In this 2-hour workshop, you will understand the traditional and respectful way to use this sacred sound: both theoretically and practically.
We will draw on the ancient texts of Yoga as our point of reference.
The use of a mantra is a powerful tool for healing, emotional and mental clarity, and spiritual development. You will be guided in a variety of accessible practices to experience the effects of this mantra.
This workshop can open new dimensions to your practice, or it is also a great way to start on the Yoga Journey.
I teach from the Viniyoga tradition of Krishnamacharya, where mantra is used as an integral aspect of Yoga, whether it be asana, pranayama, or meditation.
This workshop will be nourishing to all the dimensions -heart, mind, and body.
You do not need to be a singer at all-just be willing to have a go at making a sound, even in your head if out loud feels too weird.

description:
From Bookings to Bottom Line: Accommodation Roadshow 2025 - Blenheim, Practical strategies from industry leaders to improve every step of your guest journey Hospitality New Zealand invites you to our Regional Accommodation Roadshow, designed especially for hotel, motel, and boutique accommodation providers across the Upper South Island. This focused event brings together some of the industry’s most innovative and trusted suppliers—sharing practical tools, expert insights, and real-world strategies to help you improve your guest experience, streamline your operations, and grow your bottom line.
Why Attend?
Hear from the Experts – Presentations from leading providers in pricing, operations, marketing, payments, tech, and insurance.
Get Practical Advice – Walk away with actionable strategies that you can put into practice straight away.
Regional Focus – Tailored insights designed to meet the challenges and opportunities of operators in our regions.
No Sales Pitches – This is an education-first forum, giving you clarity and confidence without the pressure.
Connect & Collaborate – Network with peers, ask questions, and explore trusted solutions—all in one place.
What to Expect 20-minute educational presentations from each partner Open Q&A sessions for your burning questions Networking & light refreshments to wrap up
Featured Partners Mews – Cloud-based PMS to modernise your operations
RoomPriceGenie – Automated pricing to maximise occupancy & revenue
Booking.com – Tools & insights to increase online bookings
Other Key Partners – Additional solution providers offering insights and support for your business
label: Business & Networking

description:
Upper Hutt Gypsy Fair, Upper Hutt Gypsy Fair
The Gypsy Fair is a nationwide travelling event, bringing family fun, live music and an unbeatable vibe to each town we visit.🌞💜

Having been on the road for over 45 years, it’s safe to say our roots run deep. Our people are incredible, and house trucks/buses are pretty cool too! So don’t forget to check out our unique way of living while you’re here 🫶🌿🌻💜

Whether you’re just having a browse, letting the kids loose on our rides, parking up with some food or coffee, or checking out some funky handmade crafts, we would love to see you! Come and hang out for the day, we’re sure to bring smiles to your faces, and create lifelong memories💜

🌞Free entry for everyone🌞 We pride ourselves on being an affordable event for every family. With free entertainment all day, plenty of chill out zones, and loads of life size games laying around, we truely love to see the community getting amongst it all! Can’t wait to see you there🌞👣🐝🌿🌊

Follow us on Facebook – ‘Gypsy Fair’ for updates on our travels and creations! We’re always open to anyone who wants to come and live the dream, so please email us if this sounds like a bit of you. –
label: Markets & Fairs

description:
NZIFF: The President’s Cake, A young girl scrambles to prepare a high-stakes birthday cake for a dictator amidst the dangers and deprivations of the Gulf War in this irresistibly scrappy Caméra d'Or-winner from Iraq.

Nine-year-old Lamia (Banin Ahmad Nayef in a spectacular debut) lives with her grandmother and beloved rooster in the impoverished but tranquil Iraqi Marshes. Despite barely being able to feed themselves due to crippling food shortages caused by international sanctions, the family is randomly selected to prepare a cake as part of the forced national spectacle observing Saddam Hussein’s birthday.

From bucolic wetlands to bustling city streets, Lamia embarks on an ingredient-hunting odyssey that mixes equal parts sweet absurdity and bitter reality. Bartering with hawkers, dodging authorities, and begging the kindness of strangers, the young girl encounters the full gamut of humanity, from good to grotesque, as she approaches her ludicrous mission with innocent determination.

Director Hasan Hadi deftly evokes humour and open heartedness against a bleak background of oppression and war. Cinematographer Tudor Vladimir Panduru summons rich texture from the gorgeous locations, beautifully backed by a flowing soundtrack of traditional strings. — Adrian Hatwell
label: Film & Media

description:
Certified Better Business Analyst - 2 Day In-person Training, Exam and Certificate, Certified Better Business Analyst (CBBA) – Wellington (Two-Day Certification Course, Exam and Certificate)
Ready to take your business analysis career to the next level? The CBBA course is Wellington’s practical, industry-recognised certification for anyone serious about growing their BA capability and impact.
What you’ll get:
In-depth BA skills: Master the full business analysis lifecycle—from strategy and stakeholder management to requirements and solution delivery.
Certification that counts: Walk away with your Certified Better Business Analyst credential, backed by local employers and the BBAI community.
Real-world learning: Work through Wellington-focused case studies, hands-on exercises, and group discussions designed for today’s public sector and business environment.
Career connections: Meet fellow BAs, connect with local leaders, and get personalised advice on your next career step.
Who should attend?
Practicing business analysts ready for certification and career growth
Project professionals, change leads, and digital specialists wanting deeper BA expertise
Wellington-based professionals looking for a recognised BA qualification and community
Next cohort: End of August, Wellington CBD
Spaces are limited. Reserve your spot and join the region’s growing network of Certified Better Business Analysts!
label: Business & Networking

description:
From the Shadows to the Spotlight, You’re invited to a unique leadership event, one that trades buzzwords for real stories and surface-level networking for something deeper.
From the Shadows to the Spotlight
Venue: Cliftons Wellington, L28, 100 Willis Street
Date: 26th August 2025
Time: 5:00pm–7:15pm
Led by Stew Darling, a former covert operator turned leadership expert and founder of Unstoppable Force. This evening will explore what it means to lead under pressure, navigate the unknown, and stay true to your values when it matters most.
Expect:
- 90 minutes of real-world leadership insights
- A room full of values-led professionals
- Networking over drinks and canapés (provided by Everybody Eats)
A chance to support Big Brothers Big Sisters Wellington through a gold coin donation at the door
We’re proud to partner with Cliftons to host this free event and would love to see you there.
Spaces are limited, and this one’s going to fill fast.
Get your free ticket today!
label: Business & Networking

description:
Café Scientifique - Space: What Is Our Place In the Cosmos?, Join us for a new Café Scientifique series hosted by Pūtaiao ki te Pāpori—School of Science in Society.

At this first event in September, astrophysicist Dr Yvette Perrott and novelist Dr Tim Corballis will discuss the evolving picture physics gives us about the nature of the universe, and the ways people find their place in it.

Café Scientifique is a place where, for the price of a cup of coffee or a glass of wine, anyone can come to explore the latest ideas in science and technology in a relaxed, friendly environment.

The evening will start with a short introduction from the speakers, followed by a question-and-answer conversation.

Doors open at 5.30 pm, talks begin at 6 pm. All welcome—free entry, nibbles provided.

Please note: anyone under the age of 18 must be accompanied by a parent or legal guardian.
For further information, please contact scienceinsociety@vuw.ac.nz.

description:
Improving the Behaviour and Engagement of Boys Conference, Be part of a groundbreaking national conference, hosted by the Australian-based Positive Masculinity Foundation in collaboration with the Wellington College Research Centre.
Across Aotearoa and the world, many boys are feeling disengaged and excluded from the classroom. This event brings together educators, coaches, counsellors, and mentors for a day of meaningful conversations, keynote presentations, and practical breakout sessions focused on improving boys’ engagement, behaviour, and social connectedness.
Why attend?
Learn practical strategies to connect with boys and young men
Gain insights on classroom engagement, behaviour management, and building respect
Discover how to harness student culture and involve parents/whānau
Hear from world-class experts in education, leadership, and boys’ development
Speakers include:
Dr Ray Swann — Executive Director, Positive Masculinity Foundation
Dr Mark Dowley — Author, The Classroom Management Handbook
Kristen Molloy — Associate Head, The Crowther Centre
Ingrid Howren — Leadership Coach & +M Curriculum Specialist
Dr Aaron Columbus — Deputy Principal Teaching & Learning, Wellington College
Special Keynote: Professor Matt Englar-Carlson — Co-Director, Center for Men and Boys, California State University, leading expert on positive masculinity and mental health
Details:
Ticket includes morning tea & lunch
Accommodation advice available for out-of-town attendees (contact Dr Aaron Columbus at Wellington College)
This is a rare opportunity to learn from international leaders and collaborate with peers passionate about helping boys thrive.
label: Business & Networking

description:
Wave of Light 2025, Hōkai Tahi invites you to attend our Wave of Light memorial to remember all our babies gone too soon.
We'll gather at the Carrington Park Rotunda from 6.45pm for a 7pm candle lighting and minute of silence.
Bring along a candle to add to our memorial display - lanterns or jars are a good idea if it is breezy.
We'd love to see photos of your babies too.
Stay for a hot drink (provided) and add your babies name to our memory tree.
All welcome!
This event is held at the end of Baby Loss Awareness Week 9th - 15th October.
About the International Wave of Light:
The International Wave of Light invites baby loss families, friends, loved ones and supporting organisations from around the world to join in honour and remembrance of all loved and longed for babies gone too soon.
No matter where you are in the world, you can light a candle at 7pm in memory of your baby or babies to be part of the wave of light that begins here in Aotearoa and wraps around the globe.
Wherever you do this, you will be joining a global ‘Wave of Light’ in memory of all the babies who lit up our lives for such a short time.
This is a family friendly event, please be mindful pregnant families, babies, children, as well as health professionals wishing to support our community may be in attendance
label: Community & Culture

description:
Health and Safety Essentials for Small Business, The purpose of this course is to give you the oversight you need to ensure your business health and safety systems and processes reflect a best-practice approach. Each session comes with practical templates for you to use in your business to comply with the Health & Safety at Work Act 2015. It also supports your understanding of the core elements of a health and safety system.

Key Audience:
This course is suitable for people who own a small business and want to ensure they comply with health and safety best practice requirements. It is also good for those businesses without a health and safety committee and anyone who is required to be involved in health and safety in a small business.

Learning outcomes
Understand the core elements of a health and safety system.
Understand the key duty holders and their respective duties under the Act.
Understand essential health and safety components and how they relate to your legal duties.
Understand practical ways to increase the effectiveness of your health and safety system.

If you would like to register with Business Central directly and receive an invoice for payment, please contact our training team via training@businesscentral.org.nz.

Places are limited, so register today.

Course details
Duration: One day, in person.
Time: 9am - 4pm

Course includes
Workbook, arrival tea or coffee, morning tea, lunch and afternoon tea.

To view our Terms and Conditions click here.

description:
E-Waste Drop off Day Zealandia, Drop off your unwanted electronic products during this drive-thru event!
Held in the lower "overflow' carpark of the Zealandia - on the corner of Birchwood Street.
Please check the posts in 'discussion' for more details.
Staff will unload everything for your convenience.
We are proud to accept donations for Variety – the Children’s Charity.
FREE OF CHARGE
Computers, Monitors, Tablets and Small Devices, Laptops, Routers and Modems, Mice, Servers, UPS, Cameras, Hifi Stereo Amps and Speakers, Mobile Phones, Car Batteries, Wiring & Cabling, Mainframe Circuit Boards, etc.
CHARGED ITEMS:
• $2 Fluorescent Tubes (Normal Light bulbs not accepted)
• $3 for Media and DVD player, Keyboards, Toner Cartridges, Desk phones
• $5 per kg - Mixed Batteries
• $5 for Heaters, Microwaves, Vacuum Cleaners, AV Equipment, Small Home Appliances
• $10 for Printers, Scanners, Fax Machines
• $20 Dishwashers, Washing Machines, Dryers, Flat screen TVs
• $40 Fridges, Heatpumps and Air Con units
• $60 Large Photocopiers
Please understand charges above are for sharing the recycling cost.
Eftpos and cash accepted on site.
What we don't accept:
- CDs & DVDs
- Floppy discs
- LED lightbulbs
- Household lightbulbs
- LPG gas bottle
- Medical devices
- Glass
Other hazardous waste (e.g.)
- Paint
- Garden waste
- General chemicals
- Furniture (e.g.)
- TV cabinets
label: Conservation & Environment

description:
Leadership And Management Part 1, Learn how to make the transition from buddy to the boss and lead a successful team. Managing staff can be a very rewarding, interesting and fun role, it can also be a tough and demanding job. Between managing your own time and projects, helping your team members solve problems and complete tasks, and helping other managers, your day can fill up before you know it.

This workshop aims to maximise your leadership and management potential and help you become a more confident, effective and efficient leader and manager with information on understanding personality types, effective communication, setting expectations and goals, assigning work, effective delegation, motivating staff, leadership styles, giving feedback and having courageous conversations, understanding what is required to be a good leader and manager and encouraging teamwork.
 
The workshop is designed for those who have been promoted recently into a supervisory management role or for those who have been there for some time but need to improve their leadership and management skills. To book: email - info@biztrainers.co.nz or call 04 974 8790.
label: Business & Networking

description:
Managing for value: building a strong financial advice business-Wellington, Building a valuable financial advice business means you have a resilient business to support your clients and a strong asset. Transactions – acquisition and disposal support the long-term growth and sustainability of financial advice provider businesses. Transactions take many forms, going concerns regularly acquire and dispose of clients, business units, lines of business, have investors buy-in, bring key staff together – and split businesses up. Only a small number of our transactions are the classic market exit.
Our aim is to spend time talking with advisers about how to grow their business and manage for value – making their business more valuable by explicitly thinking about valuation in addition to the other metrics such as profit and cashflow.
label: Business & Networking

description:
Market Partner Academy LIVE - Wellington, Get ready, Wellington—Market Partner Academy LIVE is coming your way!
Join us on Wednesday 1st October 2025. 1:15 p.m. – 6 p.m. NZST at Whisky & Wood – 60 Cambridge Terrace, Te Aro for an unforgettable afternoon packed with learning, connection, and MONAT magic.
This training event is a registered Market Partner only event open to all career ranks from MP – SED. Whether this is day 1 or 100 of your business this event has been designed to help you learn from the best and help you grow your businesses with all of the post MONATions excitement.
This event brings the energy of MONATions right to your city—featuring:
Hands-on sales training
Exciting product launch updates
VIP Program insights
Inspiration from our incredible local leaders
Practical business-building tools you can put into action immediately
You’ll leave with fresh ideas, new connections, and a renewed vision for your MONAT journey—all while having FUN! Expect good vibes, insight, learning, and plenty of laughter along the way.
Come along, invest in yourself and your business, and take this opportunity to grow alongside fellow Market Partners and our corporate team.
Tickets include a sweet treat.
We can’t wait to see you there!
This is a registered MP only event - no prospectives
About this venue
Whisky & Wood offers a modern, stylish event space in the heart of Wellington, perfect for a high-energy, collaborative afternoon
MONAT Gratitude
$3 from every ticket sold will be donated to MONAT Gratitude and go towards our Gratitude efforts in Australia. MONAT Gratitude is a very special piece of the MONAT culture where we seek to instil the values of giving back not only in our corporate offices, but also in our Market Partners all over the world. Our mission is to motivate and inspire our greater community to take action and generate positive change by partnering with visionary organisations in the areas of education, children, and families that are improving the world.

description:
Jazz Festival: Daniel Harris Quartet, An exclusive concert for Wellington Jazz Festival at The Undercurrent.

Be prepared for a relaxing evening of traditional jazz music!

Hailing from the (not so) distant city of Christchurch, Daniel and Zachary are joined by locals Ferdinand and Oscar to deliver a wonderful blend of relaxing jazz classics. Featuring quintessential songs from the jazz age, you can rely on a wonderful evening to wash away the worries of the 21st century.

The modern jazz style often incorporates many harsher elements in order to stand out, which can be very engaging. But it often demands attention, and radiates a tense atmosphere. Vintage jazz tends to prioritize an easy listening experience, with lyrical melodies and traditional music harmony.

Settle into a chair, take a sip of wine, and let the smooth harmonies flow over you!

Featuring:

Piano: Daniel Harris
Trombone: Ferdinand Hitchings-Anstice
Bass: Zachary Chyr
Drums: Oscar Garvie
label: Festivals

description:
Meet the Buyer Te Whanganui a Tara, Ehara taku toa i te toa takitahi, engari kē he toa takitini
Kia ora koutou, Noaˈia ˈe mḁuri, Kia Orana, Ni Sa Bula Vinaka, Fakaalofa lahi atu, Mālō e lelei, Malo le soifua, Malo nī, Faka talofa atu, Kam na mauri.
After some very successful Meet the Buyer events in both Porirua and Fielding, we are taking Meet the Buyer to the Capital.
The mission of Amotai is – Building sustainable wealth for Māori and Pasifika. One of the most important ways we do this is through our mission – to unlock opportunities for Māori and Pasifika businesses through supplier diversity.
We are very excited to engage Māori / Pasifika businesses in our nations capital in the second half of our Meet the Buyer programme for 2025. We have some great relationships with Wellington City and Greater Wellington Regional Council, as well as Tier 1 businesses. We are look forward to providing this awesome platform for our Amotai Buyers to connect with Māori and Pasifika businesses to all Amotai suppliers throughout the Wellington region, nau mai, haere mai.
Nau mai, hoki mai ki tēnei whakangahau whanaungatanga. Nau mai, haere mai ki te hono, ki te koorero me te mahi tahi a Suppliers me Buyers o Amotai.
label: Business & Networking

description:
NAWIC Wellington Annual Regional Meeting 2025, Join us at the NAWIC Wellington Annual Regional Meeting to show your support and share your ideas.
The current NAWIC Wellington Committee excited to welcome members to attend the Annual Regional Meeting (ARM) where we come together as a chapter to reflect on our achievements, discuss ongoing projects, and plan for the future. This meeting is a fantastic opportunity to connect with fellow members, share insights, and contribute to the growth and success of our organisation.
Along with the formalities we will review the past 12 months and look forward to the year ahead. We want to hear your feedback and discuss how you can contribute to the success of our organisation.
We are keen to hear from you if you:
Have an interest in joining the Committee
Have ideas for inspirational speakers or other types of events
Can offer access for site visits and/or venues for our events
Can give your time to represent NAWIC to speak at schools/career days
If you are unable to attend but interested in providing your feedback, you can contact us at rsvpwgtn@nawic.org.nz
DATE & TIME: 5:30pm, Tuesday 7 October
VENUE: TBIG, Level 13, 215 Lambton Quay
REGISTRATIONS: NAWIC members only, who can attend in person or online. Registration required.  Anyone is welcome to join NAWIC here
Please note: NAWIC is a voluntary organisation, committed to its obligations as a PCBU under the Health and Safety at Work Act 2015.   Amongst other things, this requires NAWIC to take all practicable steps to eliminate, isolate or minimize hazards that our event attendees are exposed to. Health and safety is a shared responsibility.

description:
Managing for value: building a strong financial advice business-Wellington, Building a valuable financial advice business means you have a resilient business to support your clients and a strong asset. Transactions – acquisition and disposal support the long-term growth and sustainability of financial advice provider businesses. Transactions take many forms, going concerns regularly acquire and dispose of clients, business units, lines of business, have investors buy-in, bring key staff together – and split businesses up. Only a small number of our transactions are the classic market exit.
Our aim is to spend time talking with advisers about how to grow their business and manage for value – making their business more valuable by explicitly thinking about valuation in addition to the other metrics such as profit and cashflow.

The Educate Plus NZ Chapter is thrilled to invite you to our 2025 Summit taking place on Tuesday 19 & Wednesday 20 August at Victoria University of Wellington for the 𝗠𝗮𝗸𝗲 𝗧𝗼𝗺𝗼𝗿𝗿𝗼𝘄 𝗖𝗵𝗮𝗽𝘁𝗲𝗿 𝗦𝘂𝗺𝗺𝗶𝘁. This professional development opportunity will bring together Advancement Practitioners from across New Zealand, in Tertiary Institutions and Schools, all dedicated to shaping the future together.
The Summit, with sessions in Admissions, Alumni & Community Relations, Fundraising, Marketing & Communications, Leadership and People & Culture, will be more than just a learning experience—it will also be an opportunity to connect, collaborate, and share insights with professionals who, like you, are passionate about building a better tomorrow.

description:
Urban Cocktail Trail, On Sale Times
Presale Access - Thursday 31 July, 10am NZST
General Access - Thursday 31 July, 12pm NZST
----
Grab your mates and discover the best bars in Pōneke Wellington on the self-guided Urban Cocktail Trail! Whether you're a cocktail lover, or just up for a fun afternoon out, this trail is all about good drinks and great vibes!

Kick things off with a bite at your starting venue, then make your way around using your cocktail vouchers. Where you go and what you sip is totally up to you!

Tickets will fly, so lock yours in and get ready for an afternoon of flavour and fun!

VENUES + SIGNATURE COCKTAILS
1. Dirty Little Secret Ft. Peachy Pear
Absolut Pear Vodka + Vanilla Galliano + Peach Syrup + Lemon Juice + Egg White
2. Ernesto's Ft. Pimm'd to the Brim
Pimms + Cucumber Gin + Strawberry Liqueur + Juices
3. Otto Champagneria & Beer Hall Ft. Saigon Sunset
Papaiti Orchard Gin + Lemongrass Liqueur Syrup + Ginger Syrup + Lime Juice + Soda + Mint
4. Rosie's Red-Hot Cantina Ft. Coconut Margarita
Cazcabel Coconut Tequila + Triple Sec + Lime Juice + Agave Syrup
5. St John's Bar Ft. Tiki Trail
Sailor Jerry Spiced Rum + De Kuyper Banana Liqueur + De Kuyper Mango Liqueur + Kwai Feh + Lychee Liqueur + Lemon Juice + Pineapple Juice + Grenadine
6. The Old Bailey Ft. Pash & Dash
Rum + Passionfruit Liqueur + Passionfruit Syrup + Lime + Lemonade + Mint & Lime Garnish

TICKETS (Limited Availability)
Option #1 – The Connoisseur | $99
$10 Food Voucher for your chosen starting venue (valid until 2 PM)
6x Cocktail Vouchers to enjoy at any participating venue (valid until 5 PM)

Option #2 – The Trailblazer | $75
$10 Food Voucher for your chosen starting venue (valid until 2 PM)
4x Cocktail Vouchers to use at any participating venue (valid until 5 PM)
Note: Food options may vary from the venue’s regular menu due to the event format.

EVENT REGISTRATION & VOUCHER COLLECTION
Pick up your event vouchers and guide at the designated registration point before starting your trail.

Event Day Registration
Location: Ernesto's (1 Grey St, Te Aro)
Date: Saturday 6th September
Time: 12 PM – 1:30 PM

REFUND POLICY
Sorry no refunds, unless the event is cancelled/postponed by the organiser

GETTING AROUND
Aside from the amazing cocktails, one of the best things about the Urban Cocktail Trail is that it's a completely self-guided day out! What that means is once you've been to your nominated starting location you can go where you want, when you want!

description:
New Zealand Vocational Education and Training Research Forum, Rebuilding together.
Ngā mihi nui ki a koutou katoa

Skills Group and BCITO are delighted to join forces to return NZVETRF as a unique national event to showcase and disseminate new and emerging research and innovation in Vocational Education and Training.
Since 2004, the NZVETRF has been the must-attend event for policy makers, researchers and practitioners engaged in vocational education, across all parts of the tertiary sector and industry.
The vocational education sector is transforming through both policy and technological change. Knowing 'what works' and what is emerging is more critical than ever as a new network of provision for vocational education and training is established.
Over a day and a half you'll hear from international and national keynote speakers, government and sector stakeholders, the learner voice, and debates on the hot topics, along with curated and competitively selected research and evidence presentations.

Places are limited - register now to secure your place at Aotearoa's pre-eminent cross-sector vocational education event.
Call for Abstracts Now Open
We now invite researchers, practitioners, and policy makers to submit abstracts for presentation at the Forum. As part of New Zealand's premier VET research platform, your contributions will help shape New Zealand’s future as our sector moves forward.
Submission Guidelines
Abstracts should be no longer than 300 words and outline your completed research and intended presentation. We particularly welcome submissions that address one or more of our key conference themes:
·       Workplace learning and Industry Training
·       Diversity, Access and Equity
·       Developing our Future Workforce
·       Technology and Innovation
·       Learner Journey and Outcomes
·       Collaboration and System Approaches.
Your research should demonstrate evidence-based outcomes, share good practice, support high-quality research networks, and inform policy development. We encourage submissions that honour Te Tiriti o Waitangi and incorporate Māori perspectives in VET innovation.
Submit your abstract here
Submission Deadline: 5pm, 17 September 2025
An assessment panel comprising representatives from Skills Group, BCITO, and an independent assessor will evaluate all submissions. Successful presenters will be notified by the end of September 2025.
Keynote Speaker Announcement
We are delighted to announce that Kathryn Rowan, Executive Director of Switzerland-based Global Apprenticeship Network will address the Forum.

Kathryn is a seasoned leader with a background in human resources and corporate social responsibility, who brings a wealth of experience from her previous role as Vice President of Human Resources, Zone Latin America, and Global Youth Lead at Nestlé. Throughout her career, Ms. Rowan has consistently demonstrated a passion for harnessing the power of business to drive positive change in society. During her tenure at Nestlé, in national, regional, and global roles, she promoted initiatives to strengthen leadership and capability building, diversity, and corporate reputation, while spearheading youth-focused efforts, including the Global Alliance for Youth.
The Global Apprenticeship Network was established in 2014 by ILO, the International Organisation of Employers (IOE), the Organisation of Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD), and Business at OECD. GAN is governed by a private-sector led, multi-stakeholder coalition representing major global corporations and international organisations, GAN's primary role is to encourage businesses to implement apprenticeship and WBL programs and support the creation of an enabling policy environment.
Further programme details and speaker announcements will be made in coming weeks, so register now!
Your Co-Hosts
Skills Group is New Zealand's largest Private Training Establishment, supporting 17,000 learners and training across 33 industries, through both work-based and provider-based learning, across 15 campuses nationwide.
BCITO is New Zealand's largest provider of Apprenticeships, having qualified 55,000 tradies and counting, across 15 construction and allied trades.

Skills and BCITO gratefully acknowledge Ako Aotearoa, the Centre for Tertiary Teaching Excellence, for support and permission to carry this event forward. We acknowledge Ako's enormous contribution to VET research and this event over many years. NZVETRF is a taonga, and as co-hosts we are committed to upholding the mana of the event.

Partner with us.
NZVETRF is all about walking the talk on sector collaboration. We warmly invite interest from interested education and industry partners to join on as event supporters. Sponsorship and event supporter packages are available. Contact nzvetrf@skills-group.org for details.

description:
Painless Presenting - Tuesday 18th November, Full day presentation skills workshop in Wellington. Limited tickets available. Get in now so you don't miss out!
Who's it for?
You work in a technical field. You’re great at your job — but struggle to get your ideas across the business.
You often:
Dive into technical detail that loses or confuses your audience
Overload people with too much information, which makes it harder to get the results you need
Find it tough to explain complex areas of your role in a way others can easily understand
Spend hours planning presentations, yet still feel stiff and uncomfortable when delivering
Feel nervous when presenting, and wish you could speak with more ease and confidence
If this sounds like you, Painless Presenting will help you cut through complexity, present clearly, and build the confidence you know is vital for your career growth.
What you will learn:
A proven step by step process that will take the pain out of planning presentations and set the foundations for becoming a more engaging, natural and effective business presenter.

Participants are taught how to write a valuable business presentation, how to manage their nerves, design useful visuals and are given key delivery techniques to help deliver their presentations in a natural and engaging way.
You will come away with:
an understanding of how to use the SpeakerMap™ system, a step by step, proven approach to planning presentations quickly and effectively
a new appreciation of purpose when speaking
an understanding of how to quickly design useful presentation visuals
how to easily overcome the problems of speaking too fast, um-ing and ah-ing, and losing your place
a tailored strategy to dissolve the anxiety that so often accompanies presenting
three delivery tricks that will help you come across as credible and confident
Note: You will not need to present to the group on this course. If you are interested in a more intensive training option, including one on one coaching, check out our 2 day workshop The Effective Speaker.
What past participants say:
"By far the best course i have attended in any organisation, either here in NZ or abroad. The format of the course was engaging and there was a great balance between listening, engaging and participating. I look forward to using the skills used presenting at our next Team Hui!"
Matthew Townsley, Medical Council of New Zealand


"Really great course, no pressure environment with a good mix of interactive and book work. Have walked away feeling more confident in how I am going to put my presentations together."

Jessica Stokes, Emergency Management Team, New Plymouth District Council
"It was good, practical and useful tools "not rules" for business comms and pressos. Good to learn some of the other things you don't often learn in traditional presentation skills training. Really good engagement and interaction - the team were impressed we were all engaged right until the end! Easily one of the best courses I have been on in this line of work. Keep up the good work! "
Brad Stansell, Channel Account Manager, Pax 8

description:
NLUF 2025: Infrastructure Resilience in a Shifting Landscape, NLUF 2025: Infrastructure Resilience in a Shifting Landscape
This Forum brings a wider range of people involved in critical infrastructure resilience to learn and discuss the latest developments.

About this Event

Welcome to NLUF 2025: Infrastructure Resilience in a Shifting Landscape!
This Forum brings together people delivering infrastructure resilience to discuss the latest developments and opportunities.
We welcome attendees from critical infrastructure organisations, regional Lifelines Groups, CDEM Sector, research agencies and others, working to improve New Zealand’s infrastructure resilience and the wellbeing of our communities.


Feature Sessions:
National Resilience Perspectives.
The First ‘R’ - Reducing Risk
Enhancing Resilience – Regulatory and other Levers
Community Resilience to Lifelines Failures
Engineering more Resilient Infrastructure
Intelligence for Readiness and Response
National Planning for Lifelines Readiness and Response.

Interactive Sessions:
• Opportunities for discussion and networking.

Keynotes:
• Political and executive leaders influencing infrastructure resilience.


Associated Forum Events
Wednesday 15th October 2025, 12.30pm - 4.30pm, Lifeline Utility Coordinator Forum (invite only).
Thursday 16th October 2025, 5.30pm – 7.00pm
Social Event tbc. All attendees invited.
Friday 17th October 2025, 7.15am – 8.45am: Breakfast meeting for Programme Managers and Chairs of regional Lifelines Groups (invite only)

description:
Poroporoaki for Rosalie & Welcome to Elizabeth & Shaquille, Kia ora e te whānau EHF,
You're invited to a very special evening!
Join us on Wednesday 27 August at 5:30pm for a heart-filled poroporoaki, a chance to celebrate Rosalie Nelson, and to officially welcome our new Co-Executive Directors, Elizabeth McNaughton and Shaquille Shortland.
📍 Te Wharewaka Function Centre, Wellington
🕔 Doors open at 5:00pm | Welcome begins at 5:30pm sharp
🕢 Event concludes by 7:30pm
👔 Dress: Business casual
To RSVP (button)
To register to join online (button)
This will be a joyful evening of reflection, reconnection and looking ahead. Whether you're joining us in person or online, we’d love to have you in the room (or on the screen!) as we mark this milestone in the life of the Fellowship. You are also welcome to bring your partner.
In te ao Māori, a poroporoaki is more than a farewell; it's a ritual of transition and gratitude. A moment to steady the waka, acknowledge the hands that have guided it, and prepare together for the voyage ahead.
We’ll honour Rosalie’s contribution, and we’ll raise a glass to Elizabeth and Shaquille as they step into their new roles. Expect warmth, good company, big-hearted kōrero and a few surprises too.
If you're planning to attend in person and haven’t yet booked travel, now’s a good time to do so.

Ngā manaakitanga,
The EHF Board

description:
Resilience and Emissions Reduction Workshop for Not-For-Profits | Blenheim, Ready your not-for-profit for the future
Do you know you need to take action to address climate change but don’t know where to start?
Do you want to strengthen your organisations’ planning and readiness for change?
Do you want practical tools and support to measure, assess, and report on your organisations’ impact?

In partnership with Rātā Foundation, our Earth+ Resilience and Emissions Reduction programme has been designed to flip the script on climate change, centering your organisation as agents of change and kitting you with the tools, support and community to make a difference; and it’s free of charge!
About the programme
With the support of the Terra Nova team and other programme participants, you will be guided to identify how your organisation is uniquely placed to contribute to the resilience and wellbeing of people and planet, and the opportunities and obstacles to creating positive change.
The programme is accessible and suitable for everyone, from those just starting on the journey, to those who have steps in place but are looking to gain access to further resources. This programme is not intended to add extra workload or deliverables for your organisation, it is an offer of support to integrate an Earth+ approach into your BAU; an answer to the question “what can we do about climate change?”
We know that every organisation’s capacity is different, so our support is available for you to utilise it when you need it until the end of 2025. This includes:
Access to a dedicated online community where you can connect with the Terra Nova team, other Rātā grantees and specialised partners. Ask questions, find resources and share your journey.
A toolkit of resources and impact sessions to develop your knowledge and connect you with the expertise and support to build resilience and tackle change in a range of impact areas.
Complementary access to the Cogo carbon emissions measurement tool, providing you the ability to quantify and report on your emissions impact and providing recommended actions for emissions reduction and cost savings, in an easy-to-use format.
It begins with a 1-day interactive workshop to kick things off. By the end of the workshop, you will walk away:
Feeling more empowered about the future, with a deeper understanding of resilience and climate change as it relates to your organisation’s context.
Having explored how you can make change positive and achievable, centered on the needs of your community and team. 
With free access to Cogo carbon manager, an emissions profile, report of your carbon footprint and practical action you can take to reduce your emissions.
Having built a network of support and gained free-to-use practical tools and templates.
Note: we will be running multiple workshops throughout the year; you only need to attend one workshop to join the programme. If you prefer an alternate date, please head to our Humanitix profile to find the corresponding event. 
The programme is fully funded for not-for-profit organisations and registrations are now open for 2025! Register for the programme and secure your spot in a workshop through this Humanatix event, and a member of the Terra Nova team will be in touch to confirm your enrollment. For more information about the programme and workshop, visit the Terra Nova website.
We look forward to welcoming you into our community of changemakers!

description:
Resilient Leadership, Resilient Leadership
Wellington Chamber of Commerce and JacksonStone & Partners present: Future Fluent: Navigate What’s Next – A New Series

About this Event

Resilient Leadership
Real talk on leading well without losing your spark
Leadership shouldn’t come at the cost of your wellbeing. Yet too often, high performance is confused with running on empty.

Why be part of this session?
We’ll cut through the clichés and have a real conversation about resilience, balance, and what it takes to sustain yourself - and your team - over the long haul. Walk away with practical strategies to embed wellbeing into daily work, recharge team culture, and lead in a way that keeps your spark alive.
Because the best leaders don’t just survive pressure - they model how to thrive through it.

This event is part of a new 3-part series: Future Fluent - Navigate What’s Next.
A practical, thought-provoking speaker series for professionals who want to stay ahead - not just keep up.

Who’s the speaker?
Jude West, Team & Clinical Lead from EAP Services/Habit Health

What’s in-store:
11:00am – Arrival/networking
11:30am-12:15pm – Speaker session
12:15-12:30pm – Q&A
12:30-1:00pm – Networking with light snacks

description:
Hōkai Tahi Winter Woodlands Pizza Evening, We’re inviting you to a cozy night out with heart.
Our Winter Woodlands Pizza Evening is a special fundraiser supporting Hōkai Tahi.
Based in the Wairarapa, Hōkai Tahi walks alongside women and whānau through pregnancy, baby loss, and the early years of parenting - offering time, space, and resources when they are needed most.
Indulge in a delicious 3-course meal (wood-fired pizza included, of course!) with non-alcoholic drinks provided.
A limited bar menu will be available, or feel free to BYO.
Alongside your meal, enjoy live music, a live auction of locally donated treasures, and for those feeling adventurous, a short glow worm walk through the native bush (don’t forget your torch, sturdy shoes, and warm layers - hot water bottles welcome!).
Details:
Watermill Bakery, 33 Blakes Road, Mt Holdsworth
Saturday 1st November 2025
5:30–8:30pm
$75 per adult - $20 per child (under 14)
Look out for our friendly parking warden in hi-vis on arrival and simply give your name to be guided in.
Please note there’s no reception at the venue, so make any arrangements before you head our way.
Share an evening of great food, live entertainment, and woodland magic - all in support of a truly worthwhile cause.
Every ticket sold helps Hōkai Tahi continue supporting local whānau through life’s most tender moments.

description:
Self Promotion for Business Owners, First impressions count! 
Present yourself as an approachable, confident and competent business owner to attract new clients.
Overview:
Highly interactive in-person workshop, ensuring you action and refine your learnings immediately amidst a safe supportive learning environment.
Our goal is to make a natural strong first impression and spark further conversation with potential clients. We will cover crafting a compelling narrative, identifying a target audience, and practicing impactful delivery.
Key learnings:
Understand basic sales skills and the psychology around self-promotion
Manage your nerves
Refine your message
Become savvy in articulating your USP (unique selling proposition)
Learn what to say when and how using powerful words and body language
Receive on the spot expert coaching and feedback
Work on your voice modulation, posture, and gestures to ooze professionalism
 Previous Workshop Attendee:
"Big thanks to Angelika Barnes for her course on "Self Promotion'. I would highly recommend her. We learnt so much and had a great time doing so! The workshop helped me immensely in developing a clear, concise & compelling way of presenting and promoting myself in future business environments. Angelika is a great presenter."
Luke Swart, Nelson
Presenter Bio:
With a background in sales and communication as trainer for the Banking Academy in Cologne, Germany and roles in both operational and people management, Angelika has maintained her focus on empowering people through highly engaging experiential workshops and 1:1 coaching sessions.
Angelika empowers people to express themselves with confidence and is looking forward to sharing gems that help others succeed.
To register - visit https://www.abcangelikabarnescoaching.com/funded
You could be eligible for up to75% funding through the Regional Business Partner Network (RBPN) Growth Advisors, e.g. Rose Ryan call 03 577 9575 or email rose@mcoc.org.nz o

description:
TENZ Conference 2025, TENZ Conference 2025
TENZ invites you to our 2025 Conference - Inspiring Ākonga Empowering Kaiako, to be held at Wellington East Girls' College, 131 Austin Street, Mount Victoria, Wellington 6011.

The conference is designed for teachers and researchers at all levels of technology education and will provide opportunities to connect with, and learn from, other members of the community as well as get up to date with new products, tools and opportunities that support students’ learning in technology.

Register here: https://tenz.org.nz/2025-conference/

With over 50 sessions spanning the full spectrum of technology education - from food, textiles, DVC, and STEAM to digital, vocational, and emerging tech - there’s something for every kaiako, at every level. Dive into workshops on AI, AR, and rockets; explore neuro inclusion, culturally sustaining practice, and curriculum integration; get practical with tools like Minecraft, WorldPainter, and Brisk; or collaborate on pathways, assessment, and cross-curricular design thinking. Whether you're refining your NCEA practice, reigniting creativity, or discovering new ways to inspire ākonga, these sessions are designed to spark ideas, deepen confidence, and empower you to lead change in your classroom and community. This is your chance to connect, create, and be part of shaping the future of technology education in Aotearoa.

description:
Strengths & Superpowers, Strengths & Superpowers
Personal branding isn’t showing off - it’s taking ownership over how you’re perceived. Join a Masterclass in making yours standout among the rest.
Welcome to the second conversation in our Women in Business series: four events that bring you important conversations led by Women in Business and heard by everyone. In partnership with Forsyth Barr, this bar-setting series is bringing hard-hitting topics into the conversational spotlight.
This conversation is led by two experts who are empowering other women, and will focus on an often-overlooked asset: personal branding. Whether your sights are set on a project or a promotion, this powerful tool can put you on the radar for the opportunities you want.
Why be part of this conversation?
When you control your narrative, you can ensure that it's accurate, compelling, and unique. Join our interactive session to uncover and learn how to convey the unique value you bring to the table. It isn't about crafting a fake persona, it's about making sure your superpowers get noticed.
You’ll get expert insights into:
Strengths: Understand and use your strengths for impact.
Superpower: Take control of what you want to be known for.
Story: Quick ways to naturally share your value.
Who’s the speaker?
Natalie Ferguson & Kristen Luman are the founders of Powrsuit - a career accelerator for every woman that takes professional development out of to-do lists and into weekly routines. With over 700 members across NZ, Australia, North America and Singapore, Powrsuit's research-backed approach delivers a tangible return on investment. After six months, 82% of members increase self-leadership skills, and 28% take a tangible step forward in their careers.
This interactive workshop is a must-attend for anyone who wants to maximise their visibility and value, regardless of job title.
**All attendees will go into the draw to win a annual Powrsuit membership**
What’s in-store:
5:15-5:30pm – Arrival/networking
5:30-6:15pm – Powrsuit mini-masterclass
6:15-6:30pm – Q&A
6:30-7:30pm – Networking with drinks & canapes
This event is part of the Women in Business chapter from our “Join the Conversation” series - 4 events that spotlight important topics through conversation, led by the amazing women driving change within them.
Business card prize draw:
Attend the event and go in the draw to win a “New BMW for a Weekend” and a “New MINI for a Weekend” from Continental Cars BMW and Wellington MINI Garage.
Attend other events in the series:
17 July: Making money in the mess - How every woman can financially thrive in messy economic times
20 August: 3 Gals, One Beehive – live! - Hear three leading women take a week in politics, and turn it into the unfiltered commentary that you wish you’d hear on the 6 o’clock news.
18 September: Impactful Leadership - What do horses, mules and the All Blacks have in common? Hear a true expert break-down what really works when it comes to impactful leadership.

description:
The Power of Successful Cross-Sectoral Collaboration: A Real-World Example, From Pilot to Powerhouse: The BEATS Research Journey
Presented by Dr Sandra Mandic
In a world where complex challenges demand bold collaboration, the BEATS Research Programme stands as a beacon of what’s possible when sectors unite with purpose.
Join Dr Sandra Mandic as she shares the remarkable 10-year journey of BEATS—an award-winning, interdisciplinary initiative that brought together academia, local government, schools, and communities across Dunedin. From its humble beginnings in 2013 to its international recognition by 2023, BEATS exemplifies the transformative power of shared vision, strategic leadership, and cross-sectoral teamwork.
In this session, you’ll discover:
🔍 How BEATS advanced scientific knowledge while serving real-world needs
🤝 What made its partnerships thrive across disciplines and institutions
🧭 Key lessons in leadership, adaptability, and long-term sustainability
🚀 Insights to inspire your own collaborative projects and research endeavours
Whether you're in education, policy, research, or community development, this talk offers a compelling blueprint for building impactful, resilient collaborations.
Explore the full story at AGILE Research – BEATS Programme
About Sandy
Dr Sandra Mandic, PhD, PMP is a transformational leader, innovator and award-winning researcher and author. Sandra’s personal and professional journey spans nine cities across five countries and three continents – including Europe, Canada, United States and New Zealand. She speaks four languages and has experience of working in academia, government and business sectors. Sandra was the founder and lead researcher on the award-winning BEATS Research Programme (2013-2023). She is also the founder and the director of the research consultancy AGILE Research Ltd. and the creator of the Compass Guide Research Training resources which currently include four books and over dozen research training and project management courses.
More information about Dr Mandic’s background and the link to her brief curriculum vitae:
https://agileresearch.nz/about-the-author/

description:
The Moonlit Market at The Atom - A playful experiment in entrepreneurial leadership, Date: Wednesday 15 October
Time: Doors open 5pm, adventure begins 5:30pm sharp. We’ll wrap up around 7:30pm.
Location: The Atom, Rutherford House, Victoria University, Wellington
Cost: Free (but only 25 places - first in, first served)
Step into a fantasy world where business plans mingle with strange enchantments and the market is never what it seems.
This event is designed with entrepreneurial leadership in mind - for anyone curious about the messy reality of building ideas and leading through uncertainty. If you’ve ever wondered what it really takes to test, fail, and adapt on the fly, you’ll feel right at home.
You’ll take on a fantasy character and join a small team of fellow entrepreneurs-in-disguise. Together, you’ll:
Interview strange and unpredictable NPCs to gather intel.
Dream up bizarre products that might just make you rich.
Build your idea with limited time and energy tokens.
Roll the dice and see what magical mishaps or unexpected opportunities change your fate.
The market is chaotic, the customers are fickle, and your product could become a cult sensation - or a village-wide joke.
This playful experience is more than just fun and games. You’ll get a taste of:
Leading through uncertainty
Making decisions with incomplete information
Collaborating under pressure
Turning setbacks into opportunities (or at least good stories)
No business experience required - just bring your imagination, your sense of humour, and your willingness to play.

description:
The Inevitabilism Panel, We're told AI is Progress, progress that cannot be stopped, that it will change the way we work and live, from business to education and the commons. But who says? Whose progress and whose AI is it anyway? Is societal progress really bound to technological innovation, or are there other ways of reading - and even shaping - positive social change?
Technological Determinism is described as the belief system that social progress is driven by technological innovation, which in turn follows an "inevitable" course." This panel will take a good hard look at this 'inevitabilism' - its forces and politics - with a view to our shared future in Aotearoa and the Pacific.
Join us for a rigorous evening of discussion with a view to how we might gain more understanding - and more say - as to the reach and influence new technologies have over our autonomy, dignity, communities and cultures.
label: Business & Networking

description:
The Workplace Rituals Deck Facilitator Masterclass, Build culture by design, not by default - one ritual at a time.
Facilitate meaningful culture change and create connection through the power of workplace rituals.
This masterclass is for people who want to build stronger, more connected workplace cultures — and are ready to turn values and intentions into real, daily action.
Whether you're a leader, culture champion, facilitator, or change consultant, this training will give you the tools and confidence to run your own Workplace Rituals Workshops using the WRD (Workplace Rituals Deck).
Led by the co-creators of the deck, Lotty Roberts and Lorissa Garcia, this is a hands-on learning experience rooted in emotional culture, intentional design, and purposeful leadership.
In this Masterclass, you'll learn:
What rituals are and why they are important
Why rituals matter in workplaces
The difference between habits and rituals
Indepth knowledge of each of the 4 parts of the deck and why they are important
How to use our PARR model to craft rituals that stick
How to run the Rituals Audit
How to guide groups through ideation, crafting and action
Lotty & Lorissa's tips and tricks for using the deck first hand, along with the story and background behind the deck.
You'll walk away as a Certified Workplace Rituals Deck Practitioner, with confidence to run rituals sessions with your own teams or clients.
What's Included:
3.5 hour in person masterclass
Co-led by the WRD creators: Lotty Roberts & Lorissa Garcia
Certification as a WRD Practitioner
Digital Toolkit
Option to purchase with or without a deck.
Who it’s for:
Leaders & Team Managers
Culture Champions
Small business owners wanting to create an intentional culture as they scale
HR, OD, and Change Practitioners
Leadership Development Consultants
Facilitators & Coaches
Anyone who wants to turn values into action and create emotionally intelligent, connected teams and workplaces
Why Join? Because culture doesn't live in a document. It lives in the small, intentional things we do every day. This masterclass gives you the tools and confidence to help others design those moments — and build workplaces where people feel connected, seen and supported.
Culture happens with or without you - rituals help make it intentional.
Presented by the WRD Co-creators:
Lorissa (founder of Assembly Culture) and Lotty Roberts (founder of MiND.U) met through their shared work in emotional culture, leadership, and change - and quickly became friends as well as collaborators.
After years of working with teams and leaders, they kept noticing the same thing: workshops sparked insight, but translating that energy into everyday action was where things fell short.
So they created The Workplace Rituals Deck - a practical, human way to close the gap between knowing and doing. It’s full of simple, powerful rituals to help teams shape a culture that’s not just talked about, but genuinely felt.
Ticket Options:
Masterclass Only – $299 NZD
Masterclass + WRD Deck – $529 NZD (Deck provided on the day at in-person events.)
Will refreshments be provided during the workshop?
Coffee, tea, water and some light snacks will be available during the morning tea break.

29th October 2025

What's the refund and cancellation policy?
Unfortunately we do not offer refunds for this workshop.
However, you may send someone else in your place to this workshop if you cannot attend for any reason.
You must notify the host that you will not attend the workshop and the name of the person that will attend in your spot.
If you cannot attend the workshop and have purchased a deck we will send that to you along with the digital toolkit.
If the Workshop Host cancels this workshop, you will be transferred to the next available workshop. You can contact the Workshop host for a refund if you cannot attend the revised workshop date.

description:
Aurora Distillery Gin Experience, Create, make and take home your own gin with us at our Gin Experience sessions at our beautiful Wairarapa site, just 10 minutes from Martinborough. Our experienced distillery staff are on hand throughout to guide you through the process and give as much or as little advice as you want. We have hundreds of satisfied customers who have made some really exciting gins.

You’ll begin by foraging in the distillery gardens then we move to the gin-making room to learn about the gin making process and the ingredients involved. You’ll sample loads of botanicals then you will choose what you want to put in your very own gin recipe. After weighing out your recipe, you’ll move to your very own still and begin distilling!

While your gin is distilling, we’ll do a gin tasting of some of our own Arrival brand gins and some surprises from our other spirits.

At the end of the session you’ll bottle and seal your own 500ml bottle of gin to take home!

Please note each Experience attendee must have their own ticket. To ensure all participants have a great time and get our full attention we cannot accept spectators.

description:
The Tradie Roadshow 2025 - Johnsonville!, The Tradie Roadshow - 2025!
Come join us at the Johnsonville Rugby Club for an exciting event tailored just for tradies like you! Learn valuable tips and tricks to boost your business and increase your success in 2026. Network with fellow tradies and industry experts to gain insights and grow your professional circle. Don't miss out on this opportunity to take your trade to the next level!


Key Topics & Talking Points

Quote Smarter, Win More
How to make your quotes stand out from the competition with simple, professional templates.
Using free/low-cost quoting tools to speed up response time (and why speed wins jobs).
Adding small touches (images, guarantees, payment links) that boost acceptance rates.

Lead Tracking Made Easy
Simple ways to track every enquiry so none fall through the cracks.
Using a basic CRM or spreadsheet to stay on top of follow-ups.
How to automate reminders so you never forget to reply.

Booking Without the Back-and-Forth
How to let customers book jobs or quotes online, even outside work hours.
Tools to sync bookings with your calendar automatically.
Why offering easy booking options can double your conversion rates.

Boosting Your Online Presence
Making Google Reviews work for you — and how to get them without pestering.
Setting up a simple “digital business card” (or Quickr app) for instant credibility.
Quick wins on Facebook & Instagram that take 10 minutes a week.

Following Up Like a Pro
The 3-day rule for follow-ups — and why it secures more jobs.
Automating polite reminders for quotes and overdue invoices.
Staying front-of-mind without being pushy.

Why It’s Impactful for 2026

Customers expect fast, simple communication — these tools make it effortless.
You can compete with bigger companies without hiring extra staff.
Every strategy here is low-cost or free, and takes less than 1 hour to set up.

This event is free, just bring a mate and your questions to the Johnsonville Rugby Club.

PRE-REGISTER YOUR VEHICLE:

Why wait? Pre-register your vehicle or bike now for just $10 online. Just jump onto the website and on the day you can just park up, and flash your email confirmation on your dashboard. Easy peasy! Just head to https://www.tuihq.co.nz/mangatainoka-motors/

And if you forget to pre-register? No sweat! You can still sign up on the day.

All proceeds from registrations go towards the Mangatainoka Motors Reserve Restoration Project. It’s a win-win!

So, gather your crew, polish that ride, and join us for a day of laughter, camaraderie, and, of course, some seriously sweet wheels. We can’t wait to see you there!

description:
Treasury Guest Lecture with Michael Keen: IN-PERSON attendance, Join us for our special Fiscal Policy for the Future seminar
New Zealand faces significant long-term fiscal challenges, including the rising costs associated with an ageing population, increasing demand for public services, and the need to adapt to a changing global economy. These pressures will require careful planning to ensure the sustainability of government finances while maintaining fairness and efficiency in the tax system.
Inland Revenue’s draft Long-Term Insights Briefing explores these issues by asking critical questions about the future shape and scale of our tax system. Similarly, the Treasury’s Long-Term Fiscal Statement highlights the importance of future-proofing our tax framework and other broader policy settings to address these challenges.
Join us for this seminar delivered by a highly regarded economist and expert in tax policy and administration, and a prolific author, Michael Keen, as he shares his insights on future proofing our tax system.
This will be a hybrid event, and we encourage you to attend it in person for an opportunity to engage in a discussion on all those issues with our guest speaker.
About this event
This will be a hybrid event. Please use this site to register if you plan to attend it in person.
If you would like to attend it virtually, please use THIS LINK to register.
The Tax Policy Charitable Trust has arranged Mick’s visit to New Zealand. The Trust was established to support leading tax policy thinking in New Zealand. You can read about the Trust’s work here.
About the presenter
Michael (Mick) Keen is a former Deputy Director of the Fiscal Affairs Department at the International Monetary Fund, where for over twenty years he played a central role in shaping and delivering IMF policies and advice on tax matters.
He has advised finance ministries in all parts of the world, including missions to over forty countries, and led the preparation of influential papers for the G20 and the Executive Board of the IMF.
Before joining the Fund, Mick was Professor of Economics at the universities of Essex (UK), Queens (Canada) and Kyoto, and is now Ushioda Fellow at the University of Tokyo.
Mick was the keynote speaker at the 2014 conference on the Future of Tax Administration in New Zealand and has provided peer review for Inland Revenue’s previous Long-Term Insights Briefing.
Mick has jointly authored, with Joel Slemrod, Rebellion, Rascals and Revenue – an entertaining account of how history illuminates the perennial challenges and timeless principles of taxation—and how the past holds clues to solving the tax problems of today.
About this seminar series
New ideas, innovative concepts, research evidence and expert advice are all crucial to stimulate and inform the Treasury’s economic analysis and advice. Our current theme for guest lectures - Fiscal Policy for the Future - explores the role of stabilising, sustainable and effective fiscal policy. Speakers provide insights into how fiscal policy can be designed to support government to meet its current and future objectives and obligations while adapting to changing circumstances and delivering value to the New Zealand public.
Fiscal policy has a stabilising role in helping to smooth the business cycle, while sustainability in fiscal policy is foundational for resilience to both shocks and longstanding challenges, such as climate change, technological advancements, and demographic trends. Ensuring effective and value for money expenditure is important so that fiscal policy contributes to the living standards of New Zealanders, both now and in the future.
Please note that the views, opinions, findings, and conclusions expressed in the Treasury Guest Lecture Series are those of the individual presenters. They do not necessarily reflect the views of the New Zealand Treasury or the New Zealand Government.
For updates and our latest research visit: www.treasury.govt.nz
Keep in touch
If you would like to be the first to hear about our upcoming events in the Treasury Guest Lecture Series, please SUBSCRIBE to stay up to date.

description:
Wellington Before9: Responsible AI - have we figured out what that means in practice?, Join us for "Responsible AI - have we figured out what that means in practice?," an engaging Before9 (Breakfast event) discussing the latest strategic direction of the technology in Aotearoa New Zealand.
New Zealand's first national AI strategy has arrived, aiming to boost productivity and encourage the uptake of AI "with confidence." But as we move forward, a critical question remains: what does "responsible AI" actually look like in practice for businesses and organisations in Aotearoa? This panel discussion will delve into the nuances of the government's new strategy, exploring its impact on our collective journey. Our panel will unpack the challenges and opportunities presented by a "light-touch" regulatory approach and discuss how we can build a uniquely Kiwi framework for responsible AI in New Zealand.
Our panel will be made up of the following individuals:
Zoe Udy, Deputy Chair at TUANZ
Sasha Vlassoff, Senior Policy Advisor at InternetNZ
Plus one other
Zoe in particular will be able to give an update from our meeting with the Parliamentary cross-party caucus on AI.
We look forward to hosting you at this Before9.  This event is free for members of InternetNZ and TUANZ.  This is a number limited event to 30 individuals so make sure you register early.
Please note the formalities will start at 7:45am but you can arrive any time after 7:30am.

description:
The Inevitabilism Panel, We're told AI is Progress, progress that cannot be stopped, that it will change the way we work and live, from business to education and the commons. But who says? Whose progress and whose AI is it anyway? Is societal progress really bound to technological innovation, or are there other ways of reading - and even shaping - positive social change?
Technological Determinism is described as the belief system that social progress is driven by technological innovation, which in turn follows an "inevitable" course." This panel will take a good hard look at this 'inevitabilism' - its forces and politics - with a view to our shared future in Aotearoa and the Pacific.
Join us for a rigorous evening of discussion with a view to how we might gain more understanding - and more say - as to the reach and influence new technologies have over our autonomy, dignity, communities and cultures.

description:
6-12 In person PLD, 6-12 In person PLD
The story of Communication and Signs is one of the five great stories which scaffold the learning in Montessori classrooms for the 6-12 year old child. It traces the beginnings of human communication and the development of writing.

How can we as educators encourage writing in our Montessori environments and ensure collaborations and an understanding of the basic writing processes, bring success and enthusiasm to the telling of powerful stories?

What are some of the stumbling blocks for children when researching? How can we provide strategies and structure to enable lively and informative information writing?

In this day-long face to face workshop, with a focus on guidance for narrative and information writing, participants will be invited into the world of learning to write. Strategies and exercises to stimulate interest and action for writers will be given, alongside challenges and advanced crafting lessons for more fluent writers in 6-9 and 9-12 classrooms. We will examine elements of structuring, elaboration, character and place, revision, and author techniques. Note taking and writing for research will be included in an information writing session.

Day 2: Sunday 14th September
Come prepared to share your collective wisdom while we align NZC History curriculum to what we do in our classrooms to ensure that everything is covered. By September we will also have a better idea of where the conventional system is headed with the new-look maths coming out. We will spend time unpacking the the WHY we do what we do.

This is an opportunity for you to discuss, share ideas and gain ideas for ways forward.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
'WOMB WOMEN' Workshop for Women, IMAGINE...100 THOUSAND GRANDMOTHERS SPANNING BACK THROUGH 2.5 MILLION YEARS OF HUMANITY. ONE WOMAN GIVING BIRTH TO THE NEXT, ON AND ON THROUGH TIME, UNTIL HERE AND NOW.

This is AN INVITATION TO COME PLAY, to create with your own hands little Womb Women in honour of your own matriarchal lineage … with hands that have been created from the DNA of all your ancestors before you.
As I sit and sculpt each woman, I become deeply aware that the bone and flesh of my own hands hold the DNA of all my grandmothers. How many of them had their own stories of shaping clay, forming sculptural figures, moulding pots .. what was it my grandmother of 200 thousand years ago created I wonder. 
Through the evolution of humanity, the hands of approximately 100 thousand womb to womb women of my unique bloodline have given birth to my own. Our shared DNA forms these hands which are now shaping clay.
Each one of us has our own special womb to womb lineage, with a unique tone particular only to us, perhaps similar to another, however no one female whakapapa is truly the same.  
Perhaps you will have a particular mother or grandmother in mind as you create, imbuing their passed down wisdom into the clay figurine, perhaps the little woman you make will symbolize your entire line, calling up the flavour of your own unique lineage, or perhaps she is you and represents your own story … or maybe she will hold for you the wisdom of the ancient mother that resides within us all. 
DO COME JOIN US for an afternoon of making your own little womb women.
NO EXPERIENCE NEEDED, simply bring a curiosity and willingness to play, surrounded by other humans doing just the same.
PRACTACALITIES,
bring a cushion and blanket (you may prefer to sit comfortably on the floor as you make - there will also be tables and chairs available)
if you are already familiar with clay and have your own favorite hand tools please feel free to bring these
snacks and hot/cold beverages will be available
Workshop cost includes supplies, materials and firing. I will fire your creation then post it back to you, therefore postage will be extra and determined once packaged up.
PLEASE NOTE!!! This booking is for FRIDAY 5TH SEPTEMBER
                                              ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
“Within the DNA is written not only our histories as individuals but the whole history of the human race … patterns of DNA that have come down to us virtually unchanged from our distant ancestors – ancestors who are no longer just an abstract entity but real people who lived in conditions very different from those we enjoy today, who survived them and brought up their children.” ~ Bryan Sykes (The Seven Daughters of Eve)
Return to MAIN EXHIBITION WEBSITE - link coming soon

description:

In 2025, thanks to our generous funder Mercury, the course is FREE to Manawatu students aged 14 to 18.

The In-House Vocal Coach and Bookings Agent at BigMouth Voices, excels in Demo Reel Production, Audition Management, and provides comprehensive Accent and Voice Coaching for the agency's talents. Tessa is the newest tutor addition to 'The Voice Academy', and prior to this she has developed online courses focused on Vocal Stamina, Projection and Health. With a rich professional background spanning roles as a speech pathologist, vocal coach, voice-over artist, actress, podcaster, and content creator, Tessa brings a wealth of expertise to her multifaceted career. She is the creator of ‘The Good Talkers Podcast’, an entertaining and educational podcast dedicated to the lives of voice over artists. Her commitment to excellence underscores her reputation as a dynamic professional in the realm of voice and performance arts.

Learn how to use your voice to its full potential and spend the afternoon in the recording studio recording a piece for a show reel. Fun character voices, accents and using your voice to its fullest with confidence!

description:
Advanced Claw Setting in Two Days, This two-day class will run on two Sundays, 24 and 31 August, 10am - 1pm. It is designed for advanced students and focuses on teaching a range of claw setting techniques, along with straightforward construction methods to securely hold gemstones of various shapes and sizes. The emphasis is on mastering the techniques rather than creating polished, finished jewellery pieces.
Students are encouraged to bring along their own particular tools, metal and stones if they would like to. They can also bring their own half made ring shanks or other projects to set into.
They will start by creating claw settings for flat-bottomed stones on plate to gain an understanding of how claws work.
Students will then move on to faceted stones and be shown how to construct their own settings in a number of styles, and how to secure their stones in settings. Finally, they will be taught the dos and don’ts of finishing settings to a salable level.
The workshop will also look at how to use pre-made claw settings to best advantage.
Workshop fee $245, Early bird $221 till 27 July.
