description:
Ruamahanga Farm learning day, At this Toru Trail, we look forward to a day of planting, learning and creativity at Ruamāhanga Farm. Just outside Martinborough, Ruamahanga Farm Foundation are bringing the local community together to help restore wetlands and provide greater access to the awa. The restoration is a foundation for Te Reo o te Wai, an arts and conservation programme for local primary schools.


Our hosts Jane Riddiford and Rod Sugden will share the story of the land and the conversion of a traditional stock and crop farm into a regenerative, community oriented venture. They will involve us in some of the experiential ways they are helping children and young people connect to hidden places along the Ruamāhanga. The day will include planting trees and grasses along a new wetland walk combined with nature based story telling, art and creative writing. We will have a shared lunch by the awa or under canvas if it is wet.
label: Conservation & Environment

description:
Reimagining Construction: Participatory, Circular, and Open by Design, This presentation examines how the principles of participatory, circular, and open design can transform construction by bringing human and ecological values into the heart of how we build.
Drawing from both ancient timber framing traditions and modern innovations, it demonstrates how modularity and standardisation unlock flexibility, efficiency, and customisation while supporting sustainable, locally-rooted solutions.
A key focus is placed on design for disassembly and reassembly, enabling buildings and their components to be reused and adapted over time—reducing waste, lowering environmental impact, and fostering resilience for current and future communities.
label: Conservation & Environment

description:
Beth Britten - with Eilish Wilson and Michael Howell, Bassist and vocalist Beth Britten brings a collection of original improvised music, together with saxophonist Eilish Wilson and guitarist Michael Howell. With the intention to enjoy the moments and interactions that music presents us with, this project is a playful exploration of small compositions through the musical conversation of the trio.

Beth Britten presented this music at her gig 'Not What I Planned' with a quartet in Tāmaki Makaurau earlier this year. She is excited to be bringing this explorative music to Pōneke in a trio format for the Wellington Jazz Festival.

Doors: 6:45pm
Gig starts: 7pm

description:
Te Āhua o te Haenga | Pollination in Motion, Step into the colourful, buzzing world of pollination! Join the Wellington Gardens Education Team for a day of hands-on fun exploring how plants and pollinators work together to keep nature thriving.

Meet the Beekeepers – Learn how bees keep the hive running, why they’re super pollinators, and try on real beekeeper gear
Sensory Pollination Play Station – Transfer “pollen” between flowers in a fun sensory tray
Outdoor Pollinator Bingo Trail – Explore the gardens to spot different pollinators
Wind Pollination Station – Make mini fans and paper “pollen” to see how the wind carries pollen from one plant to another

Bring the whānau, follow the buzz, and leave with a new appreciation for the small creatures (and breezes!) that make big things happen.

description:
Te Aro Zero Waste Just Sew Repair Cafe, Repairing rather than buying is a great way to take climate action in your own life - and learn new skills along the way!
Book through our website and bring along 1-2 clothing or lightweight items for repair to our September Just Sew!
Our skilled volunteers will be here to assist you with repairs such as missing buttons, tears, holes and hemming. We will supply a selection of patches and buttons, but you are also welcome to bring your own if you have something specific in mind.

description:
The Power of Community - Dr Amanda Cahill, "What does it take for communities to lead the renewable energy transition - not just be consulted?"
If one person is positioned well to respond to that question, it is Dr Amanda Cahill.
Goodlife Collective, Sustainability Trust and WEAll Aotearoa are proud to be co-hosting Dr Amanda Cahill, founder of The Next Economy
Don't miss this opportunity to hear Amanda's insights from her work in Australia, which demonstrate how acting on climate change can help catalyse fairer, more regenerative wellbeing economies.
Amanda has worked at the intersection of government, local councils, big companies and communities for 30 years, to support communities to transition to a thriving future.
Amanda is the Founder of The Next Economy, where she supports regional communities across Australia to manage the impacts of decarbonisation and climate change in a way that builds more equitable and regenerative economies. Most of this work has been in coal and industrial regions, where she has brought together government, industry, workers and community groups to co-design transition strategies despite deep-seated tensions. Her work draws on 30 years’ experience working with changemakers across the world to address economic and health inequalities, environmental degradation, women’s rights and climate justice.
Event Programme:
5:15pm - doors open, drinks & nibbles
5:45pm - Welcome & Introduction
6:00-6:30pm - Talk from Dr Amanda Cahill
6:40 - Dialogues & Q&A
7:00(ish!): Networking

About Sustainability Trust: Sustainability Trust are your local experts in sustainability, healthy homes, ethical electricity and supporting our local communities.
About WEAll Aotearoa: WEAll Aotearoa is a non-partisan and independent ‘think and do’ tank working to redesign Aotearoa New Zealand’s economy around the wellbeing of our people and te taiao. WEAll use an evidence-informed approach and focus upstream to develop practical, long-term solutions for the public good.

About Goodlife Collective: Goodlife Collective designs and delivers events and experiences to build connection between people, nature and valuable ideas, in service of unlocking our collective potential.
About Dr Amanda Cahill
Amanda is the Founder of The Next Economy, where she supports regional communities across Australia to manage the impacts of decarbonisation and climate change in a way that builds more equitable and regenerative economies. Most of this work has been in coal and industrial regions, where she has brought together government, industry, workers and community groups to co-design transition strategies despite deep-seated tensions. Her work draws on 30 years’ experience working with changemakers across the world to address economic and health inequalities, environmental degradation, women’s rights and climate justice.
Amanda is a Churchill Fellow and has a PhD from ANU in human geography. She is also a Research Fellow at the University of Melbourne, an Industry Fellow at the University of Sydney and a co-editor of the recently published book: Regional Energy Transitions in Australia: From impossible to possible.
About The Next Economy
Next Economy works with government, industry, investment and community to create the conditions for a rapid, responsible and fair transition to a climate-safe, regenerative and socially just Australian economy.
label: Conservation & Environment

description:
BEN WILCOCK AND THE JELLY ROLLS, Ben Wilcock and The Jelly Rolls have been a mainstay on the Aotearoa jazz scene for the last 15 years. Their two studio albums are a collection of piano trio jazz, with the pervasive pianistic influences of Erroll Garner, Fats Waller, Oscar Peterson and Ahmad Jamal.
They have toured New Zealand extensively and performed internationally, including a sold-out performance at The Edinburgh Jazz Festival in 2019. Along with unique interpretations of jazz piano standards, the trio's repertoire includes original material from Wilcock's recently released album The River Tethys, as well as the solo piano album Goodnight T.V.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Father's Day Lunch, Saturday 6th and Sunday 7th September 2025. Celebrate this Father’s Day in the heart of the Wairarapa, surrounded by the breathtaking views of Wharekauhau Country Estate and Palliser Bay. Treat the father figure in your life to a memorable afternoon with a luxurious lunch at our renowned restaurant, where rustic charm meets world-class cuisine.

Our specially crafted Father’s Day menu highlights the finest seasonal produce, expertly prepared by our talented chefs. Enjoy a variety of mouthwatering dishes, from tender cuts of locally sourced meats to fresh, flavorful sides that will make every bite a celebration. Paired with a selection of New Zealand’s best wines, it's the perfect way to honor ‘Dad’ while taking in the stunning landscapes of rolling hills and expansive coastlines.

Relax in the elegant yet cozy atmosphere of our dining room, where impeccable service and a warm, welcoming environment make this a day to remember. Whether it's your first time or you're a returning guest, Wharekauhau offers an experience that combines exceptional food, unparalleled views, and a relaxed, family-friendly ambiance—everything needed to make this Father’s Day extra special.

Reserve your place today and give Dad the gift of a memorable experience he’ll treasure long after the day is over. Available on both Saturday and Sunday

NZ Professional To Paid Consultant In 30 Days, Wellington Professionals! Thinking about packaging your expertise into coaching/consulting programs in 2025? This free event is for you…
It’s called: “NZ Professional To Paid Consultant In 30 Days” it’s on Thursday the 18th of September at The InterContinental Hotel, Wellington Central, from 6.30pm-8.15pm.
There are only 10 FREE SEATS on the night - so secure your spot now before the event fills up.
Here’s what you’ll learn on the day:
MODEL: The 3-pillar framework to package your expertise into a scalable consulting program that’s easy to deliver and gets clients rapid results.
MARKETING: The social media marketing system to attract new clients every 30 days (from scratch).

description:
WECG ANNUAL GENERAL MEETING 2025, ANNUAL GENERAL MEETING
Tena Tatou Katoa, Greetings Everyone
A WARM INVITATION TO ALL TO ATTEND THE 2025 AGM OF THE WAIKANAE ESTUARY CARE GROUP INC
Venue: The Otaihanga Boating Club, Makora Rd,
Otaihanga
Date & time: Wednesday 3rd September at 7pm
Speaker Mike Joy - see Bio below

Mike is a Senior Research Fellow and Lecturer in Environmental Science at the School of Geography, Environment and Earth Sciences, Mike’s research includes ecological modelling, freshwater bioassessment, environmental policy, biophysical limits to growth and the role of energy in society. He is publicly outspoken about the decline in freshwater quality and ecosystems, especially the impact of nutrient pollution from intensive dairying on New Zealand's "100% Pure", clean, green image.
Mike is an outspoken advocate for environmental protection in New Zealand and for this has received several awards including an Ecology in Action award from the NZ Ecological Society, the Charles Fleming Award for environmental achievement in 2013 and in 2023 the Callaghan Medal for science communication from the Royal Society of New Zealand. In 2015 he was awarded the Morgan Foundation inaugural River Voice Award and in 2017 the inaugural NZ Universities Critic and Conscience award. His book 'The Fight for Freshwater' is a memoir that provides a rare first hand look at those whose voices question the health and future of our waterways.
The Meeting will conclude with supper and korero
label: Conservation & Environment

description:
Te Hononga hikoi: Taupō Swamp, Te Hononga hikoi: Taupō Swamp
Te Hononga hīkoi enable our members to connect with others in the Wellington Catchments Collective. It's pretty inspiring seeing the activities happening in other catchment groups.

The next Te Hononga hikoi will be at Taupo Swamp in Porirua on the morning of Sunday 21 September at 10am – 11.30pm approx.

Come for a spring stroll and bring friends and family. Bring water and own snacks or fuel up at nearby cafes in Plimmerton.

We will meet in Ulric Street by the pedestrian bridge entrance to the dog park (plenty of parking)

Friends of Taupo Swamp & Catchment Inc was formed in 2018 by a group of Porirua residents. Restoration activities have been focused on the part of the wetlands that is owned by Porirua City Council.

Back in 2018 there was a lot of blackberry on the site. Now, some of the 2019-20 locally sourced plantings by volunteers are 5 metres high. By the end of the current planting season FOTSC will have put in 18K plants. An adjacent planting programme around the Plimmerton Domain coordinated by the local Rotary Club and the Porirua City Council has resulted in 22k trees and plants.

Please register your interest/intention to attend by flicking a short email to . In the event of bad weather we will advise cancellation by 8am and rescheduling for a week later.
label: Conservation & Environment

description:
Wellington Timebank Spring Clothes Swap!, All welcome!
Wellington Timebank will be hosting a fun social event for Spring - a clothes swap! Come along to meet and hang out with other Timebank members, and take this opportunity to sustainably refresh and/or clear out your wardrobe for Spring!
Sunday 19 October
10am-1.30pm
Te Aro Zero Waste Centre
2 Forresters Lane, Te Aro
--
How it works:
10am-11am:
Drop off your clothes/accessories etc to swap (washed and in good condition please!).
We welcome clothes and accessories from/for everyone - including kids clothes and pet clothes (?)!
~ Have a hot drink while our team sort out the clothes
~
11.30am-1.30pm:
Swap is open! Go and get yourself a whole new wardrobe!
--
Timebankers receive 1 time credit for bringing clothes, or spend 1 time credit to pick up some new (to you) clothes (if you do both, it's free!).
Non-timebankers can attend for koha, so please feel free to bring your friends and whānau. And encourage them to join the Timebank
All clothing remaining after the swap will be donated to charity op-shops - Aunty Dana's and Opportunity for Animals.
If you would like to do some baking or volunteer (we need some clothes sorters!) for this event, your support would be very much appreciated! Please send me a message/email me on info@wellingtontimebank.org.nz.
label: Conservation & Environment

Get ready for a legendary night of music and fun at the Cossie!

Uncle Monkey, the iconic band that has become a Wellington institution, is here to rock your world. They recently celebrated an incredible 25 years together. That's a true testament to their popularity and their lasting impact on the music industry.
Over the years, they've graced numerous festivals, corporate events, and stages, delivering a party atmosphere with their signature brand of popular covers wherever they go.
Join us for a night of nostalgia, great tunes, and unforgettable memories as we celebrate 25 years of Uncle Monkey's incredible journey in the world of music!

description:
Winter Planting at Paekawakawa Reserve, It's our favourite time of year - tree planting!
We have planted thousands of trees in Island Bay's loveliest little nature reserve since 2013, but there's more work to do. We have around 500 plants that need help to settle into the forest in the next couple of months.
Come to one planting bee, or come to all - we love helping hands.
If planting it not your thing, come for some weeding, or just to give encouragement to the planters and the cup of tea afterward.
Bring:
Decent shoes, there is often planting on the slope
Gardening gloves
Water
A friend
label: Conservation & Environment

description:
🛠️🌿 Hands-On Conservation: Trap-Making with NAWIC🌿🛠️, Join us on Thursday 9th October, from 5:00pm – 7:30pm at MenzShed Hataitai for a hands-on evening of teamwork in the spirit of conservation. Let's protect our local native wildlife by building pest traps to donate to Predator Free Wellington in support of their mission.
With materials and ready-to-assemble kitsets kindly sponsored by Aoraki Construction, we’ll roll up our sleeves and assemble traps at MenzShed Hataitai - all tools and materials provided. No experience required.
After the mahi, we’ll come together to share fish 'n' chips and fizzy drinks on the bowling green, kindly provided by NAWIC. It’s a chance to connect, give back, and make a tangible impact on our environment.
label: Conservation & Environment

description:
Māori Sidesteps – Māori Made Mischief, Contemporary showband The Māori Sidesteps are serving crooning and comedic goodness. With soulful harmonies, satirical skits, and superb song parodies, these fullas have won rave reviews, alongside their hit webseries and TV show – and now you can catch them live on stage at Circa Theatre!

The Sidesteps flip comedic nostalgia on its head and weave stunning harmonies with theatrical play, skewering social idioms and shining a cheeky light on what it means to be Māori in 2025.

Celebrating connection and the richness of our differences, The Māori Sidesteps bring pride in identity, the strength of mana motuhake, and the reminder that joy is the best antidote to division. From government blunders to policies ripe for the picking, these top-notch entertainers take aim at the kaupapa of the moment. Expect fearless satire, wickedly subversive humour, and a refreshing dose of truth-telling disguised as hilarity.

If you’ve ever wished someone would sing what you’ve been thinking about the current political climate, The Māori Sidesteps are here to deliver Māori made mischief through waiata that wink!

Reviews:
“Never did satire and self-deprecation go hand in hand and so cleverly and entertainingly” Alan Scott – Theatreview
“A night of whakawhanaungatanga – aroha, not (too much) hōhā.” Flat City Field Notes
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
NZ Mountain Film Festival 2025 - Pure NZ Night, A collection of New Zealand-made mountain films - brought to you by the Vic Uni Tramping Club, Wellington Tramping and Mountaineering Club, and of course the New Zealand Mountain Film and Book Festival!


Pedals To Powder (28 mins) Nick Kowalski, NZ. Two women cycle to every ski field in Aotearoa
in one wild season, braving storms and exhaustion—uncovering a hidden world of independent
ski culture along the way.
All in or Nothing (24 mins) Gordon Duff, NZ. Up against 120 riders with full support crews, a
young athlete only has himself to rely on. Follow his gruelling six days as he attempts to win the
overall title at the NZ MTB Rally. BEST DOCUMENTARY
Riverbound - The Storybook Has Just Begun (13 mins) Dylan Gerschwitz & Deane Parker,
NZ, World Premiere. Yak, a former pro kayaker now paraplegic, takes on Class 3 rapids in the
Upper Buller Gorge. Can packrafting restore his freedom—and redefine who gets to run wild
rivers? FESTIVAL SPIRIT AWARD
As One - The MHS Adventure Racing Team (15 mins) Louie Burger, NZ, World Premiere.
This uplifting documentary follows nine Motueka High students on a wild, 40-hour adventure
racing from the West Coast home—raising funds for World Vision with grit, laughs, and heart.
Spirit of the West (12 mins) Pedro Pimentel, NZ, World Premiere. Set against New Zealand’s
wild West Coast, this film captures the spirit of the Old Ghost Ultra—where community, resilience,
and grit collide in a transformative celebration of people and place. COMMUNITY SPIRIT
AWARD
Rakiura Solo (13 mins) Michael Beckmann, NZ. A tough solo hike around the 130km North West
Circuit on Stewart Island/Rakiura. Beyond the challenge, what makes this island truly special is
its rich wildlife. An ambient film without dialogue.
Waiatoto (20 mins) Josh Morgan & Jasper Gibson, NZ. This film tells the story of a traverse
across the Southern Alps through packraft, skis and tramping. Starting at the Matukituki, the route
went via Tititea, the Volta Glacier, and the Waiatoto, to the Tasman Sea. BEST NZ MADE FILM


Total running time: 125 minutes + 15 minute intermission.

description:
Cliff Richard - Can't Stop Me Now, Cliff Richard - Can't Stop Me Now
British music icon Sir Cliff Richard announced his highly anticipated live tour for New Zealand 2025. These shows offer a rare chance to witness one of Britain’s most celebrated performers in a live setting.

Next year will mark 12 years since New Zealand audiences have seen Cliff Richard live in concert and the 2025 tour will begin in Auckland and make its way to Wellington & Christchurch. Fans will be treated to a setlist packed with timeless classics, including hits such as "Living Doll," "We Don’t Talk Anymore," "Devil Woman," and many more. Known for his energy, charisma, and enduring stage presence, Sir Cliff continues to capture hearts and inspire audiences as he has done across the eight decades.

As one of the greatest hitmakers in British music history, Cliff Richard has sold in excess of 250 million records worldwide, securing his place among the best-selling artists of all time. He remains the only artist to achieve UK Top 5 albums across eight consecutive decades, a remarkable feat recognised by the Official Charts Company. Since his debut in 1958 with “Move It!”, Sir Cliff has delivered a string of chart-topping hits, including 14 number-one singles and seven No. 1 albums, cementing his legacy as a pop legend.

These 2025 performances offer fans a rare opportunity to see one of music’s all-time greats in concert at the age of 85.

This film chronicles Jacinda Adern's tenure as Prime Minister and provides an insight into both the political and personal challenges Jacinda faced during those six years. The inclusion of considerable footage from Jacinda's partner Clarke Gayford provides a deeply personal view of life as the Prime Minister in very challenging times.
(Los Angeles Times review) 'Prime Minister' is not interested in wrangling, dealing and lawmaking, or even the nuts and bolts or her progressive views. .. But in the fleet, pacey manner of the editing, toggling between private and public moments with highlight-reel efficiency, the film is a stirring glimpse of top-down kindness as a winning leadership style.

description:
Victorian Photography Workshop with Brian Scadden, Victorian Photography Workshop with Brian Scadden
DATE: Sunday Sept 28
TIME: 9:30am-1:30pm
LOCATION: Cobblestones Museum, Greytown
AGES: Over 18
COST: $135 per person. Max 5 people.
Come and have a go at wet-plate collodion photography, using authentic materials to produce your own heirloom image as were made 170 years ago. This almost lost art produces one-of-a-kind images on tin or glass plates, which you create and have an image you’ve crafted to take away.

Brian Scadden will be your instructor for this workshop. Brain has been passionate about photography for over 40 years, beginning his career at the National Film Unit in the 1970s before joining Park Road Post Production as Head of Laboratory, Head of Picture, and Restoration Manager. His work in film sparked an interest in early photographic techniques, prompting him to master wet-plate collodion photography. In 2006, he was invited to assist leading wet-plate experts in the USA and has since taught many New Zealanders this challenging process. Jane, who attended Brian’s workshop in 2014, later married him in 2019 and completed a photographic project in Carterton in 2016.
Although Brian retired in 2015, he returned for short-term assignments at Park Road Post and part-time work at Archive NZ, supporting film archiving until mid-2023. Both Brian and Jane continue to shoot with 35mm and 120mm film using vintage cameras from their collection.

NOTE: Link for booking tickets coming soon.

Email:
www.greytownarttown.com

description:
Empathic Boundaries: Saying No Without Guilt, Empathic Boundaries: Saying No Without Guilt

If you hear rejection when someone says "no" to you, or if you struggle to say "no" even when you want to - this workshop is for you.

Plus there is an amazing plant-based dinner & dessert included in your ticket! Stay back to continue the connects over a nourishing meal.

In this workshop based on Nonviolent Communication (NVC) you will discover how to listen to feelings and needs that sit behind the "no" and how to connect to what truly matters to yourself and others. You will get to know some foundational tools of NVC, and practice on examples from real life. This session is interactive, and you will walk away with some understanding of NVC processes and materials to practice in your own time.

You will discover:

What stops you from saying "no" when you really want to

How to connect to what matters (to you and others) and find the needs behind the "no"

How to listen for needs, rather than look for conflict

Meet Helen & Anna, your hosts
Anna Banaś and Helen Williams are passionate, down-to-earth facilitators who bring warmth, depth, and a wealth of experience to their work in Nonviolent Communication (NVC). Anna is undertaking certification as an NVC trainer, a sociolinguist, and skilled group facilitator who has spent nearly 20 years supporting families, organisations, and communities to communicate with more clarity and compassion. Helen brings a rich blend of experience as a mindfulness teacher, mediator, coach, and yoga practitioner. Together, Anna and Helen create a safe, engaging, and supportive space where learning feels both empowering and nourishing. Whether you’re completely new to NVC or looking to deepen your practice, you’ll be in very good hands.

description:
Weeding Bee 18th October, Weeding Bee 18th October
Kia Ora Koutou

Now we have finished planting we are turning our attention to the all important W**d releasing.
This is essential to keeping the seedlings we have planted this winter from being overwhelmed by grass and weeds.
Also mulching to help with moisture retention over those hot summer days (hopefully we get a summer!)
Meeting at the Nursery on Hana Udy street at 9am
Gloves, tools and sunscreen provided along with a morning tea and an update on the Reserve afterward.
Hope to see you there !



Health & Safety Notice: When working in the Reserve, please ensure your clothing and footwear are appropriate for expected weather conditions (cold, wet or hot) and the terrain (such as holes, hidden objects, blackberry, overhead branches). Trip hazards and slippery tracks are a possibility. Stay clear of waterways. Be cautious if you have allergies and carry the necessary medication. Enjoy your time in the Reserve and please avoid blocking pathways used by other users. Report any accidents, injuries or possible hazards to the H&S Coordinator (021 071 536)

Come to one planting bee, or come to all - we love helping hands.
If planting it not your thing, come for some weeding, or just to give encouragement to the planters and the cup of tea afterward.
Bring:
Decent shoes, there is often planting on the slope
Gardening gloves
Water
A friend

description:
123 of Painting, In this introduction to painting, tutor Melissa McDougall, will start the class on a journey through the basic elements of painting in acrylic and oil paint. This class is structured for students new to painting as well as returning students from prior 123 of Painting classes or the like.

The class is structured around a series of exercises that explore the foundations of still-life and portrait painting. New students will be informally assessed in order to create a programme that best meets their needs.

With an emphasis on simple beginnings, the lessons will include colour theory, skin tones, structure and composition.

Teaching is done by analysing and copying master paintings in order to improve observational skills while learning the components of structure and composition.

Class is suitable for all levels of experience; we start from where you are. Melissa focuses on a personalised approach for the student with an emphasis on finding that person’s passion in art.

All basic materials provided.

Monday evenings, 13 Oct - 8 Dec (no class on Labour Day, 27 Oct), 6:30-8:30 pm.

description:
Octavia - A VATS Production!, COME TO OUR CLOSING NIGHT FOR A DIRECTOR Q&A!

Welcome back to another night of ancient theatre with the one and only Victoria Ancient Theatre Society! VATS is a student-led club at Victoria University of Wellington that puts on an ancient play annually, celebrating the fusion of Classical Studies and Theatre, to learn from, and to experience in full. This years' experience comes in the form of the Roman tragedy Octavia—the only extant Roman play set in the eternal city of Rome.

Often attributed to Seneca, but likely in truth penned by an unknown playwright we know as Pseudo-Seneca under the Flavian dynasty, Octavia is a hard tragedy depicting the divorce and hardships of the titular Octavia—the first wife of Emperor Nero.

Follow our tragic heroine as she bears the weight of her Julio-Claudian family name and all the expectations that are thrust upon her with it. Bear witness the cruelty of Emperor Nero and his crimes driven by an unbridled and unabated passion. Experience the illustriousness of a grand imperial wedding and follow it with the bloodied remains left by the ruthlessness of Roman politics. Shall Octavia survive this brutal game? Come find out, for you are cordially invited...

description:
Wet-plate Photography Tintype Introduction Workshop, *Note, completion needs to be at 1pm
Create a wet-plate photograph with Brian and Jane from Brass and Glass Photographic Alchemy. You will see the magic of silver and light combining to create an authentic, 19th century tintype.

Beginning with a short presentation into the process, you will then have the opportunity to hand-craft your own portrait tintype to take home with you. With care, your priceless heirloom photograph will last for decades without fading or changing colour.

This almost-lost-art produces a one-of-a-kind image, using authentic materials and a bellows camera. Be prepared to experience the need to sit still for up to several seconds, it's not as easy as you may think!

Bookings essential, with a maximum of 5 people for this workshop.

Private, one day workshops in Carterton are available on request.

description:
Family event: Explore Omnibirding with Giselle Clarkson, We are thrilled and delighted to announce we are going to be hosting a fabulous school holiday event with the multi-award winning Giselle Clarkson to celebrate the release of her latest book Omnibird: An Avian Investigator’s Handbook, a guide to the art and science of omnibirding.
Giselle Clarkson, the author of The Observologist, will be in Tawa for this very special event to explore the inner workings of the book and delights and wonders of the avian world.
Some birds are so commonplace it’s easy to forget how extraordinary they are. These creatures have a secret eyelid, hollow bones and a two-part brain. They dress in feathers. Omnibird, explores what’s remarkable about the birds all around us and the clues we can all use to become avian investigators.
Giselle is an author, illustrator and cartoonist based in Greytown, known for her work on conservation and environmental topics. She has illustrated award-winning picture books and nonfiction and is a 2023 Arts Foundation Laureate, receiving the prestigious Mallinson Rendel Illustrators Award.
This promises to be an unmissable event for bird and nature lovers of any age.
Books for sale thanks to the Children's Bookshop.
We wish to extend our thanks to Gecko Press for helping make this event happen.
This is a free event.
We expect this event to be very popular so to secure your seat early arrival is suggested.

Drinks: FIRST DRINK IS INCLUDED IN THE TICKET PRICE

Food: A delicious menu will be available to purchase throughout the event.

What is Paintvine?
It’s a fun social painting class where our artists will run you through step-by-step instructions on how to create your very own masterpiece in a fun and relaxed bar setting. Perfect for dates, catching up with mates or for meeting new friends!

We provide all the materials you need (high-quality canvas, acrylic paint, brushes). All you need to bring is your creative spirit (or find some at the bottom of a glass). At the end of the night you will leave with your own painting ready to hang up on your wall.

description:
Intro to 2D Traditional Animation - Creative Arts Holiday Programme, This is a beginners course in 2D animation where tweens & teens will learn the time-honoured principles of hand-drawn animation and how to apply them to your own animation project. You may work on a project incorporating your own ideas, or if you'd rather, an assigned a project from your tutor.

You can use any device, ipad or laptop you already own (except a mobile – it's really not big enough to do good animation on). The school does not provide any digital equipment.

Your tutor, Ross Payne, is a 30 year veteran of traditional 2D animation, and loves to share his knowledge about it for you to love it as much as he does.

In each lesson there will be examples and demonstrations of the animation principles with follow up exercises to put your new skills into practice. You'll work on your project both during class and at home, applying the animation principles to your individualised project.

You can choose to draw your animation on paper then scan/capture into your device, or choose to draw your animation digitally, directly into an animation programme. which ever you choose, instructions in class will be provided to give you the skills needed for this step.

Bring a water bottle and snack for morning tea.

This workshop is for ages 10 and above. Tuesday - Friday, 30 September - 3 October, 10 am - 1 pm daily.

This workshop is part of Inverlochy Art School's September School Holiday Programme. For more teen & tween workshops including photography, jewellery making, pottery and sewing head to the 'Tamariki and Teens' section of our website.

description:
New Zealand Vocational Education and Training Research Forum, Rebuilding together.
Ngā mihi nui ki a koutou katoa

Skills Group and BCITO are delighted to join forces to return NZVETRF as a unique national event to showcase and disseminate new and emerging research and innovation in Vocational Education and Training.
Since 2004, the NZVETRF has been the must-attend event for policy makers, researchers and practitioners engaged in vocational education, across all parts of the tertiary sector and industry.
The vocational education sector is transforming through both policy and technological change. Knowing 'what works' and what is emerging is more critical than ever as a new network of provision for vocational education and training is established.
Over a day and a half you'll hear from international and national keynote speakers, government and sector stakeholders, the learner voice, and debates on the hot topics, along with curated and competitively selected research and evidence presentations.

Places are limited - register now to secure your place at Aotearoa's pre-eminent cross-sector vocational education event.
Call for Abstracts Now Open
We now invite researchers, practitioners, and policy makers to submit abstracts for presentation at the Forum. As part of New Zealand's premier VET research platform, your contributions will help shape New Zealand’s future as our sector moves forward.
Submission Guidelines
Abstracts should be no longer than 300 words and outline your completed research and intended presentation. We particularly welcome submissions that address one or more of our key conference themes:
·       Workplace learning and Industry Training
·       Diversity, Access and Equity
·       Developing our Future Workforce
·       Technology and Innovation
·       Learner Journey and Outcomes
·       Collaboration and System Approaches.
Your research should demonstrate evidence-based outcomes, share good practice, support high-quality research networks, and inform policy development. We encourage submissions that honour Te Tiriti o Waitangi and incorporate Māori perspectives in VET innovation.
Submit your abstract here
Submission Deadline: 5pm, 17 September 2025
An assessment panel comprising representatives from Skills Group, BCITO, and an independent assessor will evaluate all submissions. Successful presenters will be notified by the end of September 2025.
Keynote Speaker Announcement
We are delighted to announce that Kathryn Rowan, Executive Director of Switzerland-based Global Apprenticeship Network will address the Forum.

Kathryn is a seasoned leader with a background in human resources and corporate social responsibility, who brings a wealth of experience from her previous role as Vice President of Human Resources, Zone Latin America, and Global Youth Lead at Nestlé. Throughout her career, Ms. Rowan has consistently demonstrated a passion for harnessing the power of business to drive positive change in society. During her tenure at Nestlé, in national, regional, and global roles, she promoted initiatives to strengthen leadership and capability building, diversity, and corporate reputation, while spearheading youth-focused efforts, including the Global Alliance for Youth.
The Global Apprenticeship Network was established in 2014 by ILO, the International Organisation of Employers (IOE), the Organisation of Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD), and Business at OECD. GAN is governed by a private-sector led, multi-stakeholder coalition representing major global corporations and international organisations, GAN's primary role is to encourage businesses to implement apprenticeship and WBL programs and support the creation of an enabling policy environment.
Further programme details and speaker announcements will be made in coming weeks, so register now!
Your Co-Hosts
Skills Group is New Zealand's largest Private Training Establishment, supporting 17,000 learners and training across 33 industries, through both work-based and provider-based learning, across 15 campuses nationwide.
BCITO is New Zealand's largest provider of Apprenticeships, having qualified 55,000 tradies and counting, across 15 construction and allied trades.

Skills and BCITO gratefully acknowledge Ako Aotearoa, the Centre for Tertiary Teaching Excellence, for support and permission to carry this event forward. We acknowledge Ako's enormous contribution to VET research and this event over many years. NZVETRF is a taonga, and as co-hosts we are committed to upholding the mana of the event.

Partner with us.
NZVETRF is all about walking the talk on sector collaboration. We warmly invite interest from interested education and industry partners to join on as event supporters. Sponsorship and event supporter packages are available. Contact nzvetrf@skills-group.org for details.

description:
Suffrage Day Walking Tour Bolton Street Cemetery, It's Suffrage Day on Friday 19 September, marking the day in 1893 when New Zealand became the first self-governing country in the world to grant women the right to vote in parliamentary elections.

To celebrate our pioneer women, and those who signed the Suffrage Petition in 1893, we're taking a walk through the cemetery, talking about the roles of settler women from 1840 onwards.

We'll meet at the Seddon Memorial at the top of the cemetery (by Anderson Park) in time to set off at 11.00am, and we'll finish at the Museum in Bolton Street about 12.30pm.

This tour is suitable for all ages, but full mobility is required. Cost $10 per person, children under 12 free, and good dogs on leads welcome.

description:
Intro to 2D Traditional Animation - Creative Arts Holiday Programme, This is a beginners course in 2D animation where tweens & teens will learn the time-honoured principles of hand-drawn animation and how to apply them to your own animation project. You may work on a project incorporating your own ideas, or if you'd rather, an assigned a project from your tutor.

You can use any device, ipad or laptop you already own (except a mobile – it's really not big enough to do good animation on). The school does not provide any digital equipment.

Your tutor, Ross Payne, is a 30 year veteran of traditional 2D animation, and loves to share his knowledge about it for you to love it as much as he does.

In each lesson there will be examples and demonstrations of the animation principles with follow up exercises to put your new skills into practice. You'll work on your project both during class and at home, applying the animation principles to your individualised project.

You can choose to draw your animation on paper then scan/capture into your device, or choose to draw your animation digitally, directly into an animation programme. which ever you choose, instructions in class will be provided to give you the skills needed for this step.

Bring a water bottle and snack for morning tea.

This workshop is for ages 10 and above. Tuesday - Friday, 30 September - 3 October, 10 am - 1 pm daily.

This workshop is part of Inverlochy Art School's September School Holiday Programme. For more teen & tween workshops including photography, jewellery making, pottery and sewing head to the 'Tamariki and Teens' section of our website.

description:
Jazz Orchestra Composer Series Presents Callum Allardice, The eleventh concert in our series of Aotearoa jazz composers features award winning composer and performer Callum Allardice, with a new suite of music for rhythm section and strings; Ode to Sadness.

A collection of songs, old and new, presented alongside some of the works that inspired them. From intimate improvisations and poignant melodies to soaring strings, the music moves through moments of reverence, reflection, and quiet triumph. Sometimes solemn, sometimes radiant, but always beautiful, Ode To Sadness is a celebration of the beauty found in sorrow.

Callum is an award-winning composer and guitarist based in New Zealand. He is a three-time recipient of the APRA Best Jazz Composition award for his works ‘Sons of Thunder’ (2016), ‘Deep Thought’ (2017), and ‘Chungin’ (2019). In 2020 he and his group The Jac, received the Recorded Music NZ Best Jazz Artist award for their album ‘A Gathering’, and in 2022 he was the inaugural Te Kōkī - New Zealand School of Music jazz composer-in-residence.

The Jazz Orchestra Composer Series showcases original music for large jazz ensemble by New Zealand composers. Concerts take place every 1st and 3rd Friday of the month, from May to October, from 7pm. Tickets are $15, door sales $20.

Thanks to Creative New Zealand for their generous support.

description:
Life Drawing Meets Yoga!, Connect with your body and your creativity in this all-levels workshop that combines vinyasa yoga practice with a fun and interactive Life Drawing class!

A unique experience where movement meets mark-making. We begin with yoga and flow into life drawing until the two become naturally intertwined.

The drawing process is fully guided and inspired by the philosophies and methods of British artist Cecil Collins, encouraging a non-academic, intuitive approach. Through playful interaction with asana, the connection between these two practices becomes beautifully apparent.

Drinks and nibbles follow, along with a chance for kōrero and connection.

Guided by JoElle Gragilla, owner of Island Bay’s South Coast Studio, and AWHI yoga teacher Lachlan Broughton.

Encouraging expression over perfection, this experience is open to all levels and accessible to both artists and non-artists alike.

Come curious. Leave inspired.

Investment
$75 (includes all drawing materials, yoga, mat hire, drinks & nibbles)

All supplies & props provided — wear comfortable clothing to move in!

description:
STEAMS School BLENHEIM Term 4 2025, What is STEAMS?
STEAMS is an integrated learning programme covering Science, Technology, Engineering, Arts, Maths, and Society. It focuses on real-world skills, critical thinking, collaboration, and creativity through hands-on, project-based learning—not play-based, but purposeful exploration without rigid time constraints.
Students are immersed in engaging, age-appropriate activities that encourage curiosity, innovation, and independent learning.
Key Benefits:
Students in STEAMS learn to:
Think creatively and critically
Collaborate and communicate effectively
Connect ideas across disciplines
Take ownership of their learning
Explore without pressure
Understand real-world applications
When & Where?
Weekly classes during school terms, based on age group and location:
Blenheim-Waterlea Racecourse
Class Times:
Little STEAMerS (Ages 5–6): TUES 11:30am–2:45pm
STEAMS Jr (Ages 7–9): TUES 9:00am–2:45pm
STEAMS Sr (Ages 10–13): THURS 9:00am–2:45pm
Cost
Trial (3 weeks): Pay via Humanitix (non-refundable)
Ongoing: $75/day (incl. GST)
Little STEAMerS: $30/day
Scholarships: 25% off for financial need (not available for Little STEAMerS)
School Absence?
Inform your child’s regular school—they’re attending STEAMS School. Most schools are supportive, and students should be marked as justified.

description:
Messengers, ‘Animals first entered the imagination as messengers and promises,’ John Berger.
Messengers explores the enduring gaze shared between humans and other animals. The exhibition title is inspired by a line from John Berger’s seminal 1977 essay ‘Why Look at Animals?’ Berger argued that the relationship between humans and animals – ‘our unspeaking companionship’ – has been transformed by capitalism.
Messengers brings together historical and contemporary ways of looking at animals in photography and art. It features archival photographs from the National Library and Alexander Turnbull Collections, first taken by newspaper photographers in the mid twentieth century. The images capture everything from the polar bears once housed in Wellington Zoo, to an elderly gentleman standing amongst the life size concrete animal sculptures in his garden. These images are at once tender and loving, sentimental and silly, kind and indifferent.
Messengers places these archival photographs in proximity and conversation with contemporary sculpture and moving image works by four Aotearoa-based artists: Denise Batchelor, Brit Bunkley, Jane Dodd and John Ward Knox. From eerie AI and computer-generated animals to the hypnotic stare of a real live Ruru; from carved wooden godwits you can hold in your hand to ‘hominoid’ brooches, each artist’s work speaks to the ‘unspeaking companionship’ between humanity and other animals.
IMAGE Brit Bunkley, still from Transit, single channel video, 2025
label: Arts & Theatre

🎨🛍️ Otaki Kids Market is back on Sunday, 5 October 2025 🎉 Rangatahi and tamariki get ready to showcase your creativity.
Let's celebrate the power of young minds and crafts! 🌟👦👧

The Otaki Kids Market is a vibrant and creative event that provides a unique platform for young entrepreneurs to showcase their talents and entrepreneurial spirit.

This special market invites tamariki and rangatahi from 5-19 years old to become stall holders, offering them the opportunity to sell their handmade art and crafts, delicious home baking, toys, and books.

#OtakiKidsCraftMarket #YoungArtistsUnite
www.otakiwomensclub.org/kidsmarket


Nau Mai Haere Mai, meet you at the Market. 🌞

Outdoor market located on State highway one in О̄taki, opposite New World. Come and say hi to our regular stall holders along with special guests from the community.
+ all our awesome regular stall holders!

description:
North Pole Express Kapiti 2025, North Pole Express Kapiti 2025
The North Pole Express is back in 2025!

SUBSCRIBER PRE-SALE 25 JUNE 2025
PUBLIC TICKET SALE FROM 1 SEPTEMBER 2025
Get your tickets or sign up for the “Nice List” at: ontrackevents.co.nz

Families love the magical train ride in one of the beautifully decorated carriages, you’ll meet Santa, sing, and celebrate this special time of year.

Set to the sounds of carols passengers are invited to join us to be whisked away on the North Pole Express and delight in the magic of Christmas as the train departs for a two hour long round-trip journey to see Santa!

COCOA CLASS – General Admission – $79 per passenger
CANDY CLASS – $91 per passenger

**Children under 2 and travelling on the knee of an adult are Free - please select "Under 2 years" at time of ticketing.

The Two Hour Round Trip includes: Entertainers, Carolling, Iced Cocoa & Cookies, Souvenir Mug, Santa Visit, Special Gift and Extra surprises on the way.

description:
Paint Time with Rapunzel, Paint Time with Rapunzel
Join Rapunzel for a magical painting session where young artists will create their own flower-filled canvas masterpiece!

About this Event

Paint Time with Rapunzel
Let your creativity blossom in this enchanting art workshop for kids aged 5 and up! 🎨🌸🌼 Join Rapunzel for a magical painting session where young artists will create their own flower-filled canvas masterpiece inspired by her colourful tower garden.
While your artwork dries, enjoy whimsical games with magical prizes and take some fairytale-worthy photos with the princess herself!
Includes:
🌼 Guided painting on canvas
🌷 Fun games and activities while paint dries
👑 Meet & greet photos with Rapunzel
🎨 Take-home flower artwork

Perfect for young artists, fairy tale lovers and anyone who dreams in pastel! 🌸🖌️✨

Please note that we are not registered childcare providers, which means an adult responsible for each child must remain on the premises. The venue is also a café restaurant with other areas where parents can chill while the workshop is running.

Nau mai, haere mai!

We are excited to be holding an Open Day this term for families interested in finding out more about our Playgroup and Preschool (caregivers interested in other areas welcome too!).

Wā Ora is the only Montessori school in New Zealand that caters for children from playgroup through to Year 13. Mark the date in your diary and pop in to see our Montessori playgroup, preschool and primary environment. Teachers and current parents will also be available to chat. description:

Book in Online https://NZpoihakenaportraits.as.me/porirua23
Sitting Fee ($100 for up to 5 people) includes
* Portrait Session time
* Kakahu & Taonga
* Styling & Moko stamps
* $50 Credit towards Packages
We provide everything whanau need to create portraits like ours.
During the session we will style whanau, apply moko stamps, photograph a variety of poses and arrangements depending on your requests and family cooperation.
After the portraits have been taken, whanau will change back into their clothing and then view the unedited photos and order their package.
For payment of packages we accept cash, eftpos, zippay & Afterpay through our eftpos machine using the Afterpay card on your phone.
You can view our most popular packages in the discussion

description:
CHEERS DAD!, Come along for an afternoon creative session of painting a piece of pottery for Dad - or with Dad, whilst sipping on your choice of brew.
This is your opportunity to get sorted for Father's Day (Father's Day NZ is Sun 7th September).
Book a ticket for yourself, your family and your dad, enjoy a creative session altogether, each turning a mug or tumbler into work of Picasso. No family dramas just a fun old time.
If Dad can't make it, make him a custom gift. Bring along your partner or your beer loving bestie!
You will be guided through the process of painting (let's get our facts straight its actually underglaze not paint!) your Mug/Tumbler. Dad will treasure his custom made piece or you could make matching family mugs!
This Pottery painting workshop is absolutely suitable for anyone...even the least creative people!
Ticket price includes:




Your own ceramic Mug/Tumbler ready for decorating


One Beverage (Beer or non alcoholic)


All the materials needed


Guidance from me to create a piece Dad will treasure forever


1 Kiln firing ~ this makes the piece strong, shiny and food and drink safe

description:
Women's Krav Maga Self Defence Intro Night, We believe every woman should feel strong, fearless and confident for life. Krav Maga has proven to be highly empowering for women all around the world. We offer this course to women to learn to deal with women-related challenges, encouraging every woman to overcome anxiety or fear, with confidence, skills and strength.
Krav Maga is a system that enables a smaller person to effectively disable a larger opponent. We will teach you how to utilise adrenalin and function under stress. It was created to be adaptable and easy to learn, regardless of your size. This makes Krav Maga perhaps the most suitable self-defence training for women today. Apart from the physical training, we will also train you to develop mental resilience, street tactics, confidence, positive self image, and empower you for life.
In an ideal world, women would not need to learn to protect themselves. However, until some deeply ingrained societal problems are resolved, it is smart and necessary to have some skills to be able to look after yourself and loved ones with. In the meantime, we encourage every women to approach this training with personal development, personal growth, enjoyment and empowerment being the motivating purpose.
We understand women often prefer to train in a women's class. This is our Women's (13+) class called ROAR.
These classes are about empowering you for life. Beginning in 2018, this program was created to provide a safe, holistic and supportive class where women can experience empowerment through our training. You will learn to find your voice, your confidence, your inner strength and resolve, while learning physical skills such as how to escape and overpower an assailant, counter grabs, abduction attempts, chokes, hair grabs, pushing and shoving, being hit, being pinned to the ground and sexual assault attempts. We will help you unleash your protective feminine fighting spirit
The Intro Night is the ideal time for women interested in the Women's Class to try a class first, see how we train, who we are, and gain some valuable basic skills, before deciding to join the full course. (Note: School Term 4, 2025 is 11 weeks long). No cost to attend the Intro Night.
Please email contact@tacticalsurvival.co.nz to enquire or book your spot.
More Info: www.tacticalsurvival.co.nz/womens
After Intro, classes run every Wednesday night 7:00pm - 8:00pm (Thistle Hall Cuba St)
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Tap for Healing Trauma & the Nervous system, Tuesday Wellbeing Seminars
Tap for Healing Trauma & the Nervous system
Our nervous system is shaped by more than just big life events — hidden wounds and micro-traumas from childhood can leave lasting imprints that show up as stress, anxiety, and repeating relationship patterns. When triggered, these unconscious “programs” hijack our reactions, leaving us feeling stuck even when we want to move forward. In this workshop, we’ll explore how trauma influences the nervous system and why awareness alone isn’t enough to create lasting change.
In this 75 minute workshop, you’ll discover how trauma impacts the nervous system and learn FasterEFT tools to release triggers, reframe old memories, and reset your stress response. You’ll walk away with simple, science-backed practices you can use every day to build resilience and emotional freedom.
“This is an interactive workshop where you’ll connect with others. It’s a powerful reminder that, beneath the surface, we generally share the same challenges and struggles—and that healing becomes easier when we explore them together.”
Meet your host, Krishnaloka
Introducing Krishnaloka, who is driven to help others overcome their issues within their mind and pyschology. As a mind technician trained in eutaptics (Faster EFT), she employs the fastest and most powerful method to create lasting change by addressing the root causes of issues rather than just the symptoms. Her warm and caring nature makes every interaction with her both comforting and transformative.


6.15pm Tuesday 7th of October
End the session on a high note with a delicious plant-based dinner, dessert, and good conversation.
Tickets available here~ bit.ly/eventTickets
Bhakti Lounge 1/175 Vivian Street, Te Aro, Wellington. http://www.bhaktilounge.org.nz
label: Health & Wellness

description:
Science Bites School Holidays science workshops, Get hands-on with some tasty, edible science these school holidays! Science Bites is an edible science workshop for tamariki aged 8-12 years old.
Learn about rainbow diffraction chocolate, make your own gummy worms, explore some glow-in-the-dark jelly, and more! All the projects in this workshop are safe to eat, meaning kids can taste their creations as they learn.
Tamariki will be excited to come home and share their new understanding of how science can be found in our everyday lives, even our kitchens!
Workshops include a complimentary planetarium show.
Tamariki can be dropped-off in the morning and picked-up afterwards; caregivers are not required to stay for the duration of the workshop. Tamariki should bring a packed lunch.
This workshop will involve handling and consuming some known allergens and substances your child may be sensitive to. Please refer to the Space Place website.
Best suited to ages 8-12 $65 per tamariki.
label: Family Friendly

Winter Planting at Paekawakawa Reserve, It's our favourite time of year - tree planting!
We have planted thousands of trees in Island Bay's loveliest little nature reserve since 2013, but there's more work to do. We have around 500 plants that need help to settle into the forest in the next couple of months.
Come to one planting bee, or come to all - we love helping hands.
If planting it not your thing, come for some weeding, or just to give encouragement to the planters and the cup of tea afterward.
Bring:
Decent shoes, there is often planting on the slope
Gardening gloves
Water
A friend

description:
An Evening with Dr Hinemoa Elder, Nau mai, haere mai! Join us for this very special event to meet Dr Hinemoa Elder and hear all about her latest book, Ara: A Māori guidebook of the mind, published by Penguin NZ.
Dr Hinemoa Elder will talk about chapters in Ara, and how she has delved into a unique exploration of how to think about thinking, rooted in the wisdom of Māori culture.
In Ara, Dr Hinemoa Elder introduces us to a profound journey guided by Hinengaro, Māori goddess of the mind, leading us through 23 specific rua, caves, into the unfamiliar depths of Papatūānuku, our earth mother, and back to the surface again.
Hinengaro offers us a dedicated path to gather insights, face challenges and help us navigate the complexities of our minds.
Hinemoa will be signing books.
label: Community & Culture

description:
Take A Kid Tramping - Maketawa Hut Overnight, Family tramping.
Take a Kid Tramping Trip for our kids with extra stamina and ability to carry an overnight pack, this one has a lot of climbing. We will head up the translator track from North Egmont, turn off and follow the ridge down to the hut. The next day we will return via the Makatawa track down through the bush and across a few streams.
All participants must be equipped for tramping in alpine conditions. Overnight tramping equipment required.
Children must be accompanied by a parent or caregiver approved by their guardian.
Shared transport costs apply, unless own transport is provided.
$10 per adult passenger, kids or own car free + hut fee.
Hut Tickets or annual pass required.
If interested, please register by Thursday 11 September:
Jo-anne Mowat | takt@nptc.org.nz

description:
The Pantoloons Present: Cinderella, The Pantoloons Present: Cinderella
Glass slippers, royal balls, and a Fairy Godmother who’s still on her learner’s licence, what could possibly go wrong?

Prince Percy is hopelessly charming (emphasis on hopeless), the Queen is busy approving new royal wave techniques (it’s very hard work being a Queen!), the step-sisters are causing chaos in couture, and Buttons has big dreams!

Will true friendship win over fairy-tale romance? Will Buttons dreams come true? And who is behind the kingdom’s mysterious gossip vlog? Packed with music, mischief, and magical mayhem, this is Cinderella with a twist, a tune, and a whole lot of sparkle! Step into a spellbinding world of wonder where dreams shimmer, magic floats on the breeze, and anything is possible… but only until the clock strikes twelve!

REVIEWS FOR RED RIDING HOOD

“You guys were amazing, thank you so much. Me and the kids had an amazing time. We can’t wait for the next holidays t come see you again.”

“My kids had a blast! My little man was in hysterics at Mr Moa.”

description:
Try Something New - Build, Paint, Play - School Holidays, School Holidays are a great if you have always wanted to get into the Warhammer hobby or if you are you looking to Try something new & want help with your next activity on your Warhammer journey.
It's also great if you want to improve your hobby skills.
Below you will find a few of the many Free hobby lessons we run at Warhammer Wellington
Introductory demonstrations: pick between a free introductory Stormcast or Space Marine model and then you can learn to build, paint and play a game with it.
Warhammer Build, Paint, Play Workshops are between 15min - 45mins
Learn to Build:
Learn how to build your miniatures & build your first model or a Free Miniature of the Month.
Learn to Paint:
Learn how to use Base, Shade, Layers, Contrast & Technical paints.
Learn to Play:
Learn more about the rules of your favorite game or try out a
new game.
All great ways to do the next step in your hobby journey while also getting your Battle Honours activities stamped off so remember to bring your activity book with you when you visit!
New to the Warhammer hobby & want to discover more about collecting, building, painting, playing Warhammer?
Drop in and have a chat with us about grabbing a Free Battle Honours booklet.
No need to book, just drop in or give us a call 04 471 098 to find out more

Location (indoor): Lyall Bay Junction: 53/70 Kingsford Smith Street, Lyall Bay, Wellington

Extra Info: Everyone loves freebies. Each day we've got some snacks and x10 seriously cute goodie bags* to give away to the first 10 customers. Think treats, something handy, something soothing etc
Big shout out to our suppliers! Keep an eye on socials for sneak peaks.
Not in Wellington? Don't worry, we've got something for everyone. All purchases made that weekend at the pop up or online will go in the draw to win their order back
this means you get your money or a credit with us back, you choose.
And all purchases $50 and over will get one of our dog keychains** for FREE.
Here's some more exciting information!
DAY ONE: Saturday
Oh Vienna founder Kat will be in Wellington to meet and greet you. She will be available from 10am to 12pm and able to give you the low down on why her engineer designed collars are the best on the market, advice on sizing and help to resize your collar on the spot.
BOTH DAYS: Saturday and Sunday
Abi and Em from the newly branded Your Canine Compass will be available 10am to 12pm to do muzzle fittings as well as give you information on their new training programmes. From puppy, teen, adolescent to adult - they've got you covered.
Specially sent down from Mr Soft Top, is an amazing box of goodies. This will be on top of our current range. Think the best NZ made apparel and blankets. Thanks Rachael and hopefully you can make it next time!
WE'D LOVE TO SEE YOU THERE! RAIN OR SHINE, BUT LET'S HOPE SOME SHINE

description:
Wellington Marine Life VR Experience, Dive beneath the surface and explore Wellington’s Blue Belt - no snorkel required!

Using virtual reality headsets, take a few minutes these school holidays to see the underwater world through the eyes of a scuba diver: swim through the deep reefs of Kapiti Island, be surrounded by schools of fish at Whitireia Park, glide through the lush marine forests of Taputeranga Marine Reserve, and explore a shipwreck! Expect close encounters with octopus, vibrant sea life and even a cute shark with the team from Explore Your Coast!

This free, drop-in event is suitable for the whole family and will be held in the Zealandia Visitor Centre Foyer. Regular admission fees to the sanctuary apply and overflow carparking is available at Birdwood Street during the busy school holiday period.

To learn more about our local underwater forests visit Explore Your Coast at https://exploreyourcoast.co.nz/

Whānau Day!, Whānau Day!

Get creative with hands-on activities like collage, painting, and drawing as we explore poses, emotions, and colour. You’ll get to make your own unique artwork to take home!

And don’t miss the FREE face painting (10am-12pm) – what or who could you become!?

Access information: The New Zealand Portrait Gallery is an accessible venue, all on one level. There is an accessible wharepaku (toilet) at the back of the venue. The gallery has automatic sliding doors and glass doors that can be pushed or pulled to enter. We have a wheelchair available for use within the gallery, and there is low stool seating throughout. You can find more accessibility information here. If you have any questions regarding accessibility or if there is something we could do to make your visit easier, please get in touch.

description:
Journey to Self through Art, Journey to Self through Art
You are invited to attend workshops with Rebecca Sinclair of Camellia Healing Art to be guided to the very essence of who you are. Learn to create space to truly understand what it is your soul wants you to know. Each workshop will introduce you to at least two intuition building activities that will delight a different sense each month. Every workshop is a build on the last but also a new beginning should you be joining for the first time.

Allow yourself to create a beautiful space to truly honour your very essence through anchoring deeply through grounding in nature. You need no artistic experience. Art is the medium and vehicle to learn and grow.

The first hour will be spent with a channelled message and healing drawing for the group by Camellia, followed by at least two exercises in raising frequency, working towards bringing alignment and fine tuning intuition. The second hour will be spent creating drawings from your very essence with time for discussion at the end.

COST: $30.00
BOOKINGS ESSENTIAL
Email Rebecca:
CONTACT: Rebecca 027 246 0405

Workshops held every second THURSDAY evening of the month and every third TUESDAY morning of the month.

description:
A Celtic Christmas by A Taste of Ireland - Wellington, A Celtic Christmas by A Taste of Ireland - Wellington
“Jingle Jigs, Reels a Treat.”
Ken Longworth – The Newcastle Herald

Direct from its Off-Broadway season, A Taste of Ireland - The Irish Music & Dance Sensation, presents its holiday spectacular, A Celtic Christmas. Prepare to be enchanted with some of the world’s finest Irish dancers and musicians bringing the spirit of Christmas to life, in a show that will make you laugh, cry, and sing into the night.

After captivating audiences across the USA and around the world, A Celtic Christmas by A Taste of Ireland returns to New Zealand this festive season following a highly successful 2022 tour. Experience the magic as world-class performers blend melodic folk mash-ups, acapella tap battles, and heartwarming storytelling in one truly unforgettable performance.

Featuring former World Irish dance champions and stars from Lord of the Dance and Riverdance, A Celtic Christmas delivers a holiday spectacular packed with Irish wit, traditional tunes and heartfelt ballads, alongside all your favorite carols. The show’s exciting mix of electrifying rhythms and extraordinary talent promises an evening brimming with Irish charm and enthralling entertainment, all in one powerhouse event.

Immerse yourself in a traditional Celtic landscape and let the magic of an Irish Christmas transport you to a world filled with excitement and wonder, where vibrant music and dance embody the heartbeat of the festive season.

With over one hundred and fifty 5-star Facebook reviews and over 150,000 followers, A Celtic Christmas by A Taste of Ireland promises 100% live singing and dancing as it bridges the gap between energetic folk music, Irish dance, and modern tap styles.

Don’t miss your chance to see this magical show as it tours New Zealand for a strictly limited season. Get your tickets now before they sell out.

**musical instruments are subject to change from performance to performance
label: Festivals

description:
Matiu Te Huki Haka for life workshop - Moera Hall - Lower Hutt, You can pay online via bank deposit (if you don't want to use credit/debit card) using this account. $30
Please email matiuthehook@gmail.com with your details and a screen shot of the payment so I can secure your spot at the event
Matthew Te Huki
38-9003-0669210-00
Workshop starts at 1:30pm please be there by 1:15 ready to start on time
Haka for Life Workshop
🔥 Haka for life – A Transformational Māori Experience with Matiu 🔥
Step into a sacred, immersive journey led by Matiu—a master of Māori language, performance, and storytelling, with over 30 years of experience empowering individuals across the globe.
This dynamic, interactive workshop weaves together ancient Māori wisdom with modern empowerment, unlocking deep connection, strength, and presence like never before.
🌿 What You’ll Experience:
✔ The Warrior’s Energy – Harness the raw power of haka, the traditional Māori dance that awakens your inner fire and unshakable presence. ✔ The Art of Connection – Learn the profound practice of hongi, the sacred sharing of breath, and cultivate deeper relationships. ✔ The Power of Storytelling & Song – Discover the soul-stirring magic of Māori narrative and music. ✔ Sacred Masculine & Feminine Balance – Explore potent, healing practices that honor, empower, and connect on a deep, transformative level. ✔ Embracing Light & Shadow – Find balance between your strength and vulnerability, your power and grace.
⚡ Why This Workshop?
This is for those who are ready to step into their power. Those who want to speak with confidence, move with purpose, and lead with authenticity.
By the end of this experience, you will: ✅ Feel grounded, present, and connected—to yourself, to spirit, to your ancestors. ✅ Command a room with presence and mana (power) when you speak. ✅ Own your voice—so that people truly listen and feel your words. ✅ Stand in your warrior energy—unshakable, confident, and fully embodied. ✅ Walk away with practical, ancient tools to help you move through life with more strength, clarity, and purpose.
🔥 Are You Ready? 🔥
If you’re up for real growth, if you’re ready to step into your power, be seen, be heard, and be fully present—then this workshop is for YOU.
Matiu’s approach is welcoming, inspiring, fun, safe and deeply empowering.
🌿 Join us. Awaken your warrior. Change your life.
Here are testimonials for workshop:
Kia Ora. I felt new strength to be in integrity with myself and power to speak from this place within. The workshop was a beautiful experience of the love and trust that is possible in community - and
that resonated for ages and flowed into all my interactions moving through life. When are you coming back to Hobart, Matiu, to do more workshops?
Here is another testimonial from Bali spirit fest participant:
It's not often in life, that I've met someone so powerfully walking their talk, that by their presence alone they can offer a deep transformational experience. I have felt this on both the occasions I've had the pleasure to cross Matiu's path. He has an ability to hold space and guide an opening and understanding of the moment, and the current times. Of divine male/female divide, and the healing available to individuals and our collective. I would highly recommend engaging with him on any level, it's definitely been a rewarding and growth promoting experience in my journey.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Serenades across cultures, Join Lala Simpson (vocals),  Dayle Anderson (piano), and Jonathan Berkahn (accordion) for an enchanting evening of music, where the soulful melodies of French chanson legends like Edith Piaf and Jacques Brel blend seamlessly with the haunting rhythms of Malagasy icons such as Bessa and Fanja Andriamanantena. Be serenaded by heartfelt songs of love, loss, and romance—an unforgettable night of timeless classics that capture the essence of passion and longing.
Join Us for an Unforgettable Concert Experience – A Night of Music with a Heartfelt Purpose!
Last year, as part of our Cultural Immersion Tour, I had the profound privilege of visiting Mamitiana Orphanage in Madagascar, alongside Stuart Simpson, Rose Ruane, and my nieces and nephews. Located on the eastern side of Antananarivo, the capital, the orphanage was founded by the incredible Madame Hary in 2012. What started as a humble project from her own home has grown into a haven for 54 children, some of whom were rescued from areas where twins are sadly believed to be cursed.
Despite the challenges, the orphanage continues to thrive, relying entirely on the kindness of visitors. They grow their own rice, maintain a small chicken farm, and have a vegetable garden to sustain themselves. But their greatest need is for ongoing support and resources to continue providing for these beautiful children.
By attending our concert, you’ll be helping make a direct impact on the lives of these children. All profits from this concert will go toward completing the construction of a much-needed training center at Mamitiana Orphanage in Madagascar, helping provide valuable education and support to the children in their care.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Bodgies to Bogans, Bodgies to Bogans
This Festival event runs from the 18th October to the 9th November 2025.


'Bodgies to Bogans' tells the story of the juvenile delinquencies and teenager rebellion of the 1950s to the Bogans of the 1980s.

Whether you were listening to rock and roll, riding motorcycles and drinking milk shakes at milk bars in the 50s or growing a mullet and thrashing out the leathers to heavy metal in the 80s, this exhibition documents the history of youth culture in Upper Hutt, and New Zealand.

Curated and developed by Whirinaki Whare Taonga.
Proudly supported by The Rimutaka Trust.
Open 10am–4pm, seven days a week.


Cost: Koha
Event information here: https://wellingtonheritagefestival.co.nz/event/bodgies-to-bogans/


Health & Safety:
Staff will be onsite at all times on the front desk to assist in emergency situations.

description:
Blossom Valley: Wellington's Cherry Blossom Festival, Blossom Valley: Wellington's Cherry Blossom Festival
Wellington's annual spring cherry blossom festival is back this September 🌸 A must-see event with 350+ cherry blossom trees creating a sea of pink 🌸

⭐ 'After Dark' evening light experience tickets now on sale.

📷 Capture gram-worthy photos and videos under the blossoms, and find our viral style photo spots including a giant living love heart, a swing, a boat (new this year!), a giant frame, and more

🛏️ Book a night in our chalet accomodation and wake up to a sea of pink 🌸

☕ Pre-purchase a delightful high tea alongside your ticket for the full experience (bookings required)☕

Weekends often sell out so make sure you have pre-purchased tickets online to secure your car park as spaces are limited. We hate to have to turn cars away when tickets are sold out so please do pre-purchase your tickets this year for weekends!! 🚗

🌸 New This Year - Flexi Passes
This pass allows you to come on whichever day you like. Not sure about the weather or at what level of blossom the trees are then this is for you. Purchase this ticket and come during the day on whichever day and time you like. (These tickets do NOT cover the After Dark experience).

Shuttles are available from Wellington, Palmerston North, Masterton or (anywhere!) with Capital Shuttles. With bookings available from 1 person, up to a 54 seater bus, they are the ideal way to get to and from Aston Norwood Gardens 🚌

Our in house photographer Lilia will be back again offering affordable professional photography sessions - perfect for family photos, couple photos, solo, friend groups, or even secret engagements! 📷

🌸 Blossom Valley is more than an event—it’s a fleeting moment of beauty, peace, and connection with nature. We can’t wait to share it with you. 🌸

-
In 1994, inspired by visits to Japan, owners Mark and Fiona Rammell planted over 350 Sakura Cherry Blossoms and are now seeing their dream burst into life each Spring.

Blossom Valley is an annual spring celebration sure to put the spring in your step as you explore the 14 acres of garden with New Zealand’s highest number and density of mature cherry blossom trees in the one place. For just a short amount of time each year at Aston Norwood Gardens in Kaitoke, Upper Hutt, hundreds of cherry trees come alive creating a canopy of pink blossom.

The event is carefully scheduled around the natural blossoming of the trees, with data from previous years informing the date selection. While the team at Blossom Valley do their best to ensure the ultimate blossom experience the timing of the bloom is up to mother nature.

description:
Bookshop Day 2025, Mark your calendars, Bookshop Day takes place on Saturday 11 October! Bookshop Day is a one-day nationwide celebration of independent bookstores, highlighting the cultural importance of books and bookshops, and the people that bring the two together, our amazing booksellers.
This year marks 10 years of Bookshop Day in Aotearoa – that’s 10 years of dress-up competitions, live music, storytimes, regional bookshop hops, author readings, spot prizes, teddy bear sleepovers, giveaways, arts and crafts, scavenger hunts, delicious baked goods, and many, many more activities and offerings!
Bookshop Day is run by the Booksellers Association of New Zealand to encourage book lovers, like you, to celebrate your local bookshop.
Head to our website to explore our Bookshop Day event calendar and see what your local bookshop has planned this year: https://www.booksellers.co.nz/bookshop-day-2025-events

🌙✨ Join us for the Hutt City Night Market – a new weekly night market bringing food, flavour, and fun to the heart of Lower Hutt!

Come down to Dowse Square every Thursday from 4–8PM, rain or shine, and enjoy a handpicked line up of local food trucks serving a delicious range of cuisines. It’s the perfect way to unwind after work, catch up with friends and whānau, and support small local businesses.

🍔 Tasty street food from around the world
