description: The Gospel According to Tolkien, A public lecture exploring the Christian themes and allegorical meanings within J.R.R. Tolkien's epic fantasy, The Lord of the Rings. Discover how his deep faith influenced his world-building, characters, and narrative arcs. This is a fascinating and insightful talk for fans of Tolkien and students of theology alike.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description:
Bar Blanc de Blancs with Martin Bosley's Oyster Saloon, Alexia's special annual Blanc de Blancs celebration returns for a 4th edition with the release of the 2021 vintage of our world famous (in Greytown) Méthode Traditionnelle!

After four years of patient making and aging, the corks on the most sparkly of all our wines are ready to be popped and the liquid gold consumed on the Alexia terrace!

The man, the myth, the mollusc maestro Martin Bosley is back with his Oyster Saloon between 12pm - 3pm shucking fresh oysters for the occasion so get in early for these or miss out!

Oysters not your thing? Fear not, the Alexia kitchen will also be turning out some delicious delights to match to your Blanc de Blancs – everyone will be happy!

It’s always a great day when the new vintage of Blanc de Blancs starts flowing and we’re quietly delighted with how the 2021 vintage is looking!

Essential Details:
- Alexia Urban Winery, 197 West Street, Greytown.
- Leashed dogs ok!
- No bookings required, just turn up. Want oysters? Get there before 3pm.
- Parking onsite, on the street, and lots of parking for bikes. 15 minute walk from Greytown centre.
label: Food & Drink

description:
Rafa Ferrer Noel's: AFROKAN - Wellington Jazz Festival, Led by New Zealand’s foremost exponents of Cuban music, Afrokan marks the latest project from veteran percussionist Rafa Ferrer Noel.
This premiere performance offers audiences a vibrant and
rhythmically rich exploration of cross-cultural musical dialogue.
A central figure in Wellington’s Cuban and Latin music communities for over two decades, Rafa leads an accomplished octet performing a sophisticated fusion of Afro-Cuban rhythms and contemporary jazz.
The ensemble features Rafa Ferrer Noel, Mikey Trujillo and John Rae (percussion), Jacqui Nyman (bass), Ben Wilcock (piano), André Paris and Ben Hunt (horns).
label: Music & Concerts

description:
William Gray Young: Architect Extraordinaire, William Gray Young: Architect Extraordinaire
William Gray Young, Wellington Architect from 1905 - 1962 left an indelible mark on the architectural landscape of New Zealand. A traditionalist, innovator and architect with meticulous attention to detail.

An exploration into the key stages of his life, his notable works, with some memorable quotes.

One of Wellingtons finest architects of the past. The presentation will focus on his extraordinary portfolio of work he carried out during his career. Familiar to many for its outstanding contribution to the place we all love to live and work in.

Known for his outstanding commercial projects like the Wellington Railway Station of the 1930’s and his Neo-Georgian Architecture like his Kent Terrace House for Sir James Elliot 1913, the presentation will also show Gray Young was prolific for his early residential work in the English Vernacular Style which adorns much of Kelburn and Wadestown in Wellington. Then outline how he built a very successful practice with his brother Jack Young and Herbert Morton designing many outstanding buildings throughout his career.


Booking is REQUIRED
Cost: $25 (or $20 if booking for the 3 Wellesley talks)
Booking information here: https://wellingtonheritagefestival.co.nz/event/william-gray-young-architect-extraordinaire/


Health & Safety

The Wellesley hotel has recently been identified as a potential earthquake risk but remains fully operational while plans are developed for strengthening. Safety procedures will be explained at the talks.

description:
Original Sin (UK), FULL TIME SENDERS & JUICED UP PRESENT: ORIGINAL SIN - SATURDAY 20 SEPTEMBER | EVA, WELLINGTON



The jump-up king himself touches down in Wellington for the very first time. From tearing up the UK underground as one half of G Dub alongside Sub Zero, to unleashing solo anthems like Don’t Be Silly, Haunted and DNB Forever (Soz Nan), Original Sin has carved his name into the core of drum & bass.



With releases on RAM, Playaz, Souped Up, Crucast and Elevate, his sound is heavy, high-energy, and built for chaos. Having torn through festivals like Let It Roll and Boomtown, it’s finally Wellington’s turn to feel the full force of his basslines.

description:
Aurora Distillery Gin Experience, Create, make and take home your own gin with us at our Gin Experience sessions at our beautiful Wairarapa site, just 10 minutes from Martinborough. Our experienced distillery staff are on hand throughout to guide you through the process and give as much or as little advice as you want. We have hundreds of satisfied customers who have made some really exciting gins.

You’ll begin by foraging in the distillery gardens then we move to the gin-making room to learn about the gin making process and the ingredients involved. You’ll sample loads of botanicals then you will choose what you want to put in your very own gin recipe. After weighing out your recipe, you’ll move to your very own still and begin distilling!

While your gin is distilling, we’ll do a gin tasting of some of our own Arrival brand gins and some surprises from our other spirits.

At the end of the session you’ll bottle and seal your own 500ml bottle of gin to take home!

Please note each Experience attendee must have their own ticket. To ensure all participants have a great time and get our full attention we cannot accept spectators.
label: Food & Drink

description:
Cheesy Lovers, Calling all cheese lovers! Whether you're planning a romantic date, a fun night with a friend, or a family treat, Cheesy Lovers is the perfect hands-on experience for two — your chance to craft, taste, and share the magic of artisan cheese together.

Begin the evening by exploring the art of fresh cheese-making — a simple yet rewarding process that will have you creating your own delicate cheese from scratch. Our experts will guide you through each step, from curdling the milk to shaping and seasoning your fresh creation.

Start your journey by making two fresh cheeses from scratch, guided by our expert cheesemongers. You and your partner will work as a team to curdle, shape, and season your own cheeses, learning the art of fresh cheese-making step by step.

Then, put your creativity to the test by building a cheese platter for two. Using a curated selection of artisan cheeses, you’ll design a board that balances textures, flavours, and perfect pairings. An array of charcuterie, fruits, nuts, and condiments will be provided, along with expert tips on plating and pairing to ensure your board is as stunning as it is delicious.

This intimate, hands-on experience is designed for anyone who loves good food, great company, and, of course, cheese!

description:
Club Tropicana, This August, Beach Babylon becomes Club Tropicana, a retro, romantic escape inspired by 1960s tropical honeymoons, classic tiki bars and vintage beach glamour. Picture golden sunsets, flamingos, thatched umbrellas and the carefree buzz of a sun-soaked getaway, right in the heart of Wellington. No passport required.

The menu is vibrant and full of escapist flair. Start with coconut prawns and banana blossom kokoda, then dive into mains like mango glazed  pork rib rack or the tropical tofu paneer curry. Save room for dessert: pineapple upside-down pudding or a coconut rum fondue to bring the tropical fantasy to a sweet finale. Behind the bar, the tiki and kava-spiked cocktails flow freely, from Blue Hawaiian’s to retro rum punches, all dressed to impress with flamingo stirrers, umbrellas and tropical garnishes.

A golden-age soundtrack sets the mood, featuring the smooth calypso of Harry Belafonte, beachy vibes from The Beach Boys, and sun-drenched classics by Astrud Gilberto.

Club Tropicana is a winter getaway, fun and fabulously over the top.

description: Cognac vs Armagnac, Noble Rot sommelier Maciej Zimny has a undeniable passion for brandy, and he is yearning to share that with you. Maciej will guide you on an educational journey through this fascinating world focusing on the most prestigious French regions for brandy production: Cognac and Armagnac. He’ll provide detailed insight into the appellations, distillation and ageing processes, differences in oak maturation and why one region focuses on vintage expressions while the other ages blends for several years in barrel. But don’t worry, this isn’t a classroom affair—they'll be pouring 8 different spirits paired to a unique three-course menu to showcase Maciej’s knowledge, and he’ll even teach you the sommelier’s techniques for how to taste spirits correctly. Fall in love with brandy, find your favourite and next time you’re ordering a nightcap you can show off your new-found knowledge to your friends.

description:
ELIXIR CLOSING Blindfolded Daiquiri Competition VII x WCC x Diplomatico Rum, 𝐈𝐭’𝐬 𝐭𝐡𝐞 𝐥𝐚𝐬𝐭 𝐜𝐚𝐥𝐥, 𝐥𝐞𝐠𝐞𝐧𝐝𝐬 — 𝐚𝐧𝐝 𝐰𝐞’𝐫𝐞 𝐠𝐨𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐨𝐮𝐭 𝐰𝐢𝐭𝐡 𝐚 𝐛𝐚𝐧𝐠.
For the SEVENTH consecutive year, we're bringing back our legendary Blindfolded Daiquiri Competition and YOU are all invited!
Calling all movers, shakers, and daiquiri dream-makers: your mission is simple…
Make the best daiquiri. While blindfolded. In 60 seconds. In front of a crowd. No pressure.
After almost four years of shaking, stirring, caffeinating, feeding, and occasionally corrupting Wellington, Elixir Cocktail Apotheke is throwing a glorious, FINAL 𝐁𝐋𝐈𝐍𝐃𝐅𝐎𝐋𝐃𝐄𝐃 𝐃𝐀𝐈𝐐𝐔𝐈𝐑𝐈 𝐂𝐎𝐌𝐏𝐄𝐓𝐈𝐓𝐈𝐎𝐍 before we ride off into the cocktail sunset.
This year, we are pairing up with 𝐃𝐢𝐩𝐥𝐨𝐦𝐚𝐭𝐢𝐜𝐨 𝐑𝐮𝐦, courtesy of 𝐇𝐚𝐧𝐜𝐨𝐜𝐤𝐬 AND the 𝐖𝐞𝐥𝐥𝐢𝐧𝐠𝐭𝐨𝐧 𝐂𝐨𝐜𝐤𝐭𝐚𝐢𝐥 𝐂𝐥𝐮𝐛
https://www.facebook.com/groups/246872129390986
Competitors will be given four mystery spirits, juices, and sugars in unmarked bottles, pick their fight song, then step up and shake like the future of cocktails depends on it.
Expect some Elixir closing-party nonsense: specials galore, questionable games, family pricing, and memories to last.
There’ll be laughter, probably some tears, and definitely some questionable dance moves. This is our last hurrah — one more night to raise a glass, hail Satan, and make some chaos together.
𝐒𝐢𝐠𝐧 𝐮𝐩𝐬 𝐜𝐨𝐦𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐬𝐨𝐨𝐧, 𝐤𝐞𝐞𝐩 𝐚𝐧 𝐞𝐲𝐞 𝐨𝐧 𝐭𝐡𝐢𝐬 𝐩𝐚𝐠𝐞 𝐟𝐨𝐫 𝐝𝐞𝐭𝐚𝐢𝐥𝐬
𝐖𝐞 𝐫𝐞𝐩𝐞𝐚𝐭, 𝐬𝐢𝐠𝐧 𝐮𝐩𝐬 𝐜𝐨𝐦𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐬𝐨𝐨𝐧, 𝐬𝐨 𝐤𝐞𝐞𝐩 𝐚 𝐠𝐨𝐝𝐝𝐚𝐦𝐧 𝐜𝐥𝐨𝐬𝐞 𝐞𝐲𝐞 𝐨𝐧 𝐭𝐡𝐢𝐬 𝐩𝐚𝐠𝐞.

𝑪𝒖𝒓𝒂𝒄𝒂𝒐 𝒎𝒊𝒈𝒉𝒕 𝒃𝒆 𝒃𝒍𝒖𝒆,

description:
Dragons Is My Uso, Chef Jessica Tang and legendary home chefs Litia Lefaoseu and Iutita Mallon are drawing on the century long fusion of Chinese and Samoan cuisine and the way food expresses love, ai, and alofa. In the late 1800s, small numbers of Chinese settled in Samoa and became part of a growing multicultural community. There they influenced local customs, made an enduring contribution to Samoan cuisine introducing contemporary favourites such as sapasui (chop suey), keke pua‘a (pork buns) and of course laisa (rice). 

Dragons celebrate this cultural and culinary fusion by showcasing these favourites and presenting new dishes highlighting the shared love of culinary staples such as taro and noodles, rice, fish, and pork, the magnificent spectrum of Chinese herbs, spices and flavours. Through cooking and sharing food together the chefs honour their culinary heritage, strengthen our connections to one another and celebrate the big and little moments in life. This is a shared-style meal, served banquet style on lazy Susan turntables. 
Dragons is My Uso was one of the sell-out hits of the 2024 festival - don't miss out!

Discounted tables for 10 available for $1000, so get the whole aiga together!

description:
Feed Your Senses, Step into an immersive experience where nature’s core elements — stone, clay, wood, water, fire, and air — are brought to life through a dynamic fusion of artistic mediums. Explore interactive installations and captivating performances that engage all of your senses with visual art, sculpture, sound, and more. Throughout the evening, enjoy six unique canapés and six meticulously crafted drinks, each inspired by the work of a different artist. Each exhibit reflects the raw power and beauty of the natural world, as local artists push boundaries to bring these elements to life in real-time.

As you journey through Foxglove’s Secret Wardrobe, you'll be surrounded by live artistry unfolding around you, creating an environment filled with raw creativity and vibrant energy. Aphrodisiac-inspired canapés and expertly paired beverages complement the visual experience, bringing each artist’s medium to life while celebrating Wellington’s rich and diverse creative community.

This culinary and sensory pairing will transport you deeper into the world of artistry, blending food and creativity in unexpected and delightful ways.

This event goes beyond simple exhibition — it’s a celebration of Wellington's local talent where the boundaries between food, art, and sensory experience are beautifully blurred. Whether you’re an art aficionado or a culinary enthusiast, this immersive experience promises to engage your senses in an unforgettable way.

description:
I-Sarn Thai KanTok, Join Daeng from Tuk Tuk Thai for a deeply personal culinary journey to the heart of E-Sarn, the north-eastern region of Thailand she once called home. This one-night-only event celebrates the traditional Kan-Tok style of dining – a communal meal served on handwoven bamboo trays and shared amongst family and friends. This event is made to be shared, the ticket price is for a shared menu for two. 

Growing up in the small town of Tha Bo near the Mekong Delta, Daeng’s childhood was filled with stories of rice farming, village generosity, and dishes cooked from what the garden offered. In E-Sarn, meals were acts of love, shared daily around the Kan-Tok with laughter, music, and warmth.

Now, Daeng invites you to gather at her table and experience the flavours of her upbringing. You’ll be served nine traditional dishes on a beautifully crafted bamboo tray, designed for sharing, just as they are in her village.

On the Kan-Tok:
Hor Mok Salmon – Steamed salmon in banana leaves, marinated with herbs, spices, and coconut milk
Mok Nor Mai with Pork Belly – Pork belly steamed with bamboo shoots
Larb Gai – A celebratory chicken mince salad with fresh herbs and toasted rice
E-Sarn Sausages – House-made, spiced and fermented in true north-eastern style
Nam Prik Tomato – Roasted tomato dipping sauce with chillies, garlic, and shallots
Som Tum – Green papaya salad with a sweet, sour, spicy kick
Sticky Rice – Soaked overnight and steamed in traditional bamboo baskets
Fresh and Steamed Seasonal Vegetables – To enjoy with sauces and mains

Dessert:
Kanom Chan – Thai layered jelly cake
Kanom Mun – Tapioca and coconut pudding

Pull up a seat at Daeng’s table and discover the stories, flavours, and traditions that shaped her childhood.
Single tickets or odd numbers unable to be catered to.
label: Food & Drink

description:
Interislander: Pop-up Burger, Interislander has been a long-time supporter of Visa Wellington on a Plate, the famous hospitality event that lights up the Wellington region each August.

The Love Ferry
Featuring a Poneke Red brioche bun, with a beef & pork patty seasoned with a mix of smoked paprika, garlic, and a touch of cayenne pepper. Melted Kapiti brie cheese with caramelised onions, roasted red peppers, rocket and truffle aioli. Topped with crispy Harrington’s bacon and pickled jalepenos for those who like a little heat. Served with a side of crispy fries sprinkled with smoked paprika and sea salt at $20. For the perfect pairing, we offer a Garage Project Beer match for $12.

Pop-up Burger at Wellington Railway Station
We've set up a pop-up burger truck outside the Wellington Railway Station. This will allow the public to indulge in our burger and fries without needing to sail on the Interislander. Its also available to passengers when travelling the Cook Strait on the Ferry.

description:
JETAA Wellington - Brewkaiwa September @ Mean Doses, We will be having our September Brewkaiwa at Mean Doses, a bold and modern craft brewery in the heart of Wellington. Known for its inventive beers and laid-back atmosphere, it’s the perfect place to share a drink and good conversation.
Brewkaiwa is JETAA’s monthly casual meetup for anyone with any connection to Japan.
We’re a diverse group of people who have studied, worked, or lived in Japan or have been invited along by someone who has.
Come join us for a brew and stay for the kaiwa! Bring your friends!
***Japanese or alcohol consumption NOT REQUIRED!***
Brewkaiwaとは
一杯いかがですか？
JETAAがウェリントンで親睦会を開催するとどうなるのか？その結果、BREWKAIWA！
2020年に始まった、ブリューカイワは、ウェリントンの様々なバーで毎月開催されている飲み会です。大人気の国際交流グルップです！！！ 日本で働いたり、住んだり、旅行したことのある人達に人気のあるイベントです！！！お酒を飲んで、友達を出来、素敵なごちそうを食べ、おまけに異文化を知られます！
日本語が話せる外国人も良く参加しているので、日本語しか話せなくても全然大丈夫です！
是非来てください！

description:
Le Petit Chef, InterContinental Wellington proudly presents the first official Le Petit Chef experience in New Zealand - an extraordinary fusion of theatre, storytelling, and fine dining.

Step into the whimsical animated world of Le Petit Chef, the world’s tiniest and most determined chef, as he embarks on a globe-trotting quest to source the finest ingredients. Using groundbreaking 3D projection mapping technology, your table transforms into a magical stage, where continents shift, spices fly, and the art of cooking comes thrillingly to life before your eyes.

As the journey unfolds, a five-course menu is served in perfect harmony with the story. Highlights include Wairarapa crayfish bouillabaisse, corn-fed chicken with Perigord truffle, and a decadent Valrhona chocolate dessert. Choose from the Grand Menu ($180), Classic Menu ($140), Vegetarian Menu ($140), or a dedicated Kids Menu $70). While each menu offers a distinct culinary experience, the stunning visual show remains the same for all guests and is centered around the Grand Menu storyline.

Please note, while primarily designed for individual bookings, some shared seating may apply due to the technical nature of the performance.
label: Food & Drink

description:

In this exclusive olfactive experience, indulge in small bites and sip on a glass (or three!) of something delightful, setting the perfect mood for exploring the emotional power of fragrance.

Over the course of the evening, you’ll sample up to twelve unique fragrances, each one tied to a captivating love story that inspired its creation. Learn the intimate tales behind these scents and discover how they evoke the passions and emotions that shape our experiences of love. Whether you're a fragrance enthusiast or a newcomer, this sensory journey is sure to arouse your olfactory senses and deepen your appreciation for the art of perfume.

Chefs Tim and Aaron Banks will lovingly create a four-course dinner with ingredients locally sourced and lovingly produced by small scale sustainable farmers... and perhaps they will read their own poems too.

description:
Porirua Parkrun, What is Porirua parkrun? It is a free 5km walk or run event - It’s not about coming first or winning. You can go at your own pace and just enjoy being with other people. It is inclusive and the perfect way to start your weekend in the outdoors chatting to people.

The start occurs just upstream of the Bothamley Park carpark. This car park is off Champion street, opposite the intersection with Windley Street. Head to end of carpark where the concrete ends and there is a gate. For location see https://goo.gl/maps/wEohfp9bRu82.

The course is following the old coach road (circa 1870's) established for the early farms in the area. Today this historic track is located within a park, away from cars and now used by walkers, runners and cyclists.

The track is generally 3 metres wide with a gentle gradient and a compacted gravel surface beside the Kenepuru Stream through a picturesque wooded wild valley. (Note there is a pinch point for a short section after the 2km marker where participants need to go single file each direction for approx 30 metres)

The valley runs east-west with mature trees which means this has to be one of the most sheltered places, out of the wind to exercise in Wellington.

What does it cost to join in? Nothing - it's free! but please register before your first run or walk, so you can get your timing results. You only need to register with parkrun once, to participate at any of the parkrun events around the world. Don't forget to bring a copy of your barcode. If you forget it, you won't get a time.

How fast do I have to be? Walking is fine as long as you can finish the 5km. Please come along and join in whatever your pace!

One dog per adult is welcome, as long as it is on a short hand held lead.

Children welcome but those 10 years and under need to be kept within arms reach of a supervising adult.

Note there is no toilets in the park, so go before you go.

We're friendly! Every week we grab a post park run/walk coffee/tea at Get Fixed within Kai Tahi at 20 Parumoana Street, to mix exercise with socialising.

There are volunteering opportunities even week. So those doing Duke of Edinburgh or similar challenges can get volunteer credits. Ensure you contact us well in advance at "porirua@parkrun.co.nz"

On 30 October, gather your cleverest friends and find your darkest ghoulish attire
Who will crack the case first: the Detectives or the Villains?

Expect twists, laughter, and a touch of fright
with spot prizes through the night — plus a reward for the best-dressed.
Award-winning chef Max Gordy ( @grazewinebar ) will conjure up a frightfully delicious Halloween-themed feast.
Your ticket includes one complimentary alcoholic beverage (with more available to purchase on the night).
Every ticket sold helps Kaibosh ensure that no good food is left to die.
TICKET TYPES
Bring a team of six to solve the mystery and devour a fiendishly good feast for $666.
Have a frightening four-some? Book a table for $444.
Spooky single seats available for $111... we will seat you at a mystery table...
VENUE
60 Dixon Street is up a flight of steep steps – with only one way in.
What is Mischief Night?
In parts of Pennsylvania and New Jersey in the eastern USA, 30 October is called “Mischief Night.” The tradition refers to the eve of Halloween in which children and teenagers celebrate the holiday one night early with pranks, tricks and more. While in New England, some call it Cabbage Night...

description:
Next Gen Cook Off, The Next Gen Cook Off returns for its fifth year, and things are heating up at Everybody Eats.
Every Monday in August, four of Wellington’s freshest young chefs will go head-to-head in a high-energy kitchen takeover, serving up epic three-course dinners using rescued food.

Each chef will be given the same protein, generously provided by Meat Direct, but everything else is a surprise—ingredients are revealed that morning, based on what’s come in. Menus are created on the spot, and dishes are served to a buzzing, hungry crowd. It’s fast-paced, creative chaos with serious culinary skills on display. Guests get a front-row seat to the action, while supporting a truly game-changing enterprise.

4 August — Jessie Gibberd, Loretta
Originally from rural Waikato, Jessie Gibberd made the move to Wellington to study, but it was the buzz of hospitality that captured her heart. Swapping textbooks for tongs, she left her degree behind to dive headfirst into the kitchen. Now a chef de partie at Loretta, Jessie brings a grounded, fresh perspective to one of the city’s most beloved eateries.

11 August — Felipe Molina, El Matador
Hailing from Chile, Felipe Molina is a professional chef with over 15 years of experience in kitchens around the world. Having worked in several countries and world-class restaurants, Felipe brings a global sensibility to his craft. With a passion for seafood, meats, and bold, expressive flavours, his cooking is shaped by travel and tradition, blending international influence with creativity on every plate.

18 August — Zane Gupwell, Graze
Zane Gupwell began his hospitality journey at just 15, washing dishes at a local café in Mount Eden. From there, he headed to Queenstown, learning from a wide range of chefs and kitchen styles before challenging himself with a move to Wellington. Since then, he’s worked at some of the city’s top restaurants and now brings his thoughtful, evolving style to Graze Wine Bar.

25 August — Lulu Temmuyin, Mr Go’s
Lulu Temmuyin is a chef who loves pushing boundaries, even when they’re unexpected. Lactose intolerant but obsessed with cheese, and not a fan of lamb but winner of a lamb cooking competition, Lulu is all about surprises. At Mr Go’s, she brings bold, sustainable flavour to the forefront, blending personality with punch in every dish.

Everybody Eats runs on a pay-what-you-can model, transforming food waste into gourmet meals and bringing the community together over good kai. The Next Gen Cook Off celebrates and champions this mission, proving that rescued food can be next-level delicious.

The Next Gen Cook Off is proudly supported by The Gas Hub.
label: Food & Drink

description:

The secret lies in mastering the technique! From flawless walks and captivating combos to strength-building exercises and perfect posture, it’s all about technique and practice.
Why is heel technique important?
- Safety First: Proper technique prevents injuries, ensuring you can dance for years to come.
- Strength & Posture: Build the muscles needed to support your ankles, knees, and back, while perfecting that elegant posture.
- Confidence Boost: Knowing you have the technique down pat gives you the confidence to own the floor!
Whether you’re a beginner or looking to refine your skills, this class will cover:
- Walks that turn heads
- Seamless combos
- Targeted exercises for strength
- Posture tips to keep you looking and feeling your best
Bookings via zoekeesueguidance.com

description:
Resilience and Emissions Reduction Workshop for Not-For-Profits | Blenheim, Ready your not-for-profit for the future
Do you know you need to take action to address climate change but don’t know where to start?
Do you want to strengthen your organisations’ planning and readiness for change?
Do you want practical tools and support to measure, assess, and report on your organisations’ impact?

In partnership with Rātā Foundation, our Earth+ Resilience and Emissions Reduction programme has been designed to flip the script on climate change, centering your organisation as agents of change and kitting you with the tools, support and community to make a difference; and it’s free of charge!
About the programme
With the support of the Terra Nova team and other programme participants, you will be guided to identify how your organisation is uniquely placed to contribute to the resilience and wellbeing of people and planet, and the opportunities and obstacles to creating positive change.
The programme is accessible and suitable for everyone, from those just starting on the journey, to those who have steps in place but are looking to gain access to further resources. This programme is not intended to add extra workload or deliverables for your organisation, it is an offer of support to integrate an Earth+ approach into your BAU; an answer to the question “what can we do about climate change?”
We know that every organisation’s capacity is different, so our support is available for you to utilise it when you need it until the end of 2025. This includes:
Access to a dedicated online community where you can connect with the Terra Nova team, other Rātā grantees and specialised partners. Ask questions, find resources and share your journey.
A toolkit of resources and impact sessions to develop your knowledge and connect you with the expertise and support to build resilience and tackle change in a range of impact areas.
Complementary access to the Cogo carbon emissions measurement tool, providing you the ability to quantify and report on your emissions impact and providing recommended actions for emissions reduction and cost savings, in an easy-to-use format.
It begins with a 1-day interactive workshop to kick things off. By the end of the workshop, you will walk away:
Feeling more empowered about the future, with a deeper understanding of resilience and climate change as it relates to your organisation’s context.
Having explored how you can make change positive and achievable, centered on the needs of your community and team. 
With free access to Cogo carbon manager, an emissions profile, report of your carbon footprint and practical action you can take to reduce your emissions.
Having built a network of support and gained free-to-use practical tools and templates.
Note: we will be running multiple workshops throughout the year; you only need to attend one workshop to join the programme. If you prefer an alternate date, please head to our Humanitix profile to find the corresponding event. 
The programme is fully funded for not-for-profit organisations and registrations are now open for 2025! Register for the programme and secure your spot in a workshop through this Humanatix event, and a member of the Terra Nova team will be in touch to confirm your enrollment. For more information about the programme and workshop, visit the Terra Nova website.
We look forward to welcoming you into our community of changemakers!

description:
Jewellery-making in 8 weeks: Wednesday mornings - Wellington, This NEW block of morning classes is the best way for beginners to get into jewellery-making in a lively, warm and friendly environment.
It starts on Wed 8 October and runs for 8 weeks until Wednesday 26 November, 10am - 12.30pm.
This class is mixed-level, allowing beginners to work alongside advanced students.
Beginners start with basic ring making in copper or brass, students will learn measuring, texturing, shaping, cutting and soldering.
Then we move on to making a practice ring set with a cabochon stone (cabochon means it has a flat bottom and a smooth domed top).
Once your first setting is completed you can move to working in silver and produce another stone set ring with more interesting design elements.
Level 2 students explore chainmaking as a way to develop their fine soldering skills. Their silver project can be a pendant on a handmade chain or a piece of their own design.
Level 3 and above students are encouraged to work on their design skills and try new and challenging techniques.
Included in the class fee are copper and brass for practising on, up to 8 grams of sterling silver, an extra $8 for stones and fine silver and all consumables such as sandpaper, solder and chemicals. Extra metals and materials are available for purchase in the studio.
Course fee is $440, Early bird $396 till 17 September.
Our booking system asks for full payment to be made via credit card, PayPal or AfterPay on booking. If you do not have access to these payment methods or need to pay your course fee over time please email us to arrange this

description:
Rotten Luck Fermentation Club Special CHEESE-MAKING – Pop-up Parlour 2025, Rotten Luck Fermentation Club Special CHEESE-MAKING – Pop-up Parlour 2025
The Rotten Luck Club is at the Pop-up Parlour!

Come along for a 2 hour cheese-making demonstration and tasting session! Local enthusiast Erin will guide us through the process and share her love for all things cheese.

• What - 2 hr workshop where you'll be shown how to making a fresh batch of cheese (probably halloumi and maybe also paneer), and everyone can take some home.
• When - 2pm-4pm, 28 September 2025
• Where - St Marks, 98 Rāwhiti Road, Pukerua Bay (opposite school)
• Cost - $10 per person BOOK NOW ( https://tinyurl.com/5n7twce7)
• What to bring? Anything yummy for the tasting session. Bonus points if it is home made.
• Who - Kids welcome to join but they will need their own ticket and must be supervised by a caregiver at all times.

We will also have a tasting session of different types of cheeses for everyone to sample.

Bring any questions you have and you'll be able to look at the range of equipment used too. Will have tips and tricks for setting up at home, including sourcing the right type of milk and getting your hands on some rennet.


Other Rotten Luck Fermentation Club events at the Pop-up:

- Sauerkraut & Kimchi (Rangatahi & Adults) $10. https://tinyurl.com/7myhk5v9
- Bread-making $20 https://tinyurl.com/yfkderv7
- Recipe Discovery @ PKB Library, free https://tinyurl.com/byswfp93
- Sauerkraut & Kimchi (Kids) $10 https://tinyurl.com/4hdapf3b
- Whiskey-making @RSA $20 https://tinyurl.com/2a26z3yt

All paid events are helping to fundraise for the Pop-up Parlour.

The bar at the RSA will be open for further alcohol purchases. Please do not bring your own alcohol to the venue.

Note, no paywave facilities. Cash and card only. Do not drink and drive - arrange a lift if you are drinking alcohol. Pukerua Bay Hub will not be liable for any unruly behaviour.


____________________________________
WHAT IS THE POP-UP PARLOUR?
A chance to create and connect in our pop-up community space. From 1-30 September we've got a jam-packed schedule with 65+ events for kids, families, rangatahi and adults to learn, hang out and have fun.

Check out all the free/koha events too -
https://www.pkbhub.org.nz/whatson

Waiho i te toipoto, kaua i te toi roa –
Let us keep close together, not far apart.

description: Santiago to Buenos Aires, Noble Rot sommeliers Maciej Zimny and Jessica Wood invite you to embark on their recent road trip through Chile and Argentina. They will indulge you with stories and share their experiences through these two fantastic wine countries alongside a South American themed five-course degustation menu including dishes they enjoyed on their journey. Relax and enjoy their tales and insight into why the wines taste the way they do, the key stylistic differences between the two countries, and learn from them first-hand the secrets of why Chilean and Argentine wines are ones to watch in the future.

description:
Sconnoisseur, Get ready to master the art of making Wellington's iconic cheese scones at Pravda Café. Widely regarded as the home of the city's best cheese scones, Pravda's creations are so beloved, they often sell out before you can blink. Now, you can learn the secrets behind their mouthwatering scones firsthand.

In this hands-on workshop, you’ll be guided through mixing and preparing your own batch of Pravda’s famous cheese scones. Once your dough is ready, you'll hand them off to be baked to crispy flaky perfection. While they cook, relax with a cup of tea or coffee, and once your scones are ready, you’ll enjoy the fruits of your labour fresh from the oven.

The best part? You’ll get to take home the coveted recipe, allowing you to recreate these legendary scones in your own kitchen whenever you want. This is a perfect opportunity to learn a piece of Wellington’s culinary history and enjoy a deliciously rewarding experience.
label: Food & Drink

description:
Snacks Amore, When the host brings you bread, instead of a red flag...Snacks Amore!
Amuse Snack Bar invites food lovers to ditch the dating apps for one delicious night of light-hearted speed dating and snack-based bonding at their Euro-inspired aperitivo haven. Whether you are after a snack (human) or a snack (sustenance), you're guaranteed to leave with a full heart and a satisfied appetite.
Each attendee will enjoy 12 mini dates and 6 courses of Italian-inspired snacklets – cacio e pepe, agrodolce, pasta alla norma, porchetta, and zabaione, all served in perfect bite-sized form. A glass of Lambrusco kicks off the evening, with a cheeky mini tiramisu maritozzo to take home. Throughout the event, wines curated by the charming Richard Klein of Artigiano Imports will be on offer, alongside Amuse’s house spritz, Negroni, and Parrotdog Lager.
The atmosphere is relaxed and welcoming – more aperitivo hour than high-pressure matchmaking. The Amuse team, also musicians, will guide the evening with playful icebreakers, musical moments, and a light-touch structure that makes meeting new people easy and enjoyable.
Two themed evenings allow guests to choose their best fit:

Evening 1: General Assembly
Grouped on the night by chosen generation:
• 5:30pm – Millennials (28–45)
• 7:30pm – Gen X (40–60)

Evening 2: Rainbow Night
Grouped by dating preference.
• 6:30pm – she for her upstairs, he for him downstairs.

The event warmly welcomes all gender identities and sexual orientations. Attendees will be asked to indicate who they’re interested in dating at checkout, but gender identity remains private unless individuals wish to share it. Symbols and nametags on the night will help create a fun and inclusive vibe. Amuse Snack Bar is proud to be an LGBTQIA+ friendly space.
label: Food & Drink

description:
Messie, AUCKLAND, NEW ZEALAND (Jul 1, 2025) – Wellington-based DJ phenomenon MESSIE, aka Tessa Hills has today announced two All Night Long DJ sets across Pōneke and Tāmaki Makaurau. Gaining international attention after opening for one of the United Kingdom’s most coveted DJs Fred again.. and remixing his song ‘places to be’ which now has over 2.6M listens on Spotify alone, MESSIE is quickly becoming one of the most exciting new names to watch in New Zealand.
Audiences will be able to enjoy MESSIE’s high-energy, electrifying set for literally the entire night - with these two shows running until the early hours of the morning. Saturday, September 13th will see her take over Auckland’s Studio the Venue, before heading to Wellington’s San Fran the following Saturday, September 20th.
Tickets for MESSIE’s All Night Long tour in Auckland and Wellington will be available to purchase by the General Public on Friday 4th July at 12:00pm.
My Live Nation members will also be able to secure tickets during the presale which commences Wednesday 2nd July from 11:00am until Friday 4th July at 11:00am. Fans can register for access at livenation.co.nz.
MESSIE is taking Aotearoa’s electronic dance music scene to filthy new levels. As a former drummer, her passion for drumming was the pipeline for her falling in love with genres like Garage, Breakbeat, and Jungle. She has since expanded her sound and it’s safe to say each set will keep you guessing what will come next as she effortlessly merges genres such as Baile Funk, Ghetto Tech, Jersey Club, Juke, Afro beat inspired drums, Techno and many more global club soundscapes that encompass her high energy DJ sets. MESSIE’s sets are guaranteed to be bootleg heavy with something for everyone as she draws from her own music taste of rap and grime, to early 2000’s singalongs, girl-boss anthems and queer music culture in the form of edits you’d never expect.
Alongside her headline tour around Aotearoa in mid 2024, MESSIE has now brought her fresh, high-energy club music internationally to Glastonbury, Reading & Leeds, R&V, Beyond The Valley, Wildlands, Love Saves The Day, Gemfest & Outro Festival. With slots at Pohoda Festival, Hidden Festival, Motion, Truck Festival, AIASOUND and All Points East locked in for the second half of 2025, there is no slowing her down.
MESSIE
ALL NIGHT LONG TOUR Presented by Live Nation
STUDIO THE VENUE, AUCKLAND
SATURDAY, 13 SEPTEMBER
SAN FRAN, WELLINGTON
SATURDAY, 20 SEPTEMBER
TICKETS ON SALE FRIDAY, 4 JULY, 12PM (LOCAL)
Live Nation Presale: Wednesday 2 July 11:00am - Friday 4 July 11:00am Artist Presale: Wednesday 2 July 11:00am - Friday 4 July 11:00am
For complete tour & ticket information, visit: livenation.co.nz

description:
An Evening with Dr Hinemoa Elder, Nau mai, haere mai! Join us for this very special event to meet Dr Hinemoa Elder and hear all about her latest book, Ara: A Māori guidebook of the mind, published by Penguin NZ.
Dr Hinemoa Elder will talk about chapters in Ara, and how she has delved into a unique exploration of how to think about thinking, rooted in the wisdom of Māori culture.
In Ara, Dr Hinemoa Elder introduces us to a profound journey guided by Hinengaro, Māori goddess of the mind, leading us through 23 specific rua, caves, into the unfamiliar depths of Papatūānuku, our earth mother, and back to the surface again.
Hinengaro offers us a dedicated path to gather insights, face challenges and help us navigate the complexities of our minds.
Hinemoa will be signing books.

Taco Addicts at Waitoa, Hataitai, Come join Taco Addicts & Waitoa Social Club for a suburban taco night!
Friday, 12 September, the Taco Addicts caravan, Prince, and crew will be popping up at the side of the bar. Waitoa will be serving their excellent beers of course
Enjoy your tacos from the comfort of the pub, or grab takeaways and enjoy in your own home.

description: Sunday Sesh, Starting August 10th, join us every weekend from 11:00 AM to 1:00 PM for our take on Bottomless Brunch!
label: Food & Drink

description:
Petals & Pastries: Roses & Rosè, Celebrate winter’s quiet beauty in the warmth of the Longbush Cottage glasshouse with a luxurious afternoon of flower-making and indulgence. In this guided workshop, you’ll learn how to craft stunning crepe paper roses — from gently curling petals to forming elegant buds and assembling your own everlasting bouquet. As you create, enjoy a spread of fresh pastries alongside a glass of blushing rosé wine. With the soft light of the garden outside and the warmth of good company within, this is a joyful, hands-on way to embrace the season and take home handmade blooms.
Date & Time: Sunday 31st August - 10am-1pm
Location: 1023 Longbush Road, Longbush 5884
(20 min scenic drive from Martinborough)
Price: $129
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Jazz Festival: Queens of the Blues, An exclusive concert for Wellington Jazz Festival at The Undercurrent.

Bye bye Gatsby! Ali Affleck is celebrating 30 years of pioneering blues and hokum (1913-1933).

Award-winning vocalist (& jazz historian) with an local kiwi musicians join forces to Celebrate the brave and bawdy blues queens who reigned in the prohibition era - many sadly forgotten over time.

'The music was bold – the women even more so! 'Masterclass in grassroots jazz/blues' ***** (Edinburgh49.org).

'Not a household name yet – she soon will be' (BBC Jazzhouse).

‘Vivacious’ (Herald).

Six-time nominee for Best Vocalist (Scottish Jazz Awards)
label: Festivals

description:
The Enchanted Ale Quarter, Enter the magical realm of The Enchanted Ale Quarter, a fairytale-inspired pop-up tavern where whimsy, wonder and craft beer collide.

Step into a storybook setting, with twinkling lights, woodland decor, and forest-fantasy touches around every corner. Feast on gnome and fairy-themed comfort food like the solstice salad, loaded forest fries, sirens & ships fish & chips, and a decadent dark forest brownie, all paired with enchanted brews and mythical tipples.

Cosy, curious, and otherworldly, The Enchanted Ale Quarter brings a little magic to Wellington’s winter nights. Dust off your wings and join us for a pint, some sustenance or a potion, no quest required.
label: Food & Drink

description:
The History of Newtown's Green Belt, The History of Newtown's Green Belt
Tales of a Wellington hill range from 250 million years ago to the present day.

Tonight's talk will be hosted by local environmental artist Paul Forrest who weaves tales from his research about the heritage and history of our Newtown Green Belt hill range Te Ranga a Hiwi.

The talk covers the landscape from pre-human times, the changes with human history, to the present day through the eyes of birds and humans and butterflies.


Cost: Free
Event information here: https://wellingtonheritagefestival.co.nz/event/the-history-of-newtowns-green-belt/


Health & Safety:
No health and safety concerns. Wheelchair friendly and multiple safety exits.
label: Community & Culture

description:
Te Omanga Hospice Vintners' Lunch 2025, Te Omanga Hospice Vintners' Lunch 2025

Tickets are now available for Te Omanga Hospice's largest fundraising event - the Vintners' Lunch!

This will be held at the Lower Hutt Events Centre on Sunday 28 September, 11am-5pm.

Join in for a six-course lunch, engage in live and silent auctions, while enjoying fabulous entertainment all in support of Te Omanga Hospice.

Get your tickets now at www.Galabid.com/vintners

If you have any questions, please email

We can't wait to see you there!
label: Food & Drink

description:
The Lunch Society: Spring Edition, Join us for 'The Lunch Society: Spring Edition' , an afternoon of delicious food, meaningful connections, and inspiring conversations to warm the soul.

The Lunch Society is a quarterly ladies’ lunch event designed to bring together women in Wellington for networking, entertainment, and philanthropy.

This event is all about bringing together like-minded individuals to connect, learn, and share in a vibrant and welcoming atmosphere. Expect an engaging guest speaker, valuable networking opportunities, and plenty of moments to inspire you.

Settle in for a beautifully curated experience featuring:

• A powerful keynote by Kristy Grant on New Voices, Fresh Stories: Women Leading Creative Change
• A delicious three-course set menu and a refreshing welcome drink on arrival
• An exclusive goodie bag for every guest + spot prizes
• A chance to give back, with a portion of all ticket sales donated to a charity : KidsCan + Cancer Society

Whether you're a returning guest or joining us for the first time, you’ll be welcomed into a warm, inclusive space that celebrates women, ambition, and community. Come to be inspired, stay to be part of something bigger.
label: Food & Drink

description: Tire-toi une bûche, Executive Chef Jonny Taggart shares his love for the classic – and not-so-classic – flavours of Quebec. Fresh from a culinary adventure in Montreal, Jonny returns with an open heart, an inspired palate, and plenty to share. This special menu will feature everything from Tourtière (French Canadian meat pie) and smoked meat sandwiches to the beloved pairing of poutine with a steamie (Montreal-style hot dog), along with the sweet and comforting tarte farlouche. No need to book. Just come along with your friends and family and enjoy these French Canadian delights!
label: Food & Drink

description:
Traditional Kölsch Service!, Kölsch Service is BACK!! Enjoy our fresh batch of Dösen Kölsch the traditional way - just like in Köln.
What's Kölsch service?
It's kinda like beer yum cha but there's only one thing on the menu - 200ml glasses of Kölsch bier!

We keep track of your tab by marking the edge of your coaster and when your glass is empty - voilà, another glass appears!
If you're done, just pop your coaster on top of your glass to indicate no more.
You can order food and non-alcoholics the same way, just take a seat and everything will come to you.
To make sure you get a table, book here: https://www.meandoses.co.nz/bookings
PLUS DEUTSCHES ESSEN!

We're serving up Apache's take on Currywurst - the classic German streetfood that is a dream with a crisp Kölsch. Yes we'll sort some vegan ones too!
We're also slinging more amazing fresh Brezels
from Brezelmania, served with cheese sauce

We'll be running Kölsch service from 12pm - 5pm on Saturday October 4th, come along and get the Köln experience!
label: Food & Drink

description:
Tītahi Bay Spring Community BBQ, Tītahi Bay Spring Community BBQ
It's (nearly) summer so it's time for a BBQ! Come and join us at 43 Kapiti Crescent (St Matthew's Hall) for a BBQ on the lawn. If it's bad weather, we will move into the hall.

All welcome! Dinner will be served from 5pm; we will make dinner, so just bring yourselves!



FAQ

Who is this for? Can I come along?

Yes absolutely, please come, we would love to have you. This dinner is for all the people who live in the beautiful community of Tītahi Bay!

What if I can't make it until a bit later?

That's all good, we will be serving a rolling dinner from 5 to 6.30pm so come whenever suits you. If you can only come a little later than 6.30pm, we will likely have more than enough so come anyway!

Can I bring my kids along?

Yes! In fact, please bring your kids along. We will have some games in the room and some options for crafts on the tables along with the food.

Do I need to bring anything?

Nope! Just yourselves, all are welcome just as you are.

But I really want to bring something to contribute?

If you would like to bring a salad to contribute to the BBQ, feel free to email us at and we can chat! We really just don't want this to be a barrier to anyone coming along.

Can I help?

Yes absolutely, this is a community event so help is always appreciated. It is also a great time to meet some other people. We will have some tasks for set up and also some for packing down and cleaning up. If you are interested in helping, flick us an email at

Will my dietaries be met?

We will make sure there will be options for these dietaries: vegan, gluten free, dairy free, and nut free.

If you have a dietary that isn't on there, feel free to check and flick us an email.

Can I bring my friend(s) along?

Yes, please bring your friends along, especially if they live in Tītahi Bay!

Who is this hosted by?

This idea is hosted by us, the crew who run Tītahi Bay Anglicans, but it is run with the help of our friends around Tītahi Bay. The hope is that this can become a recurring community event where others can join in on hosting this.

This is at a church, will I be preached to?

No, we promise that this isn't a Tupperware party bait and switch. While we definitely are a church, this event is for the Tītahi Bay community as a whole to be able to come eat together and connect.
label: Food & Drink

description: Buddhism for Beginners: The Eightfold Path, An introductory course on the core teachings of Buddhism. This workshop will provide a clear and accessible explanation of the Eightfold Path and how it can be applied to modern life to cultivate happiness and wisdom. Suitable for absolute beginners, this session is a great way to learn about the path to enlightenment.
label: Religion & Spirituality

Urban Cocktail Trail I Pōneke Wellington (NZ), Urban Cocktail Trail I Pōneke Wellington (NZ)

Whether you’re vegan, vegan-curious, or just chasing big flavour and good vibes, this one’s for you. Grab your crew, bring your appetite, and settle in for a plant-based feast you won’t forget.
One day. One menu. Infinite flavour.

description: Wagyu Flame Feast, This one-off event for The Dumpling Company promises premium New Zealand and Japan Wagyu. Sourced from the finest cuts, wagyu is known for its rich marbling, tenderness, and deep umami flavours. Every bite melts in your mouth, delivering the ultimate BBQ experience. Enjoy their signature house-made dipping sauces and a curated selection of fresh, traditional Asian side dishes. So you can curate your own perfect balance of flavours. With the grill right at your table you'll feel the warmth, hear the sizzle, and immerse yourself in the true essence of Asian barbecue.
label: Food & Drink

description:
Yoga Nidra: Grounding into Spring, Yoga Nidra: Grounding into Spring
A soothing evening of rest and renewal — followed by a nourishing plant-based dinner and dessert.
Welcome the energy of spring with a deeply grounding Yoga Nidra practice designed to reconnect you with the earth and your inner calm. This session will centre on releasing stuck or stagnant energy while inviting fresh energy to flow in. With a focus on stability and openness, Emma will guide you through gentle breath, nature-inspired imagery, and mindful awareness, creating space to feel supported, steady, and ready for new beginnings.
The space will be thoughtfully prepared to support stillness, with soft lighting, grounding scents, and a soundscape inspired by nature’s renewal. All comforts are provided — mats, blankets, bolsters — though you’re welcome to bring anything personal that helps you feel completely relaxed.
Whether you’re seeking balance, clarity, or simply a pause from the pace of life, this is a chance to feel grounded and centred as the season of spring unfolds.
After the session, stay to enjoy a wholesome plant-based dinner and dessert — a grounding way to nourish, connect, and carry the calm into your evening.
What’s on the menu?
Jackfruit Rendang
Satay Seitan Skewer
Gado Gado salad with Peanut Sauce
Fragrant Rice
Banana Cake with Caramel suace
Warming Hot Chocolate


Meet Emma, your host
With a 100-hour trauma-informed Yin Yoga certification and a background in the corporate world, Emma brings both groundedness and empathy to her teaching. Her approach is slow, intentional, and centered on creating a space where your body feels safe to relax and release.

description:
The Dancing & Drinking Society plus support - William Jackmann, The Dancing & Drinking Society (or DADS for short), is New Zealand’s premier exponent of authentic 1920s Blues & Jass.
Their repertoire includes many of the Rags, Rambles, Shuffles, Drags, and Blues that our great-grandparents would have shimmied to in the juke joints, speakeasies, woolsheds and Memorial Halls of 1920s New Zealand.
Although this combo has a mere 4 members, it has the impact of a full Syncopating-Orchestra, with multiple instruments being played simultaneously by multiple band members.
Blair “Sweet-Lips” Latham - Clarinet, Bass Clarinet, Tenor Saxophone
Mat “Mon Colonel” Enright - Trumpet, Resonator Guitar, Vocals
Adrian “AJ” Jensen - Gypsy Guitar, Bass Drum
Daniel “Pappy” Yeabsley -Tuba, Hi-Hat.
William Jackman will be supporting He will be on at 8.30, and The DADS about 9.15.
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Wellington Crack Chicken x Heinz Fried Chicken Sauce Pop-Up, Heinz’s fan-favourite Fried Chicken Sauce has finally landed in Aotearoa, and it’s making its NZ debut in style – with a limited-time pop-up collab at Crack Chicken. - Plus the option to add the new Heinz Fried Chicken Sauce to anything and everything on the menu.

Where:
- Crack Chicken Ponsonby – 168 Ponsonby Road, Auckland
- Crack Chicken Hamilton - Made Mess Hall - 401 Grey Street, Hamilton East
- Crack Chicken Willis Lane – 1 Willis Street, Wellington Central
- Crack Chicken North City - North City Mall – Porirua

description:
Whisky Galore Tasting: Kilchoman 20th Anniversary Tour, Founded in 2005 by Anthony and Kathy Wills, Kilchoman was the first distillery to be built on the island of Islay for over 120 years. In the 20 years since its founding, the Wills family remain driving force behind Kilchoman, keeping the traditions of farm-to-bottle whisky making alive on Islay.

Since their first visit to New Zealand in 2007, the Wills and their whisky have garnered an enthusiastic following, and it is with great pleasure that the team at Whisky Galore announce the 20th Anniversary Tour of Kilchoman, proudly presented by Catherine MacMillan, Brand manager for the distillery.

Join our very special guest Catherine MacMillan, all the way from the Isle of Islay in Scotland, for an evening celebrating the 20th anniversary of Kilchoman. This tasting is a celebration of all things Kilchoman for the past 2 decades, including several of the brand-new, limited edition 20th anniversary whiskies.

description:
WineDogs - Martinborough, We’re back – and it’s going to be better than ever.
Love Wine?
Love Dogs?
Then Winedogs is a must-do on your calendar this spring.

After selling out in 2023 and again in 2024, we’re heading to Luna Estate in Martinborough for our Wairarapa debut on Sunday 26 October 2025 – and we’re bringing the full winedogs experience with us.

Whether you're a past guest or brand new to the pack, this is your chance to join a community of dog lovers, wine drinkers, and people who know how to spend a Sunday in style.

Date: Sunday 26 October 2025
Time: 10am – 5pm
Location: Luna Estate Winery, Martinborough

What to expect:
Sip stroll and socialise with your pup this Spring at Luna Estate Vineyard! Enjoy a walk around Martinborough’s most picturesque vineyard with wine and dog treats along the way, followed by a dog friendly festival!
And the fun doesn’t stop after the walk.

We’ll have:
Fashion parades (yes, for the dogs too)
Prizes for best-dressed dog and best matching human/dog pair
Photo booths
Food trucks, music, wine, and chill zones to kick back for the afternoon
You don’t need to own a dog to come – you just have to love dogs.

Ticket Options:
Early Dog Admission: $50 – SOLD OUT
General Admission: $65
VIP Ticket: $150 – includes exclusive area, VIP menu, Luna Sparkling Wine, premium dog treats and a few surprises

Book now and don’t miss out →
A round of a-paws to our hosts, Luna Estate, for welcoming the winedogs crew to their incredible vineyard. This is one event you’ll want to be part of – whether you’re returning for another round, or joining us for the first time.

See you (and your dog) there.

description:
Affordable Healthcare for All: Wellington, Luxon’s cuts are making our health system worse. His choices mean it’s getting harder and more expensive to see a doctor or nurse. 
National has found hundreds of millions for tobacco companies while New Zealand’s hospitals go understaffed and nurses are left without jobs. 
It's Luxon's fault GP fees are heading towards $100. Under National, you’re paying more, waiting longer and getting less. 
Labour believes that every New Zealander should be able to access world-class healthcare, no matter where they live. 
We will make it cheaper and easier to get care close to home, and make sure hospitals are there when you need them.  
Join Labour Leader Chris Hipkins and Health Spokesperson Dr Ayesha Verrall for a public meeting on getting the healthcare you deserve.

description:
Book Launch - Isaac Featherston 'Petatone': A Colonial Life, Join us next month to launch Isaac Featherston 'Petatone': A Colonial Life by John E Martin. The book will be launched by Charlotte MacDonald.

Tuesday 7 October, 6pm
Unity Books Wellington
All welcome!

'Existing views of Featherston are fragmentary, negative and not very satisfactory. He was the “little Doctor”, a single-minded despot wielding tyrannical power and casting an oppressive shadow. As I began to understand more of his life, I realised that there was little appreciation of a man who had contributed so much.’ —John E.Martin

Isaac Featherston was at the heart of some of the most significant developments in New Zealand from the 1840s colonisation by the New Zealand Company to the abolition of the provinces in 1876. A doctor, newspaper editor and politician, he advocated for the provinces against the domination of central government, while also being primarily responsible for the relocation of the capital from Auckland to Wellington in 1865.

Known amongst Māori as ‘Petatone’ and with a reputation for directness and honesty, he was at the very centre of Pākehā–Māori relations, and in his 1857 official portrait is depicted alongside leading rangatira Te Puni and Wi Tako.

About the author: Dr. John E. Martin has researched and written about New Zealand history since the 1980s, teaching in universities and employed as a historian in the public sector. He was parliamentary historian in the 2000s and 2010s. His publications include rural and labour history, the history of science and engineering, and social and political history. His books include The Forgotten Worker (1990), People, Politics and Power Stations (1991 and 1998), Holding the Balance (1996), The House: New Zealand’s House of Representatives, 1854–2004 (2004), Parliament’s Library (2008), Honouring the Contract (2010), Illuminating Our World (2017), A Colonist’s Gaze (2018) and most recently Empire City: Wellington Becomes the Capital of New Zealand (2022).

description:
China and the Media Landscape in the Pacific, Over the last decade, the People’s Republic of China has sought to deepen its ties with Pacific Island countries. Beijing’s efforts to cultivate influence in the region have included expanding economic, diplomatic, and security ties with Pacific Island nations, as well as expanding China’s footprint in the region’s media landscape. This talk will present the findings of recent research on China’s efforts to shape reporting, media coverage and narratives in the Pacific Islands and put Beijing’s efforts within the context of the region’s rapidly evolving information landscape.
 About the speakers:
Heidi Holz is a Senior Research Scientist at CNA. For close to two decades, her work has focused on PRC strategic communications, propaganda, and influence efforts. She is a graduate of Georgetown University’s School of Foreign Service, where she received a master’s degree in security studies and a bachelor’s degree in Chinese and East Asian history.
Genevieve Collins is a research specialist in the China Studies program at CNA, where her research focuses on the behaviour of China’s state-run media and its reactions to US military operations and activities.
 Barbara Dreaver (Discussant) has been the Pacific Reporter for TVNZ 1 News since 2002, breaking stories uncovering social and economic issues affecting Pacific people living in New Zealand and the Pacific Islands. In 2020, she created a two-year training programme through Pacific Cooperation Broadcasting Ltd to support new Pacific journalists across the Pacific region. In the 2024 New Years Honours she was awarded an ONZM for services to investigative journalism and Pacific communities.
 About CNA: CNA is a non-profit, non-governmental research and analysis organization dedicated to providing independent and objective analyses to the U.S. government and the public. This talk will build on previous CNA research on China and the Pacific Islands media landscape which you can find at www.cna.org.

description:
Government Digital Transformation in Latin America - what can we learn?, We are excited to announce the latest in our series of talks on Digital Transformation, in partnership with Silverstripe.
María Inés Baque will be joining us online from Argentina to share her expert insights and experiences on the key goals, capabilities, opportunities and challenges for government digital transformation - with a range of use cases from around Latin America.
María Inés Baque is Government Transformation Advisor for Latin America, Canada, and the Caribbean (LCC) at AWS. She served as secretary of digital government and technology innovation in Argentina from 2016 to 2019. She coordinated the Digital Agenda 2030 and led the transformational efforts in the areas of digital services, digital inclusion, open government, open data and new technologies adoption.
Global awards and recognitions she has received include Innovation Lab, Tel Aviv, 20 exceptional GovTech Leaders (2020), Women Corporate Directors 2019 and The 100 Most Influential People in Digital Government, Apolitical, 2018.
She was co-chair of the G20 Digital Economy Taskforce for Gender Inclusion in 2018 that issued the Bridging the Digital Gender Divide report.
Before government, her career was in global IT and financial services enterprises. She focused on process reengineering, startups, IT management, outsourcing and business process operations.
You may attend in person at the MBIE offices (limited to 40 people - there will be some food courtesy of Silverstripe), or you may tune in online via Microsoft Teams (the link will be at the bottom of your order confirmation email). If you choose to attend in person please arrive at 11.50am so there is time for you to sign in, pick up some food, and be seated before we begin. There will be time for questions after the presentation.

description:
From Vision to Action, Wellingtonians have spoken. Thousands of voices have come together to help create A Vision for Wellington — a bold, pragmatic blueprint for our city’s future, backed by findings from independent research.
Now it’s time to hear how those who want to lead our city will respond.
We’ll begin with a short presentation of the Vision itself — celebrating the thousands of Wellingtonians who shaped it, and the bold blueprint they’ve helped create for our city’s future.
Then we’ll put the hottest issues on the table: like how to rebuild trust in leadership, how to get Wellington back in business and affordable again, and how to restore pride and energy to the heart of the city.
This is your chance to test the candidates’ ideas against a Vsion created by thousands of Wellingtonians — and to put your own questions to them as you decide your vote.
Harbourside Function Venue is located above Macs Brewery on the waterfront. Arrive from 5:00pm for a 5:30 start.
Free entry, registration essential. Spaces are limited.

description:
HRCA 50yrs Misuse of Drugs Act: What impact? What next?, Rutherford House (by the train station)
Room RHLT2
Bunny Street
Wellington
1.30-4.30pm
Free Admission
Light refreshments afterward
The NZ Misuse of Drugs Act 1975 (MoDA) has failed to deliver. Data from the United Nations Office for Drugs and Crime indicated the demand for drugs is greater than ever, while the supply of drugs knows no bounds.
A failure acknowledged globally and one we witness first hand here in Aotearoa NZ.
Back in 2011 a comprehensive review of the MoDA conducted by New Zealand Law Commission had already concluded the MoDA “should be repealed and replaced by a new Act …administered by the Ministry of Health”.
The Harm Reduction Coalition of Aotearoa wants to see that recommendation enacted.
We are delighted to have assembled a group of respected independent thinkers in the field, with vast experience of drug policy in Aotearoa and beyond, to reflect on the impact of the MoDA and to identify the principles and values needed to underpin new drug laws.
Warren Young
Professor of Law & Former Deputy President New Zealand Law Commission
Kirsten Gibson
Chair of Harm Reduction Coalition Aotearoa and Qualitative Researcher
Fiona Hutton
Associate Professor, Institute of Criminology, Victoria University of Wellington
Adam Dorsett
40 Years Living Experience of Prohibited Drug Use, in Prison for 25 years
Julian Buchanan
Former UNODC Advisor and Criminology Professor
New Zealand has a history for world leading innovative policy reform: Woman’s Right to Vote; Decriminalisation of Sex Work; National Needle Exchange, Same Sex Marriage and most recently Drug Checking.
This half day symposium will provide clear evidence why major law reform is necessary and detail the foundations upon which Aotearoa NZ can once again lead the way with new drug laws based on evidence, research and experience.
We look forward to seeing there!
Do pass on to anyone who might be interested.

description:
It's in the Ballot - CDC – Carterton District Mayoral Debate -In-studio, Contestants of 'It's in the Bag' become political candidates in 'It's in the Ballot' Meet the Candidates.
Candidates choose a numbered box which has a question that has been submitted online by voters before the show.
It’s in the Ballot” is a community-led awareness and participation initiative. We aim to increase voter interest in the general and council elections nationally.
By using broadcasting and web-based technologies to deliver in-studio; online on Facebook, YouTube and Twitch; and edited as YouTube videos we aim to enable voters to make informed voting decisions.
This means you can send the weblink of the YouTube Video of your electorate show to your friends and whanau to encourage them to watch the show before they cast their votes.
Voting papers are sent to voters on Tuesday 9th September 2025 and must be delivered into a voting dropbox by 12pm Saturday 11th October 2025

description:
It's in the Ballot - CDC – Carterton Councilor at Large -In-studio, Contestants of 'It's in the Bag' become political candidates in 'It's in the Ballot' Meet the Candidates.
Candidates choose a numbered box which has a question that has been submitted online by voters before the show.
It’s in the Ballot” is a community-led awareness and participation initiative. We aim to increase voter interest in the general and council elections nationally.
By using broadcasting and web-based technologies to deliver in-studio; online on Facebook, YouTube and Twitch; and edited as YouTube videos we aim to enable voters to make informed voting decisions.
This means you can send the weblink of the YouTube Video of your electorate show to your friends and whanau to encourage them to watch the show before they cast their votes.
Voting papers are sent to voters on Tuesday 9th September 2025 and must be delivered into a voting dropbox by 12pm Saturday 11th October 2025

description:
Running Into The Sun, Running Into The Sun
After exploding onto the Australian scene, a2 Company bring their euphoric hour of award-winning physical theatre home to Pōneke

About this Event

After winning Best Theatre at the Melbourne Fringe, Running into the Sun comes home to Pōneke for the first time. The 10 creatives in a2 Company create an “exhausting but exhilarating” story of what it means to be alive right now with live music, dance, and theatre.
It’s graduation night. Ash and Mary discover they are pregnant. A flash flood hits their hometown. The war crimes overseas become more horrifying.
Running into the Sun is “messy, joyous, heartfelt and completely off the chain.”
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Meet the Candidates | Paraparaumu, Meet the Candidates | Paraparaumu
These events are organised by Kāpiti Coast District Council. To see the full list of Council organised 'Meet the Candidates' events, visit www.kapiticoast.govt.nz/meetthecandidates

Except for the mayoral debate, which will be a facilitated debate dedicated to mayoral candidates, our Meet the Candidate events will involve inviting all candidates running for Mayor, districtwide Councillor, Māori Ward Councillor, and Ward Councillor and Community Board Member positions for that ward to attend.

They will each be provided a dedicated space for them to present their candidacy and have conversations with the community who can attend at any time during the two-hour slots.

Meet the Candidates events help voters:
🔹 meet and hear from candidates
🔹 learn where they stand on issues affecting our District
🔹 make informed decisions when voting in the local elections 2025.

Safe public spaces is core Council business. We believe that a network of protected bike lanes is an essential part of a safe and modern city that seeks to attract growth businesses and their staff. Wellington has made good progress but we need to keep going.
Hear about Council candidates' visions and plans for Wellington.
Please join members of Wellington’s cycling community for an informal meeting.

description:
Show me the shorts - Aotearoa, New Zealand filmmakers are known for their iconic coming-of-age stories, lush farmland locations and rich cultural traditions. They are also celebrated for their innovative world-building and bold, original ideas.
The short films in this collection demonstrate all of that and more. Classic Kiwi actors Rawiri Paratene, Ginette McDonald, Nathanial Lees and Katlyn Wong headline.
Meanwhile magical realism and science fiction worlds creep into the lexicon of Aotearoa.
Run time: 99 min
Rating: M - Offensive language, domestic violence themes & suicide themes.
