description:
Men's Circle: Honest Conversations & Connection, Men's Circle: Honest Conversations & Connection
Men’s Circle: Honest Conversations & Connection

In a world where men are often expected to have everything figured out, this gathering offers a space to be genuine, not perfect.

This is a free event, with an optional plant-based dinner available for $15. While there’s no obligation to stay for dinner, sharing a meal together offers a meaningful way to strengthen connections. Andre and Sri Jiva co-host this circle with a shared passion for creating authentic, supportive spaces where men can connect deeply—offering this gathering simply because they believe in its importance.

The Men’s Circle provides a safe and nurturing environment where men can share openly, express their feelings, and encourage personal growth—free from societal pressures to be stoic or self-reliant. Through honest sharing and collective support, participants build resilience, deepen self-awareness, and strengthen their sense of identity and purpose.

Structure of the Circle

Gathering in a Circle: Participants sit in a circle to symbolize equality and unity.

A short meditation or moment of silence may be included to help everyone arrive and connect.

Talking Object: A sharing stick or object is placed in the center. Only the person holding the object may speak, ensuring uninterrupted sharing.

Open Sharing: Anyone may choose to share while holding the object. Sharing is optional, and passing is always respected.

Active Listening: While one person shares, others listen attentively without speaking, interrupting, or offering advice. The focus is on witnessing and being present.

No Judgments or Advice: Participants refrain from judging or offering unsolicited advice, creating a safe space for authentic expression.

Closing: The circle may conclude with a group reflection, a moment of gratitude, or a simple acknowledgment of the shared experience.

Circle Agreements

Supportive Environment: We are here to uplift and support one another, fostering trust and brotherhood.

Focus on the Present: Share what's alive for you now, focusing on your emotions and experiences to deepen emotional awareness.

Use "I" Statements: Speak from your personal perspective using "I" statements to promote authenticity and responsibility. Avoid generalizations like "we" or "us."

No Judgment or fixing: Refrain from judging others sharing or offering unsolicited advice, ensuring a safe and non-critical space.

Confidentiality: What is shared in the circle stays in the circle. You may discuss your own experience outside the group, but keep others' details private.

Meet Andre and Sri Jiva, your hosts

Andre has been immersed in men’s work since the age of 13, when he first experienced a rite of passage in Golden Bay. That formative experience sparked a lifelong connection to circle work, which he later deepened by returning as a mentor. A multi-instrumental musician, poet, and pranayama (breathwork) facilitator, Andre also brings his passion for ecstatic dance, philosophy, and authentic connection into his offerings. He is deeply inspired by the question of what it means to be human—how we can more fully experience our aliveness, our depth, and reconnecting with the beauty of life together.

Since childhood, Sri Jiva has been fascinated by meaning, purpose, and authentic life fulfilment. This, among other things, led him to join a monastery at the age of 19. After years of monastic training, he chose to marry and pursue a career. He felt called to use his monastic experience to help others understand themselves, and to find wisdom, meaning, and purpose in their own lives. Inspired by this calling, he went to university to study counselling. Now, Sri Jiva and his wife live near Wellington, where he works with a small team of counsellors, supporting clients individually and in groups.

description:
50yrs Misuse of Drugs Act: What impact & what next?, The 1975 Misuse of Drugs Act (MoDA) has failed to deliver. Data from the United Nations Office for Drugs and Crime indicates the demand for drugs is greater than ever, while the supply of drugs knows no bounds. The failure and harm caused by the so called 'War on Drugs' is acknowledged globally and witnessed first hand here in Aotearoa New Zealand.

Back in 2011 a comprehensive review of the MoDA conducted by New Zealand Law Commission recommended the MoDA “should be repealed and replaced by a new Act …administered by the Ministry of Health”. HRCA wants to see that recommendation enacted.

New Zealand has a history for bold world leading policy reform: Woman’s Right to Vote; Decriminalisation of Sex Work; National Needle Exchange, Same Sex Marriage and most recently Drug Checking.

This half day Symposium will provide clear evidence why major law reform is necessary and detail the foundations upon which Aotearoa NZ can once again be innovative and lead the way with new drug laws based on evidence, research and experience -providing a safer environment for future generation.

Harm Reduction Coalition Aotearoa are delighted to have assembled a group of respected independent thinkers with vast experience of drug policy in Aotearoa and beyond, to reflect on the impact of the MoDA and to identify the principles and values needed to underpin new drug laws.

Warren Young: Prof. of Law & Former Deputy President New Zealand Law Commission.
Kirsten Gibson: Chair of Harm Reduction Coalition Aotearoa and Qualitative Researcher.
Fiona Hutton: Associate Prof. Institute of Criminology, Victoria University of Wellington.
Adam Dorsett: 40 yrs Living/Lived Experience of Prohibited Drug Use, 25yrs in Prison.
Julian Buchanan: Former UNODC Advisor and Criminology Professor.

NOTE:
This event is free and open to the public on a 'first come first served' basis.
However, eventfinda ticket holders will be guaranteed a seat.

He’s a monk, global speaker, and author of over 25 books, and has shared his insights at top universities like Yale and Princeton, as well as companies including Microsoft and Intel. description:
'WOMB WOMEN' Workshop for Women, IMAGINE...100 THOUSAND GRANDMOTHERS SPANNING BACK THROUGH 2.5 MILLION YEARS OF HUMANITY. ONE WOMAN GIVING BIRTH TO THE NEXT, ON AND ON THROUGH TIME, UNTIL HERE AND NOW.

This is AN INVITATION TO COME PLAY, to create with your own hands little Womb Women in honour of your own matriarchal lineage … with hands that have been created from the DNA of all your ancestors before you.
As I sit and sculpt each woman, I become deeply aware that the bone and flesh of my own hands hold the DNA of all my grandmothers. How many of them had their own stories of shaping clay, forming sculptural figures, moulding pots .. what was it my grandmother of 200 thousand years ago created I wonder. 
Through the evolution of humanity, the hands of approximately 100 thousand womb to womb women of my unique bloodline have given birth to my own. Our shared DNA forms these hands which are now shaping clay.
Each one of us has our own special womb to womb lineage, with a unique tone particular only to us, perhaps similar to another, however no one female whakapapa is truly the same.  
Perhaps you will have a particular mother or grandmother in mind as you create, imbuing their passed down wisdom into the clay figurine, perhaps the little woman you make will symbolize your entire line, calling up the flavour of your own unique lineage, or perhaps she is you and represents your own story … or maybe she will hold for you the wisdom of the ancient mother that resides within us all. 
DO COME JOIN US for an afternoon of making your own little womb women.
NO EXPERIENCE NEEDED, simply bring a curiosity and willingness to play, surrounded by other humans doing just the same.
PRACTACALITIES,
bring a cushion and blanket (you may prefer to sit comfortably on the floor as you make - there will also be tables and chairs available)
if you are already familiar with clay and have your own favorite hand tools please feel free to bring these
snacks and hot/cold beverages will be available
Workshop cost includes supplies, materials and firing. I will fire your creation then post it back to you, therefore postage will be extra and determined once packaged up.
PLEASE NOTE!!! This booking is for FRIDAY 5TH SEPTEMBER
                                              ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
“Within the DNA is written not only our histories as individuals but the whole history of the human race … patterns of DNA that have come down to us virtually unchanged from our distant ancestors – ancestors who are no longer just an abstract entity but real people who lived in conditions very different from those we enjoy today, who survived them and brought up their children.” ~ Bryan Sykes (The Seven Daughters of Eve)
Return to MAIN EXHIBITION WEBSITE - link coming soon

description:
Posture Perfection Is Possible, Are you a computer slouch, feeling stiff and tense at work? Do you find it difficult to maintain a good posture? Does your posture cause back, neck or shoulder tension? Would you like to enjoy more freedom in everyday activities?

Under the guidance of an experienced teacher, we'll explore movement in ways that help you reduce tense unhelpful habits. Movement lessons are done on the floor or sitting on a chair and are based on the pioneering work of Israeli physicist and engineer Dr. Moshe Feldenkrais. This workshop is suitable for all ages (over 16) and fitness levels.

Outcomes
By the end of the workshop, you'll be able to:
- Identify and reduce muscle tension
- Move with more lightness and freedom
- Improve your posture
- Describe some basic anatomy
- Have tools to use at home and at work

Bring two blankets (or a mat and a blanket) and wear loose, warm and comfortable clothing. Tea and coffee provided but bring your lunch.

Please note that instructions are given verbally rather than by demonstration, so good hearing and understanding of English is required.

1 Day
Presented by Sue Field.

description:
Peace Over Panic: Rewiring the Anxious Mind, Peace Over Panic: Rewiring the Anxious Mind
Tuesday Wellbeing Seminars
How do we respond when the mind spirals, when uncertainty clouds our judgement, or when we find ourselves at a personal breaking point? This workshop draws from ancient and time-tested wisdom found in yoga philosophy — especially the Bhagavad Gita — to explore how anxiety and inner conflict can become turning points for insight and conscious action.
Rather than avoiding or suppressing discomfort, the Gita offers a way to meet it — with clarity, honesty, and meaningful direction. Through a blend of philosophical reflection and grounded tools, we’ll explore how to steady the mind and reconnect with deeper purpose in the face of pressure or doubt.


Meet your host, Sivananda
Sivananda’s background is in both science and music, holding a Master's Degree in Data Science, a Bachelor of Science in Physics and a long history of playing and performing on the double bass. His passion for philosophy, music, good food and community attracted him to the bhakti lifestyle. Having studied and practiced the science of the ‘self’ for six years now, he thrives on drawing insights from contemporary science and combining it with yoga wisdom to encourage others to explore new perspectives.
6.15pm Tuesday 19th August
End the session on a high note with a delicious plant-based dinner, dessert, and good conversation.

care for a disabled child, a neurodivergent child, or a child with health impairments.

Parent to Parent hosts monthly Parent Support Groups in Miramar to support carers and parents just like you. These groups are a safe space for family and whānau to share their experiences, their challenges, their triumphs, and to learn from each other in an open and 100% judgement-free environment. No topic is too ‘weird’, no question too ‘out there’. We get it, and we are here to help.

So if you’d like to share a struggle, celebrate a success, raise a concern, or simply have a cuppa and chat with other parents and carers in your area, you are always welcome at our Parent Support Group. Children are welcome too! Drop in for as long or as short a time as you want. And did we mention there’s free coffee??

No need to RSVP, feel free to just show up on the day!

Guided by experienced, mature facilitators, each session is thoughtfully crafted to engage all your senses, nurturing the body, mind, and spirit. Suitable for all levels, the experience is holistic, embodied, and gently transformative. Take a journey, slow down, and allow time and space for insight, creativity, and connection.

In this self-empowering process, you will be supported to let go as much as you can, so you have a sense of spaciousness and can then bring in what it is you are currently seeking.

description:
Return to Love - Healing the Divine Masculine & Feminine (Group Shamanic Journeying), Return to Love - Healing the Divine Masculine & Feminine (Group Shamanic Journeying)
✨Return to Love – A Shamanic Journey of Healing the Divine Masculine & Feminine

Relationships are some of our greatest teachers. Whether you are single or partnered, whether your past experiences were harmonious or painful, each relationship reflects the inner dance of the masculine and feminine within us.

Throughout history, these sacred energies—Yin and Yang—were meant to complement and support each other. Yet, distortions, suppression, and separation have created wounds that echo through generations. Many of us carry beliefs such as:

Men cannot be trusted.
Women are not safe.
Love must be earned.
......

Rarely do we pause to sit with these wounds and meet the unhealed parts of our inner feminine and masculine. These energies may hold not only personal pain but also ancestral imprints passed down through time—shaping the way we experience love and connection today.

🌿 In this mini workshop, you will be guided through a shamanic journey to explore and heal your inner archetypes. Together, we will:

✨ Release old wounds and limiting patterns carried by the inner feminine or masculine.
✨ Make peace with the shadow side of our psyche.
✨ Embody the wholeness of the Divine Masculine and Feminine within.

We will close our circle with a sacred forgiveness ritual, bridging the separation and returning to a state of balance, wholeness, and love.

This journey is open to everyone—whether you are new to shamanic work or have walked this path before. All that is required is an open heart and willingness to connect deeply within.

🌸 You’ll leave with:

A renewed sense of love and harmony within yourself.
Greater balance between your inner masculine and feminine.
A deeper connection to spirit, self, and the essence of oneness.

Event Details
📅 Sunday, September 21st
🕒 3:00–6:00 pm
📍 Lotus Yoga Centre – Sanctuary, Paraparaumu
💫 Energy Exchange: $55 per person
🌿 Limited to 12 participants

✨What to bring:
A water bottle, journal, cushion or blanket for comfort.

🚗 Rides from Wellington may be arranged—please contact me if needed.Contact: 0272541272

About Your Guide - Fery Qiu

I am a Shamanic Healer who is committed to the healing path that help people heal from the core of their being. From suicidal depression to shamanic path, my spirituality is not based on how many trainings, meditations, and ceremonies I have done, it’s coming from a deep embodied experience to transform pain into wisdom and empowerment. The shamanic path is a way of being; we allow ourselves to go deeper within to connect all things that come from oneness. I loved my work, which has been proven to help people really change their lives. If you are curious about what this mini workshop could bring, having an open mind and open heart, you will be surprised by how much can be done just in this brief journey within.



With love,
Fery Qiu

description:
She Rises: Spring Edition, When was the last time you truly paused?
Not just for a moment between tasks, but long enough to breathe and focus on your own wellbeing?

On the eve of Spring, join us for an afternoon, designed to nourish your soul, rejuvenate your energy and awaken the inspiration you need for the season ahead.
As a business owner, Leadership Coach and active mum of four, Sina Mikaio knows the importance of taking the time to escape the hustle and reset each season. That’s why she created She Rises - Spring Edition. An opportunity for you to step away from the noise, let go of the schedules and reconnect with your own inner wisdom.

Who Is This Workshop For?
This intimate gathering is for the women who:
Feels like she is holding it all—career, family and relationships—and is yearning for a space to finally let go.
Knows she wants more from life, but is seeking clarity on what that is and how to get there.
Is ready to release the stories of self doubt and exhaustion that have been holding her back.
Craves connection not only with herself, but with a circle of like-minded women who just "get it."

What To Expect: Your Journey
Your journey through this immersive afternoon will be woven through three powerful pillars:
Movement: Beginning with a nourishing yoga flow designed to release stored energy from the body, clear your mind and open your channels to receive your own guidance. (All levels welcome).
Mindset: A deep dive into your personal energy. You will learn how it impacts your presence, identify where you are leaking energy, release what no longer serves you and get crystal clear on what you want to call in.
Manifestation: A powerful guided visualisation to connect you with your deepest intuition. This practice will help bring your ideas forth, give you clarity on your next steps and provide you with the tools to build a purposeful pathway towards your goals.

You Will Leave With:
Clarity on your path for the season ahead
Unshakeable Confidence in your own wisdom, intelligence and power
The Courage to take aligned action towards a life you truly love
Actionable tools to regulate your nervous system and manage your energy daily.
A profound sense of feeling grounded, inspired and aligned within yourself.

Tickets available to purchase via eventbrite link below:

https://www.eventbrite.co.nz/e/she-rises-spring-edition-tickets-1550395166679?aff=oddtdtcreator
label: Health & Wellness

description:
(Re)generation next: The Poet Laureate steps down, Aotearoa New Zealand Poet Laureate Chris Tse marks the end of his term in this exciting evening with fellow poets Ken Arkind, Cadence Chung, Gregory O’Brien, Chris Price, and Ruby Solly.
Reflections on the future
Join Chris at the National Library to mark the end of his time in the role with his reflections on the future of Aotearoa New Zealand poetry and readings from special guests.
"I left the doors to the past and the future unlocked ... "
Chris Tse’s three-year term as Aotearoa New Zealand Poet Laureate ends on Phantom Billstickers National Poetry Day, when the next Poet Laureate will be announced: https://www.nzbookawards.nz/nat.../2016-national-poetry-day/
About the speakers
Chris Tse (he/him) was born and raised in Lower Hutt, New Zealand. He studied film and English literature at Victoria University of Wellington, where he also completed an MA in Creative Writing at the International Institute of Modern Letters. In 2022, he was named the 13th New Zealand Poet Laureate. His poetry, short fiction, and non-fiction have been recorded for radio and widely published in numerous journals, magazines and anthologies. He has published several collections of poetry and his latest book Super Model Minority (2022) was longlisted for the Ockham New Zealand Book Awards 2023.
Ken Arkind is an American poet, author, performer, and educator originating from Steamboat Springs in Colorado. He holds the 2006 title of the American National Poetry Slam Champion and the 2010 title of Nuyorican Poets Cafe Grand Slam Champion. Ken now resides in Auckland and is a recent graduate from the Manukau Institute of Technology’s Creative Arts Programme.
Cadence Chung (she/they) is a poet, student, and musician from Wellington, currently studying at the New Zealand School of Music. Her poems started being published in her junior years of high school, and her debut chapbook anomalia was published by We Are Babies Press in April 2022. Her writing takes inspiration from antique stores, Tumblr text posts, and dead poets.
Gregory O’Brien is a poet, painter, author, curator, and editor. His most recent poetry publication is a collection of poems and paintings, House and contents (2022). Other recent publications include a book-length meditation on the Pacific, Always song in the water (2019) and the Ockham award winning book Don Binney: Flight Path (2023).

Temple • Breath • Sound & Gong Bath, Temple • Breath • Sound & Gong Bath
𝗘𝗧𝗛𝗘𝗥 – 𝗧𝗲𝗺𝗽𝗹𝗲 𝗼𝗳 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗦𝘁𝗮𝗿𝘀
A Breath, Sound & Silence Journey ✨🌌🌬

Held by the Heavens | Bathed in Stillness | Anchored in Cosmic Light

𝗝𝗢𝗨𝗥𝗡𝗘𝗬 𝗕𝗘𝗬𝗢𝗡𝗗 𝗧𝗛𝗘 𝗩𝗘𝗜𝗟 — 𝗪𝗛𝗘𝗥𝗘 𝗦𝗢𝗨𝗟 𝗠𝗘𝗘𝗧𝗦 𝗦𝗧𝗔𝗥𝗗𝗨𝗦𝗧 🌌🪐✨️🏕🌠

Nestled within a sacred Sanctuary under the starlit skies of Paraparaumu, you are invited to enter the realm of Ether — the invisible thread that weaves all of life. Here, the boundaries between body, breath, and spirit begin to dissolve into the spaciousness of the cosmos.

Cradled by silence, expanded through breath, and elevated by sound, this ceremony is a subtle, sacred transmission — a remembrance of your soul’s celestial origin.

This soulscape will guide you through:

• Gentle Breathwork to still the body and awaken presence
• Blue Lotus Ritual to open the heart and third eye
• Crystal Singing Bowls & Celestial Light Language
• Shamanic Gong encoded with Star Frequencies
• Intuitive Energy Transmissions
• Integration through Sacred Stillness

𝗕𝗟𝗨𝗘 𝗟𝗢𝗧𝗨𝗦 𝗥𝗜𝗧𝗨𝗔𝗟

Blue Lotus, known as the Flower of the Heavens, has been revered in ancient Egyptian and Eastern traditions as a plant of intuition, divination, and deep heart awakening. As you connect with the energy of Blue Lotus you are invited to soften your edges and expand your awareness into dream-like states — where insight, creativity, and emotional release naturally unfold. She is the guardian of the liminal realms, ushering you gently into etheric remembrance.

𝗕𝗘𝗡𝗘𝗙𝗜𝗧𝗦 𝗢𝗙 𝗧𝗛𝗜𝗦 𝗝𝗢𝗨𝗥𝗡𝗘𝗬:
• Deep Nervous System Regulation
• Heightened Intuition & Expanded Consciousness
• Enhanced Sleep & Dream States
• Emotional Release without Over-Processing
• Alignment with Soul & Cosmic Frequencies
• Gentle Detoxification & Energetic Clearing
• Cellular Recalibration & Vibrational Healing
• Connection to Divine Feminine & Cosmic Womb
• Inner Peace, Stillness & Mental Clarity

𝗔𝗕𝗢𝗨𝗧 𝗧𝗛𝗘 𝗦𝗔𝗖𝗥𝗘𝗗 𝗦𝗔𝗡𝗖𝗧𝗨𝗔𝗥𝗬
Nestled in the hills beside the Lotus Yoga Centre rests a sacred Meditation Sanctuary
a place where many come to reconnect, find inner stillness, and bathe in peace.

Built in 1999, this Sanctuary serves as the spiritual heart of the Centre’s activities.
The location itself was chosen with great care, resting at the meeting point of powerful ley lines, its energy deeply aligned with Kapiti Island and the Maungakotukutuku ranges to the east.

The octagon-shaped structure is crafted from natural timbers, crowned with a glass pyramid roof that amplifies and channels healing energies. Around its frame, tinted windows radiate the seven colours of the rainbow—each one carrying a unique healing ray. On a bright day, the play of colours is nothing short of spectacular, filling the space with a living rainbow of light.

𝙒𝙃𝘼𝙏 𝙏𝙊 𝙀𝙓𝙋𝙀𝘾𝙏:
• Doors open at 3.00PM for grounding & Blue Lotus
• Ceremony opens with breath & intention-setting
• 60-minute sound and silence journey in the sacred SANCTUARY.
• Integration circle to gently return and reflect
• Closing around 5:30PM

Your only task is to arrive with presence and openness, ready to receive what is already waiting within you.

description:
The Check-in Men's Group Tuesday 23 Sept, To join this community, and book your Tuesdays - please sign up here first, and we will email you the event access code. (our venue address will be emailed with your ticket).

This is a space for men to talk honestly, listen deeply, and figure some things out together. It’s not about having it all sorted. You don’t need to be a certain type of guy. Just show up as you are, with no pressure to speak or share.
Open group: new faces are welcome
Flexible: book to come when it suits you. Each Tuesday is a new event. Most will try for fortnightly.
Small groups: 8 men + 2 experienced hosts
Inclusive: all ages, backgrounds and identities (18+)
It's about connection and showing up, instead of going it alone. It makes time for meeting our various challenges, while learning and growing us into better friends, partners, dads, sons and humans. 
It isn’t a boys or bros club, therapy or a self-help seminar, religious or new-age. No fixing, preaching, or pressure. It’s not a crisis service or a substitute for professional care. The sign-up form explains this in more detail.
You can expect to:
Practice listening and learn communication skills for life
Discover greater integrity and self-accountability
Be supported in building your emotional intelligence
Become a part of a hearty and diverse community
Have a good time - it’s often uplifting and inspiring.
Joseph and your team of hosts have all been in regular men's groups for many years. The group sometimes offers simple proven inquiries that draw on NVC, MBSR, active listening, gratitude and more.
label: Health & Wellness

description:
The Healthy Hospo Stress Reset: Sauna • Ice Bath • Breathwork • Community - Auckland, Healthy Hospo and Hospitality New Zealand are excited to invite you to…
The Hospo Stress Reset: Sauna • Ice Bath • Breathwork • Community
We’re all told that stress is bad. Chronic stress can lead to burnout and serious health issues. But what if stress itself isn’t the enemy? What if learning how to work with stress could actually make it a powerful tool for resilience, energy, and performance?
With hospitality gearing up for peak season, this is your chance to reset, recharge, and equip yourself with the tools to stay calm and in control when things get busy.
Join Healthy Hospo and Hospitality New Zealand for a unique experiential workshop designed just for hospo. Across this 2-hour session, you’ll experience:
·       Interactive Breathwork, led by our resident Breathwork & Physiology expert, Josh Fankhauser, to help you manage stress and shift your state on demand.
·       Hot/Cold Contrast Therapy, a guided community sauna and ice bath experience with Sauna Collective, to boost recovery, improve focus, and leave you feeling re-energised.
·       Practical Tools for Everyday Life. Strategies you can take back to your workplace (and your own wellbeing) to help you thrive through peak season.

 Times: Three sessions to choose from, each capped at 16 people so spaces will go fast!
·       9:00 – 10:45am
·       11:00 – 12:45pm
·       1:15 – 3:00pm
What to Bring
·       Swim suit
·       2 x Towels (one for sauna, one for shower)
·       Change of clothes
·       Notebook & pen
Thanks to funding through Healthy Hospo NZ and Hospitality NZ the cost of $50 per person is fully sponsored.
Spaces are limited and as all spaces are completely funded by Healthy Hospo NZ and Hospitality NZ, you'll need to secure your spot early!
label: Health & Wellness

description:
The Overthinking Mind - Tap to break free from mental loops, Tuesday Wellbeing Seminars
The Overthinking Mind - Tap to break free from mental loops
This workshop explores why our thoughts get stuck in loops of worry, doubt, and replay. Drawing on the insights of Carl Jung, we’ll uncover how the unconscious mind, shadow, and how unresolved inner conflicts fuel over-thinking. You’ll also learn how the body and nervous system become conditioned to repeat these mental patterns, creating the familiar cycle of racing thoughts and restless emotions.
Through a guided exercise, you’ll experience practical tools from FasterEFT and the science of neuroplasticity—methods that help rewire the brain and bring the mind back to calm clarity.
By the end of the workshop, you’ll not only understand the deeper roots of over-thinking, but you’ll also walk away with simple, repeatable techniques to interrupt mental loops, ease the nervous system, and create a lasting sense of inner peace.
“This is an interactive workshop where you’ll connect with others and see that many of us face the same challenges beneath the surface—making growth and healing easier when we explore them together
“This is an interactive workshop that offers the chance to connect with others on a similar journey. It’s powerful to know, that beneath the surface, we often share the same challenges and struggles—and that healing becomes easier when we explore them together.”
Meet your host, Krishnaloka
Introducing Krishnaloka, who is driven to help others overcome their issues within their mind and pyschology. As a mind technician trained in eutaptics (Faster EFT), she employs the fastest and most powerful method to create lasting change by addressing the root causes of issues rather than just the symptoms. Her warm and caring nature makes every interaction with her both comforting and transformative.
6.15pm Tuesday 2nd September
End the session on a high note with a delicious plant-based dinner, dessert, and good conversation.
Tickets available here~ bit.ly/eventTickets
Bhakti Lounge 1/175 Vivian Street, Te Aro, Wellington. http://www.bhaktilounge.org.nz

·       Interactive Breathwork, led by our resident Breathwork & Physiology expert, Josh Fankhauser, to help you manage stress and shift your state on demand.
·       Hot/Cold Contrast Therapy, a guided community sauna and ice bath experience with Sauna Collective, to boost recovery, improve focus, and leave you feeling re-energised.
·       Practical Tools for Everyday Life. Strategies you can take back to your workplace (and your own wellbeing) to help you thrive through peak season.

 Times: Three sessions to choose from, each capped at 16 people so spaces will go fast!
·       9:00 – 10:45am
·       11:00 – 12:45pm
·       1:15 – 3:00pm
What to Bring
·       Swim suit
·       2 x Towels (one for sauna, one for shower)
·       Change of clothes
·       Notebook & pen
Thanks to funding through Healthy Hospo NZ and Hospitality NZ the cost of $50 per person is fully sponsored.
Spaces are limited and as all spaces are completely funded by Healthy Hospo NZ and Hospitality NZ, you'll need to secure your spot early!

description:
The Overthinking Mind - Tap to break free from mental loops, Tuesday Wellbeing Seminars
The Overthinking Mind - Tap to break free from mental loops
This workshop explores why our thoughts get stuck in loops of worry, doubt, and replay. Drawing on the insights of Carl Jung, we’ll uncover how the unconscious mind, shadow, and how unresolved inner conflicts fuel over-thinking. You’ll also learn how the body and nervous system become conditioned to repeat these mental patterns, creating the familiar cycle of racing thoughts and restless emotions.
Through a guided exercise, you’ll experience practical tools from FasterEFT and the science of neuroplasticity—methods that help rewire the brain and bring the mind back to calm clarity.
By the end of the workshop, you’ll not only understand the deeper roots of over-thinking, but you’ll also walk away with simple, repeatable techniques to interrupt mental loops, ease the nervous system, and create a lasting sense of inner peace.
“This is an interactive workshop where you’ll connect with others and see that many of us face the same challenges beneath the surface—making growth and healing easier when we explore them together
“This is an interactive workshop that offers the chance to connect with others on a similar journey. It’s powerful to know, that beneath the surface, we often share the same challenges and struggles—and that healing becomes easier when we explore them together.”
Meet your host, Krishnaloka
Introducing Krishnaloka, who is driven to help others overcome their issues within their mind and pyschology. As a mind technician trained in eutaptics (Faster EFT), she employs the fastest and most powerful method to create lasting change by addressing the root causes of issues rather than just the symptoms. Her warm and caring nature makes every interaction with her both comforting and transformative.
6.15pm Tuesday 2nd September
End the session on a high note with a delicious plant-based dinner, dessert, and good conversation.
Tickets available here~ bit.ly/eventTickets
Bhakti Lounge 1/175 Vivian Street, Te Aro, Wellington. http://www.bhaktilounge.org.nz
label: Health & Wellness

description:
The Overthinking Mind – Making Friends with our Mind, Tuesday Wellbeing Seminars
The Overthinking Mind- Making friends with our mind
What mood is our mind in today? What does it refuse to do that we want it do, and what does it do that we don’t want it to do? Is there any solution to the unruly nature of the mind? Thankfully yoga wisdom deals head on with the mind - how to manage it, and how to satisfy it and make it peaceful.


Meet your host, Khadiravan
Khadiravan is a seasoned bhakti yoga teacher at Bhakti Lounge and you might have heard her angelic singing, which is like therapy for the ears. Kirtan (mantra music meditation) is Khadiravan's love and she enjoys creating a comfortable and meditative space when she hosts our SoundLabs or at soulFeast. Khadiravan also offers her background of a PhD in Yoga Psychology, to whoever wants to lend an ear and an inquisitive mind to exploring life through the lens of yoga wisdom
6.15pm Tuesday 23rd of September
End the session on a high note with a delicious plant-based dinner, dessert, and good conversation.

Spring has arrived with fresh energy. Are you ready to get back to basics for some health affirming movement? Come join me!! I'm an Upper Hutt based Registered Naturopath and Medical Herbalist (NMHNZ & NZAMH).
All welcome. A reasonable level of fitness is required or a willingness to take short breaks as needed. It's a hill walk through bush with beautiful views. Meet up location is at the lawn roller next to the tennis courts.

description:
The Morning Shift - IS THAT US?! World Tour (sort of...) | Wellington, After humble beginnings in a garage, to a record-breaking rise to the top of the podcast charts, Aotearoa’s favourite trio — Jordan Vaha'akolo, Brook Ruscoe, and Marc Peard — are taking The Morning Shift to the people. This August and September, they’ll be bringing eight massive shows across Aotearoa and Australia in their first-ever LIVE tour.
Real people, real talk and now real life. Expect all the stuff you love from the podcast: deep kōrero, big laughs, a few tears, spontaneous/questionable singing, plus whatever Jordan decides to overshare that night. The live show brings the podcast to life, with that signature Morning Shift energy that turns commutes into therapy sessions and takes gym workouts to another level.
Tickets go on sale Friday 4 July at Midday NZST.

description:
The Overthinking Mind: Finding Peace in Mental Chaos through hypnosis, Tuesday Wellbeing Seminars
The Overthinking Mind: Finding Peace in Mental Chaos through hypnosis
If your brain won’t stop running in circles, this workshop is for you.
In 60 minutes, we’ll unpack why your mind loves to overthink, how to break out of thought spirals before they swallow your day, and I’ll guide you through a relaxing hypnosis to quiet the noise on the spot. You’ll leave with simple tools you can use anytime life feels too loud.


Meet your host, Gopi
Gopi helps spiritually minded professionals achieve clarity, overcome negative thought patterns and habits through his unique integration of hypnotherapy and palmistry. During his former life as a monk, he delved into the timeless wisdom of astrology, palmistry, and the ancient knowledge of the mind and consciousness, gaining deep insights into human psychology. He combines these powerful teachings with modern, effective tools as a certified practitioner in applied hypnotherapy, trauma informed coach, along with the knowledge he gained through his diploma in psychology and counseling.
6.15pm Tuesday 9th September
End the session on a high note with a delicious plant-based dinner, dessert, and good conversation.

description:
(Now on Sunday) Planetary Parade - Free event, Due to a heavy cloud forecast on Saturday morning, we have changed the date for this event to the following morning, Sunday 24 August.
A rare cosmic event where six of the seven planets are in dawn sky during this final Planetary Parade for 2025. Matariki is also visible at this time close to the line of planets.
Come down to the Wellington waterfront at dawn and see the planets Pareārau (Saturn), Kōpū/Tāwera (Venus), Hine-i-tīweka (Jupiter), Whiro (Mercury), and Matariki (Pleiades) in our skies. Rangipō (Uranus) and Tangaroa (Neptune) are also in the sky but they will be too faint to see. Matawhero (Mars) follows after Te Rā (the Sun) rises so it won't be seen in the sky.
If you want to gaze in wonder at Saturn, Jupiter, Venus, look through our amazing telescopes! We can show you where to find Matariki, but binoculars at better so if you have a pair bring them along. The event is child friendly and free!
If you want to support our Society by becoming a member, please go to https://www.was.org.nz/join-us/

description:
Master Your Thoughts: Tools for Clarity and Control, Master Your Thoughts: Tools for Clarity and Control
Your mind is a powerful place — but sometimes it feels like it’s running the show. In this engaging evening with Chaitanya Charan, a monk and internationally acclaimed speaker, you’ll discover practical tools to quiet mental noise, sharpen focus, and make clear, confident choices. Drawing on timeless wisdom and modern psychology, he’ll share insights to help you understand your thought patterns, break free from unhelpful mental loops, and channel your mind’s energy in a positive direction.
Set in our welcoming and creative space, this event blends inspiration with connection. After the talk, enjoy a nourishing plant-based dinner and dessert — a perfect chance to unwind, reflect, and connect with like-minded people over great food.
Check out the menu!

Spaghetti with Roasted capsicum & Sun-dried tomatoes
Stuffed Focaccia Bread
Fresh Pear Salad
Lemon Poppyseed Cake
Meet Chaitanya Charan, your host
With warmth, insight, and humour, Chaitanya Charan has a way of opening minds and perspectives. A monk for over 25 years, he has dedicated his life to exploring how we think, decide, and live — and how to do it with more clarity and purpose. He has spoken in more than 30 countries, from Ivy League universities to grassroots gatherings, engaging audiences with his clear thinking, relatable stories, and practical strategies. An accomplished author and speaker, Chaitanya Charan offers insights that challenge perspectives, spark reflection, and inspire real change.

description:
5 And Still Live ! - The Fifth Anniversary of Mouthfull Radio, Five years ago we were in the midst of a global pandemic, visiting digital rooms with friends around the corner, making sourdough, and sort of watching the daily news. We were also making experimental attempts into the world of radio, with the birth of Mouthfull’s first international streaming server, playing music 24/7 (also live events a few times a week).
If we travel even further back in time, 2017 was the debut of the “Mouthfull Radio” episodic series (~20eps) - but we consider the ongoingness the real thing to celebrate.
Moving towards present day ~ through a vast richness of hosts, events, music, shows, zines, selectors, connections, pop ups, and story-times. It is a real joy to help community contemporary radio ripple out from this Pacific Island nation to the world wide web.

5 Years goes so fast, and so we shall honour this time with a great celebration in the capital city of Aotearoa! We will bring together all of the elements of Mouthfull you have known to love; make some books, make up some new dance moves with friends, and make our ears glisten in the sounds of live and selected music.
Whiro // New Moon. The last dark night of winter. A time for reflection; an invitation to come together as friends and whānau and plant intentional seeds for future flowers to bloom, as well as rest in deep listening and shared beingness.

Lineup:
*ºJuniper May
*ºStar Time
*ºajhoneysuckle (tāmaki)
*ºMystery Waitress (duo)
*ºDJ B.Lo (whākatu)
*°Benny Salvador


We are also releasing our first ever compilation. This special event will be opened with a premiere listening session of the full CD, playing the album all the way through. You can purchase a physical copy at the show, or on bandcamp (preorders open September 1st).
5PM sharp CD push play. Some divine collaborators with unique new releases on offer.

This is a fundraiser to support the sustainability of Mouthfull. We are only able to pay the bills due to events like this, and are fundraising to support a long awaited update of our digital infrastructure to enable future support. THANKS FOR YOUR SUPPORT - you can support us by purchasing a ticket (extra donation if you are balling), a tshirt, a raffle ticket, or a zine - it all goes to the same goal of enabling & uplifting one another.

description:
Dads Drags, DADS DRAGS – Fathers Day - Sunday 7th September 2025 - Masterton Motorplex

Get ready for one of the most popular events on our calendar – Dads Drags is back!
A fun day out where first-timers, regular racers, families, and fans all come together for a relaxed but action-packed day at the strip. Bring the daily driver or your classic or muscle car - you don't have to have a fast car to win! So long as it has a current WoF and Rego, a helmet (see links below for info) you can race all day!

Spectator Info:
Gate entry: Adults $20
14 years & under free (bring the kids!)

Full day of racing action, plus a great atmosphere for Father’s Day.

Racer Info:
Race entry: $50
Day licence available for $30 (if you don’t already hold a current licence)
Passenger rides allowed – you’ll need a completed passenger form, $20 per passenger.

Everyone racing (including passengers) must wear a compliant helmet, long sleeves, long pants, and enclosed shoes.

If you’re new to drag racing, check out our Getting Started guide on the website – it has all the details you’ll need to know before race day.

Hot Rod & Classic Car Display:
Preferential parking is available for hot rods and classics – roll up and be part of the show in the pits and display area.

Make this Father’s Day one to remember – whether you’re on the start line, riding shotgun, or watching from the stands, Dads Drags is the place to be this Fathers Day!

Forms & Info:
Entry Form: https://www.mastertonmotorplex.co.nz/storage/ENTRY-FORM-Dads-Drags-2025.pdf
Passenger Form: https://www.mastertonmotorplex.co.nz/storage/Passenger-Indemnity-Form-dads-drags-2025.pdf
Getting Started Guide: https://www.mastertonmotorplex.co.nz/getting-started/

description:
Beer & Spirits Halloween Crawl – Wellington 2025, Beer & Spirits Halloween Crawl – Wellington 2025
Raise your glass to Halloween in Wellington! The Beer & Spirits Crawl brings cocktails, craft beer, costumes, and DJs on November 1st.

About this Event

🍺🥃 BEER & SPIRITS: HALLOWEEN BOOZE CRAWL 2025 – Wellington 🥃🍺 Halloween Saturday in Wellington is about to get boozier. The Beer & Spirits: Halloween Booze Crawl is your pass to explore the city’s best pubs, breweries, and nightlife spots in one epic night of costumes, cocktails, and craft beer.
On Saturday, November 1st, 2025, hundreds of party-ready crawlers will gather to toast the spookiest night of the year. From seasonal ales and spiced lagers to spooky-themed shots and signature cocktails, every stop on the crawl will be serving something worth raising a glass to.



EVENT HIGHLIGHTS
🥃 Beer + Spirits Combo: Enjoy the best of both worlds with craft beer options and premium cocktails at every venue.
🎶 Live Music & DJs: Halloween hits, party anthems, and dance-worthy beats all night long.
📍 Venues: Lulu Bar & Restaurant, El Horno, The Rogue & Vagabond, and BL3 — hand-picked Wellington bars and breweries offering exclusive specials for crawl guests.
🎟 Your Ticket Includes: Wristband for entry, drink specials at each stop, and access to the official crawl map.

HOW TO JOIN THE FUN
1️⃣ Check-In: Pick up your wristband at the starting venue between 7:30–10:30 PM.
2️⃣ Crawl at Your Own Pace: Visit participating middle-stop venues between 8:30–11:30 PM.
3️⃣ Last Call for Halloween: Everyone meets at the final venue at 11:30 PM for the Saturday night send-off party.



PARTICIPATING VENUES The lineup will be released soon — each location is chosen for great drinks, great atmosphere, and great music.
📍 On event day, click the to view the full venue list, drink specials, and schedule.

🎭 Costume Friendly: Whether you’re dressed as a beer-loving ghoul, a whiskey-wielding pirate, or a spooky pop culture icon, you’ll fit right in.

🚨 Saturday-Only Tickets: This is a one-night-only Halloween party. Early bird tickets start at just $15 — secure your spot before they’re gone.

What’s Included in Your Ticket:
🍺 Entry to 4+ pubs, breweries, and clubs in Wellington
🚫 No cover at all participating venues
🎟️ Exclusive Halloween Booze Crawl wristband
📱 Digital crawl map to navigate each stop
🎵 Live DJs & music at every venue
🕺 Closing party to end Halloween Saturday in style



18+ EVENT / GOVERNMENT ISSUED ID REQUIRED


TIPS FOR OUR CRAWL
Pick Up Wristbands On Time: Collect your wristband(s) during the designated check-in time at the scheduled location before 10:30 PM. Late arrivals will not be accommodated — no wristband, no entry.
Assign a Proxy if Needed: Can’t make check-in? Have a friend pick up your wristband for you so they don’t miss out.
Day-Of Updates: Review the Digital Crawl Map on the morning of the event for any last-minute changes or venue updates.
Check Venue Schedule: Each venue’s crawl time is listed in the Digital Crawl Map. Wristbands and drink specials are valid only during these scheduled times.
_______________________________________


IMPORTANT DISCLAIMERS
Age Requirement: You must be 18+ years of age with a valid government-issued ID to participate in this event. No exceptions.
Wristbands: Your wristband is your key to entry. You must present your ticket or QR code at check-in to receive your wristband. Wristbands must be worn at all times to access participating bars and venues. Wristband pickup location and time are listed on the crawl map. If you do not pick up your wristband at the designated location and time, it may not be available, and you will not be able to access crawl venues. No wristband, no entry.
Ticket Policy: All sales are final—no refunds, exchanges, or transfers. In case of event cancellation without a rescheduled date, a refund (excluding fees) will be automatically issued. Event lineup, venues, and specials are subject to change without notice.
Admission & Venue Rights: Participating venues reserve the right to refuse service or entry to any attendee based on intoxication, dress code, inappropriate behaviour, or venue capacity. If refused entry at one venue, you may visit alternative crawl venues available at that time. No refunds will be given if you are denied entry for any of these reasons.
Capacity and Late Entry: Some venues may hit capacity during the event. If a venue reaches capacity or you arrive late, you may have to wait in line to gain entry. There is no guarantee of immediate access or entry to any specific venue once capacity is reached, and no refunds will be provided due to waiting times or access issues.
Self-Guided Crawl: This is a self-guided event with no host leading the group. You must use the digital crawl map to navigate between venues.
Venue Awareness: If bar staff are unaware of the crawl, you must contact the venue representative listed on the crawl map. If you cannot reach them, consider that venue unavailable and proceed to an alternative crawl venue open at that time. Nightlife venues may reach capacity or close early, and not all staff members may be aware of the crawl.
Drink Specials: Drink specials are offered by participating venues and may be modified or discontinued at any time without notice.

description:
Bar Crossing Seminar - Manawatū (Foxton bar), Crossing A Bar? We Can Help
Bar crossings can be one of the trickiest, and riskiest parts of boating in Aotearoa. They change fast, they don’t always play nice, and they’ve caught out even the most experienced skippers. Each year, we see serious incidents and tragedies happening on our bars, so it’s super important to know your stuff before you head out.
That’s where we come in. Join us at Manawatu Marine Boating Club for a free and relaxed seminar. You’ll hear straight from local Coastguard skippers and boating legends who’ll share their real-world tips, local knowledge, and a few stories from the water.

Here’s what we’ll cover (and chat about):

Understanding the local features of your bar
Reading and interpreting the conditions when planning a trip
Getting your boat and your crew bar crossing ready
How to handle your boat while crossing
How to do a bar crossing report (and why it’s worth it)
What to do if things go pear-shaped
It’s interactive – so bring your questions, share your own experiences, and have a yarn with others in the boating community.
Bring your mates too – whether they’re brand new to boating or have been around since the days of paper charts and handheld compasses, there’s something in here that could save a trip… or a life.
 Why it matters:
In 2024, 23% of craft-related drownings happened during bar crossings.
5 lives were lost due to capsizing while crossing a bar.
Older blokes are still the most at-risk – but everyone can make safer choices with the right knowledge (and a lifejacket on).

https://citadelcolour.com/armies-on-parade/

https://citadelcolour.com/armies-on-parade-frequently.../

https://citadelcolour.com/armies-on-parade-terms-and-conditions/

How Big Should My Entry Be?
This is Armies on Parade, so go big!

Armies on Parade is your opportunity to show off what inspires you in the Warhammer hobby. Your project could be anything from a K*ll Team squad or a Warcry warband to a massive galaxy-conquering battleforce or a realm-shaking army.

For Warhammer Age of Sigmar, Warhammer 40,000, Legions Imperialis, Middle-earth™ Strategy Battle Game, Warhammer: The Old World, and Warhammer: The Horus Heresy, the minimum number of units per entry is two complete units. This can be any combination of unit types, including, but not limited to, a character model and a squad, two tanks, a tank and squad, and more.

For skirmish-style games including Necromunda, K*ll Team, Warcry, Warhammer Underworlds, and Blood Bowl, the minimum entry is one complete warband, K*ll team, gang, Blood Bowl team, or other equivalent.

description:
Astronomy on Tap, Astronomy on Tap
Experience the wonders of the Universe as you embark on an extraordinary journey into the vast depths of space and beyond.

This September at Astronomy on Tap, we’re diving into one of the biggest questions in science: Are we alone? Our theme is The Search for Life and Water. Wherever we find water on Earth, we find life. Could the same be true beyond our planet?

From icy moons in our Solar System to distant exoplanets, scientists are searching for the conditions that could support life. Join us as we explore the potential for discovering life in the universe and the technology helping us get closer to the answer.
Upon arrival, receive a drink and your first-class inflight snacks. Then sit back and relax in our digital full-dome planetarium as we explore the night sky. Complete your trip through the galaxy with the cash bar and a look through interactive exhibitions.

Whether you’re accompanied by a special someone, a friend, or embarking on a solo adventure, raise your glass to the stars and enjoy the stellar ride.

$45pp | 8PM – 10PM | R18 | Space Place

description:
Jewellery Making - Lost Wax Cast Rings, Evolve and advance your jewellery-making abilities with exciting lost wax methods to create rings cast in copper, brass, bronze, white bronze and silver - beginners welcome! All material costs included in course fee.

Description
In this fresh 6-week jewellery-making course, you get a hands-on opportunity to develop new techniques creating rings with a sculptural and organic flair.

The lost wax process offers a wide range of creative outcomes such as 3D forms and textures, which are not achievable with fabrication techniques.

You will design and create a pair of rings in jeweller’s wax. These wax masters will be cast professionally for you, outside class, making them in metals of your choice - copper, brass, yellow bronze or white bronze.

Later in the course you will refine your new wax shaping skills and develop a ring to be cast in sterling silver!

In the second part of the course, you will sand and refine your casts into finished jewellery.

The class offers beginners a fun introduction to jewellery making, and for those with some jewellery experience it offers a great way to advance and expand your making techniques to new levels.

All materials included in course fee. Please bring pen and paper and your reading glasses (if you use these) and wear clothing and footwear suitable for a workshop environment.

By the end of the course, you’ll be able to:

- Evolve your jewellery-making abilities with new and exciting lost wax methods
- Develop and create unique sculptural ring designs
- Carve hard jeweller’s wax ring master designs to fit a chosen finger size for casting
- Sculpt and model soft jeweller’s wax master design to fit a chosen finger size for casting
- Combine hard and soft jeweller’s wax to create unique designs ready for casting
- File, sand and polish metal casts into finished jewellery

Note: Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel. We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly.

6 weeks, Thu 6:00 PM - 8:30 PM
Wellington High School
Presented by Thorn Richards.
$299.00 incl. GST

Friday raises a pint. Saturday unleashes the horde. Two nights, one wristband, all of Wellington's Halloween energy.

About this Event


👻🍺 Boos & Brews + Feeding Frenzy 🧛🧟‍♀️Weekend Pass – Wellington 2025

Two nights. One pass. Non-stop Halloween madness.
Friday kicks off with Boos & Brews — pints, cocktails, and costumed pub crawlers packing the city’s best bars. Saturday unleashes Feeding Frenzy — a zombie-fueled bar crawl where DJs, shots, and wild costumes keep the night alive until 2 AM.




WHAT’S INCLUDED
🎟️ One wristband for both crawls (Friday + Saturday)
🚫 No cover charges at any venue
🍹 Exclusive Halloween drink specials
🎶 DJs + entertainment at every stop
📱 Friday + Saturday digital crawl maps 🕺 Two huge closing parties




PARTICIPATING VENUES
Lineup announced soon. Each stop brings themed drinks, DJs, and a full Halloween vibe.


👻🍺🧟‍♂️🧛 Double your Halloween fun. One ticket gets you two back-to-back crawls, two closing parties, and hundreds of costumed partygoers.
🚨 Early bird weekend passes start at $25 — grab yours before they’re gone.




HALLOWEEN CRAWL TERMS & CONDITIONS
ENTRY REQUIREMENTS
This is a 18+ event only. Government-issued photo ID is mandatory at the door. No ID, no participation.
WRISTBAND POLICY
Your wristband = your access. It must be collected at the official check-in location during posted hours (before 10:30 PM).
If you miss check-in, your wristband will not be available and you will not be permitted into crawl venues. No refunds.
If you can’t make it, you may designate a friend to pick up your wristband on your behalf.
VENUE PARTICIPATION & RULES
Crawl schedules, bar times, and specials are listed on the Digital Bar List.
Your ticket is only valid during the scheduled crawl hours — not outside of them.
Digital Crawl Map: Always check it the morning of the event for final venue confirmations and any last-minute adjustments.
Venues may close early, reach capacity, or have staff unaware of the crawl — if so, simply continue to another participating location listed on the map.
All venues reserve the right to deny entry based on intoxication, dress code, behavior, or safety concerns. Standard security checks still apply.
TICKETS & SALES
All sales are final. Tickets are non-transferable and non-refundable.
If an event is fully canceled without a replacement date, a refund (minus processing fees) will be issued.
Events run rain or shine, and lineup, specials, or bar participation may change without notice.
COSTUMES & CONDUCT
Costumes are encouraged, but anything resembling a weapon or considered offensive may result in denied entry with no refund.
Disorderly conduct, harassment, or damage to property will result in removal without compensation.
LIABILITY RELEASE
By purchasing a ticket and joining the crawl, you confirm that you are participating at your own risk. You accept full responsibility for any injuries, illnesses, property loss, theft, accidents, alcohol-related incidents, or death that may occur before, during, or after the event.
You hereby waive, release, and discharge Events Per Se, its owners, staff, contractors, sponsors, volunteers, affiliates, and all participating venues from any and all liability — whether due to negligence, gross negligence, breach of duty, or otherwise.

description:
Boos & Brews Halloween Pub Crawl Wellington 2025, Boos & Brews Halloween Pub Crawl Wellington 2025
Boos, brews & beats. 4+ pubs, seasonal pours & a citywide Halloween party in Wellington. Oct 31 — your crawl awaits.

About this Event


👻🍻 BOOS & BREWS HALLOWEEN PUB CRAWL – Wellington 2025 🍻👻
Halloween Friday in Wellington deserves a proper toast. On October 31st, 2025, join Drink Link for the Boos & Brews Pub Crawl, a night where costumes meet craft beer. This crawl will take you through 4+ pubs, each serving up themed drinks, lively music, and plenty of Halloween energy.





🍺 Crawl Highlights
🍻 Seasonal Pours & Haunted Cocktails – Pumpkin ales, blood-red brews, and crawl-only drink deals
🎶 Music & DJs – From spooky classics to dancefloor favorites
🍺 Walkable Route – All pubs within easy reach, no rides needed


🍺 How the Night Flows
Check-In (7:30–10:30 PM) – Collect your wristband and your first pint of the night.
Roam (8:30–11:30 PM) – Move between pubs at your own pace, guided by the digital crawl map.
Final Toast (11:30 PM–2 AM) – Everyone gathers at the closing bar for the big party.

🍻 Digital Crawl Map – Full lineup posted on event day ()


🍺 Tickets
🎟 Early Bird pricing starts at $15
🚫 Capacity is limited — don’t wait
🍻 Wristband covers venue entry, drink specials, and map access





⚠️ Important Event Disclaimers
Age Requirement
Entry is strictly 18+. You must show a valid government-issued photo ID to participate. No exceptions will be made.
Wristbands
Your wristband is your pass for entry. Present your ticket or QR code at the check-in location to receive it. Wristbands must be worn throughout the night to access participating venues. If you miss the pickup window listed on the crawl map, you forfeit your access — no wristband means no entry. Lost or unclaimed wristbands cannot be replaced.
Tickets & Refunds
All sales are final. Tickets cannot be refunded, transferred, or exchanged. If the crawl is canceled without being rescheduled, the base ticket price (minus fees) will be automatically refunded. Participating venues, event hours, and drink specials may be adjusted at any time without advance notice.
Venue Entry
Each participating location has the right to refuse service or entry for reasons including intoxication, violation of dress code, inappropriate conduct, or venue capacity. If denied entry at one stop, you may visit another participating venue. No refunds will be issued under these circumstances.
Capacity & Access
Venues may reach capacity at peak times. Admission is not guaranteed once a venue is full. Late arrivals may face lines or delays. Refunds will not be issued for wait times or inability to enter specific venues.
Self-Guided Crawl
This is a self-directed event. There is no host leading the group. Use the DIGITAL CRAWL MAP LINK to navigate between stops.
Venue Awareness
Not all bar staff may know about crawl logistics. If confusion arises, contact the event representative listed on the crawl map. If that venue cannot accommodate you, move on to another open crawl location.
Drink Specials
Discounts and drink deals are set independently by each bar. They may change, sell out, or be discontinued without notice.
Event Timing
Tickets are valid only during official crawl hours listed on the digital map. Showing up early, late, or outside of the crawl schedule does not guarantee entry.
Security
All venues will conduct their own security screening. A wristband does not bypass checks.
Costumes
Costumes must be safe and respectful. Props resembling weapons or offensive attire will result in denial of entry without refund.
Notifications
To stay updated, sign up for text alerts. These will notify you of venue changes or movement times during the crawl.
Conduct
Respect staff, other attendees, and venues. Disorderly behavior, property damage, or harassment will result in immediate removal without refund.
Liability Waiver
By purchasing a ticket, you acknowledge and accept that participation carries risks. You voluntarily assume all dangers, including but not limited to: accidents, personal injury, illness, disability, property damage, theft, alcohol-related incidents, interactions with other participants, and even serious injury or death.
You, and anyone acting on your behalf, hereby release and discharge Events Per Se, its affiliates, sponsors, contractors, employees, volunteers, and participating venues from any liability for losses, claims, or damages — whether due to negligence, gross negligence, breach of duty, or any other cause — that may occur before, during, or after the crawl.
You further agree to indemnify and hold harmless all released parties against any claims, costs, or expenses (including legal fees) that arise as a result of your actions during the event.
By attending, you confirm you have read and understood this waiver, that you are participating voluntarily, and that this agreement is intended to be as broad as allowed by law.
Event Continuity
The crawl will run rain or shine. Venues may change last minute. Always check your email and the digital crawl map for updates.
Acknowledgment
Purchase of a ticket signifies full acceptance of these disclaimers, terms, and conditions. You accept complete responsibility for your participation.

Join Chef Arayna as she teaches you how to make a range of delicious Thai food.

Description
Thai cuisine is an exciting explosion of tastes and textures. This highly aromatic food has become popular around the globe. Each week you will be shown different Thai dishes and you will get to make these. This course will provide you with tips, tricks and knowledge and it will be fun, easy and yummy!

Not suitable for vegetarians. All ingredients included in course fee – please bring to each session your apron, a couple of tea towels, a dishcloth and containers to take leftovers home

By the end of the course you'll be able to

Make a range of Thai dishes at home with more confidence
Use ingredients spices and herbs like Thai people do!
Be able to explain some simple Thai eating etiquette

Note: Our cooking courses are designed to provide a collaborative and immersive learning experience where learners often work in pairs and/or groups. While we wish to create an inclusive environment for all participants, it is important to note that our courses are unable to accommodate specific food allergies or deviate from the preplanned dishes and menus.

Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel. We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly. If you need to cancel your registration, here are our terms and conditions: "What You Need to Know".

4 weeks, Tue 5:30 PM – 7:30 PM
Wellington High School
Presented by Aranya Putthapipat
$189.00 incl. GST
label: Classes & Workshops

More info about DRNZ, including membership, events, entries, results, and resources:

description:
F*ck the Small Talk: Wellington #6, F*ck the Small Talk: Wellington #6
🎟️ Sign up here: https://lu.ma/ftstwellington6 🎟️

F*ck the Small Talk has traveled the world from Berlin, Melbourne, London, Lisbon, and Mexico City, to Lisbon and is now coming to Wellington! 🇳🇿


📦 WHAT'S THIS ABOUT?

FTST is a one-of-a-kind social experience where strangers come together for an afternoon of meaningful, fun, and deep conversation. It’s also just a different & cool way of meeting new people by getting a bit out of your comfort zone and skipping the small talk!

Join us for games, talks, and connections with friends you haven’t met yet. Join if you get annoyed after being asked what you do, where you are from, and how long you have been in Wellington every single time you meet someone. If you feel that there are better questions in life then this is the place for you. 🙌


🎈 HOW DOES IT WORK?

We start with a short & sweet intro talk followed by a few light-hearted group games to warm up. Don't worry, nothing too awkward! After that, we split you up into small groups and start with the conversation rounds (with 3-4 people). We'll have awesome question cards that will guide the flow of the conversation. You’ll never have to speak in public if you don’t want to!


🕹 HOW TO JOIN?

Take 2 minutes to fill out our form 👇🏼
https://lu.ma/ftstwellington6

Our events are limited to 30 handpicked guests to ensure a cozy atmosphere. We prioritize a balance in gender and cultural diversity, making each gathering a unique blend of perspectives! If you're invited you'll receive an invite with a special link via our ticketing platform Luma :)


🧧 HOW MUCH IS IT?

The cost to attend is NZD 23 (early llama) - NZD 25 (general llama) and includes the following:

⏰ 3 hours of facilitated and curated activities
🥪 Light snacks to keep the energy going (only if outdoors)
👥 A space to meet new people in the least boring way possible
💛 Supporting our mission to slowly eliminate small talk around the world
🎫 Also includes those pesky ticket fees!


🌳 WHERE IS IT?

We host our events in awesome cafes, rooftops, and bars across the city. We only reveal the location to ticket holders 24 hours before the event.


💛 WHAT THEY SAY

🗣 “Great way to connect with people in a more meaningful way. Get to the heart of the matter, dive straight into what really counts!” - Matthias


🗣 “This is the kind of activity humanity needs every weekend. Thank you for all.” - Sonya


🗣 “F*ck the Small Talk changes the narrative from "Where are you from?" to "When was the last time you laughed uncontrollably?" and I think that's beautiful.” - Monika


🗣 “I loved F*ck the small talk, I was a little bit nervous at first but they are pros at making you feel comfortable with the rest of the group, the activities are really fun and I enjoyed every second (consider that the one who's saying this is very, very shy). Give it a try!” - Brenda


🗣 "it’s a wonderful experience, it’s like being a kid again, when you were at the park, playing with other kids, and just decided you were going to be best friends for the next hours. Maybe you’ll never see those kids again. But that hour was amazing because you both opened up and trusted each other." - Sara


🗣 “Lively, interesting, introspective, completely open and no judgement. Everyone that joined was ready for great conversation and helped with different perspectives. So much fun! I can't wait for the next one! “ - Yaz


Check out our 100+ Google reviews: https://goo.gl/maps/TpZy77bfPFkGoikn7 🫶


🤓 FAQ

• Can I come alone?
Of course, in fact, we encourage it! 99% of people do.


• I signed up but never got an invite. Why?
We usually get a high volume of sign-ups yet we like to keep it cozy & only about 30 people. We believe this is a good number to ensure an awesome experience! Please try again next time if do not receive an invite - no hard feelings 💛


• Why do you charge?
We value our time and put a lot of love, planning, and effort into creating & designing these experiences. ♥️ This is our project/business and what we give to the world and we think everything should be a fair exchange! However, money should never be the reason for people not to attend. If you can’t afford it simply get in touch with us :)


• I'm digging this! Can I get involved somehow?
Sure thing, send us a message!


• Can I bring my cute dog/llama?
It depends on where the event is! Message us to make sure. But it's always a YES in our hearts.


• Can I get a refund if I can't make it?
Unfortunately, we do not offer refunds or ticket transfers to another event date if you cannot attend with a notice of less than 5 days notice. BUTTTT feel free to pass on your ticket to a friend, provided they also sign up for the form :)

--


𝘾𝙤𝙢𝙚 𝙘𝙪𝙧𝙞𝙤𝙪𝙨, 𝙡𝙚𝙖𝙫𝙚 𝙘𝙤𝙣𝙣𝙚𝙘𝙩𝙚𝙙. ✨

* Only 30 spots available
* Location is only revealed to ticket holders!
* Age guide, 22-40 years old (only a reference, never a limit 💃)


🙅‍♀️📱This event is a no-phone experience. Keep them tucked in your pocket 🙅‍♀️📱


We started in Berlin back in 2019 out our frustration of being asked 'where are you from?' 40 times in one week. Now there are chapters in 11 cities around the world including Mexico City, Zurich, Lisbon, London, Berlin and Vancouver. 🌍


--

Stay in touch 👇

Website: https://www.epicllama.com/fuckthesmalltalk
Instagram: www.instagram.com/epic.llama/
Join the club (newsletter): epicllama.myflodesk.com/wellington
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Art @ The Cathedral: Celebrate the Fabric, Exquisite pieces of needlework are on display and in use every day at Wellington Cathedral of St Paul: beautifully decorated fabrics that hang at the front of the altars, spectacular robes and stoles worn by priests at services, and fine linens used at every service of Holy Communion. You’ll learn much about this remarkable fabric artistry when Jo Dixey talks to the Friends of Wellington Cathedral of St Paul and guests on Wednesday, 24 September at 10.30 am.
Jo is an internationally regarded embroiderer who graduated from the Royal School of Needlework and now lives permanently in New Zealand. She teaches, exhibits and sells her work, as well as accepting commissions. She has had contracts from the film industry, working on the Disney film Mulan and most recently on season 1 of Lord of the Rings TV series. Jo’s collection of embroidered 3D viruses, created during the 2020 Covid lockdown, are now on display in The Museum of New Zealand Te Papa Tongarewa.

Eyegum (free) Wednesdays: Fine Wine Social Club & Day Moon, Back by popular demand we're bringing you Fine Wine Social Club with Day Moon! Don't miss it!
8:30 Day Moon
9:15 Fine Wine Social Club
10:00 DJ
Pitta Patta Pitta Patta, Fine Wine Social Club plays cool music and the bees matter. Heaps of instruments, Heaps of euphoria, we play good music until we snoreria. Modern Soul for your Jazz and Funk-Reggae for your hands
Day Moon: Naming our band after the astrological paradox, Day Moon is a 7 piece travelling caravan of musicians calling forth catchy tunes from the depths of human emotion.
Beaut poster by Vanessa Cone
Band links:
https://www.instagram.com/finewinesocialclub/
https://www.instagram.com/daymoon.band/
Pōneke is home to an incredible diversity of artists and music lovers.
We want Eyegum Wednesdays to be a space that everyone can enjoy with care and respect.
We have no room for transphobia or racism, sexism, homophobia, and disregarding consent.
If you see or experience anything concerning, no matter how small, please let our crew or San Fran staff know.
Lovingly sponsored by San Fran, Abandoned Brewery and Wellington City Council

description:
Father's Day Lunch, Saturday 6th and Sunday 7th September 2025. Celebrate this Father’s Day in the heart of the Wairarapa, surrounded by the breathtaking views of Wharekauhau Country Estate and Palliser Bay. Treat the father figure in your life to a memorable afternoon with a luxurious lunch at our renowned restaurant, where rustic charm meets world-class cuisine.

Our specially crafted Father’s Day menu highlights the finest seasonal produce, expertly prepared by our talented chefs. Enjoy a variety of mouthwatering dishes, from tender cuts of locally sourced meats to fresh, flavorful sides that will make every bite a celebration. Paired with a selection of New Zealand’s best wines, it's the perfect way to honor ‘Dad’ while taking in the stunning landscapes of rolling hills and expansive coastlines.

Relax in the elegant yet cozy atmosphere of our dining room, where impeccable service and a warm, welcoming environment make this a day to remember. Whether it's your first time or you're a returning guest, Wharekauhau offers an experience that combines exceptional food, unparalleled views, and a relaxed, family-friendly ambiance—everything needed to make this Father’s Day extra special.

Reserve your place today and give Dad the gift of a memorable experience he’ll treasure long after the day is over. Available on both Saturday and Sunday

description:
Watch This Space - Footnote Dance, Footnote New Zealand Dance bring their site-specific gallery performance series to the New Zealand Portrait Gallery Te Pūkenga Whakaata. Come engage with the Gallery in a new way, encountering the dancers throughout the space as they respond to the current exhibition Me: Artists Paint Themselves.
Access information: The New Zealand Portrait Gallery is an accessible venue, all on one level. There is an accessible wharepaku (toilet) at the back of the venue. The gallery has automatic sliding doors and glass doors that can be pushed or pulled to enter. We have a wheelchair available for use within the gallery, and there is low stool seating throughout. You can find more accessibility information here. If you have any questions regarding accessibility or if there is something we could do to make your visit easier, please get in touch.
