description:
Fright Night + Screams & Shots Weekend Pass – Wellington 2025, Fright Night + Screams & Shots Weekend Pass – Wellington 2025
Double the nights, double the chaos. Dance, crawl & party across Wellington Halloween weekend. DJs, shots & finales ‘til 2AM!

About this Event


Fright Night + Screams & Shots Weekend Pass – Wellington 2025 👻🎧
Halloween weekend is built for the bold — and this pass is your all-access ticket.
The Fright Night + Screams & Shots Weekend Pass gets you into both nights of the city’s most electrifying Halloween parties. Friday kicks off with Fright Night, a citywide takeover where DJs, costumes, and neon lights set the stage. Saturday keeps the momentum alive with Screams & Shots, a high-voltage crawl of bars and clubs serving Halloween-themed shooters and nonstop beats.
This isn’t just a bar crawl — it’s a two-night music-fueled Halloween marathon. Think of it as your festival pass to the city’s nightlife: two different lineups, two massive finales, one unforgettable weekend.




WHY GRAB THE WEEKEND PASS?
⚡ Two Nights, One Wristband – Access to both Friday & Saturday events.
🎶 Festival-Level Energy – Back-to-back parties with DJs mixing EDM, hip hop, and Halloween remixes.
🍹 Exclusive Drink Deals – Spooky cocktails, shot specials, and themed drinks both nights.
🎭 Costumes Required – From glow-in-the-dark ghouls to full-on festival fits, the dance floor is your stage.
📍 Multiple Venues – 4+ stops each night, all within walking distance, ending in a huge late-night finale.


HALLOWEEN CRAWL INSTRUCTIONS
Check-In: Get your weekend wristband at the starting venue (7:30–10:30 PM each night).
Crawl the Clubs: Move between participating venues at your own pace from 8:30–11:30 PM.
Finale Blowout: Meet the full crowd at the closing party from 11:30 PM–2 AM.


YOUR WEEKEND PASS INCLUDES
🎟️ Entry to both crawls (Friday + Saturday)
🚫 No cover charges at any participating venue
📱 Access to the official crawl maps for both nights
🎶 DJs & live entertainment at every stop
🍸 Drink + shot specials exclusive to crawl attendees
🕺 Two grand finale parties — one each night




PARTICIPATING VENUES
The full lineup of bars and clubs will be released closer to the event. Expect high-energy DJs, themed rooms, and Halloween drink specials at every stop.

👻 Whether you’re chasing bass drops, showing off your costume on packed dance floors, or rallying your crew for back-to-back nights out, the Weekend Pass is your way to experience Halloween without limits.
🚨 Early bird passes start at just $25. Grab yours now before they sell out.



18 + EVENT / GOVERNMENT ISSUED ID REQUIRED


TIPS FOR OUR CRAWL
Pick Up Wristbands On Time: Collect your wristband(s) during the designated check-in time at the scheduled location before 10:30 PM. Late arrivals will not be accommodated — no wristband, no entry.
Assign a Proxy if Needed: Can’t make check-in? Have a friend pick up your wristband for you so you don’t miss out.
Check Venue Schedule: Each venue’s crawl time is listed in the Digital Bar List. Wristbands and drink specials are valid only during these scheduled times.
Day-Of Updates: Review the Digital Crawl Map on the morning of the event for any last-minute changes or venue updates.
_______________________________________


IMPORTANT DISCLAIMERS
Age Requirement: You must be 18+ years of age with a valid government-issued ID to participate in this event. No exceptions.
Wristbands: Your wristband is your key to entry. You must present your ticket or QR code at check-in to receive your wristband. Wristbands must be worn at all times to access participating bars and venues. Wristband pickup location and time are listed on the crawl map. If you do not pick up your wristband at the designated location and time, it may not be available, and you will not be able to access crawl venues. No wristband, no entry.
Ticket Policy: All sales are final—no refunds, exchanges, or transfers. In case of event cancellation without a rescheduled date, a refund (excluding fees) will be automatically issued. Event lineup, venues, and specials are subject to change without notice.
Admission & Venue Rights: Participating venues reserve the right to refuse service or entry to any attendee based on intoxication, dress code, inappropriate behaviour, or venue capacity. If refused entry at one venue, you may visit alternative crawl venues available at that time. No refunds will be given if you are denied entry for any of these reasons.
Capacity and Late Entry: Some venues may hit capacity during the event. If a venue reaches capacity or you arrive late, you may have to wait in line to gain entry. There is no guarantee of immediate access or entry to any specific venue once capacity is reached, and no refunds will be provided due to waiting times or access issues.
Self-Guided Crawl: This is a self-guided event with no host leading the group. You must use the digital crawl map to navigate between venues.
Venue Awareness: If bar staff are unaware of the crawl, you must contact the venue representative listed on the crawl map. If you cannot reach them, consider that venue unavailable and proceed to an alternative crawl venue open at that time. Nightlife venues may reach capacity or close early, and not all staff members may be aware of the crawl.
Drink Specials: Drink specials are offered by participating venues and may be modified or discontinued at any time without notice.
Event Time Restrictions: Your ticket is valid only for crawl venues during the scheduled crawl times listed on the crawl map. It is not valid for entry outside these times. If you arrive late or at the wrong venue, refunds will not be issued.
Security Checks: Wristbands do not entitle you to skip venue security checks. All attendees must comply with security screening before entry.
Costume Policy: Do not wear costumes that include items which could be considered or used as weapons. Highly offensive costumes are not tolerated and may result in denial of entry without refund.
Crawl Notifications: Sign up for crawl notification texts to receive updates about when to move to the next venue. There is no host to notify you in person.
Respect & Conduct: Treat others and the event venues with respect. Disorderly conduct, inappropriate behaviour, or damage to the venues will result in removal from the event without a refund. The participating bars reserve the right to refuse entry or remove attendees for inappropriate behaviour at any time.
Liability Waiver: By purchasing a ticket and participating in the crawl, you understand and agree that you are attending entirely at your own risk. You voluntarily assume all risks and dangers incidental to this event, including but not limited to: personal injury, illness, disability, property loss, theft, damage, accidents, death, alcohol-related incidents, and actions of other participants, staff, or third parties. You, on behalf of yourself and your heirs, executors, and assigns, hereby fully release, waive, and discharge Events Per Se, its owners, officers, directors, employees, contractors, volunteers, affiliates, sponsors, participating venues, and their respective representatives from any and all liability, claims, demands, actions, or causes of action whatsoever arising out of or related to any loss, damage, injury, illness, or death — whether caused by negligence, gross negligence, breach of contract, or otherwise — that may occur before, during, or after the event. You agree to indemnify and hold harmless Events Per Se and all released parties from any claims, costs, or expenses (including legal fees) brought by you or on your behalf, or by any third party as a result of your actions during the event. You acknowledge that you have read and understood this waiver, that you are participating voluntarily, and that this waiver is intended to be as broad and inclusive as permitted by applicable law.
Event Changes: Bars and venues may change, but the event will continue rain or shine. Always check the digital crawl map for the latest venue list and updates. Be sure to check your email for any last-minute updates.
By purchasing a ticket, you confirm that you have read, understood, and agreed to all disclaimers, terms, and conditions stated above, and accept full responsibility for your participation in the event.
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Fright Night Halloween Bar Crawl Wellington, Fright Night Halloween Bar Crawl Wellington
Dance, drink & crawl through Wellington this Halloween! 4+ venues, DJs, spooky vibes & no cover charges. Oct 31, 18+ only.

About this Event


🦇 Fright Night Crawl 2025 – Wellington🌙
When Halloween Friday rolls in, Wellington belongs to the night owls. The Fright Night Crawl isn’t just a bar hop — it’s a moving costume party across the city’s nightlife. On October 31st, 2025, expect packed dance floors, creative costumes, and drinks that only appear once a year.




Ticket Perks
✔️ Admission to 4+ participating venues
✔️ Wristband for access and drink deals
✔️ Zero cover charges at crawl stops
✔️ Digital crawl map to guide your route
✔️ DJs and entertainment throughout the night


What to Expect
From vampires to movie icons, everyone shows up ready to make a scene. Grab friends or roll solo — either way, you’ll be part of a city-wide takeover with:
🍹 Crawl-only cocktails and shots
🎶 High-energy sets from DJs spinning Halloween remixes and party favorites
👻 Venues transformed with spooky themes and live entertainment




Bar Hop Schedule
Check-In | 7:30–10:30 PM: Pick up your wristband at the opening venue.
Main Crawl | 8:30–11:30 PM: Explore middle stops at your own pace.
Finale | 11:30 PM–2 AM: Everyone comes together for the closing party.



Venues
The official list drops closer to the event. Each location will feature its own atmosphere, music, and specials. On event day, open the Digital Crawl Map for the full schedule and details.


Extra Tips
Be early: no wristband pickup after 10:30 PM.
Can’t make check-in? A friend can pick yours up.
Costumes encouraged — just leave the props that could be mistaken for weapons at home.
Check the Digital Map morning-of for any last-minute changes.


Tickets
🎟 Early Bird from $15 (limited supply). Prices increase as Halloween nears.
🔒 Capacity capped at 500 people — once sold out, that’s it.




Important Disclaimers
Age & Entry
18+ only. Valid government-issued ID required at every stop.
Wristbands
Your wristband is mandatory for venue entry. Pick up during the check-in window (7:30–10:30 PM). No late pickups.
Tickets & Refunds
All sales are final. Non-refundable, non-transferable. If the event is canceled, refunds will be issued automatically (excluding processing fees).
Venue Rights
Venues may refuse entry for intoxication, capacity, dress code violations, or inappropriate behavior. No refunds if refused.

description:
Glow in the Dark Paint Party: Aurora Lake Scene, Ultra Violet lights and neon nights. Prepare to experience Paintvine like you’ve never experienced it before - in the dark!

Paintvine After Dark is New Zealand’s first glow in the dark paint party!

Grab a drink in one hand, a brush in the other and get your creative juices flowing and your brush strokes going with ultra-violet lights, glow in the dark paint and nothing but laughs all night long!

Drinks: No drinks are included in the ticket price, but drinks are available for purchase.

Food: A delicious menu will be available to purchase throughout the event.

What is Paintvine?
It’s a fun social painting class where our artists will run you through step-by-step instructions on how to create your very own masterpiece in a fun and relaxed bar setting. Perfect for dates, catching up with mates or for meeting new friends!

We provide all the materials you need (high-quality canvas, neon acrylic paint, brushes). All you need to bring is your creative spirit (or find some at the bottom of a glass). All our events are in licensed venues, so you can purchase drinks to sip as you create! At the end of the night you will leave with your own fluro painting ready to hang up on your wall.

For tickets, future events, FAQs and more info head to the Paintvine website ⇒ paintvine.co.nz

description:
Glow in the dark titiwai tours - New Zealand glow worms, A fascinating tour into the world of titiwai, New Zealand's glow worms, in Wellington Botanic Garden ki Paekākā. This outdoor night-time tour takes about an hour, and all are welcome to join. If bringing children, we find it most suitable for those aged 7 years and older.
Meet at the Founders’ entrance to Wellington Botanic Garden ki Paekākā on Glenmore Street. Please bring your ticket, a torch, and an umbrella if it’s raining. We'll see you there!
This tour is operated by the Friends of Wellington Botanic Garden.
Glow Worm Tour Ticket Refund Policy
• No Refunds: We do not offer refunds for Glow Worm Tour tickets.
• Ticket Transfers: If you can’t attend your booked tour, we will put you on a future tour, subject to availability. Please contact us as soon as possible to arrange this.
• Weather Conditions: Tours operate rain or shine. In the event of extreme weather or unsafe conditions, we will reschedule your tour or provide a refund.
For any changes or enquiries, please get in touch with us in advance at Treehouse@wcc.govt.nz or call 04 499 1400.

description:
96 Originals, Celebrate a quarter-century of culinary excellence at Logan Brown’s 29th anniversary lunch, where the past meets the present in a delicious fusion of food and stories. Join Steve Logan and Shaun Clouston, alongside original Logan Brown team members Francois Febvre (La Cloche) and Shepherd Elliott (previously of Ti Kouka, Leeds Street Bakery, Shepherd, Concord and The Test Kitchen), for a special afternoon filled with fantastic kai and plenty of memories.

As the doors of Logan Brown first opened in 1996, it quickly became one of Wellington’s most beloved dining destinations. Now, this unforgettable event offers a chance to reminisce with the chefs who helped shape the restaurant’s legacy, sharing tales from the early days while serving up a feast of flavours inspired by their storied careers.

For any longtime Logan Brown fan or someone curious to the whakapapa of Wellington food, this is a celebration of the friendships, milestones, and moments that have defined one of New Zealand’s most iconic dining experiences. Expect a menu that reflects Logan Brown’s rich history, prepared with passion and paired with great conversation, laughter, and a few tall tales.

description:
Guitar - Next Step, Follow on from the beginners' course and learn barre chords, more complex strumming styles and simple finger picking.

Bring your own acoustic guitar.

By the end of the course, you'll have built on the skills learned in the Beginners’ course and will be able to:
- Play additional chords, including E and Am shape barre chords
- Demonstrate new strumming patterns
- Demonstrate basic fingerpicking techniques
- Confidently play more songs which use the chords and strums learned
- Build up the F chord to 5 strings
- Move common chord shapes up the fretboard

Bring your own acoustic guitar.

8 weeks
Presented by Will Allardice.

The Southern Hemisphere's original and only Hip Hop + Chess Night returns to Cuba Street's best spot - Loosies Superette.

description:
Inner Marlborough Sounds Kayak Trip, Inner Marlborough Sounds Kayak Trip


Hi this is a trip through the Inner Marlborough Sounds, suitable for beginners who have gone to at least one SKISL and be OK with rescues. The focus is on camping, coffee, and having a fun time with relatively short kayaking times on the water.

The schedule for Wellingtonians is: on the Thursday 29th Ferry over to Picton, in at 12:30, launch from Picton beach head over to Kumoto, tents up, Friday - paddle around the Bay of Many Coves, stop for coffee / lunch / chips / shower at Punga Cove, stay at Camp Bay. Maybe a quick trip over to Bumine Island with empty boats. Saturday night at Ratimira for camping / snoozing. Sunday - up early, on water at 8am, paddle back to Picton in by 12, lunch, on 1pm sailing. So 4 days with Blumine as an optional paddle, mostly shortish trips. We might shift the plan around depending on the weather, but that sets out the general plan.

For the ferry you need to book your own tickets and I would urge you to get your ferry tickets now as they go fast. If you are concerned about the weather get the fully refundable tickets. When you buy your ticket select the "kayak" option. Any questions ask them in the comments below.

description:
Talk the Walk: Preparing for An Overnight Tramp, This talk is aimed at people considering their first overnight tramp. Celia Wade-Brown walked Te Araroa in 2017, and will be leading the Wairarapa Walking Festival two-day tramp from Waiohine to Holdsworth on 21st - 22nd November 2025. Celia will bring her overnight backpack and show the gear she is taking on the tramp.

The talk will cover: food and drink, hut wear, toileting tips, keeping your sleeping bag dry, emergency communications, and looking after your feet.

Bring your questions!
Adam Philps from Masterton Foot Clinic, a festival sponsor will be joining us to talk feet and things to consider.

Murray Johnston, chair of Wairarapa Land Search and Rescue will also be speaking. Please bring a gold coin to donate to WaiLandSAR.

Please register for this session.

description:
No mans heath album launch celebration, The same moon is the follow up record to the last no mans heath offering ‘ball of string’ that was released in 2017.
This show is a celebration of the finishing of the record.
Tom will be playing songs from the record and a few old favourites. With the help of one of Wellington’s most loved musicians Scott Pilgrim.
No mans heath aka Tom Kane is an English singer songwriter who has made Wellington his home. He songs are insightful and delicate and have been described as a beautiful exercise in restraint.
The wonderful Tessa de Lyon (also of Mystery Waitress) will open the evening with a set of piano songs. Tessa’s songs merge beautiful storytelling with wistful tunes that belong on film soundtracks. "A seemingly endless supply of comforting melodies" (RNZ).
Helpful information
Happy hour at the bar is 3pm to 6pm.
Set times
Tessa De Lyon - 6:30
No mans heath - 7:10

description:
Haunted Hop & Halloween Bar Crawl Weekend Pass – Wellington 2025, Haunted Hop & Halloween Bar Crawl Weekend Pass – Wellington 2025
Party all weekend in Wellington! The Haunted Hop & Halloween Bar Crawl Weekend Pass gets you into the best bars on Oct 31 & Nov 1.

About this Event






👻🎃Haunted Hop + Halloween Bar Crawl Weekend Pass – Wellington 2025 👻🎃
Two nights. One ticket. The ultimate Halloween takeover. The Weekend Pass gives you entry to both of Wellington’s biggest Halloween crawls — the Haunted Hop Bar Crawl on Friday, October 31st, and the Halloween Bar Crawl on Saturday, November 1st. Back-to-back nights of costumes, cocktails, and chaos, all across the Wellington’s hottest bars and nightclubs.
Friday kicks off with the Haunted Hop, a massive crawl where costumed partygoers pack the streets and every venue becomes a Halloween hotspot. Saturday turns up the volume with the Halloween Bar Crawl, bringing out DJs, dance floors, and spooky specials to close out the weekend in style.
Why settle for one night when you can crawl through both?





WEEKEND PASS HIGHLIGHTS
🎟️ Two Crawls, One Wristband – Admission to both Friday + Saturday events.
🎶 Live Music & DJs – Halloween hits, party anthems, and dance-floor energy all weekend.
🍸 Exclusive Drink Specials – Spooky cocktails, eerie shots, and bar-only deals.
👻 Costumes Everywhere – From scary to sexy to over-the-top — your outfit gets two nights to shine.
📍 Multiple Venues Each Night – 4+ bars and clubs, all within walking distance.



HOW IT WORKS
1️⃣ Check-In: Collect your weekend wristband at the designated starting venue (7:30–10:30 PM, both nights).
2️⃣ Crawl the City: Explore participating bars and clubs between 8:30–11:30 PM at your own pace.
3️⃣ Final Party: Join the crowd at the closing venue from 11:30 PM–2 AM for the ultimate send-off.





WHAT’S INCLUDED
🎟️ Admission to both Friday + Saturday crawls
🚫 No cover charges at any participating venues
📱 Digital crawl maps for both nights
🎶 DJs & live music at every stop
🍹 Themed drink and shot specials
🕺 Huge closing parties each night



PARTICIPATING VENUES
The full lineup of bars and nightclubs will be revealed closer to the event. Each venue offers its own Halloween theme, entertainment, and drink specials for crawl guests.


🎃 Hundreds of Halloween lovers, back-to-back nights, and the best nightlife Wellington has to offer. Whether you’re creeping through the Haunted Hop on Friday or shutting it down at Saturday’s finale, the Weekend Pass is your ticket to experience it all.
🚨 Early bird passes start at just $25. Lock in your plans now before prices rise.



18+ EVENT / GOVERNMENT ISSUED ID REQUIRED

Pick Up Wristbands On Time: Collect your wristband(s) during the designated check-in time at the scheduled location before 10:30 PM. Late arrivals will not be accommodated — no wristband, no entry.

description:
JETAA Wellington - Brewkaiwa August @ The Welsh Dragon, We will be having our August Brewkaiwa at The Welsh Dragon, a cosy and quirky pub nestled in the heart of the city. With its warm atmosphere, distinctive character, and range of drinks on offer, it’s the perfect spot to relax, chat, and connect.
Brewkaiwa is JETAA’s monthly casual meetup for anyone with any connection to Japan.
We’re a diverse group of people who have studied, worked, or lived in Japan or have been invited along by someone who has.
Come join us for a brew and stay for the kaiwa! Bring your friends!
***Japanese or alcohol consumption NOT REQUIRED!***
Brewkaiwaとは
一杯いかがですか？
JETAAがウェリントンで親睦会を開催するとどうなるのか？その結果、BREWKAIWA！
2020年に始まった、ブリューカイワは、ウェリントンの様々なバーで毎月開催されている飲み会です。大人気の国際交流グルップです！！！ 日本で働いたり、住んだり、旅行したことのある人達に人気のあるイベントです！！！お酒を飲んで、友達を出来、素敵なごちそうを食べ、おまけに異文化を知られます！
日本語が話せる外国人も良く参加しているので、日本語しか話せなくても全然大丈夫です！
是非来てください！
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Lindsay Keats – Documentary travel photography, Lindsay Keats – Documentary travel photography
Lindsay Keats is a very experienced commercial and editorial photographer based in Wellington, working on assignments as varied as food, product, aerial, editorial, corporate, and industrial. Shooting personal projects has been important and Lindsay loves to travel and he is well known for his travel photography. For tonight’s meeting, he will talk about documentary travel photography and show us some recent work. Lindsay is honoured to be an official Fujifilm X-Photographer and he will also bring along some of Fujifilm’s latest gear to show us.
Check out more of Lindsay's work here: https://www.lindsaykeats.com/index
August 28, Tararua Tramping Club (4 Moncrieff St, Mt Victoria), Doors Open at 7pm
If you're curious about the Wellington Photographic Society, you're welcome to attend two meetings for free before deciding whether to join. It's a great way to meet the community and see what we're all about!
https://wps.wps.org.nz/
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Magic: ANZ Super Series Qualifier #1 - Standard @ Cerberus Games, The ANZ Magic Super Series is for the Australian and New Zealand Magic communities. It is designed to bring the community together to run competitive tabletop Magic events and be a pathway for players to attain greatness by reaching the Pro Tour and beyond!
Here are the event details:
Entry Fee: $35
Format: Standard
REL: Competitive
Tournament Structure: 5 Rounds Swiss into a Top 4/8 cut
Maximum Players: 24
Decklists will be required. These can be filled out on paper in store or submitted digitally to: support@cerberusgames.co.nz
Prizes:
The winner of this event will qualify for the Cycle 11 Super Series Final held in Sydney.
1 Standard Play Booster Pack for entry.
1 Standard Play Booster Pack towards the top placers for each participant.
Promo cards will also be awarded to all participants.
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Inner Marlborough Sounds Kayak Trip, Inner Marlborough Sounds Kayak Trip


Hi this is a trip through the Inner Marlborough Sounds, suitable for beginners who have gone to at least one SKISL and be OK with rescues. The focus is on camping, coffee, and having a fun time with relatively short kayaking times on the water.

The schedule for Wellingtonians is: on the Thursday 29th Ferry over to Picton, in at 12:30, launch from Picton beach head over to Kumoto, tents up, Friday - paddle around the Bay of Many Coves, stop for coffee / lunch / chips / shower at Punga Cove, stay at Camp Bay. Maybe a quick trip over to Bumine Island with empty boats. Saturday night at Ratimira for camping / snoozing. Sunday - up early, on water at 8am, paddle back to Picton in by 12, lunch, on 1pm sailing. So 4 days with Blumine as an optional paddle, mostly shortish trips. We might shift the plan around depending on the weather, but that sets out the general plan.

For the ferry you need to book your own tickets and I would urge you to get your ferry tickets now as they go fast. If you are concerned about the weather get the fully refundable tickets. When you buy your ticket select the "kayak" option. Any questions ask them in the comments below.
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Magic: Commander Party Edge of Eternities @ Ceberus Games, Join us for Commander Party! Purchase a booster for entry.
Commander Party is a story-inspired Commander event that immerses players in the setting of the latest set release. The vibe is fun and casual, and the events are outstanding opportunities to welcome in broad groups from your community, from new players to lore enthusiasts to Commander fans.
The event features special rules designed specifically for Edge of Eternities and includes play aids and party cards to support play.
Set up and play follows the regular Commander format rules but players all have these additional abilities:
Special Rules:
Alternate win condition: At the beginning of your upkeep, if you control all five worlds, you win the game.
At the beginning of your end step, if one or more opponents lost 3 or more life this turn, gain control of an unclaimed world or a world controlled by one of those opponents.
Whenever you cast your commander, you get an orbit counter.
, pay an orbit counter: choose left or right. Each player passes control of a world they control to the next player in the chosen direction. Activate only as a sorcery.
Each world card also grants a triggered ability whenever a player gains control of it and at the beginning of their upkeep while it is in their control in their command zone.
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Magic: Chaos Draft Event @ Cerberus Games, The latest Magic: The Gathering set has been incredibly popular leaving us with not enough packs to run a draft of it. As such, the format for the Friday draft this week is Chaos!
Chaos Draft is just like any other Magic Draft format: get together with seven of your drafting buddies and grab three packs of cards for each drafter. The twist is that instead of drafting a normal format the packs you will receive is chosen randomly from our store selection of packs!
Here are the details:
Start Time: 6:30PM
Entry Fee: $35.00
Format: 3-Pack Chaos Draft
Prizes:
Everyone will receive 3 packs (decided randomly at the time) to draft with. Any card you draft is yours to keep!
For each player, 0.5 standard Play Boosters are added into the prize pool towards top placers per pod. Additional Promos given out for attendance.

description:
Magic: Marvel's Spider-man Prerelease Weekend, Your friendly neighborhood Spider-Man swings into Magic: The Gathering, and not a moment too soon! Gather web-slingers from across the Spider-Verse and team up to take down the sinister foes that threaten the city
The new Magic: the Gathering set is due to release in September and Cerberus Games is running 4 Prerelease Events on the following dates:
* Friday 19 Sep: 4pm and 9pm
* Saturday 20 Sep: 11am
* Sunday 21 Sep: 12pm
Entry: $75.00
Format: 6 Pack Prerelease Sealed
Each Participant will receive a Prerelease Pack containing 6 Play Boosters to build a 40 card deck.
Rules can be found here:
https://magic.wizards.com/en/formats/sealed-deck
Prizes:
We will be adding 2 Play Boosters to the prize pool, 1 for participation and 1 towards the top placers.
Please ensure you provide your Wizard Account email address when preregistering for a prerelease. You can register a Wizards account here:
myaccounts.wizards.com
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Mangatainoka Motors Hot Rod Car Day, Mangatainoka Motors Hot Rod Car Day
Attention all petrolheads! Buckle up for a rip-roaring day at our Car Days, where you can flaunt your sweet ride to fellow enthusiasts and the public alike. Plus, you'll have the chance to compete for some epic prizes that are sure to rev your engine!

Get ready to soak up the atmosphere with live music, delicious grub, and a refreshing ale. Swing by the Histui Museum for a bit of nostalgia, or hit up the Tui Shop for some merch to show off your Tui pride. Or, if you’re feeling laid-back, just kick back, relax, and let the crowd admire your ride while you swap stories with mates and family.

PRIZE CATEGORIES:

We’ve got a treasure trove of fantastic prizes up for grabs! From Most Original to the ever-coveted Star of the Show, there’s something for everyone!

- Most Original – For the ride that makes jaws drop!

- Local Star – Must be from Wairarapa or Tararua (home turf pride, baby!)

- Furthest Travelled – For those brave enough to put some serious miles on the clock!

- People’s Choice – Because the crowd knows best!

- Star of the Show – Walk away with a whopping $500 Tui voucher! (You know you want it!)

KEY TIMINGS FOR THE DAY:

- 09:00 AM - Gates open for cars (let the engines roar!)

- 10:00 AM - Gates open for the public (let the ogling commence!)

- 10:45 AM - All competing cars to be parked (no late arrivals, please!)

- 11:00 AM - Registrations close (don’t miss out!)

- 11:00 AM - 12:00 PM - Judging takes place (bring your A-game!)

- 12:30 PM - Prize giving (who will take home the glory?)

- 4:00 PM - Tui Brewery closes (but we do it all again the following month!)

PRE-REGISTER YOUR VEHICLE:

Why wait? Pre-register your vehicle or bike now for just $10 online. Just jump onto the website and on the day you can just park up, and flash your email confirmation on your dashboard. Easy peasy! Just head to https://www.tuihq.co.nz/mangatainoka-motors/

And if you forget to pre-register? No sweat! You can still sign up on the day.

All proceeds from registrations go towards the Mangatainoka Motors Reserve Restoration Project. It’s a win-win!

So, gather your crew, polish that ride, and join us for a day of laughter, camaraderie, and, of course, some seriously sweet wheels. We can’t wait to see you there!
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Make friends & BlaBla Language Exchange Wellington - Every other Thursday - Recurrent event, Meet new people - Make international and local friends - Speak languages (mingle) - Have fun

................
Any question or request? Reach out to us on Instagram: www.instagram.com/blablalanguage
................
Join Our BlaBla Whatsapp Group: https://chat.whatsapp.com/LFeNVmzCnaG1BrHYpgBnqU
................
Stay updated via our Telegram channel: https://t.me/+n6e00r9ByRw0MmNk
................
Some guidelines for a delightful experience:
-
Our events are GRATIS, we will not charge you anything but You are asked to order a drink directly upon arrival to participate
(Mandatory).
-
Outside food and drinks are not allowed.
-
Please respect the venues staff and make sure to leave the place clean and tidy before you leave.
-
Be polite and respectful.
Please kindly note that venue staff or our organizers will ban you from our events and community without any warning if you don't respect it. We offer you opportunities to make friends and improve your language skills for free. Be nice enough to make things easy for us.
................
How it's working:
We are working with a mingle setup and we usually don't have designated language tables or areas.
English and the local language are typically spoken.
If you would like to speak other languages, please ask the organizers or seek participants who meet your language expectations.
................
Things to keep in mind before joining:
-
By attending our events, you consent to being photographed or filmed. Photos and videos taken during the events will be shared on our social media. If you do not wish to appear in the photos, please send us a private message as soon as possible on Instagram (@blablalanguage).
-
Remember to keep an eye on your belongings and prioritize your own well-being. We are not responsible for any lost items or personal issues.
................
/
Make a Difference with BlaBla: Volunteer as an Event Organizer (volunteering)!
These gatherings are brought to you by BlaBla Language Exchange, spanning over 150 cities across 5 continents. We are always looking for new organizers. More information and application here: https://www.blablalanguageexchange.com/event-organizers
................
/
Share your photography / video skills: Volunteer as photographer (volunteering)!
Are you a photo virtuoso or a video wizard?
Whether you're a pro or a passionate newbie, we want YOU!
No cash, but lots of laughs and fame (well, sort of). We'll even give you a virtual high-five!

description:
NATIONALS 2025 **LAST CHANCE QUALIFIER** WELLINGTON REGION, LCQ #1 for Wellington Region

Earn those W's and fight your way to the top!
Saturday, 23rd August
From 11AM - 5PM
Respawn Esport Center, Manners Street, Wellington
www.facebook.com/RespawnEsportsCentre
This is it! If you haven't earnt rank through Metal League or your fresh to the scene but you know you have what it takes! This is the first of 2x LCQ Tournaments that give you a shot at jumping the que and joining the wild card team for Nationals Nov 15th in Auckland.
LAST CHANCE QUALIFIER:
Earn your spot at NATS
Top 3 grab the ultimate bragging rights!
Rule Set:
3on3 Deck
5pt Pools
Top Cut
4pt B2o3
REGISTER HERE:
https://challonge.com/tournaments/signup/8IoAlnLIz2...
IMPORTANT INFO:
$15 entry paid to Respawn on arrival
Bring your own official X series launcher (Starter, String, or Ripcord)
3x Beyblades from the X series — no repeating parts
Deck box or container for your beys WITH 3 DISTINCT POCKETS
Clones approved
Metal Needle is banned
Need help or gear? Message the page beforehand!
What You Get:
A day of smashing spinning metal
Prizes!
Access to BXW competition videos for training/content
Practice stadiums & gear renting available
Pathway to Gear Sport New Zealand's Aotearoa Beyblade Nationals!
Minors must be accompanied by a responsible adult
No fake parts — gear will be inspected
Good sportsmanship only — no bullying or dodgy mods
Arriving under the influence is prohibited
Hungry? Respawn’s burger bar is one of the best!
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Monthly Stitching Circle, Monthly Stitching Circle
Bring whatever you're working on (it can be knitting, crochet, embroidery, cross stitch, mending - anything crafty!) and join us on the second Sunday of the month (February to November) for a casual session of sociable stitching hosted by the Wellington Embroiderers' Guild.

Each session runs from 2pm to 4pm, but as an informal event you are welcome to arrive late or leave early. Please note the session will be held in an upstairs room, for more information about accessibility at the house, see this page of our website.

Tea and coffee provided. Suggested donation $5; free for Friends of Katherine Mansfield House & Garden and Wellington Embroiderers' Guild members.

Distilled Comedy – Home of "The Jar"
📍 The Bond Store, Paraparaumu
📅 Wednesday 12th November
⏰ Show starts 7:00PM sharp

Twelve comedians will put their name in "The Jar" and then wait for you, the audience, to draw it.
This high-octane comedy with some of the best bringing the laughter to your Wednesday night.

Book a table, come early, and grab a feed – the kitchen’s cooking and the vibes are simmering before the show even kicks off.

Fresh laughs. Local talent. Good food.
The best entertainment on a Wednesday night.

Tea, Coffee, Sausage Sizzle
Plant swap between 12noon and 1.30pm, koha
Turtle Therapy will be there with houseplants for sale.
If you wish to have a plant or garden related stall email me Janettew.avcc@gmail.com. Small fee towards Fundraiser event.

description:
Show me shorts - Sampler, Inspiring and thoughtful stories include a boxing nun, an AI robot, a dedicated teacher and a Palestinian man trying to return home. Much loved stars Hugh Bonneville, Marlon Williams, Thomas Sainsbury and Alison Bruce make an appearance. We have some fun with an out-of-his-depth dad at a twirling competition and a maniacal ice-cream seller on the beach.
Run time: 102 min
Rating: M - Violence, offensive language, sexual references & content that may disturb

description:
New Year Camp at Paraparaumu Beach, New Year Camp at Paraparaumu Beach
Join us for a relaxed New Years camp at Paraparaumu Beach Sea Scouts site. Its just a short walk to the beach, estuary and local shops, and beside a large park and sports area.
The site is suitable for tents and camping vehicles. The scout hall has toilets, a shower and a basic kitchen.

There is limited space on the site, so if you are planning to camp with us, please RSVP in advance using the button below.

$5 per adult per night for members. $8 for non-members. Children free and discounted rate of $4 per night for members who bring children with them.

More details & RSVP at https://www.allpointscampingnz.org/event-details/new-year-camp-at-paraparaumu-beach
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
OPEN MIC - Vogelmorn Upstairs, OPEN MIC - Vogelmorn Upstairs
Open Mic / Variety show night at Vogelmorn Upstairs

Step into the spotlight and share your talent on the Upstairs stage.
Music, stand-up, poetry, storytelling, movement, experiments. If it's performable, it's welcome.
No genre too strange, no format too small.

A vocal mic and simple PA will be provided, please bring along anything else you need to perform.

Bar open from 3pm, Happy hour from 3pm to 6pm, Open Mic from 5pm.

Sign-up on the night - all voices, styles, levels of experience etc welcome

https://www.undertheradar.co.nz/gig/98053/Open-Mic-Night-At-Vogelmorn.utr

"Vogelmorn Upstairs is not a wheelchair accessible building. There is an accessible
bathroom in the space. This is an all ages venue but those under the age of 16 must be
accompanied by a designated adult after 8pm. The Vogelmorn Precinct is a community
space located in a residential area. With that in mind, the team ask that you be kind to
others' and that when you leave the gig, you do so quietly to avoid disturbing our
neighbours.”
“The Upstairs Bar and Smoked and Pickled Restaurant will be open from 3pm, to book a
table for pre-show kai email Alice at ”

description:
Filtersphere / Bridget Kelly & Peter Liley / Studio Norwood Lab (AU), Filtersphere is the duo of James Gilberd on an expansive, vintage-bass-drum-heavy kit and John Kingston on guitar with an array of effects pedals, together creating atmospheric soundscapes.
---
The improvising duo of Bridget Kelly (reeds, harp) & Peter Liley (saxophone & electronics) will combine their unique creative voices and impeccable musicality moving from lyrical melodies to unearthly growls, creating meditative yet visceral compositions in real time.
---
And visiting from Naarm, Australia will be Studio Norwood Lab aka Colin Hodson who debuts his new instrument in Aotearoa - the détournement of a bicycle wheel into a sonic object!
$15 presales via UTR
$20 on door

Special thanks to CNZ for supporting Pyramid Club's programme
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Northern Suburbs Big Spring Clean!, Hurray, it's nearly spring! Whether you're 8 or 80 come along and show your love for our neighbourhood and come along to this year's Community Spring Clean. This year we're going for Saturday 20th September, which also happens to be UN Community Clean Up Day.
Meet at Pukehuia Park at 10.30am to collect protective gear and rubbish bags, and then head out around our neighbourhood to collect what you can. You might like to head to somewhere you know is particularly rubbish-y around our suburb.
Bring your rubbish back to the park for a weigh-in and to be collected by the Council. Then celebrate your hard work and grab a free sausage or two off the BBQ.
Bring your friends and neighbours and join the fun and satisfaction of making our home a nicer place.
Organised by Newlands Anglican and Newlands Baptist Churches. For more info contact office@newlandsanglican.org.nz or get in touch with Rebecca on 021 0869 9235.
label: Conservation & Environment

description:
Omaka Wings & Wheels 28th Sept, Daylight Savings is coming, and so is the Omaka Aviation Heritage Centre's Wings & Wheels Open Day! Make sure to mark Sunday, 28th September, 2025, on your calendar to spring forward into an amazing day of aircraft and classic cars!

We have a spectacular lineup of aircraft planned from throughout history, and joy flights will be available. Re-hydrate and refuel at the Omaka Cafe and guest food outlets. Bring your picnic rugs and deck chairs, and make yourself comfortable because you won't want to leave!

And don't forget to take the opportunity to visit the two remarkable exhibitions at the Omaka Aviation Heritage Centre. Entry to both is included in your Omaka Wings & Wheels ticket. For value for money, it doesn't get any better than this!
** There will be gate sales on the day. However, we highly recommend that you pre-purchase tickets online for the best price and quickest check-in experience. **
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Paint and Wine Night in Wellington - Banksy Heart Balloons, The concept is simple - take a brush in one hand, a drink in the other and let’s paint a masterpiece!

Join us for a creative night of drinking and painting in the heart of Wellington! No previous painting experience necessary. Get your creative juices flowing and your brush strokes going!

Drinks: No drinks are included in the ticket price, but drinks are available for purchase.

Food: A delicious menu will be available to purchase throughout the event.

What is Paintvine?
It’s a fun social painting class where our artists will run you through step-by-step instructions on how to create your very own masterpiece in a fun and relaxed bar setting. Perfect for dates, catching up with mates or for meeting new friends!

We provide all the materials you need (high-quality canvas, acrylic paint, brushes). All you need to bring is your creative spirit (or find some at the bottom of a glass). At the end of the night you will leave with your own painting ready to hang up on your wall.

For tickets, future events, FAQs and more info head to the Paintvine website.
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Spelljammer and Beyond Campaign, Spelljammer and Beyond Campaign
Welcome to the Astral Sea - the starlit realm that surrounds the worlds of the Dungeons & Dragons multiverse. When a cosmic enemy threatens to destroy their world, brave heroes must do everything in their power to save it. This quest will take them across the teeming oceans of Wildspace to the silvery void of the Astral Sea and beyond.

Can they save their world before time runs out?

Matthew Gee (He/him) is a friendly and welcoming DM to anyone who pulls up a chair. If you're looking for engaging adventures look no further! Happy to put on a show with character voices and indulge party shenanigans, while still hooking you into the ongoing narrative and challenging the party through roleplay, lore, traps and maybe a puzzle or two. With a mixture of theater of the mind and mini combat there's never a dull moment in his games. Matthew has a wealth of experience DM'ing numerous genres and systems to create immersive and entertaining sessions for all ages.
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Paint and Wine Night in Wellington - Piha Sunset, The concept is simple - take a brush in one hand, a drink in the other and let’s paint a masterpiece!

Join us for a creative night of drinking and painting in the heart of Wellington! No previous painting experience necessary. Get your creative juices flowing and your brush strokes going!

Drinks: No drinks are included in the ticket price, but drinks are available for purchase.

Food: A delicious menu will be available to purchase throughout the event.

What is Paintvine?
It’s a fun social painting class where our artists will run you through step-by-step instructions on how to create your very own masterpiece in a fun and relaxed bar setting. Perfect for dates, catching up with mates or for meeting new friends!

We provide all the materials you need (high-quality canvas, acrylic paint, brushes). All you need to bring is your creative spirit (or find some at the bottom of a glass). At the end of the night you will leave with your own painting ready to hang up on your wall.

For tickets, future events, FAQs and more info head to the Paintvine website.
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Pearls & Pints - Adults Social Club, Meet new people, make new jewellery, and enjoy your first drink on the house! Pearls & Pints is a faction of our Village Beads Social Collective, which aims to connect people of similar interests as you bond over creating some new pearl jewellery and enjoy some pints (or other beverages!). Come solo and meet new people, or bring some friends along for a fun night at Abandoned Brewery! No beading skills required, our team will help out with all the technical skills at the end.

Create either two freshwater pearl bracelets or one freshwater pearl necklace in this session. We’ll bring a huge selection of different freshwater pearl beads with us, and Abandoned have a huge selection of craft beers, wines, and other delicious drinks to choose between! Snacks available for purchase too.

Bookings and payments required in advance for people aged 18+. Valid ID required upon entry.

description:
Partial Solar Eclipse - Free event, A rare Partial Solar Eclipse will take place as the Sun (Te Rā) rises on the morning of Monday 22 September. Aotearoa New Zealand is one the few places it will be visible. The last one we had was back in November 2012. At maximum, which takes place just after 7:00 am, 66% of the Sun will be covered by the Moon.
To make the most of this opportunity the Wellington Astronomical Society Outreach team will be at the Wellington waterfront with our solar scopes. Solar eclipse glasses will be available to purchase for $2 each. Please bring coins/cash.
Please DO NOT look at the Sun directly or even with sunglasses. You will damage your eyes. If you don't have access to solar glasses, use a pinhole projector or look at the shadows of leaves on the ground.
If you want to support our Society by becoming a member, please go to https://www.was.org.nz/join-us/

description:
Pre-order my new book! Homegrown Fruit: A Practical Guide, Pre-order your copy of the book, then come along to Firebird on the 28th and pick it up. I'll sign it, and then we'll settle in for a book chat about 3.15.
Coffee + cake for sale.
Jason and I are so proud of this book! Were stoked to get this practical, useful information out there, and give you the tools to be an epic fruit gardener.
"A book for those who love growing their own fruit, or who want to learn how to do it or do it better – no matter your garden size. It covers it all – where to start, what to look for, what is suitable for your area, how to prep, how to look after and train – you name it, it is in here. A must have and a keeper." Fiona Eadie, author of 100 Best Native Plants for New Zealand Gardens

description:
Private Cape Palliser Day Trip from Wellington, Escape to the Dramatic Coast: Private Cape Palliser Day Trip from Wellington
Are you looking for a unique and unforgettable day trip from Wellington?
Imagine yourself surrounded by breathtaking coastal scenery, watching playful seals in their natural habitat, and standing in the shadow of a historic lighthouse with panoramic ocean views.
As your dedicated travel and adventure tour guide, I offer exclusive, low-key private tours to Cape Palliser, perfect for individuals, couples, or families seeking a personalized and enriching experience.
What's in store for you:
Personalized Pick-up & Drop-off: Enjoy the convenience of being picked up and dropped off directly from your Wellington accommodation.
Scenic Coastal Drive: Relax in comfort as we journey through picturesque landscapes, including the stunning Remutaka Hill Road and the rugged Wairarapa coastline.
Marvel at the Putangirua Pinnacles: Explore the otherworldly rock formations made famous by "Lord of the Rings."
Encounter the Cape Palliser Seal Colony: Witness a thriving colony of New Zealand fur seals up close (from a safe and respectful distance).
Discover the Iconic Cape Palliser Lighthouse: Climb (or admire from below) the iconic red and white striped lighthouse and soak in the incredible views.
Flexible & Relaxed Pace: This is your private tour, so we'll move at a comfortable pace and can tailor the day to your interests.
Gourmet Options Available (upon request & additional cost): Elevate your experience with a pre-arranged gourmet picnic lunch or inquire about other bespoke dining options featuring local flavors.
Expert Guidance: Benefit from my local knowledge, insights into the region's history, geology, and wildlife, ensuring a truly engaging experience.
Perfect for Photography Enthusiasts: Capture stunning photos of dramatic landscapes and unique wildlife.
Who is this tour for?
This private Cape Palliser day trip is ideal for:
Individuals seeking a solo adventure.
Couples looking for a romantic and scenic escape.
Families wanting a memorable and educational day out.
Anyone who appreciates beautiful scenery, wildlife encounters, and a relaxed, personalized travel experience.
Those who value quality and are happy to invest in a private tour.
Date & Time: Flexible - Contact me to discuss your preferred dates and times.
Duration: Approximately 8-9 hours (can be adjusted slightly based on your preferences).
Price: Pricing is tailored to the number of people in your group and any additional requests (e.g., gourmet lunch). Please message me for a personalized quote.
Booking:
Send me a direct message to discuss your preferred dates, group size, and any specific interests you may have. I'm happy to answer any questions and create a bespoke itinerary for you.
Don't miss out on this opportunity to experience the magic of Cape Palliser on your own terms!
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Pōneke Pump n' Dump - Pinball Tournament, PINBALL TOURNAMENT AT YE OLDE PINBALL SHOPPE
Pōneke's Premier Pinball Tournament for your future career as an internationally ranked pinball player!
Make a hearty pilgrimage through the arcade, trying your hand at a selection of our finely curated games, report your scores to the staff, and watch your ranking on the tournament ladder rise as your scores are stacked up against your competitors. Not happy with a score you got? No problem, you can keep trying until you're
happy with it!
Make it into the Top 16 before the end of Saturday, and you'll be invited to play in the finals round the following Sunday, where 1st - 8th will play in A Division, and 9th - 16th will play in B Division.
This finals round is free of charge, and comes with a whopping prize pool worth $200 in value awarded to the top finishers in each division.
So what are you waiting for? Come and show us your skills!
Qualification Round (7th - 13th September):
Each player is granted access to a token deal of 12 tokens for $20!
- Sunday to Saturday
- Submit at least one score on each of the selected 8 games during open hours.
- Your best score on each game is ranked.
- Take a picture of your score and submit it at the counter.
- Unlimited qualifying! Not satisfied with your score? Grab more tokens and keep playing to improve it!
Scoring System:
- Linear Scoring applies. Score 100pts for the top score on each selected game, 99pts for 2nd, 98pts for 3rd, and so on.
Finals (14th September):
Top 16 qualifiers will battle it out on Sunday from 12pm onwards, with 8 in A-Division, and 8 in B-Division! Keep an eye on our socials if you've participated in the competition throughout the week - those who have qualified for the finals will be announced on SATURDAY night (the 12th).
You could win a share of $200 in Shoppe Credit!
How to Participate:
Simply come to Ye Olde Pinball Shoppe during open hours and submit your scores from Monday to Saturday!
Location:
18A Bond Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011
This month's games are:
AC/DC
Fish Tales
Godzilla
James Bond 007
King Kong
Lord of the Rings
Medieval Madness
Pulp Fiction
Come, participate, and let’s find out who the true Pinball Wizard is! May the best player win!

description:
Pōneke Pinballers - Tournament & Free Play, - FREE TO PLAY PINBALL
- TOURNAMENTS
- PRIZES
- ON-SITE BAR
What more you could ask for?
Kicking off at 6pm, Thursday the 3rd of April. We open to you the entire arcade set to “free play”. This is the one time a month when you won’t need any tokens to play pinball, just push the start button and you’re on your way.
You might be wondering how much this incredible night will cost? We present to you a bargain of a life time. $20 at the door gets you night of dirt cheap pinball.
BUT WAIT THERE’S MORE…
For only an extra $5 get your self entered in the NZ's largest monthly tournament, Pōneke Pinballers. Put your skills to the test and play with the best players in the country.
Tournament details:
Qualifying:
- From 6:30 - 8:30pm.
- Group match play 7/5/3/1 scoring.
- 1 game per round
- no new rounds after 8:30pm
Finals:
- Top 12 players.
- Amazing race format

Bring your mates along for a night of ALL YOU CAN PLAY PINBALL!

description:
Retina NZ Social - Axe-Throwing!, Retina NZ Social - Axe-Throwing!
Come along this Sunday to meet some of the Committee of Retina NZ while getting to know more of what Retina NZ does - all over a game of axe-throwing!

Axe-throwing starts at 2pm and will go for 90-120 minutes. Please arrive early so we can go through health and safety checks.

Sweet Axe Throwing Co. have trained staff in how to guide blind and low vision people, so we want to give the opportunity to our community to try an activity they may not normally consider.

Ages: 12+
Cost: Retina NZ/ Blind Low Vision Members: $20pp
RSVP's essential
Contact Dan on 0273594473 for more information

Don't forget our AGM is also on this Saturday (6th September)!

description:
Radio Hauraki 'The Big Show' • Beervana Warm Up Show, We’re going BIG to warm up for the BIGGEST beer weekend in the capital.
Next Thursday, @radiohaurakinz are bringing The Big Show to Lyall Bay - broadcasting their @beervananz Warm-Up Show live from Parrotdog Bar.
Roll in early to score one of 100 FREE Backbone Tees and hang with The Big Show crew. Then pull up a stump for a cold pint of Parrotdog, perfectly paired with dinner from two Wellington food icons – @oikoshellenic and @tommytomato.
@oikoshellenic will be serving charcoal-grilled chicken, slow-cooked lamb, and charred eggplant, all tucked into their house-made pita.
@tommytomato will be firing up the @gozney for slices of hot, crispy pizza.
On the sounds we have DJ Karl Gebbie.
On tap we’ll be pouring our brand-new Alcoholic Ginger Beer, alongside all the usual suspects.
See you next week!
#parrotdogbar #haurakinz #thebigshow #beervanawarmup #nice

description:
Toi Pōneke Market Lane Tours: CANCELLED, We’re excited to announce tours of the new Toi Pōneke whare at 3-6 Market Lane, Wellington. We will be occupying a portion of the building on the corner of Cable Street and Market Lane.

Before our new premises undergo a refit, we invite you to tour the interior of the building and see where the artist studios, arts offices and workshop space will be located.

Tours are available on Sat 30 Aug '25 at 11am, 12noon, 1pm and 2pm and Sun 31 Aug '25 at 10am, 11am, 12noon, and 1pm.

The re-imagined Toi Pōneke Moemoeā (Vision) is:
He kaiwhakatere i te tupu me te whanaketanga o ngā ringatoi o Te Whanganui-a-Tara

A catalyst for the growth and development of Wellington artists

Our new Toi Pōneke will create a vibrant space that nurtures collaboration, creativity and cultural exchange among artists of all generations using Tuakana-Teina Kaupapa. 

For more information head to the Toi Pōneke website.

description:
5 Course Dinner at Le Cordon Bleu | 6 SEPTEMBER 2025, This 5-Course dinner expertly prepared by our Intermediate Cuisine & Diplôme Avancé Culinaire students is not to be missed.
Ticket Information
IMPORTANT NOTE: Tables are arranged per order. If you purchase tickets separately you need to e-mail nz@cordonbleu.edu to advise which other ticket holders you wish to be seated with.
Date: Saturday 6th September
(We are hosting additional dinner sessions, to purchase tickets for these events please click here and select your chosen date. Tickets are non-transferable, please ensure you purchase tickets for the correct date.)
Price: $99 per person
Booking Times: 5:30pm | 6:00pm | 6:30pm | 7:00pm
Matched Wine Option: If you would like to add matched wines to your dining experience you can do so on the day by paying an additional charge. Alternatively, we have a selection of wines to purchase by the glass or bottle as well as beers and soft drinks. We are a fully licensed restaurant and do not offer BYO.
Dietary Requirements: Our menu is set and we are unable to make any menu alterations or cater to any specific dietary requirements (including religious diets) or food allergies. We apologise for any inconvenience this may cause.
The Menu: will not be released before the event. Please be aware that the menu will include fish, meat and shellfish components.
Tickets are allocated for specific seating times, please ensure you arrive promptly at the time indicated on your ticket.
The estimated time to enjoy the full Le Cordon Bleu 5 course dining experience is 2 hours. We invite you to sit back, relax and enjoy our students' creations.
What is Brasserie Le Cordon Bleu?
Brasserie Le Cordon Bleu is our training restaurant where our students get practical experience in a real restaurant environment - all under the expert guidance of their chef lecturers. In the kitchen, we have students from our Diplôme de Cuisine programme. In the dining room we have our Bachelor of Culinary Arts and Business students serving you and putting their theory skills into practice.
Brasserie & High Tea Refund Policy
• No refunds are provided unless the event is cancelled by Le Cordon Bleu NZ.
• Customers can arrange for someone else to take their place.
label: Food & Drink

description:
War on Drugs Film Screening, In remembrance of the victims of human rights violations and extrajudicial killings during the War on Drugs in the Philippines, please join us for a free/koha screening of "On the President's Orders" documentary in Te Whanganui-a-Tara.

NOTE: For a list of trigger warnings, please see this document. Since we will be viewing and discussing potentially sensitive topics, the event will have an Open Door Policy, which means that you may leave the venue any time, for any reason, and will not be judged for doing so.
WHAT IS THE WAR ON DRUGS?
Spearheaded by the former Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte, the War on Drugs is a violent anti-drug campaign which killed nearly 30,000 Filipinos, most of which were urban poor (Karapatan, Amnesty International, Human Rights Watch).
WHAT ARE EXTRAJUDICIAL KILLINGS?
"Extrajudicial killings, or extrajudicial executions, happen when someone in an official position deliberately kills a person without any legal process" (World Organisation Against Torture).
WHY IS IT IMPORTANT TO TALK ABOUT TODAY?
Human rights violations and extrajudicial killings are still on-going in the Philippines under President Bongbong Marcos, the son of the dictator Ferdinand Marcos Sr. who proclaimed Martial Law in 1972, and Vice President Sara Duterte, the daughter of former President Rodrigo Duterte (Karapatan).
WHY WOULD I WANT TO JOIN THE FILM SCREENING?
The film screening is for anyone who is keen to learn about the War on Drugs, wants to share their experience during the War on Drugs (or something similar) through group discussion, wants to meet new people, wants to watch a Philippine film/documentary, or just wants to have snacks.
I WANT TO JOIN BUT I'M FROM TĀMAKI MAKAURAU / CHRISTCHURCH / THE PHILIPPINES.
We will stream the film through Zoom for viewers outside Te Whanganui-a-Tara, however, there may be internet and other technical difficulties during the event itself. Also please make sure to select the "Online" ticket option when RSVPing.
HOW MUCH IS THE TICKET?
The film screening is free but we appreciate koha for the venue/snacks/donations to Philippine non-governmental organisations (NGOs).
NOTE: This is an LGBTQ+ friendly event.
label: Film & Media

description:
Roll for Hope 2025, A tabletop roleplaying games event, all proceeds will go to Make-A-Wish. Please visit our website for more information on games and times - https://rollforhope.nz
With a range of games including Dungeons & Dragons, Savage Worlds, Pirate Borg, Paranoia, homegrown games, playtests, and more, there's sure to be something for everyone.
The doors will open at 9.30am, with the first session starting at 10am. There will be three sessions of games in a variety of systems and genres; 10am-1pm, 2-5pm, and 6.15-9.15pm, Book for anywhere between 1-3 sessions for $8 per session, with a 20% discount if you book all three.
A survey link will be emailed closer to the event for attendees to rank their game preference so that we can assign people to games, check spam if you don't receive the email.

description:
Roll For Romance (AGE 25- 39), Roll For Romance (AGE 25- 39)

Single? We have got you!



Highlights:

This unique event adds a playful twist to speed dating, allowing singles to connect through fun and games.
Enjoy simple board games like Giant Jenga, perfect for breaking the ice – even if you’re new to games!
Skip the awkward small talk and see how people interact in a relaxed, group setting. Match with someone and get connected for a second date.


You’ll start the night in mixed-gender groups and rotate around to see people of the opposite gender.



Feeling a bit shy? You’ll stay with your same-gendered group through the night, so bring a friend along for the ride!



Drinks are provided, and we have nibbles to keep you fueled. Because, let’s face it, gaming is thirsty work!





After the games wrap up, feel free to hang out with your new acquaintances till 9.15 and play other games.

A match form will be sent out the following day, and we’ll connect you with your matches in the coming days.

Perfect for singles looking to mix fun with the chance to meet someone special.





Recommended age 25-39.

Book now!



Not your vibe? Check out our other upcoming events on our website!
By purchasing a ticket you agree to our Privacy Policy & Terms & Conditions.



** If your gender is showing as sold out, join the waitlist! You’ll get a notification if there are cancellations or additional tickets released!
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Saturday Mahjong and Chinese Chess (Sept 2025), Calling all Mahjong (麻將), Chinese Chess (象棋) and Go (圍棋) players...
Whether you're a complete beginner or have some skills under your belt, come along to enjoy some friendly games at our Saturday afternoon session. You can drop in and leave anytime.
We offer a variety of Mahjong styles to suit your preference, including Cantonese, Sichuan, and Taiwanese. While we primarily play Mahjong, Chinese Chess and Go is available for play.
Lessons are available for Mahjong from 1.30-2.30pm.
Fee: $10 per person
Afternoon tea: Tea, coffee and light afternoon tea provided.
Game sets: Please bring along your Mahjong, Chinese Chess and Go sets.
Payment options: Credit card with 60c booking fee; Internet Banking or Cash

description:
Social Sewing Saturday - September, Social Sewing Saturday - September
Join us for a fun day of sewing and socializing this September at Social Sewing Saturday - make new friends and create something amazing tog

About this Event

Social Sewing Saturday - September
Come join us for a fun-filled day of sewing and socializing at Karori Arts & Crafts! Whether you're a seasoned pro or just starting out, this event is perfect for anyone who loves to sew. Bring your latest project or start something new - either way, you'll have a blast chatting with fellow sewing enthusiasts. Bring your current project or get inspired by others' creations at our friendly gathering. Share tips, tricks, and stories while working on our projects together.
Don't forget to pack your sewing machine, fabric, and any other supplies you'll need. We can't wait to see what you create! You will need to bring your own machine and materials. Please bring an extension lead and multipoint box if you have one. (Don't worry, though—we have some in the centre, too!) We'll supply an iron and ironing board to share, as well as a table and relatively comfy chair each. There are also spare cutting-out tables at a taller height. You are welcome to come along and work on hand-sewing projects.
A kitchen is available on site and supermarkets as well as cafes are very close by.
Parking is free and there are 3 dedicated spaces for the centre as well as others closeby.
Cost: Free for members of the Karori Arts Centre or $15 per person payable directly to KACC. (Membership of the centre is $105 annually and also gives you reductions on classes and access to other groups)
Please do NOT attend if you are sick (even just a little bit!)

Stitch and butch is a playful twist on the stitch and b!tch name to reflect the queerness of the group. Attendees do not need to be in any particular subset of the queer community to be welcome.

description:
The Festive Flyer, The Festive Flyer
Join us and celebrate Christmas with a delicious lunch and a day out on the train! Saturday 6th December 2025

Get into the festive spirit with Steam Incorporated—perfect for celebrating with colleagues, friends, and family!

Jump onboard our heritage train departing Wellington Station, and nestle down into your seats for a relaxing journey up the coast behind one of our heritage Da class locomotives.

After arriving at the private entry at Tatum, you'll take a short walk across the car park and follow the music into the Pavilion, where we settle in just in time for lunch!

Immerse yourself in a well-crafted meal, created by the talented chefs there. The menu is set to be a classic kiwi style Christmas buffet feast with all the trimmings!

There will be plenty to keep you entertained such as outdoor games, live music, and 2 dinner sittings, so there is plenty of time to tour Tatum, check out Tatum House, and relax in the gardens on the Tatum House Lawn with a drink. You will be advised of your sitting time prior to arrival.

Departing Tatum, climb on board, head to the Lounge Car, grab a drink from the bar and enjoy the journey home. This unforgettable ride hugs the dramatic coastline along the famed Kapiti escarpment, offering sweeping views of the Tasman Sea and rugged cliffs. It’s a rare chance to relive the golden age of rail in one of New Zealand’s most scenic rail corridors as the sun begins to set.

This excursion will be hauled by our 1955-built diesel electric locomotive, Da 1410, and consist of our steel carriages.

Fares (include your return train travel, meal and entertainment)
Adult 13+ yrs - $229
Child 2-12yrs - $189
Infant 0-2yrs - FREE

Thinking of a larger event, or your corporate Christmas Function?
We're pleased to be able to offer some fantastic packages for large groups, or corporate functions with our friends at Tatum. This all inclusive train ride and Christmas lunch combo is a great way to celebrate 2025 with your team! Please contact us via email or call us on 0800 783 264 for a personalized group package.

Please be at your boarding station minimum 10 minutes prior ready to roll, with your tickets, carriage letter and seating allocations at the ready.

Limited Mobility Disclaimer
Tatum does NOT have a platform. This means you must be able to board and disembark the train from ground level with little to no assistance.

Due to the age, design and nature of our heritage carriages, these are not suitable for passengers with limited mobility. If you have any concerns, please contact us on 0800 783 264 to discuss options with our bookings team!

All tickets and seating allocations are sent via email, within 48 hours prior to the departure of this excursion.

Prior booking is essential, make sure you reserve your spot now to avoid missing out on this experience.

Each performer gets the chance to have a six- minute set with a microphone, guitar and keyboard provided.

This is an originals only event. We want to encourage new creative voices to be heard.

“We want to provide a positive and encouraging environment for established and fledgling acts to shine in. It's a pretty inspiring place to perform,” says host Steven Hood.

Each performer will need to sign up in person before 7pm and registrations of interest need to be emailed to openwandw@gmail.com before May 25.

description:
Conservation Week, Skink and Gecko Live Show Reino Grundling will talk and show slides illustrating the mostly unrealised role that lizards (skinks and geckos) had in our pristine ecosystems, with some 130 or more different species! And what makes this presentation so marvellous is that he will have a number of living examples there for all to see! Great for the kids!

Conservation Colouring Competition The Masterton Library is celebrating the importance of conservation with a colouring competition—and there are some great prizes up for grabs. There will also be an informative display featuring conservation-themed resources you’re welcome to take home with you.

Dr Marie Doole Biodiversity Funding Talk Dr Marie Doole will discuss the pros and cons around nature/biodiversity credits, an emerging option for funding the protection of biodiversity, particularly on private land, by investors, whether corporate or philanthropic. Worth attending if you've been following the media hype.

Think Like a Forest Film Forest and Bird are showing this film, starring Sam the Trap Man, in three locations. The Regent have generously offered to show it where it will have the most effect—on the big screen! The film is produced by Pure Advantage who have an aspirational programme around landscape-scale restoration of native forests called Recloaking Papatūānuku.

Kōkako Morning Hikoi Join us for a special one-off tour and experience the magic of the kōkako at Pūkaha. Follow our expert guide to a kōkako hotspot and enjoy the rare opportunity to possibly see and hear kōkako. After your walk, return to the centre for a hot drink and morning tea.

Waihinga Bridge Planting Morning Ruamāhanga Farm Foundation is hosting a morning of planting and a celebration of children's voices at the start of the soon to be opened Waihinga Bridge Walkway. Tools will be provided and all ages and abilities are welcome!

Exploring Ngahere Under Story and Campfire Talk The Tramping Gently Club Art Collective (TGCAC) takes up temporary residency at Te Whare Whakapapa Raranga to explore human-centred warning systems and ngahere's role in mitigating danger. Join us in bringing the understory into te whare through kōrero and creative exploration.
label: Conservation & Environment

description:
Unity Book Club October 2025 | Cursed Daughters, About the book: 
No man will call your house his home. And if they try, they will not have peace...

So goes the family curse, long handed down from generation to generation, ruining families and breaking hearts. And now it's Eniiyi's turn - who, due to her uncanny resemblance to her dead aunt, Monife, is already used to her family's strange beliefs, as well as their insistence that she is a reincarnation. Still, when she falls in love with the handsome boy she saves from drowning, she can no longer run from her family's history. Is she destined to live out the habitual story of love and heartbreak, or can she escape the family curse and the mysterious fate that befell her aunt?

Melissa and Eden will be hosting our monthly book club to discuss some of the excellent recently released books.

In October we will be discussing Cursed Daughters by Oyinkan Braithwaite.

We have limited tickets available so grab a ticket sooner rather then later and tell your friends and whānau.

Drinks and snacks provided. If you have any specific allergies, let us know and send an email.

If you have any further queries send us an email to wellington@unitybooks.co.nz and address it to Melissa.
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Draw It Out - Teens block course, A fun and deep way for teens (11-17 year olds) to learn to process their feelings.
Theme: Listening to your inner voice
Learn how to listen to your feelings and find guidance from within, using a gentle powerful tool called Interactive Drawing Therapy.
Teenage years can often be filled with external influences, making it hard to listen to our own inner voice for guidance. This 4-session block course teaches teens how to use drawing to process hard feelings and access their own inner resources, which can be used at home as visual journaling.
Dates
This block course consists of 4 workshops:
4.15pm-5.30pm
Tuesday 19th August - Metaphors for feelings
Tuesday 26th August - Uncovering needs
Tuesday 2nd September - Unlocking self-compassion
Monday 8th September - Curiosity in direction
Cost
$184 total ($46 per session)
Included in each session
You will be guided by Lara Phillips, a trained creative facilitator in Interactive Drawing Therapy, through drawing prompts (similar to a guided meditation or journaling) to draw out where you are at and draw out your own inner guidance. No art skills are needed, more simple mark making.
This gentle yet powerful tool uses drawing and writing as a way to access your subconscious and to listen to your heart rather than your head for guidance. A tool often used in therapy, it is made accessible for self-care and community wellness through these workshops.
About Lara Phillips
Lara Phillips is a creative facilitator trained in Interactive Drawing Therapy. With a 20 year career in creative copywriting in design and communication, she shares drawing and writing as a mode for wellness and self-care, to promote preventative and proactive mental health measures through creativity.
“We all have the wisdom within to help ourselves, if given the space.”
For more workshops or to book individual sessions visit www.drawitout.co.nz

Liability disclaimer
Draw It Out offers creativity for wellbeing. It is not intended as therapy nor does it replace counselling, therapy, or any other medical or clinical professional help. Participants are guided to draw out where they are at, whilst drawing out their own inner resources for support and guidance.
Participants understand it is their own responsibility to manage their mental and physical health during sessions, to opt in and out of activities as they see fit, and make the facilitator aware if further support is required.
label: Health & Wellness

description:
Tui Express, Tui Express
Mainline Steam’s popular Tui Brewery trip returns with Steam locomotive Jb1236 (Joanne) and the fleet of Ao carriages featuring large panoramic windows, air conditioning and heating.

Travel from Plimmerton through Pukerua Bay overlooking the stunning coast line with views of Kapiti Island as we proceed north through Kapiti into the country side of the Manawatu. We pass through the Manawatu Gorge with spectacular views of the river and the remnants of the old highway now bypassed by the new The Te Ahu a Turanga highway over the Tararua ranges.

Our buffet carriage will have food and drinks available for purchase during the trip.

Upon arrival at Mangatainoka, a bus will transfer you to the Tui Brewery or feel free to take the 10-minute walk to the Brewery.

Our hosts at the Tui Brewery will serve a gourmet BBQ lunch in the original Flagon room with a complimentary drink (beer, cider, Sav) and you will receive the Mangatainoka Passport full of vouchers to redeem at the Brewery. Please purchase the lunch option when booking your train tickets.

Timetable:

Depart Paraparaumu 8:25am Return 6:10pm

Depart Otaki 9:15am Return 5:25pm

Depart Levin 9:50am Return 4:55pm

Depart Palmerston North 10:50am Return 4:05pm

description:
Unity Book Club: Before the Winter Ends, Melissa and Eden host our monthly book club to discuss some of the excellent recently released books.
For the month of August we will be discussing Before the Winter Ends by Khadro Mohamed.
In the cold Wellington winter, Omar’s grades are slipping, his mum is unwell and his best friend is growing distant. Two decades earlier in Mogadishu, Asha and Yasser are falling in love and starting to build a life together while a burgeoning war threatens to take it away.
Before the Winter Ends explores the relationship between mother and son across Aotearoa New Zealand, Somalia and Egypt as they search for understanding and try to bridge the distance between them. Khadro Mohamed’s debut novel is a stark portrayal of how the past illuminates the present and how grief shapes a family.
Limited tickets available so grab a ticket sooner, rather than later and tell your friends and whānau. Drinks and snacks are provided.
