description:
Twin Peaks Meetup Wellington: Season 2 - Episodes 8 & 9, If the sound of watching Twin Peaks together with a bunch of like minded fans sounds like a good idea, then you've come to the right place!

Last time we met we celebrated completing all of Season 1 together.

I am excited to announce we are now going to watch Season 2! Starting off with the special double length "Episode 8: May the Giant Be With You". Written by Mark Frost, David Lynch and directed by David Lynch. Followed by "Episode 9:Coma". Directed by David Lynch.

This is what we will be watching :

-Short Recap "Previously...on Twin Peaks"

-Episode 8: "May the Giant Be With You" (93mins)

-Intermission

-Episode 9: "Coma" (46mins)

With all Log Lady Intros!

WHERE: The mini cinema in Te Auaha. 65 Dixon St. Te Aro.

(Take the lift or stairs to Level 1 and turn left.)
The mini cinema's specs: 4K projection, Screen size 4450mm x 2500mm, Aspect ratio 16:9 with 7.1 surround sound.

Here is a link to Te Auaha's cinema so you know what to expect.
https://www.teauahaevents.com/our-spaces/cinema

WHEN: Meet at 10:30am on Saturday 6th Sept. 2025. in the Bar area. The bar will be closed but you are welcome to bring your own snacks/drink.

Chat with other Twin peakies and the show will start on the dot at 11:00am

COST: Tickets are $10 per person

Tickets will be capped/limited so that everyone can have a decent seat. Every single screening so far has sold out well in advance, so grab those tickets ASAP and don't miss out on experiencing the epic start to Season 2 in a room full of your people that love Twin Peaks!


RULES:
1. Tickets are per person. There will be NO door sales, so DO purchase it beforehand please.

2. All attendees MUST be 18yo +

3. This is a safe, friendly, INCLUSIVE place. There is ZERO tolerance for discrimination, disrespect or creepy gross behavior of any kind. By attending you agree to the Code of Conduct.

4. Please clean up after yourself if you are snacking and help keep the mini cinema clean as a whistle.

Thank you! And hope to see you there.
label: Film & Media

description:
Unity Book Club: Before the Winter Ends, Melissa and Eden host our monthly book club to discuss some of the excellent recently released books.
For the month of August we will be discussing Before the Winter Ends by Khadro Mohamed.
In the cold Wellington winter, Omar’s grades are slipping, his mum is unwell and his best friend is growing distant. Two decades earlier in Mogadishu, Asha and Yasser are falling in love and starting to build a life together while a burgeoning war threatens to take it away.
Before the Winter Ends explores the relationship between mother and son across Aotearoa New Zealand, Somalia and Egypt as they search for understanding and try to bridge the distance between them. Khadro Mohamed’s debut novel is a stark portrayal of how the past illuminates the present and how grief shapes a family.
Limited tickets available so grab a ticket sooner, rather than later and tell your friends and whānau. Drinks and snacks are provided.
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Tui Express, Tui Express
Mainline Steam’s popular Tui Brewery trip returns with Steam locomotive Jb1236 (Joanne) and the fleet of Ao carriages featuring large panoramic windows, air conditioning and heating.

Travel from Plimmerton through Pukerua Bay overlooking the stunning coast line with views of Kapiti Island as we proceed north through Kapiti into the country side of the Manawatu. We pass through the Manawatu Gorge with spectacular views of the river and the remnants of the old highway now bypassed by the new The Te Ahu a Turanga highway over the Tararua ranges.

Our buffet carriage will have food and drinks available for purchase during the trip.

Upon arrival at Mangatainoka, a bus will transfer you to the Tui Brewery or feel free to take the 10-minute walk to the Brewery.

Our hosts at the Tui Brewery will serve a gourmet BBQ lunch in the original Flagon room with a complimentary drink (beer, cider, Sav) and you will receive the Mangatainoka Passport full of vouchers to redeem at the Brewery. Please purchase the lunch option when booking your train tickets.

Timetable:

Depart Plimmerton 7:45am Return 6:35pm

Depart Paraparaumu 8:25am Return 6:10pm

Depart Otaki 9:15am Return 5:25pm

Depart Levin 9:50am Return 4:55pm

Depart Palmerston North 10:50am Return 4:05pm

Depart Mangatainoka 2:25pm

Please be at your boarding station 10 minutes prior to departure with your tickets ready.

Tickets Prices

From Plimmerton or Paraparaumu: Adult $145. Child (under 16) $85

From Otaki or Levin: Adult $125. Child (under 16) $65

From Palmerston North: Adult $85. Child (under 16) $50

Tui Brewery BBQ Lunch and complementary drink: Adult $45. Child (under 16) $20

Limited Mobility Disclaimer
Our carriages may not be suitable for passengers with limited mobility. If you have any concerns, please contact us at: or 04 233 8131.

description:
NZSO Emerging Artists, Aotearoa New Zealand’s brightest young musicians perform as soloists and side-by-side with the NZSO in a concert celebrating the next generation of performers.

Cameron Monteath, "La veille"
Chaminade, Flute Concertino
Mendelssohn, Violin Concerto in E Minor, Op. 64, Movement 3
R. Strauss, Oboe Concerto, Movement 3 with Movement 2 cadenza
Tchaikovsky, Variations on a Rococo Theme, Op. 33
W.A. Mozart, Piano Concerto No. 23 in A Major, K. 488, Movement 1
R. Schumann, Piano Concerto in A Minor, Op. 54, Movement 1
Dvořák, Symphony No. 9 in E Minor, Op. 95 "From the New World", Movement 4

Aotearoa New Zealand’s brightest young musicians perform as soloists and side-by-side with the NZSO in a concert celebrating the next generation of performers.

Previous young artists have gone on to perform as soloist with the NZSO, NYO and other orchestras across Aotearoa New Zealand.

description:
Wellington Brick Show 2025, Wellington's largest display of LEGO® builds is back, bigger than ever!
Mark the 13th & 14th of September in your calendar and be sure to come along to see the amazing LEGO® creations from some of NZ’s best builders. This year’s show is our biggest yet, featuring over 150 passionate exhibitors from across the country to showcase their newest, most mind-blowing LEGO® creations. From towering cities to pop culture tributes, from amazing spaceships to fanciful unicorns, we have something to inspire and amaze LEGO® fans of all ages.
Come along to Walter Nash Stadium in Lower Hutt and experience amazing LEGO® displays, interactive activities, brick pits to get creative, raffles, food trucks and much more!
When:
Saturday 13th September, 9am–5pm
Sunday 14th September, 10am–4pm
Where:
Walter Nash Centre, Lower Hutt
How much:
Adults $10
Children $7
Family ticket $28
Door sales will also be available.
Be sure to like and follow the Wellington Brick Show on Facebook and Instagram to find out more about this amazing weekend of LEGO®fun! @WBS.nz
The Wellington Brick Show is proudly brought to you by Well-LUG - Wellington LEGO® User Group. We are a group of LEGO® fans of all ages from across the lower half of the North Island. New members are always welcome. Find out more about us at www.well-lug.nz
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Watercolour and Wine Night in Whangārei - Wild Viola, Turn wine into watercolour! Take a brush in one hand, a drink in the other, and let’s paint a watercolour masterpiece!

Join us for a beginner's watercolour painting event full of fluid colour mixing and delicate brushwork where you’ll craft your own bespoke watercolour artwork. One of our watercolour experts will guide step-by-step through the watercolour process and will encourage you to add your own unique touch.

Drinks: No drinks are included in the ticket price, but drinks are available for purchase.

Food: A delicious menu will be available to purchase throughout the event.

What is Paintvine?
It’s a fun social painting class where our artists will run you through step-by-step instructions on how to create your very own masterpiece in a fun and relaxed bar setting. Perfect for dates, catching up with mates or for meeting new friends!

We provide all the materials you need (high-quality watercolour paper, watercolour paint, brushes). All you need to bring is your creative spirit (or find some at the bottom of a glass). All our events are in licensed venues, so you can purchase drinks to sip as you create! At the end of the night, you will leave with your own watercolour painting!

For tickets, future events, FAQs and more info head to the Paintvine website.

description:
Wellington Halloween Bar Crawl 2025 | Saturday, November 1st, Wellington Halloween Bar Crawl 2025 | Saturday, November 1st
Get ready for the biggest Halloween Bar Crawl in Wellington on Saturday, Nov 1st. Hit the city's top bars & clubs!

About this Event


🎃🕸️ WELLINGTON HALLOWEEN BAR CRAWL 2025 🕸️🎃
Get ready for the wildest Halloween celebration in Wellington. Join the spookiest Halloween Bar Crawl on Saturday, November 1st, 2025, and get access to 4+ of Wellington’s hottest bars and nightclubs!
🎶 Music: Live DJs playing the hottest hits and Halloween classics.
📍 Crawl Stops: Lulu Bar & Restaurant, El Horno, The Rogue & Vagabond, and BL3—Wellington's hottest bars and nightclubs for an unforgettable Halloween celebration!
🕙 Kickoff: Doors open at 7:30 PM. Wristbands must be picked up by 10:30 PM!
🎟 Tickets: Starting at just $15. Prices go up soon, so don’t wait!
Throw on your wildest costume and get ready to crawl through the city with hundreds of partygoers. Whether you're spooky, cute, or covered in fake blood—this is the crawl to be at to celebrate Halloween.🧟‍♀️


⭐ Voted Wellington’s #1 Halloween Bar Crawl Experience!
Gather your friends and take over the city with the Halloween Bar Crawl this Halloween, hitting Wellington’s top bars.
🚨 This event is limited to 500 attendees, so grab your tickets early before they sell out! Don’t miss your chance to celebrate this big holiday—secure your spot before it’s too late!





What’s Included in Your Ticket:
🎃 Join Hundreds of Halloween Partygoers in Wellington
🚫 No Cover at All Participating Venues
🎟️ Exclusive Halloween Bar Crawl Wristband for Entry
📱 Bar Crawl Map to Navigate Each Spooky Stop 🗺️
🎵 Live DJs Spinning Halloween Hits and Party Anthems
🕺 End the Night in Style at the Final Haunted Venue
👻 Costume up and crawl your way through Wellington’s hottest bars. Enjoy eerie drink specials, electric energy, and unforgettable Halloween experience!


🚨 Get Your 2025 Halloween Bar Crawl Tickets Before We Sell Out! 🚨
🦇Wellington’s biggest Halloween bash is just around the corner. Costumes, cocktails, and chaos await across the city's top nightlife spots.
It’s time to show off your best look and turn heads all night long. Whether you're spooky, sexy, or just straight-up wild, this year's Halloween Bar Crawl is your chance to shine. Hit the city’s most popular bars, enjoy themed drinks, and party with hundreds of fellow Halloween lovers. Your costume deserves a crowd, and this is where to find it.
🚫🍸🔑 Celebrate Responsibly!
We DO NOT condone drinking and driving. Use Uber, Lyft, get a Taxi, or a designated driver to ensure a safe ride home. Celebrate responsibly and make it a Halloween to remember!
💀 Let the WELLINGTON HALLOWEEN BAR CRAWL begin!


100% CANCELLATION REFUND GUARANTEE
👌 If the event is canceled for any reason, all tickets will be refunded in full! No vouchers, no credits, just your money straight back to the bank!


WRISTBAND PICKUP INSTRUCTIONS & POLICY
Where and When to Pick Up Wristbands
WRISTBAND VENUE:
Lulu Bar & Restaurant
🕒 7:30 PM – 10:30 PM
📍 31 Courtenay Place, Te Aro, Wellington 6011
Details: Please arrive at our first stop to scan your ticket and collect your wristband. You have from 7:30 -10:30 to arrive and pick up your wristband for the night. You can stay at this venue until 10:30PM or explore the other venues.
MIDDLE STOPS:
El Horno
🕒 8:30 PM – 11:30 PM
📍 34 Courtenay Place, Te Aro, Wellington 6011
Details: This is a middle slot—you can visit this venue at your leisure anytime between 8:30 PM and 11:30 PM.
The Rogue & Vagabond
🕒 8:30 PM – 11:30 PM
📍 18 Garrett Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011
Details: This is a middle slot—you can visit this venue at your leisure anytime between 8:30 PM and 11:30 PM.
FINAL VENUE:
BL3
🕒 11:30 PM – 2:00 AM
📍8 Courtenay Place, Te Aro, Wellington 6011
Details: This is the final stop! Everyone should meet at this final venue at 11:30PM for a massive final Halloween party!


Wristband Policy
This is an open-format crawl. You must start at the first venue to collect your wristband. Once you have your wristband, you can visit any participating venues labeled as “Middle Stops” at your convenience between 8:30 PM and 11:30 PM or stay at the wristband venue until 10:30pm. After 11:30 PM, all participants will meet at the final venue to celebrate at the final party location!
Please remember that you need to collect your wristband at the first stop (wristband venue), as it is required for entry into all venues except the first one. Please also note that wristbands are no longer available after 10:30PM at the first venue. No refunds will be given if you show up late and miss the wristband pick-up window!
This club crawl is a walking bar crawl—all venues are within walking distance of each other. Please plan accordingly for transportation and your walking schedule.
Wristbands for entry will be provided by event staff only. To pick up your wristband, please check in with the event staff at the front reception or host stand.


2025 CRAWL MAP:




🎟️ General Admission – $20
Includes access to all official crawl stops. No frills — just the fun.
───────────────────────────────────────

👑 VIP Ticket – $25
Includes everything in GA plus:
🔥 Access to the VIP-only crawl challenge for free tickets
🚀 First dibs on future crawl drops & pre-sales
───────────────────────────────────────

🤯 Ultra VIP – $35
For the dangerously curious. Includes everything in VIP plus:
🏆 Name on our “Crawl Wall of Fame”
📜 Official “Certified Crawl Legend” digital certificate
🚪 Access to a future exclusive pre-sale drop
❓ A mystery bonus item we legally can’t describe 👀



A SPOOKTACULAR HALLOWEEN PARTY YOU WON'T WANT TO MISS
Skip the overpriced cover charge and long lines at a single bar. With one ticket, you’ll unlock access to multiple Halloween hotspots across Wellington, each with its own theme, music, and party energy. Whether you're rocking a full costume or just out for the night, this is your chance to experience the city’s top nightlife all in one thrilling Halloween themed experience.
THIS IS NOT YOUR AVERAGE HALLOWEEN NIGHT OUT
One bar? One vibe? That’s not how Wellington does Halloween. Grab your crew and bounce between the city’s best bars and clubs, each bringing something different to the table. From spooky cocktails to wild dance floors, the night builds up to one massive end-of-night party you won’t want to miss. 🧛‍♀️
THE BIGGEST HALLOWEEN PARTY NIGHT IN WELLINGTON
This crazy Halloween experience crawl will take you through the city’s top bars and clubs with a line-up built for non-stop fun. Expect packed dance floors, themed drinks, and a crowd ready to party in full costume.
GET YOUR TICKETS BEFORE THEY VANISH!
Spots are filling fast, so now’s the time to lock in your plans. Round up your friends, pick your costume, and get ready to sip, dance, and crawl your way through one of the most exciting nights Wellington has to offer. Halloween only comes once a year... so grab your tickets today! 🎟️



18+ EVENT / GOVERNMENT ISSUED ID REQUIRED


TIPS FOR OUR CRAWL
Pick Up Wristbands On Time: Collect your wristband(s) during the designated check-in time at the scheduled location before 10:30 PM. Late arrivals will not be accommodated — no wristband, no entry.
Assign a Proxy if Needed: Can’t make check-in? Have a friend pick up your wristband for you so they don’t miss out.
Day-Of Updates: Review the Digital Crawl Map on the morning of the event for any last-minute changes or venue updates.
Check Venue Schedule: Each venue’s crawl time is listed in the Digital Crawl Map. Wristbands and drink specials are valid only during these scheduled times.
_______________________________________


IMPORTANT DISCLAIMERS
Age Requirement: You must be 18+ years of age with a valid government-issued ID to participate in this event. No exceptions.
Wristbands: Your wristband is your key to entry. You must present your ticket or QR code at check-in to receive your wristband. Wristbands must be worn at all times to access participating bars and venues. Wristband pickup location and time are listed on the crawl map. If you do not pick up your wristband at the designated location and time, it may not be available, and you will not be able to access crawl venues. No wristband, no entry.
Ticket Policy: All sales are final—no refunds, exchanges, or transfers. In case of event cancellation without a rescheduled date, a refund (excluding fees) will be automatically issued. Event lineup, venues, and specials are subject to change without notice.
Admission & Venue Rights: Participating venues reserve the right to refuse service or entry to any attendee based on intoxication, dress code, inappropriate behaviour, or venue capacity. If refused entry at one venue, you may visit alternative crawl venues available at that time. No refunds will be given if you are denied entry for any of these reasons.
Capacity and Late Entry: Some venues may hit capacity during the event. If a venue reaches capacity or you arrive late, you may have to wait in line to gain entry. There is no guarantee of immediate access or entry to any specific venue once capacity is reached, and no refunds will be provided due to waiting times or access issues.
Self-Guided Crawl: This is a self-guided event with no host leading the group. You must use the digital crawl map to navigate between venues.
Venue Awareness: If bar staff are unaware of the crawl, you must contact the venue representative listed on the crawl map. If you cannot reach them, consider that venue unavailable and proceed to an alternative crawl venue open at that time. Nightlife venues may reach capacity or close early, and not all staff members may be aware of the crawl.
Drink Specials: Drink specials are offered by participating venues and may be modified or discontinued at any time without notice.
Event Time Restrictions: Your ticket is valid only for crawl venues during the scheduled crawl times listed on the crawl map. It is not valid for entry outside these times. If you arrive late or at the wrong venue, refunds will not be issued.
Security Checks: Wristbands do not entitle you to skip venue security checks. All attendees must comply with security screening before entry.
Costume Policy: Do not wear costumes that include items which could be considered or used as weapons. Highly offensive costumes are not tolerated and may result in denial of entry without refund.
Crawl Notifications: Sign up for crawl notification texts to receive updates about when to move to the next venue. There is no host to notify you in person.
Respect & Conduct: Treat others and the event venues with respect. Disorderly conduct, inappropriate behaviour, or damage to the venues will result in removal from the event without a refund. The participating bars reserve the right to refuse entry or remove attendees for inappropriate behaviour at any time.
Liability Waiver: By purchasing a ticket and participating in the crawl, you understand and agree that you are attending entirely at your own risk. You voluntarily assume all risks and dangers incidental to this event, including but not limited to: personal injury, illness, disability, property loss, theft, damage, accidents, death, alcohol-related incidents, and actions of other participants, staff, or third parties. You, on behalf of yourself and your heirs, executors, and assigns, hereby fully release, waive, and discharge Events Per Se, its owners, officers, directors, employees, contractors, volunteers, affiliates, sponsors, participating venues, and their respective representatives from any and all liability, claims, demands, actions, or causes of action whatsoever arising out of or related to any loss, damage, injury, illness, or death — whether caused by negligence, gross negligence, breach of contract, or otherwise — that may occur before, during, or after the event. You agree to indemnify and hold harmless Events Per Se and all released parties from any claims, costs, or expenses (including legal fees) brought by you or on your behalf, or by any third party as a result of your actions during the event. You acknowledge that you have read and understood this waiver, that you are participating voluntarily, and that this waiver is intended to be as broad and inclusive as permitted by applicable law.
Event Changes: Bars and venues may change, but the event will continue rain or shine. Always check the digital crawl map for the latest venue list and updates. Be sure to check your email for any last-minute updates.
*By purchasing a ticket, you confirm that you have read, understood, and agreed to all disclaimers, terms, and conditions stated above, and accept full responsibility for your participation in the event.

Transcend the ordinary on a journey like no other, to a show like no other. This extraordinary experience brings you the Greatest Stages on Earth.

Departing 2nd October, 2025

Beginning in Auckland or Hamilton, you'll witness the unique landscapes of the North Island aboard the Northern Explorer WOW Train. A very special service, full of all things WOW, you'll be treated to a VIP welcome, special WOW garment appearances with accompanying commentary, a WOW goodie bag and full catering during your journey. In Wellington, your journey ascends yet further with premium 'Gold' seats at the World of WearableArt (WOW) Show. This is a WOW experience like no other!

You'll love this break
If you are looking for the ultimate WOW Show experience, then this is the ticket!

Indulge your senses with a unique WOW Train experience through the volcanic heart of the North Island on your way to our stunning capital, Wellington. There, you will continue your journey into the extraordinary with a Gold ticket to see the 2025 World of WearableArt Show.

This magical 3-day experience is set to be one of the greatest journeys of all time!

Inclusions
A 'Gold' ticket for the WOW Show performance on Friday 3 October and a WOW Show Programme

description:

The undead rise in Wellington! Join the Zombie Horde Pub Crawl on Nov. 1 for 4+ pubs, specials, & a monstrous finale!

About this Event


Zombie Horde: Halloween Pub Crawl – Wellington 2025 🧟‍♂️

On Saturday, November 1st, 2025, the undead rise in Wellington. The Zombie Horde Pub Crawl takes you through 4+ pubs and bars, each with their own specials and Halloween themes. Walk with the horde, grab exclusive drinks, and end the night at the ultimate zombie party.

Crawl wristband for entry & specials
No cover charge at participating venues
Digital crawl map for navigation
DJs and live entertainment at select stops


Event Schedule
🔑 Check-In | 7:30–10:30 PM – Pick up your wristband at the opening pub.
🍺 Crawl Time | 8:30–11:30 PM – Move between bars at your own pace.
🎉 Final Party | 11:30 PM–2 AM – Gather at the last venue for the closing zombie party.



Details
🎟 Tickets start at $15 (Early Bird). Prices increase closer to Halloween.
🧛 Costumes encouraged — whether you’re a fresh zombie, survivor, or something in between, you’ll fit right in.
📍 Venue lineup announced soon. Full details will be available on the Digital Crawl Map on event day.



18+ Event / Valid ID Required

Send a Friend: If you can’t make check-in, you may authorize a friend to pick up your wristband so you don’t miss out.
Know the Schedule: Each venue’s times are listed in the Digital Crawl Map. Drink specials and crawl access are only valid during the hours posted.

All participants must be 18+ with a valid government-issued photo ID. Entry will not be granted without ID.
Wristbands
A wristband is required for entry at all participating venues. You must present your ticket or QR code at check-in to receive it. Wristbands must remain visible throughout the night. If you fail to pick up your wristband during the scheduled window, no replacement will be provided.
Tickets & Refund Policy
All ticket sales are final — no refunds, exchanges, or transfers. If the event is canceled in full, your ticket (minus fees) will be automatically refunded. Venues, times, and drink specials may be modified without notice.
Venue Rules
Each venue reserves the right to deny entry or remove guests for intoxication, capacity limits, inappropriate dress, or disruptive conduct. No refunds will be issued if entry is refused for these reasons.
Capacity & Timing
Some stops may reach capacity during the event. Admission is first-come, first-served, and your ticket does not guarantee immediate access to any specific location. Late arrivals may face delays in entry.
Self-Guided Experience
This is a self-led crawl — no host will escort groups between venues. Use the Digital Crawl Map to navigate. If staff at a venue are not aware of the crawl, contact the rep listed on the map and proceed to another participating venue if needed.
Drink Specials
Promotions are determined by each venue and may change or end without advance notice.
Security & Dress Code
All venues conduct their own security screening. Wristbands do not bypass these checks. Costumes must not include weapons (real or replica) or offensive themes. Violations may result in denied entry without refund.
Behavior Expectations
Respect venue staff, security, and fellow attendees. Aggressive or damaging behavior may result in removal without a refund.
Liability Notice

You waive any claims against the organizers, affiliates, staff, and participating venues. You also agree to indemnify and hold harmless these parties from any expenses or claims resulting from your actions.
Event Continuity

Acknowledgment

Manawa Ora Mirimiri Community Clinic Day GLENSIDE, Mirimiri and Romiromi is traditional Māori bodywork and healing. Treatment is holistic and includes body alignment, deep tissue work and release of stress and tension by applying pressure to specific points on the body.
This will be our first Community Clinic Day at our new premises in Glenside!
If you have never experienced Mirimiri or Romiromi before, this is your opportunity! Treatment is beneficial for conditions of pain, misalignment, sports or work injuries and relief from emotional distress, stress & tension; while also supporting the body to realign and rebalance energetically.
Sessions: 20mins. COST: $20
Please ensure you are well with no cold or flu symptoms on the day.
One booking per person please (no double appointments)
Payments are non-refundable but may be transfered to another person on the day.
If you are on ACC or require a full consult please contact us directly to book in.
Thankyou for your co-operation and we look forward to seeing you there!

description:
The Beatniks x IVY - NZ Tour 2025 - Wellington, ‘IVY’ and ‘The Beatniks’, two of the biggest independent artists coming out of Ōtepoti, are both known for their highly-captivating live performances. Melancholic in one instance, and packed full of noisy energy the next - now geared up with new material to showcase, the art-rock and surf-punk stylings of each of these young acts are tighter than ever.
‘IVY’ are held in the highest of regards when it comes to emerging kiwi artists. Nestling within the realm of dark and brooding tones, and immense, layered chorus, IVY know how to deliver a powerful and emotionally-resonant set; their sharp growth has quickly turned heads nationwide. From appearing on festival lineups such as Snow machine and OUSA Ori, playing with the Dunedin Youth Orchestra, and earning the SRN 2024 People’s Choice Award, IVY are ready to take their breathtaking art-rock performance around Aotearoa for the first time.
‘The Beatniks’ have been playing together since 2021, and have quickly become a ‘must-see’ live act within Aotearoa. After playing large-scale festivals last year, such as Rhythm & Alps, their recent release has delivered a more mature sound. Yet still soaked in their signature surf-grunge style. Having not toured the North Island since their debut album ‘Archetype’ in 2023, they’re ready to show you a whole new layer of alt-rock spirit on the stage.

SET TIMES:
7pm - Doors Open
7:30pm - Half/Angel
8:30pm - IVY
9:50pm - The Beatniks

description:
bbno$ | Meow Nui, Wellington - SOLD OUT, bbno$ | Meow Nui, Wellington - SOLD OUT
SOLD OUT! Sign up to the waitlist for updates.

WAITLIST: https://bit.ly/bbno25_wl

Handsome Tours & Laneway Presents are proud to present the return of bbno$ to Australia + New Zealand in 2025!

Vancouver-born Alex Gumuchian (bbno$) is an RIAA certified multi-platinum genre-blending artist who has amassed billions of streams globally, headlined by international radio hits ‘Edamame’ (2021), and ‘Lalala’ (2019) as well as viral sensations ‘it boy’ and ‘two’ (2024). Known for his signature wit and infectious production, bbno$’s latest high energy release ‘mary poppins’ stayed true to his bold, out-of-the-box form. Dubbed by producer Diamond Pistols (DJ Snake, Austin Millz) as a track “to bump at your best friends' nieces quinceanera to get the party jumping. It will literally turn a senior center bingo night into a sweaty underground Brooklyn rave”, it also arrived with a music video directed by Shiraz Higgins, which saw 100% of the video’s proceeds’ donated to the Palestine Children’s Relief Fund.

With sold out shows across the globe, bbno$ prides himself on creating and performing music that reminds the world to have fun and not take life too seriously. bbno$ has built massive online resonance with some of the world's biggest creators across YouTube, TikTok, Twitch, and beyond, cementing his status as a true internet-era artist and pioneering a lane where online sensations and musical artistry intersect.

description:
Costuming Austen's Characters, Costuming Austen's Characters
Join us for a talk about dressing Jane Austen's characters for the stage

About this Event

Costuming Austen's Characters - Reschedule of May Event (slightly later start)
Following on from our panel discussion with the writers and directors of local Austen productions we welcome costumier Meredith Dooley who worked on dressing the actors for all those productions.
Meredith Dooley is a Wellington born and bred actor, director and costumier. She completed a BA in Theatre and Film at Victoria University of Wellington in the early 1990s, and then trained in acting and directing in London. In 2018-19 she gained a Diploma in Costume Construction at Toi Whakaari New Zealand Drama School and spent the next two Covid-affected years working on theatre, film and television productions such as Wellington Paranormal, Mr Corman, WOW, and Wellington Opera's Don Giovanni.
Meredith has returned to the office and over the last few years has created costumes for Stagecraft's Pride & Prejudice and Persuasion, and KAT Theatre's Sense and Sensibility, amongst others. Early in 2024 she dipped her toes back into professional theatre, working with cabaret star Meow Meow during the NZ Festival of the Arts.

Afternoon tea provided

description:
PEBBLE - Free Live Music Wednesdays - Love In Every City, PEBBLE - Free Live Music Wednesdays - Love In Every City
Poems and Songs from the Road

After seasons of wandering through foreign cities, sharing songs with strangers, and capturing stories from the road. PEBBLE has spent the past few years on an open-ended journey: traveling across continents in search of the deepest stories, the wildest love, the purest expression of what it means to be human. From late-night train stations to hidden cafés, from sunlit rooftops to candlelit stages—PEBBLE has been gathering moments and melodies from everywhere he goes, transforming them into songs and poems that reflect a life lived wide open.

“Love in Every City” is the next chapter in that journey—a stripped-back, soul-forward performance that brings those stories home.

Backed by a vision to build a global movement of traveling artists who choose authenticity over perfection, connection over isolation, and creative ownership over compromise, PEBBLE’s work invites us to remember what we’re really here for: to live, to feel, to share.

This show is a moment of reflection and reconnection—
Join us for an intimate night of music, poetry, and storytelling at Moon in Newtown, Pōneke. A suitcase full of songs. A guitar by the table. A heart full of cities.

As always, free entry & all pizzas $15!

Listen >>> https://open.spotify.com/artist/2q9BwdeHhd7cmwTbsdPeil

description:
Kapiti Botanist Market, Kāpiti Coast, Get Ready – The Botanist Market is Coming to You!

Foxtail Events is beyond excited to bring the beloved Botanist Market to the Kāpiti Coast for the very first time — and we can’t wait to share it with you! Join us at the Paraparaumu Memorial Hall for a lush, leafy celebration of all things green, gorgeous, and garden-inspired.

Whether you're a seasoned plant whisperer or simply love beautiful spaces filled with botanical charm, this market is your perfect winter escape!

Expect a vibrant mix of:
* Indoor & outdoor plants
* Botanical art, fashion & homewares
* Ceramics, planters & garden decor
* Natural skincare & eco beauty products
* Seedlings, garden tools & plant accessories
... and so much more!

This is more than just a market — it’s a community of plant lovers, creatives, and eco-conscious makers coming together in one gorgeous space.

Come see why the Botanist Market has captured hearts across Wellington — and now, it's your turn, Kāpiti! Bring a friend, bring your plant wishlist, and don’t miss this brand new local gem.

description:
Kapiti Wedding & Events Expo 2026, Kapiti Wedding & Events Expo 2026
Get ready for a day of love, celebration, and unforgettable inspiration at the Kapiti Wedding & Events Expo 2026 – the Kapiti Coast’s premier event for anyone planning a wedding, special event, or milestone celebration. Taking place on Sunday, 19 April 2026, from 10am to 3pm at the Paraparaumu Memorial Hall, this vibrant expo brings together over 40 of the region’s top wedding and event professionals, all in one beautiful space. Best of all? Entry is completely FREE!

From breathtaking florals and stunning venue styling to expert celebrants, creative photographers, world-class entertainment, and delectable food and drink offerings, this expo has it all. Whether you’re newly engaged, planning a birthday bash, organising a corporate event, or simply love all things celebration, the Kapiti Wedding & Events Expo is your one-stop destination for inspiration and expert advice.

This year’s expo promises an immersive experience packed with exclusive show-only offers, giveaways, and dazzling live performances on the Main Stage. Meet the creative minds behind Kapiti’s most iconic celebrations, explore dreamy decor ideas, and uncover the latest wedding and event trends that will help you bring your vision to life. Our hand-picked exhibitors are the best in the business, offering fresh ideas and tailored solutions to make your event truly unforgettable.

But that’s not all – your free ticket also unlocks exclusive deals across the Kapiti Coast. From boutique shopping and cosy cafes to scenic stays and local attractions, our Explore Kapiti program gives you access to fantastic discounts and experiences from our local business partners. Simply show your expo ticket to take advantage of these offers while you’re in town.

The Kapiti Wedding & Events Expo is proudly brought to you by Kapiti Castles, experienced event organisers who understand how to make moments magical. With a deep love for creativity, community, and connection, we’ve crafted this event to help you dream big and plan with confidence.

So don’t miss out – grab your free tickets today and join us for an extraordinary day of discovery, excitement, and inspiration. Whether you're planning a wedding, a party, or something truly unique, this is where your perfect celebration begins.

description:
It's in the Ballot - WCC - Pukehīnau/Lambton Ward -In-studio, Contestants of 'It's in the Bag' become political candidates in 'It's in the Ballot' Meet the Candidates.
Candidates choose a numbered box which has a question that has been submitted online by voters before the show.
It’s in the Ballot” is a community-led awareness and participation initiative. We aim to increase voter interest in the general and council elections nationally.
By using broadcasting and web-based technologies to deliver in-studio; online on Facebook, YouTube and Twitch; and edited as YouTube videos we aim to enable voters to make informed voting decisions.
This means you can send the weblink of the YouTube Video of your electorate show to your friends and whanau to encourage them to watch the show before they cast their votes.
Voting papers are sent to voters on Tuesday 9th September 2025 and must be delivered into a voting dropbox by 12pm Saturday 11th October 2025

Khandallah Spring Market, Step into spring and join us at the twilight Khandallah Spring Market, hosted by Foxtail Events!

Nestled against the charming backdrop of Khandallah Town Hall, this vibrant market is the perfect place to explore an eclectic mix of arts, crafts, plants, and unique gifts.

Discover a wide variety of high-quality items from talented local stallholders, including:

• Beautiful plants, fresh flowers, and seedlings
• Handcrafted jewellery, clothing, bags, and accessories
• Cozy crochet and knitted toys, wool products, and homewares
• Scented candles, skincare, soaps, and wheat bags
• Pottery, ceramics, wooden products, and carvings
• Pet accessories, baby and children's items, and much more!

Come enjoy the evening sun, sample delicious local food, and get a head start on your holiday shopping!

Most stalls will accept cash or Eftpos, but it's best to bring cash as well.

We look forward to seeing you there!

description:
MARKET DAY - Wellington Office Clear-out Friday 12th Cuba Street, Everything must go - Market Day sale, beautiful items for sale on Cuba Street.
We’re moving!! After 10 years, Dev Academy is moving from Cuba Street to two/fiftyseven on Willis Street. We’re excited to be running bootcamps from their lush socially conscious space in the city from Oct.
But first, we need your help to pack down our Cuba Street campus. We are hosting a MARKET DAY where you can pick up stuff for your home or office!
We have couches, desks, plants, art, monitors, noise-cancelling stations, kitchen gear, and all sorts of Dev Academy treasures – all cared for, and ready for new homes
- Desks for all prices , couches $50-150
- Monitors starting at $30 and plants from $25
- And noise-cancelling stations from $100
- All negotiable and bulk prices available
Please note
- Payment by cash or bank transfer (no cards)
- Take your goodies home on the day - or organise collection with the team
Come for the bargains, stay for a last walk through an iconic piece of Wellington’s tech education history. Together, let’s celebrate the impact this space has had and send it off with aroha

Paraparaumu Library is hosting two days of events as part of Dying Matters Week 2025 Wellington – Kāpiti, with nine sessions running across 1 and 2 September.

description:
Mangaroa Farms Open Day 2025, Mangaroa Farms Open Day 2025
It’s that time again whānau - Open Day is back at Mangaroa Farms 🙌🏽🌻☀️

Join us Saturday 1st November from 9am - 3pm for a full day of music, kai, community, and whenua. Our last Open Day saw over 1500 people through the gates - this time we’re aiming for even bigger.

FEATURING:
- Garden tours with Cam & team (these always sell out so book your spot on our website
- Permaculture orchard tours & explore our first polyculture maze
- Live music from Casual Healing & friends
- Farm-fresh kai featuring our famous smoked lamb buns, sausages, veggies & more
- Market stalls, Coffee cart & other artisan producers
- Farm demos, including sheep dogs, ponies & more
- Kids zone, crafts & a range of activities
- Access to our full 4km Farm Trail Loop

General entry is FREE.
Garden tours $20 (kids come free).

So bring along the whole whānau, meet the animals, soak up the vibes, and enjoy a real day on the farm.

Volunteer spots are open too. If you want to get involved, email or head to the link in our bio.

Our Farm Shop will be open all day from 9am - 5pm, with fresh produce, local goods, and regenerative meat from our pastures.

Register here https://store.mangaroa.org/products/mangaroa-farms-open-day-sat-1st-november

📍 Visit us at Mangaroa Farm Shop / Kete Kai, 98 Whitemans Valley Road, Upper Hutt

#mangaroafarms #openday #regenerativeagriculture #whanau #upperhutt #farmshop #soilhealth #localfood
label: Markets & Fairs

description:
Kāpiti Food Fair 2025, All FOODIES and your tribe are invited to an exciting and indulgent day out that leaves a lasting impression on food lovers that will have you returning year after year. We take pride in our offering of GOOD food, GOOD music, and GREAT company for food enthusiasts – the ultimate Food Festival with something for everyone backed with a great vibe and professional entertainment to enjoy all day long!
On the menu for 2025 ……. up to 250 vendor sites including an off licence Liquor Zone, a licenced Tuatara Bar & Thames Pacific Main Stage, ANZ Kāpiti Kitchen Demo Stage, Kāpiti Ice Cream Dining Room, FREE Kid’s Zone, ZEAL Zone buskers, roving street performers and much more!
GETTING THERE: Walk | Bike | Drive | FREE bus from Paraparaumu Railway Station
ALL WELCOME + crowd friendly dogs on lead
LOOK out for the NEW shady picnic zone!
THAMES PACIFIC MAIN STAGE
9:45 AM – 9:50 AM | Official Mayoral Opening
10:00 AM – 10:30 AM | Devon Welch Music
10:45 AM – 11:15 AM | Intercite
11:45 AM – 12:45 PM | Jody & the Stowaways
1:15 PM – 2:15 PM | The Beat Girls
2:45 PM – 3:45 PM | The Relatives
4:15 PM – 5:15 PM | Love Shack
MERCHANDISE: $3 Bags, $5 T-towels, $10 Aprons (not sold online)
NOTE: Humanitix booking fees will be added to the cost of your ticket and paid at check-out.  Booking fees cover Humanitix costs, and everything else goes to their education projects that help to change lives.  Kāpiti Food Fair supports Manaiakalani Education Trust for Māori, Pasifika, and disadvantaged learners in Aotearoa to increase student outcomes and get equal access to digital education.
TOP TIPS for a FANTASTIC DAY at the Kāpiti Food Fair
Bring a gold coin for parking donations.
Pack a hat and sunscreen – complimentary SPF is available if you need it.
Bring a picnic blanket to relax, enjoy the ambiance, and savor your treats with plenty of seating and a NEW shaded picnic spot under the trees.
BYO your own chair if you wish and a chilly bin for purchases!
Plan your foodie route with the Site Map >>
Visit the Tuatara Bar & Thames Pacific Main Stage and relax over a craft brew, wine, local cocktails and delicious cider while enjoying the vibe of the 80's to 90's revival party all day long!  Children are welcome with their parent or guardian.  CHEERS to that!
MOST vendors accept EFTPOS or bank transfer.  BYO cash as there is no ATM available.
THANK YOU SPONSORS
Kāpiti Food Fair is a recipient of the Kāpiti Major Events Fund and is supported by numerous local businesses in-kind and reduced cost of services.  The Fair is a commercial event however we have a social agenda too.  We choose to support Kāpiti Community Patrol, Kāpiti Rotary Charitable Trust, No 49 Squadron Air Cadets, Paekākāriki Surf Lifesavers, Paraparaumu College, and Work Ready Kāpiti to help run key logistics on the day. 
Kāpiti Food Fair Ltd is privately owned and operated by Helene Judge and Jeanine van Kradenburg.  The Fair reserves the right to use any image captured by our official photographer for promotional purposes in any media, in perpetuity without compensation, unless not consented.
#KFF2025 #FoodFestival #KāpitiFoodFair #SomethingForEveryone #VisitKāpiti
Website >> | Facebook >> | Instagram >> | YouTube >> | TikTok >>

Not Your Nana's Craft Market - R18 Art and Craft Market, *Strictly R18*
Are you ready for a unique and thrilling experience? Look no further! We invite you to the most captivating event of the year - the Creepy-Cute, Witchy, Kinky, Sexy, LGBTQIA+ Friendly Alternative Art and Craft Market!

What to Expect
Get ready to immerse yourself in a world where art and craft meet the dark and mysterious. This market is not for the faint of heart! Here's what you can expect:
1. Creepy-Cute Delights: Explore a wide range of art and craft creations that blend the creepy and cute aesthetics. From adorable monsters to spooky dolls, you'll find something to tickle your fancy.
2. Witchy Wonders: Dive into the world of witchcraft and magic. Discover spellbinding artwork, mystical jewelry, and enchanting potions. Embrace your inner witch or warlock!
3. Kinky Curiosities: For those who enjoy a touch of kink, we have a selection of unique and provocative art and crafts, and kink wear. Explore the boundaries of sensuality and embrace your desires in a safe and inclusive environment.
4. Sexy Sensations: Indulge in the world of sensuality and erotic art. Discover captivating paintings, sculptures, and photography that celebrate the beauty of the human form. Embrace your sexuality with pride!
5. LGBTQIA+ Friendly: This market is a safe space for all members of the LGBTQIA+ community. Celebrate diversity and inclusivity as you explore the wide range of art and craft offerings.
6. Alternative Art and Craft: Step outside the mainstream and explore the alternative side of creativity. From gothic to steampunk, from punk to cyberpunk, you'll find a variety of unique and unconventional art and craft pieces.
Join Us!

Don't miss out on this extraordinary event! Mark your calendars and invite your friends. Get ready to be amazed, inspired, and maybe even a little bit spooked. See you at the Creepy-Cute, Witchy, Kinky, Sexy, LGBTQIA+ Friendly Alternative Art and Craft Market!
It definitely will NOT be your nana's market! See less
label: Markets & Fairs

description:
Ngaio Village Market, Ngaio Village Market
Spring is in the air and the Ngaio Village Market is back! 🌸

Celebrate the start of the season with us on Sunday, 7 September 2024, at the Ngaio Town Hall for a beautiful day of creativity, community, and local shopping.

🕙 Open from 10am – 3pm, this charming craft market is packed with an incredible variety of handmade, locally sourced goods. Perfect for treating yourself or finding that special something for someone else.

What you’ll find at the market:

• Plants, fresh flowers & seedlings
• Handcrafted jewellery
• Clothing, bags & unique accessories
• Crochet & knitted toys
• Scented candles & home fragrances
• Homewares & soft furnishings
• Baby & children’s items
• Natural skincare, soaps & cosmetics
• Gifts & artisan treasures
• Resin art & trinkets
• Crystals & spiritual goods
• Wooden & metal crafts
• Ceramics & pottery
• Pet accessories
• Carvings, sculptures & wool products
... and much more!

☕ Hungry?
Grab a bite from our food trucks, sip on coffee from the on-site cart, or treat yourself to fresh artisan baked goods while you browse.

💳 Payments:
Most stalls offer cash and EFTPOS options, but we recommend bringing some cash just in case.

👯‍♀️ Bring a friend (or two!) and enjoy a relaxed day out in one of Wellington’s most scenic suburbs. Support local, discover something beautiful, and soak up the Spring vibes at this much-loved community event.
label: Markets & Fairs

description:
Wairarapa Farmers' Market, The Wairarapa Farmers’ Market is held every Saturday from 9am to 1pm (rain or shine!) at the Solway Showgrounds Masterton. Entry is off State Highway 2 or the by pass, onto Judds Rd. There is plenty of car parking and a camping ground for NZMCA Members

Picnic tables are situated underneath the majestic Redwood Tree for you to sit and enjoy a coffee and something to eat while listening to live music. Plus you get to take home quality, delicious produce grown seasonally within the Wairarapa region. It makes for a great morning's outing.

Enjoy breakfast, brunch or lunch and pick up your dinner items with locally produced coffee, eggs, meat, berries, bread, jam, fruit, olive oil, pastries, pies, pickles, slices, cakes, soup, vegetables and more. Shop for plants, seedlings, seaweed, artisan goods including wood turning, Māori weaving, children’s and baby clothes, aprons, peg aprons, tea towels, knitted and crochet toys and hand dyed knitting wools.
Sign up for our regular Wairarapa Farmers' Market newsletter here https://mailchi.mp/d99e1ad65a18/newsletter-sign-up or join us on Facebook to get updates on all the Market goodness! Dogs are welcome to the market and a dog bowl can be provided. See you on Saturday!

"From Paddock to Plate Since 2006"

description:
Paekākāriki School Rainbow Gala & Plant Sale, The Paekākāriki School Rainbow Gala & and Plant Sale is back!

An incredible range of indoor and outdoor plants for sale, kids activities, live music, delicious food and fun market stalls!

There is always a huge demand for our beautiful plants, lovingly grown by the Potty Potters in our school garden. Get there on time to get the best bargains!

Then sit back with a fresh coffee and enjoy the live music from talented local musicians and entertainers, grab some yummy lunch, and browse the market stalls.

The kids are fully catered for with facepainting, rainbow hair stalls, a sandpit dig, bouncy castles and a rainbow colour run.

It's always a fantastic day, with a friendly community vibe. We hope to see you there!

This is a great opportunity to connect with other men in the ministry and enjoy the beauty of God's creation. All men are welcome to attend.

description:
Plant Sale, I have had great success with NZ and imported seed propagation this year so we have a wonderful range of plants ready to go in the ground now.
Some varieties are extremely limited due to the cost of the imported seed and the tiny amount of seeds per packet (only 5 in some cases).
We will be accepting preorders by messenger so get in quick if you don't want to miss out on these special plants.
Please note: Our garden will not be open during the plant sale. We aim to open in approximately 5 weeks but it depends how the tulips progress.
As other plants reach maturity we will make them available for sale on our open days. We have decided to have a pre season sale to make room for more beauties.
Abutilon - a range of mixed colours including peach, rose and lemon.
Dwarf Agapanthus - a fine leaved pale blue variety. Great for edging paths and beds. Will not take over.
Aubretia - Lavender trailing plant for rock walls and garden edges.
Arabis - White blooming Spring groundcover
Ajuga - Pink and purple varieties. Great November blooming groundcover for damp areas.
Aster - Early summer flowering variety in blue/lavender
Calamintha - new for us so I shall borrow the Chiltern seeds description. This is a most pleasant plant for your border or herb garden. Heavily scented with a fragrance described as pennyroyal-like, it is an erect perennial with small, somewhat hairy leaves. In summer it bears numerous whorled spikes of tiny blue flowers with long purple bracts. The herb can be used for flavouring. Flowers the first year from seed. 1½ft (45cm).
Campanula glomerata - deep purple
Cerastium - grey trailing leaves smothered in white blooms in Spring. (These have just been cut back)
Cerinthe - By popular demand. Technically an annual but a non invasive self sowing one so once its in your garden you'll have more each year. Glaucous foliage and interesting pendular purple blooms.
Dianthus - Grey leaves and red blooms
Erigeron multiradiatus - A beautiful evergreen groundcover with yellow centred purple/blue daisies from late spring.
Erysimum - a specialty for us as we love them so much. What's not to love? Front to mid border, semi shrubby evergreen perennial, glorious scented blooms and we have individual named colours.
Ivory, Purple bi-colour, Fire King, Vulcan, Ellen Willmott, Primrose, Ruby gem, Siberian allionii and the brand new Tangerine Titan.
Euphorbia - golden foam. Another newbie for us but we love the the chartreuse euphorbias add to the garden so we had to give it a go.
Euphorbia characias - the blue leaved evergreen semi shrubs with huge chartreuse heads that grace our garden every spring.
Geum - Yes, you guessed it, another favourite of ours. We have a good stock of the common types plus some more unusual ones.
Tall - Yellow, Red and Orange (Firestorm).
Dwarf - Deep orange/red, Lemon with hints of pink, blush (very pale pink) and the original geum rivale in a beautiful coppery peach.
Lunaria (Honesty). Two types available. Chedglow the purple leaf version that has taken Chelsea by storm the last couple of years. Variegata - the green leaves become edged in white in their second year before blooming with the typical mauve flowers.
Lysimachia nummularis - yellow creeping jenny. Great lime leaf trailing plant for part shady damp areas. One only.
Orlaya grandiflora - another favourite among designers. A self sowing annual that will provide weeks of beautiful white lacecap flowers. Perfect for filling in border spaces until the summer perennials fill in or to give a light airy feel to meadows and spring plantings. Seedlings will return year after year.
Pelargonium - Deep red
Pulmonaria - Raspberry splash
Romulea - small bulbs grow fine grassy leaves before erupting into a mass of deep rosy purple crocus type flowers in late spring.
Scabiosa - another specialty plant for us as they provide such amazing flower power all summer and autumn. They are not frost hardy but are perennial in sheltered spots for at least 3 years. Enjoy the flowers and at the end of the season collect several packets worth of seed to multiply your stock.
Named varieties available:
Snowmaiden - white, Black Knight - deep maroon, Beaujolias Bonnets - a gorgeous blend of pink, white and burgundy on the same flower, Burgundy beau - a new one this year, Salmon Queen - the most delicious shade of salmon pink. Pale yellow Fata morgana, and blue ones will be available later in the season.
Stachys officinalis - dark pink flowered evergreen groundcover. Perfect for the front of garden beds and rock gardens.
Sissyrinchium blue eyed grass. Low grassy leaves burst in to a mass of blue star shaped flowers in Spring.
Sedum mexicana - a bright lime evergreen succulent groundcover. Perfect for supporting bold tulips in spring and bright perennials in summer.
Sedum Mr Goodbud. A slightly pinker version than the well known Autumn joy.
Sparaxia - very special maroon flowers. Couple only.
Symphytum grandiflora - low-lying evergreen groundcover with medium sized leaves and stunning cream bell flowers all through spring. Excellent spreading plant for difficult to grow areas such as the shade of evergreen trees.
Urospermum - sown last spring and flowered for the first time in summer. Don't be put off by its dandelion looking leaves. This is a beauty with huge lemon flowers ( yes again like a dandelion but oh so much more beautiful). It has survived a wet winter in our gravel garden and also in soil. Definitely not a weed!
Violets - green leaf with white scented flowers and the later flowering purple leaved Viola labadorica with purple flowers.
label: Markets & Fairs

description:
Public performance: New Zealand Secondary Students’ Choir — Part of Mahuru Māori 2025 series, We are delighted to welcome the New Zealand Secondary Students’ Choir and their infectious joy in music-making to Te Whanganui-a-Tara. This will be their first public appearance of the 2025–2026 cycle. Come and hear our nation’s youngest and most talented choral singers as we celebrate Mahuru Māori.
We’re in for another treat this Mahuru Māori at the National Library. Last year, Te Rōpū Rangatahi Waiata o Aotearoa The New Zealand Youth Choir gave a public concert to celebrate this special month, and now the teina — The New Zealand Secondary Students’ choir (NZSSC) — will appear for a public performance as their tuakana did, performing waiata to celebrate te ātaahua hoki o te reo tūturu o Aotearoa.
Bring your hoa, your colleagues and your whānau kia whakanuia ēnei rangatahi me te reo rangatira — this concert is not to be missed!
Nau mai te katoa! Everyone is welcome!
About the choir
The New Zealand Secondary Students’ Choir has achieved considerable success since its formation in 1986. NZSSC has won titles such as Children’s Choir of the World at Llangollen Eisteddfod 2022, and over their near 40-year existence, embarked on 15 international tours, including Canada, Singapore, China, the United States, South America, Australia, and South Africa.
Under the direction of Sue Densem, the NZSSC is a tira waiata of Aotearoa’s finest young voices (14–18) and offers a two-year membership where rangatahi tour throughout the country and learn from some of the country’s top choral teachers and composers. At the end of their two-year cycle, the rōpū rounds out their membership term by embarking on an international tour, performing concerts and competing in choral festivals.
New Zealand Secondary Students’ Choir website: https://www.nzsschoir.com/
Image: Kaiwaiata of the New Zealand Secondary Students’ Choir perform in China (2024).
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Pasifika Night Market at VUW, Our last Pasifika market for the year. Open to the public and we will be hosting incredible Pasifika-owned businesses/stalls.
Venue: The Hub (Kelburn campus)
Please bring cash, as there are no nearby ATMs.
Vendors will sell varieties of food: oka, lu pulu masima, lu sipi, keke mamoe, sapasui, panikeke, brownies, cupcakes, and more. There will also be tattooing, haircutting, as well as handmade cards, flowers, tapa/ngatu/masi, jewellery, ei katu and kahoa.
Registration form for stallholders is in the Discussion part of this event

Scabiosa - another specialty plant for us as they provide such amazing flower power all summer and autumn. They are not frost hardy but are perennial in sheltered spots for at least 3 years. Enjoy the flowers and at the end of the season collect several packets worth of seed to multiply your stock.
Named varieties available:
Snowmaiden - white, Black Knight - deep maroon, Beaujolias Bonnets - a gorgeous blend of pink, white and burgundy on the same flower, Burgundy beau - a new one this year, Salmon Queen - the most delicious shade of salmon pink. Pale yellow Fata morgana, and blue ones will be available later in the season.
Stachys officinalis - dark pink flowered evergreen groundcover. Perfect for the front of garden beds and rock gardens.
Sissyrinchium blue eyed grass. Low grassy leaves burst in to a mass of blue star shaped flowers in Spring.
Sedum mexicana - a bright lime evergreen succulent groundcover. Perfect for supporting bold tulips in spring and bright perennials in summer.
Sedum Mr Goodbud. A slightly pinker version than the well known Autumn joy.
Sparaxia - very special maroon flowers. Couple only.
Symphytum grandiflora - low-lying evergreen groundcover with medium sized leaves and stunning cream bell flowers all through spring. Excellent spreading plant for difficult to grow areas such as the shade of evergreen trees.
Urospermum - sown last spring and flowered for the first time in summer. Don't be put off by its dandelion looking leaves. This is a beauty with huge lemon flowers ( yes again like a dandelion but oh so much more beautiful). It has survived a wet winter in our gravel garden and also in soil. Definitely not a weed!
Violets - green leaf with white scented flowers and the later flowering purple leaved Viola labadorica with purple flowers.

description:
Kora - 'Fifth Season' Album Release Tour | Wellington, Kora - 'Fifth Season' Album Release Tour | Wellington
Spark & Eccles Entertainment Present:

Kora - 'Fifth Season' Album Release Tour
Saturday 11 Oct 2025 | Meow Nui, Wellington

With special guests Black Comet

Ticketek Presale - 12pm, Thu 17 July (24 hours)
General On Sale - 12pm, Mon 21 July

-------------

Kora are back - and sound bigger, deeper and more electrifying than ever. With a long-awaited new album on the horizon, and a tour to match, the iconic Aotearoa band is set to reawaken the hearts of fans both old and new.

Known as one of the country’s most powerful and dynamic live acts fusing elements of roots, reggae, funk, rock, dub, and electronic music into a sonic identity that is entirely their own. Their music is heavy and melodic and grounded in kaupapa Māori, driven by innovation, storytelling, and groove.

Their performances bring together heavy bass, soaring vocals, and raw energy, blending musical mastery with raw power to create an immersive experience. Whether headlining major festivals or packing out venues around Aotearoa, Kora’s ability to move a crowd is unmatched.

Kora will be joined by special guests Black Comet, the multi-dimensional, galactic funk force founded by fellow Kora brother, Laughton. Known for their dynamic live jams, high energy and tight sets, Black Comet live is a groove-based experience with powerful narratives.

This is your chance to catch two live juggernauts together in full flight, performing brand new albums!

description:
The Mad Hatter's Market Express, The Mad Hatter's Market Express

Journey with Steam Inc on this return trip to the Woodville Mad Hatter's Market Day!

Bring the family up into the heart of the Manawatu on the steam train, and enjoy a fun filled day at Woodville's famed Mad Hatter's Market Day. Hauled by Ja 1271, our 1956 built steam locomotive. Join the train at Paekakariki, Paraparaumu, Waikanae, Otaki, Levin or Palmerston North. Upon arrival at Woodville, there is the option to walk up to the square, or travel by shuttle bus up.

Woodville 150th Mad Hatter's Day
Since 2017, the local Woodville community have hosted this special event in the heart of the township celebrating all thing's 'mad'! Bring the kids along for a children's tea party and old time games - with a particular focus on steampunk. Featuring live music, over 70 market stalls and most importantly - the annual Crazy Hat Competition! Last year, people on our train took away 1st place!

Spot prizes are to be given out throughout the day for best costumes and hats, and an array of vouchers will also be up for grabs!

Please be at your boarding station minimum 10 minutes prior ready to roll, with your tickets, carriage number and seating allocations at the ready.

Please note that if booking online, our booking system does add on a small percentage to the above fares. Steam Incorporated does not see this revenue.

Mad Hatters Menu
The wonderful team has put together an array of food trucks for all to enjoy at the market, and you can also support the local cafes of Woodville township. There will also be tea/coffee available on board the train, along with some alcoholic beverages and light snacks.

We can cater for larger group bookings - these are best dealt with directly through us by emailing admin@steaminc.org.nz or contacting 0800 783 264.

Book the Mad Hatters Market Express!
All seating is reserved and allocated on these special experiences. Prior booking is essential.

Limited Mobility Disclaimer
Due to the age, design and nature of our heritage carriages, these are not suitable for passengers with limited mobility. If you have any concerns, please contact us on 0800 783 264 to discuss options with our bookings team!

description:
Kapiti Tattoo & Arts Festival 2026, Kapiti Tattoo & Arts Festival 2026
Get ready, Kapiti – something bold, creative, and totally unforgettable is coming your way. On Saturday, 7th March 2026, the Kapiti Tattoo & Arts Festival makes its explosive return at the Paraparaumu Memorial Hall, bringing together the ultimate fusion of ink, art, and live entertainment for one epic day of creativity and connection. Whether you're a tattoo enthusiast, an art lover, or someone who thrives in high-energy, artistic environments, this festival is your ticket to something truly extraordinary.

This isn’t just another tattoo expo — it’s a full-blown creative takeover. Expect to see over 40 talented artists under one roof, from the regions leading tattooists to visionary painters, sculptors, illustrators, and local craftspeople. You’ll witness live tattooing, explore interactive art installations, shop handcrafted works, and dive into workshops designed to spark your imagination. Plus, with non-stop local entertainment on the main stage — from musicians to performers and DJs — the atmosphere will be electric from start to finish.

What makes this event truly special? It’s powered by the team at Kapiti Castles — the creative minds behind the popular Kapiti Wedding & Events Expo. Known for producing vibrant, community-driven experiences, Kapiti Castles has crafted this festival as a platform for creative expression, community connection, and artistic inspiration. Whether you're an artist looking to grow your brand or a visitor eager to explore the region’s creative heartbeat, this is your moment.

The Kapiti Tattoo & Arts Festival is more than an event — it’s a movement. It’s a chance to meet incredible artists, get inspired, celebrate culture, and maybe even walk away with some fresh ink. With something for everyone — from art collectors to curious newcomers — this is a must-attend event for 2026.

So mark your calendars for 7th March, gather your crew, and get your tickets now. The Kapiti Tattoo & Arts Festival 2026 is where creativity comes alive, and you won’t want to miss being part of it. Tickets are on sale now — don’t miss your chance to be part of Kapiti’s boldest new festival.
label: Festivals

description:
Wairarapa Bookshop Hop 2025, The best booksellers in Wairarapa have come together to give you the ultimate book-lovers day out in celebration of New Zealand Bookshop Day.

This year, you can collect stamps from 13 new and used Wairarapa Bookshops and enjoy a range of other bookish events all day long.

One of the (many) great things about Wairarapa is we have 13 fantastic bookshops all within an easy 30 minute drive of one another, so it's entirely possible for you to hop around all 13 bookshops in a single day.

Celebrate NZ Bookshop Day with a Wairarapa wide Bookshop Hop. It's your chance to win lots of prizes and stock up your bookshelf.

STEP 1:
Pick up an official passport from any of the participating bookshops - available from all participating stores from Friday October 10th.

STEP 2:
Collect a stamp from each store you visit and make a purchase. Each stamp is an entry into the prize draws for $1,000 in bookshop vouchers.

STEP 3:
Leave your stamped entry with the last bookshop you visit.

This event happens rain or shine!

Argentine Tango course -Monday in Wellington, New Argentine Tango course in Churton Park, Wellington.
Term four 2025 starts: 22nd September to 27th October 2025
*Must register before 18th September*
Back from Buenos Aires!
with intensive training from the best of the best!
Denise & Alex White with over 25 years teaching experience!
Course bookings essential as numbers are limited.
Held at George's Garage Milonga Studio, 25 Silverbirch grove, Churton Park, Wellington.
(parking is available down driveway, on-site next to the studio)
7:30pm to 8.30pm Open to all Levels
* Beginners to Advanced Argentine Tango
fees:
Casual/per class $20. (Provided not fully booked)
6-week course $110
Argentine Tango:
Courses mainly focus on Argentine Tango. Other Tango dance styles Milonga and Vals (aka tango waltz) are also taught, with a mix of traditional with modern styles of Tango music - no screechy ones!
A suitable foundation for both social dancing and performance/stage tango dancing developed more as you advance to be a versatile dancer able to dance each style with ease.
Other useful info:
Please wear clean socks or suitable smooth soled shoes with good ankle support. highly recommend a drink bottle as well.
This course has a minimum number to go ahead, also a maximum number of students to ensure quality of teaching. Bookings are essential.
signup online

description:
Albi & the Wolves, Gate opens 7pm Music Starts 7.30pm Wednesday 1st October 2025
Auckland based Albi and the Wolves set fire to stages and fill hearts with hope with their energetic and relatable alternative indie folk songs. Proud albino frontman Albi (Chris Dent), Pascal Roggen and Michael Young have crafted a stage show brimming with energy yet with pauses for reflection. The trio has a huge sound created simply by acoustic guitar, electric violin, double bass and three voices. Since 2014, Albi & the Wolves have gone from strength to strength touring Australia, New Zealand and Rarotonga. In 2018, they took home the Best Folk Artist Award at the NZVMAs.
What makes the band special is their sense of community. Whether it’s connection through dance, singing or laughter, their performances inspire audiences to keep coming back for more. Just love them!
Come along and enjoy their great gig in our special space, up close and personal.
Not for profit, supporting our dedicated musicians. Suggested donation $40
Teas, Coffee and Snacks provided. You're welcome to bring anything you'd like to eat or drink.
Parking available in the Coupon zones of Upland Rd & Glasgow St free after 6pm weekdays, and free all through the weekends. The Wilson Carpark at the top of the Cable Car charges 24/7.

description:
Amanda Bunting and Kris Zuelicke, Solos and Duets for Piano, Leo Smit - Divertimento

Ginastera - No. 2 from Danzas Argentinas, op. 2 - "Danza de la moza donosa"

Ravel - Sonatine, M. 40, Movement I - Modéré

Schubert - "Lebensstürme," Allegro in A minor, D 947

Amanda Bunting is a graduate of the New Zealand School of Music, completing her Bachelor of Music with Honours in 2019 in solo piano performance with Dr. Jian Liu; small group ensemble with Dr. Rolf Gjelsten; and performance and embodiment studies with Dr. Hamish Robb and Dr. Margaret Medlyn. Prior to that, she completed a Graduate Diploma in Music in performance piano, performance studies, and pedagogy.

After previously studying with Gillian Bibby at the Conservatorium of Music and graduating in 1996, Amanda chose to return to study to further develop performance skills, enhance her own piano performance abilities and to gain further knowledge that can be shared with her piano students. Amanda is an Associate of the Institute of Registered Music Teachers New Zealand, a member of the Wellington Branch and currently works both as a Piano Teacher and a Human Resources Adviser at Victoria University of Wellington.

Kris Zuelicke grew up in a theatrical and musical family, accompanying shows and choirs from high school onwards. In the USA, she gained degrees in Music (BA Miami University) and Music Theory (MA Indiana University) and taught music along with other subjects at the Bloomington Montessori School.

In Karlsruhe, Germany Kris taught at the Landau Montessori School, Berlitz Language School, courses on theatre and music at the Teacher’s College and piano privately. She studied with Annemi Egri and Sariel Maler during this time.

Kris currently teaches in five schools around Wellington, maintains a thriving private piano and cello studio and accompanies students at the New Zealand School of Music. Her most recent degree is in harpsichord performance (DMA NZSM), including study and research in Boston with Mark Kroll. Kris enjoys performing regularly with other musicians, including piano duets, chamber music and has enjoyed projects with Stroma, the Queen’s Closet and a fun stint as a harpsichordist extra in the recently released Time Bandits.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Wellington Heritage Festival - Building by the Water, Take a closer look at the history of Porirua’s harbourside, from early Māori settlements to cutting edge contemporary engineering developments.

As part of the 2025 Wellington Heritage Festival, Kai Tahi presents a visual exhibition in celebration of Porirua’s unique harbourside heritage.

Building by the Water brings together archival images courtesy of the Alexander Turnbull Library Collection and recent photographic works by Jason Mann. Seen collectively, this visual record aims to place the Kai Tahi development into the wider history of construction along Te Awarua-o-Porirua Harbour.

The exhibition traces a history of harbourside settlement from Māori pa sites, to whaling stations, early settler communities, harbour reclamation, big box retail and now, in 2025, the next community-focused iteration of harbourside settlement, as exemplified by Kai Tahi and the reuse of existing industrial forms.

Kai Tahi has a simple but powerful mission: to transform the traditional idea of a food-court into a cultural and creative harbourside hub for the Porirua Community.

Historic images on display include aerial photographs from Whites Aviation, 19th century engravings and 20th century paintings.
label: Festivals

description:
Audio Described Show - Mamma Mia! The Musical, Wellington, MAMMA MIA! IS BRINGING THE PARTY TO WELLINGTON!
My, my, how can you resist the world's favourite feel-good musical as it brings the good times and sunshine to the St James Theatre. Since first opening in 1999, this exhilarating smash-hit has become a global phenomenon, thrilling over 70 million people worldwide. MAMMA MIA! is a jukebox musical featuring the timeless songs of the legendary Swedish pop group ABBA. With its heart warming tale and infectious music, MAMMA MIA! has become one of the world's most beloved and successful musicals.
When: Wednesday, 27 August, touch tour at 5.45pm, audio described performance at 7.30pm
Where: St James Theatre, 77-81 Courtenay Place, Wellington 6011
Run time: 2 hours 35 mins, including 20 min interval
Tickets: $60, plus booking fees. A free companion ticket is available.
To book: contact the Ticketmaster Group Booking line on 09 970 9745, or email groups@ticketmaster.co.nz. A $5 service fee per transaction applies.
Let them know at time of booking how many headsets you need, if you will be attending the touch tour and if you will be attending with a guide dog.
Arrive at 5.30pm for the touch tour at 5.45pm.
On the night of the performance, tickets and headsets can be collected from The St James Foyer area (Stalls foyer, ground floor) from 6.30pm

description:
Body Ocean — Live @ Meow, Body Ocean, a dynamic force in the realm of electronic music, specialises in crafting immersive and kinetic house music. Their sonic journey explores the interplay between organic and artificial elements, navigating contrasts between personality and dissolution, as well as the push and pull of extraversion and introspection.

With an impressive catalogue of releases on influential labels such as Size, Black Book Records, Mad Decent, Dirtybird, Box of Cats, and STMPD RCRDS, Body Ocean has firmly established themselves as a notable presence in the electronic music scene. They've also left a lasting mark with remixes for acclaimed artists including Steve Angello, Valentino Khan, Alison Wonderland, Ane Brun, and Mija.

Their commitment to pushing sonic boundaries and exploring diverse musical dimensions sets them apart — fuelling a growing reputation as innovators within the industry.

As they gear up for 2024, Body Ocean is poised to captivate dancefloors with a compelling fusion of sound and a vision that looks firmly to the future of electronic music.

Catch Body Ocean live at Meow on Friday 22nd August — support to be announced.
label: Music & Concerts

All is quiet… the towns near Errens Crossing seem calm – for now…..

description:
Aroha Quartet and Friends, The popular Wellington-based Aroha String Quartet (violinists Haihong LIu and Konstanze Artmann. violist Zongxian Jin and cellist Robert Ibell) will be joined by four colleagues from the NZSO and Orchestra Wellington to present a rare performance of Schubert's famous Octet for Wind and Strings. This very substantial work of just under an hour's length has six movements, all of them brimming with warmth, charm and glorious melody. There is a wide variety of tonal colour as each of the instruments in turn shares the limelight, with delightful solo lines from violins, viola, cello, clarinet, bassoon, horn and double-bass. The clarinetist will be Nick Walshe, Justin Sun the bassoonist, joined by Alexander Hambleton (horn) and Oleksandr Gunchenko (double-bass).

Also on the programme will be a string quartet by Mozart (No 22 in B flat, K589) and a humorous light-hearted piece by Danish composer Carl Nielsen called "Serenata in Vano" in which a group of musicians attempt. unsuccessfully, to attract the attention of a young woman.

Door sales will be available for this concert, or tickets can be bought from Waikanae New World or Moby Dickens Books in Paraparaumu Beach. For booking enquiries go to www.waikanaemusic.org.nz or phone 021 147 4859.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Bob McNeill & Emily Roughton in concert, Bob McNeill & Emily Roughton in concert
DATE: Saturday Sept 27
TIME: 7pm
LOCATION: The Offering – 65 Main St, Greytown
AGES:
COST: $25 pp at the door or booking link below

Bob McNeill & Emily Roughton are two of New Zealand’s best-known folk musicians. They bring their deep musical connection to festivals across New Zealand, playing their favourite songs and tunes collected over years of playing together at festivals, stages and late into the night at kitchen tables. Based in Wellington, Bob is one of NZ’s best-known folk songwriters and a favourite with Greytown audiences. His songs have been covered by artists in NZ, Australia, the UK and the USA. New Zealand Musician magazine compared his songwriting to Bruce Springsteen and Mark Knopfler; the Dominion Post likened him to Jackson Brown, James Taylor, Luka Bloom and Dougie Ma¬cLean. A guitarist, he is known for his distinctive open-tuned acoustic fingerstyle and electric guitar playing. He has toured widely in NZ, Australia, Canada, Ireland, the UK and the USA. His latest album, released in June 2024, is Lost Stars, an extended release on CD and download featuring new recordings and rarities, with Emily on violin and piano.

From Whangarei, Emily is a virtuoso violinist inspired by the Scottish tradition and the modern trad movement. Classically trained, she is infinitely adaptable with her gorgeous stylings and fiery tune playing, making her the perfect foil for Bob’s lyrical songs.

Don’t miss a chance to see these two consummate musicians share their foot-stomping collection of banging tunes, favourite songs and stolen moments from the last 20 years.

Book your tickets here:
https://greytownarttown.com/bob-mcneill-and-emily-roughton-in-concert/
