description:
Pirate & Mermaid Magical Holiday Fun with Zappo & Rainbow Circus, Ahoy, mateys and magical mermaids!

This school holidays, set sail for adventure at Johnsonville Shopping Centre!

Join Zappo the Magical Pirate for a swashbuckling good time—packed with laughter, magic, and pirate mischief!

And don’t miss the Rainbow Circus Magic Mermaid Bubble Show—it’s bursting with colour, fun, Mermaids and giant bubbles!

It’s all FREE fun these school holidays at Johnsonville Shopping Centre—perfect for little pirates and sea-loving mermaids!

2 shows each week day at 11am & 1pm – don’t miss the magic!
label: Family Friendly

description:
Shaun Kirk | Live @ Petone Depot - Lower Hutt, NZ (Less than 20 tickets left!), Shaun Kirk | Live @ Petone Depot - Lower Hutt, NZ (Less than 20 tickets left!)
🚨LESS THAN 20 TICKETS REMAINING!🚨

More info & tickets >>> https://bit.ly/4hl4XOt

With special guest: Nick Herbison

Hailing from the music-filled streets of Melbourne, Australia, Shaun Kirk is an award-winning blues and soul troubadour recognized for his exceptional talent as a born entertainer. His unique talent has not only earned him many accolades but also much praise from fellow artists, such as three-time Grammy Award Winner Fantastic Negrito, who has declared his show as "One of the best one-man shows he’s ever seen!"

Kirk's vocals exude a gritty, soulful depth that seems to transcend far beyond his years, with critics continually acclaiming him as "one of the finest blues voices Australia has ever heard" (Buzz Mag). Complementing his vocal artistry, Kirk's vintage guitar tones and raw grooves pay tribute to the timeless influences that have shaped his musical journey, resulting in a distinctive sound fast becoming his own.

Shaun’s musical journey has taken him to stages all over the world, where he's not only performed but consistently sold out shows, leaving audiences enthralled by his magnetic presence. From iconic festival stages like Bluesfest Byron Bay, where he's become a familiar name, to sharing the billing with legends like Robert Plant of Led Zeppelin, John Mayer, Paolo Nutini, John Butler Trio, and The Teskey Brothers; Kirk's artistic prowess is in esteemed company. Moreover, he's also had the honour of opening for household names such as blues maestro Joe Bonamassa, soul sensation Allen Stone, and the indomitable Beth Hart; further solidifying his place in the landscape of contemporary music. This remarkable journey is a testament to Kirk's unmatched talent and ability to connect with audiences across genres and generations.
label: Music & Concerts

description: St. Theresa's School Production 2025 - LEST WE FORGET, Set in both New Zealand and the narrow trenches of Gallipoli, Lest We Forget tells the powerful story of New Zealand civilians, soldiers and nurses who find courage, friendship and hope in the face of war. As letters from home arrive and battles rage on, they share laughter, sorrow, and dreams of returning to Aotearoa. This school production honours the Kiwi spirit and sacrifices made during one of our nation’s most defining campaigns. A moving tribute not to be missed.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Secrets, Orchestra Wellington’s 2025 season, The Dictator’s Shadow,
follows Dmitri Shostakovich’s career, tracing his trajectory as a
brilliant young composer catapulted to early fame and then hurled into danger.
The next chapter in our story is Secrets, featuring an array of bold works and exciting talent! As we continue our exploration of Dmitri Shostakovich's journey 50 years after his death, we present his fourth symphony. The work, was meant to be his boldest statement yet — but the composer withdrew it before its premiere. Why? The whispers were clear: this music would not please the authorities. It stayed hidden for decades, a secret too dangerous to share.
We partner with At The World's Edge Music Festival (AWE) to present the stunning talents of soloists Benjamin Baker (violin) and Yura Lee (viola) in a performance of Mozart’s luminous Sinfonia Concertante. This work offers a moment of balance — a conversation between violin and viola, full of warmth and understanding, reminding us of beauty even in troubled times.
With generous support from the Orchestra Wellington Foundation we also reveal a brand-new secret: the world premiere of "House of the Faun" by WIlliam Philipson, the 2025 SOUNZ Commission for Orchestra and Sistema Youth Orchestra | Te Tono Mahinga a SOUNZ mā te Rāngi Puoro me te Rāngi Puoro Taiohi a Sistema. The work is designed to showcase the young musicians of Arohanui Strings+ by setting their playing against the full orchestra in a rich and immersive musical landscape.
label: Music & Concerts

description:

accompanied by a designated adult after 8pm. The Vogelmorn Precinct is a community
space located in a residential area. With that in mind, the team ask that you be kind to

neighbours.”
“The Upstairs Bar and Smoked and Pickled Restaurant will be open from 3pm, to book a

description:
TARN PK - LIVE AT MOON, TARN PK - LIVE AT MOON
~ DON'T GET F.O.M.O ~

Tarn PK is bringing his new EP ’F.O.M.O’ to live audiences in Wellington on the 14th of September 6pm at MOON, with support from Sig Wilder & Friends and Josh Glennie.

With his newly formed 3 piece band, they’re stripping his sound down to the essentials; funky drum breaks, soaring synths and crunchy guitars, bringing a whole new dimension to the sound from the EP.

F.O.M.O, is a reflection on burnout, ambition, and identity in a digitally overwhelmed world. It draws inspiration from urban isolation and the weight of expectations. Tracks from the EP have landed on major Spotify and Apple playlists. Reflecting the office environment, familiar to many, this performance will bring to life the themes from the EP in a host of ways.

With over 2.2 million streams across platforms and 1.8 million on Spotify alone, his impact is growing. Releases have landed on global and regional editorial playlists. His EPs—Fantasy, Monarch, SugarCoated and now F.O.M.O —have consistently showcased his range and evolution as an artist.

Sig Wilder & Friends blend kiwi authenticity with American grit, bringing you a well-worn handwritten journal of lived experiences rendered through metaphor, poetic prose, and the stylistic conventions of folk, alt-country and late-night heartbreak radio.

Josh Glennie is a soulful singer/songwriter based in Wellington, New Zealand. He's made a name for himself playing in bands around Wellington and is now striking out with his own solo material. Together with Tarn, they have produced a new EP of songs that cut to the bone, focused around acoustic guitar and Josh's striking vocals. His New EP is expected late 2025/early 2026.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
KORA tickets, Presented by: Eccles Entertainment
Kora are back - and sound bigger, deeper and more electrifying than ever. With a long-awaited new album on the horizon, and a tour to match, the iconic Aotearoa band is set to reawaken the hearts of fans both old and new.
Known as one of the country’s most powerful and dynamic acts fusing elements of roots, reggae, funk, rock, dub, and electronic music into a sonic identity that is entirely their own. Their music is heavy and melodic and grounded in kaupapa Māori, driven by innovation, storytelling, and groove.
Their performances bring together heavy bass, soaring vocals, and raw energy, blending musical mastery with raw power to create an immersive experience. Whether headlining major festivals or packing out venues around Aotearoa, Kora’s ability to move a crowd is unmatched.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Songwriters' Saturday, These Wellington singer-songwriters have put together an evening of original music for your enjoyment.

Opening the evening is Rachel Hird on piano, with vocalist Brenda Shearer. Next up is local producer, musician and songwriter Phil Riley, followed by a good 50 mins of toe-tapping grooving with The Grey Dog Band.

More about the artists:

Rachel Hird is a Wellington based singer-songwriter. She grew up playing the piano and studying classical music. Nowadays she writes and performs her own songs, best described as ‘songs from the heart'. She is constantly inspired by people she meets in the world of music such as musician, vocalist, songwriter and mentor Brenda Shearer, and sing-songwriter Charlotte Yates whose songwriting school is a place where many songs have been crafted. Rachel's songs are inspired by people, places and events of the past and present. She is planning an EP release early 2026.

Phil Riley is a full-time writer /producer with a recording studio in Korokoro. He's a wordsmith and melodic songwriter with influences from the Beatles and Paul Simon to Coldplay. Phil started on the English Club circuit as a guitarist, then drummer and keyboard player/singer in NZ bands.
Riley got to know Grammy winner Jon Mark of White Cloud Records (Naxos), and this led to a series of 6 Celtic and World music albums for the label, including The Blessing Tree, which reached #11 on the US radio play charts and was nominated for 5 NZ Tui music awards.

Riley has tracks on European and US albums alongside artists such as Enya, Sarah McLachlan, Sinead O’Connor, Secret Garden and Clannad. The compilation ‘Celtic Journey’ reached #1 on the American Billboard charts.

Over the past few years, the art and craft of songwriting has become a priority, driving his recording and performing focus and moving his musical centre of gravity. His first ’new’ indie album ‘Five Dollar Rockets’ featured a stellar cast of instrumentalists and singers.
In this unplugged ‘sneak preview’ of songs from the first and upcoming second album he’ll be joined by long-time talented music buddies Charlie Harter and Marty Parlane on guitars and the wonderful Brenda Shearer on vocals.

The Grey Dog are a deluded bunch of cork-sniffers who think they will improve with age. They are John Broadbent – vocals, guitar and harp, Martyn Parlane – vocals and guitar, Graeme “Grey Dog” Sullivan – bass and vocals and Greg Bates - drums. They often play around Courtenay Place, where they use their music to lure passing sailors to their doom. Their musical style is wide-ranging, but basically Boomer. They hope their music will provide some fuel for your hearts, heads, and toes.

The Realm is a family friendly venue with a great vibe, good food, including children's menu and a good range of refreshing beverages available at the bar. You can book a table online at https://therealm.co.nz/
label: Music & Concerts

description:
WELLINGTON - Opera House Wellington, We invite you to join us for a night of Creedence Clearwater Revival and John Fogerty, as we celebrate the music of one of the world’s most iconic bands – from the songs they wrote, to the songs covered, to the songs they wrote for others.
From their album debut in 1968 to their last album in 1972, CCR was a juggernaut of phenomenal proportions.
No other band has created such an impact in such a short time.
The Creedence Clearwater Collective brings to the stage a band that captures the unique CCR sound.
You do not want to hear through the grapevine that you missed out on this fun, hit-packed live concert.
Join us, a real-life travelling band.
Ticket Link
label: Music & Concerts

description:
THE GROGANS in Wellington, THE GROGANS in Wellington

🎤 Catch The Grogans Live at San Fran on Friday, September 5, 2025! 🎤
Ready to experience the night of your life? description:
Randell Cottage Annual Open Day, Tour this small colonial Cottage and marvel that it once housed a couple and their ten children. Share afternoon tea and listen to authors reading their works.
Randell Cottage is a rare example of colonial domestic architecture and is a listed historic place. It retains most of its original 19th century configuration, although modified as a comfortable home for writers from NZ and France. It is only open to the public annually as part of the Festival. The event includes a series of readings from current and past residents.
A limited programme will be offered if weather conditions are poor.

Cost: Koha
Event information here: https://wellingtonheritagefestival.co.nz/.../randell.../

description:
Pōneke Pump n' Dump - Pinball Tournament, PINBALL TOURNAMENT AT YE OLDE PINBALL SHOPPE
Pōneke's Premier Pinball Tournament for your future career as an internationally ranked pinball player!
Make a hearty pilgrimage through the arcade, trying your hand at a selection of our finely curated games, report your scores to the staff, and watch your ranking on the tournament ladder rise as your scores are stacked up against your competitors. Not happy with a score you got? No problem, you can keep trying until you're
happy with it!
Make it into the Top 16 before the end of Saturday, and you'll be invited to play in the finals round the following Sunday, where 1st - 8th will play in A Division, and 9th - 16th will play in B Division.
This finals round is free of charge, and comes with a whopping prize pool worth $200 in value awarded to the top finishers in each division.
So what are you waiting for? Come and show us your skills!
Qualification Round (7th - 13th September):
Each player is granted access to a token deal of 12 tokens for $20!
- Sunday to Saturday
- Submit at least one score on each of the selected 8 games during open hours.
- Your best score on each game is ranked.
- Take a picture of your score and submit it at the counter.
- Unlimited qualifying! Not satisfied with your score? Grab more tokens and keep playing to improve it!
Scoring System:
- Linear Scoring applies. Score 100pts for the top score on each selected game, 99pts for 2nd, 98pts for 3rd, and so on.
Finals (14th September):
Top 16 qualifiers will battle it out on Sunday from 12pm onwards, with 8 in A-Division, and 8 in B-Division! Keep an eye on our socials if you've participated in the competition throughout the week - those who have qualified for the finals will be announced on SATURDAY night (the 12th).
You could win a share of $200 in Shoppe Credit!
How to Participate:
Simply come to Ye Olde Pinball Shoppe during open hours and submit your scores from Monday to Saturday!
Location:
18A Bond Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011
This month's games are:
AC/DC
Fish Tales
Godzilla
James Bond 007
King Kong
Lord of the Rings
Medieval Madness
Pulp Fiction
Come, participate, and let’s find out who the true Pinball Wizard is! May the best player win!

description:
The Dave Wilson Quintet, Dave Wilson presents his quintet in a special performance of newly arranged material from his two most recent projects: Free, Free: Meditations on Liberation (debuted in 2025), and Ephemeral (Thelonious Records, 2023).  

Free, Free draws from legacies of musical collectivity in an invitation to explore the expansive possibilities for what liberation might sound like. Ephemeral, described as “quite spiritually intense music” by The Guardian, explores the transience of human relationships with one another and the natural world through alternatively floating and driving improvisatory impulses of Wilson and his ensemble.

The quintet for this performance will present the music of Free, Free and Ephemeral in a brand-new configuration: Wilson on saxophone and bass clarinet, Mana Waiariki on violin, Seth Boy on bass, Callum Allardice on guitar, and Abe Baillie on drums.

Dave Wilson is a saxophonist, clarinettist, composer, producer, and interdisciplinary scholar. His music bridges avant-garde and experimental music with various groove-oriented styles from the worlds of jazz, R&B, electronic music, and more. Before relocating to Te Whanganui-a-Tara Wellington in 2016, Dave grew up in the Chicago area, lived for a decade in Los Angeles, and spent several stints living in Skopje, North Macedonia.

Part of the Wellington Jazz Festival 2025
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Sir Ian Athfield Memorial Lecture 2025 | Te Whanganui-a-Tara Wellington, Te Kāhui Whaihanga New Zealand Institute of Architects are excited to welcome Ian Moore to New Zealand to present this year’s lecture series ‘The Past Needs a Future’ which will focus on adaptive reuse.
Ian is the principal of Ian Moore Architects, established in 1990. The practice has won numerous Australian and international awards and has been published and exhibited widely, including at the Venice Architecture Biennale in 2008 and 2012.
Initially studying civil and structural engineering at the Auckland Technical Institute in New Zealand, Ian moved on to study architecture at the University of Technology, Sydney, graduating with honours in 1988.
Ian has taught at numerous universities and been a speaker and guest lecturer throughout Australia as well as internationally.
Ian has also been a member of awards juries in Australia, New Zealand and at the World Festival of Interiors in 2013 and the World Architecture Festival in 2015. In 2003, Ian was the inaugural Creative Director for the Australian Institute of Architects annual conference.
About the Sir Ian Athfield Memorial Lecture
The annual Sir Ian Athfield Memorial Lecture commemorates the late Ian Athfield, a singular and much-loved figure in New Zealand architecture.
Affectionately known as ‘Ath’, Ian was knighted in 2014 and was one of New Zealand’s most influential architects. He won more than 60 national and international architecture and design awards and the lecture series was established to honour his legacy and celebrate his larrikin spirit.
In keeping with that spirit, each year the lecture is given by a person with something to say – someone who is challenging orthodoxy and a business-as-usual approach to practice, and life.
During his career, Ath designed many significant buildings, none more so than his own home in Te Whanganui-a-Tara Wellington, which enraged the neighbours, perplexed the Council and inspired the city for decades.
Ath was talented, original, insightful, opinionated, provocative, and sometimes outrageous. His architecture is stimulating, challenging, ever-changing, but never careless.
In 2004, Te Kāhui Whaihanga New Zealand Institute of Architects awarded Ath the Gold Medal for career achievements, noting at the time “What defines Athfield above all is his contagious enthusiasm, his devotion to architecture, and his unswerving belief in its possibilities. Believing architecture to be a civilising force, he has demonstrated a strong commitment to architecture’s public realm: the streets we live in; the urban centres we inhabit; the countryside we love and so often abuse.”
The Sir Ian Athfield Lecture Series is proudly sponsored by Resene and GIB.
CPD points: 10
TIMING:
Doors open: 5.00pm
Lecture: 5.30pm - 6.30pm
Q&A: 6.30pm - 7.00pm

Te Whanganui-a-Tara Wellington | Wednesday 3 September | Michael Fowler Centre

description:
Sterling Silver Earring Workshop, Sterling Silver Earring Workshop
Make your own Sterling Silver summer earrings – Saturday 13th September at Square Edge Art Centre, Palmerston North

Looking for a fun workshop to get your creative juices flowing after a long week in the office? Then come join us on Saturday 13th September at the Square Edge Art Centre in Palmerston North where you will make your own pair of sterling silver earrings in 4 – 5 hours.

When: Saturday 13th September, starts at 10:00 for about 4 – 5 hours (or until you’re done)
Cost: $120 - $150 pp (depending on if you add a gemstone to your design or not. See more info below)
Space: Only 8 spaces available ( book at https://www.rholenesingleton.com/product-page/summer-earrings-workshop )


What to expect:
• Friendly, expert guidance by local metalsmith Rholene Singleton. She will assist you every step of the way ensuring you leave with a beautiful pair of earrings at the end of the day.
• Design your own earrings to create something uniquely yours, or make use of the templates available, which you can embellish as you like.
• You have the option to add a semi-precious cabochon gemstone to your design.
• A selection of refreshments will be available, but you are welcome to bring a light lunch if you feel like the day will get too long without it.
• Relaxed and fun morning enjoyed in the beautiful iconic Square Edge Art Centre in the heart of Palmerston North. View the current artist exhibitions currently on show in the center for free.


Practical Details:
Come and learn the ancient art of silver jewellery making through demonstrations and then giving it a go yourself while you create your own beautiful new summer earrings, using a jewellers saw, blowtorch, gemstone setting tools and more.

• Two options for this workshop:
1. Plain sterling silver earrings - $120 pp
2. Add cabochon gemstones to your design - $150 pp

• 4 – 5 hours of guidance as you create your own piece
• All tools and materials included
• A selection of gemstones to choose from

Your space will be confirmed once payment is received. This workshop is first come, first serve. Space is limited.

To book please go to https://www.rholenesingleton.com/product-page/summer-earrings-workshop

description:
The Grogans - 'Stagger' Tour NZ 2025 | Wellington, The Grogans - 'Stagger' Tour NZ 2025 | Wellington
Ready to take these new tracks on the road, The Grogans new album Stagger is out, plus the band are excited to announce a headline tour across New Zealand. Exploring another side of The Grogans' music, Stagger is a patchwork of different sounds and sonic inspirations that all come together in the one album, "it came from this idea that it was a jagged and stylistically different album track to track", explain The Grogans.
Kicking off their tour at Loons in Christchurch on Wednesday 3 September, the band then head to Yonder in Queenstown on Thursday 4 September, San Fran in Wellington on Friday 5 September before wrapping up at Double Whammy Auckland on Saturday 6 September. Prior to their Aotearoa dates, the trio will also be playing a seven date tour throughout Australia along with stops in LA and New York for North American shows this June.

Capturing the magnetic energy of their live shows, Stagger touches on themes of mental health, taking care of yourself and your loved ones, the occasional love song, and more. As the catchy chorus first single and album opener ‘Oh Boy’ leads into
sonic powerhouse of a tune ‘Come Up (Goes Down)’, ‘In My Heart’ slows it down to a new easy listening direction, followed by ‘Have a Little Dream’ - as dreamy as the title suggests - and the big open echoed instrumentation of ‘Once In A While’. Adding new textural effects in ‘Roll Back’ and last single ‘Roundabout’, ‘Happier Man’ dips into a heavier psych realm with a reminder that "striving to be a better and happier person should be a goal for everyone." ‘Worry About Everything’ is an upbeat tune sure to have you worrying about nothing, and feel good album closer ‘All My Days’ ends on a more serious note that outlines the beauty and the beast of live music and the personal struggles that come with the lifestyle and touring.

Tickets go on sale 12pm, Wednesday 28 May.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
The Racket Lounge: Session Four, Grab a spot on our couch and enjoy the noise at The Racket Lounge, a chill classical music series featuring up-and-coming Pōneke classical and jazz musicians.

Last year the NZSQ Trust launched the Racket Lounge, a concert series for classical and jazz musicians with experience ranging from students to pros to freely express their creativity in a non-traditional concert setting. It was a huge success, with over 250 audience members and 52 artists over our four sessions. Audiences were raving about the musical variety and great talent they found at the Racket Lounge, and as one audience member commented; “Well done…do it again!” So, we listened, and the Racket Lounge is back for round two! Once again hosted at Bedlam & Squalor (above the Rogue & Vagabond), we welcome audiences, composers and performers back for another four concerts full of innovative, fun, and chill music. From classical to pop covers, video game soundtracks to original compositions, there's something for everyone to sink their teeth into at The Racket Lounge!

Even if you've never been to a classical music concert before, this one is for you. With a 'Choose your price' model you can afford to give it a go - and you might even find something you like!

A Flexible Price, So You Can Take A Chance on Something New:
Our prices range from $5 to $100, just pick the ticket price you feel like paying. At The Racket Lounge, we believe everyone should have access to high-quality but affordable art. If you're a bit strapped for cash right now, but still want a good night out, no worries! Just book yourself a $5 ticket! If you can afford to pay a little more and want to do some good for your community, then pick one of our higher ticket prices and rest assured that your dollars are going towards funding great, accessible art in your city.

All proceeds from ticket sales will go directly into presenting the next Racket Lounge, including paying musicians and artists, hiring instruments and marketing costs. Plus, by choosing a higher price point, you're ensuring that we're able to continue to offer tickets at a lower price point for those who need it.

Please note: Bedlam & Squalor is a licenced venue, so under 18s must be accompanied by a parent or legal guardian. Everyone must bring ID.
Supported by Wellington City Council.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
The Māori Sidesteps, Māori made mischief

Contemporary showband The Māori Sidesteps are serving crooning and comedic goodness. With soulful harmonies, satirical skits, and superb song parodies, these fullas have won rave reviews, alongside their hit webseries and TV show – and now you can catch them live on stage at Circa Theatre!

The Sidesteps flip comedic nostalgia on its head and weave stunning harmonies with theatrical play, skewering social idioms and shining a cheeky light on what it means to be Māori in 2025.

Celebrating connection and the richness of our differences, The Māori Sidesteps bring pride in identity, the strength of mana motuhake, and the reminder that joy is the best antidote to division. From government blunders to policies ripe for the picking, these top-notch entertainers take aim at the kaupapa of the moment. Expect fearless satire, wickedly subversive humour, and a refreshing dose of truth-telling disguised as hilarity.

If you’ve ever wished someone would sing what you’ve been thinking about the current political climate, The Māori Sidesteps are here to deliver Māori made mischief through waiata that wink!

Reviews:
“Never did satire and self-deprecation go hand in hand and so cleverly and entertainingly” Alan Scott – Theatreview
“A night of whakawhanaungatanga – aroha, not (too much) hōhā.” Flat City Field Notes

Tuesday 28th October – Saturday 1st November (5 shows only)
$25 – $49
Circa One
Age Recommendation PG
Audience Care: Occasional strong language & themes
Runtime: 95mins plus interval

Performances:
Tuesday 28 October 6.30pm
Wednesday 29 October 6.30pm
Thursday 30 October 6.30pm
Friday 31 October 8.00pm
Saturday 1 November 8.00pm

Cast and crew:
Writers: The Māori Sidesteps Collective
Director: Jonathan Hendry
The Māori Sidesteps Collective Cast:
-Jamie McCaskill
-Cohen Holloway
-Jerome Leota
-Cameron Clayton

Lighting: Sonia Hardie

description:
Topless Picking Flowers Release Tour // LEVIN, Topless Picking Flowers Release Tour // LEVIN
Sophie Songbird makes her solo debut this spring, stepping into the spotlight with a voice and vision all her own. Known for her work with the beloved band Dr. Reknaw, Sophie now unveils a fresh chapter — touring in celebration of her first solo release and sharing a collection of unreleased, vintage-inspired originals that blend nostalgic charm with a modern twist.

Drawing from the rich traditions of jazz, blues, and country — with a touch of psychedelic flair — Sophie’s songwriting is both timeless and distinctly her own. Her stories are laced with wit, warmth, and a hint of mischief, offering a refreshing take on classic genres.

Her debut single, “Topless Picking Flowers” — set for release on September 19th — is a dreamy fusion of classic country and smooth Hawaiian tones. On stage, Sophie captivates with exceptional rhythm guitar work and a honey-toned voice that soars effortlessly.

with support from ABBEY EVE

description:
Contemporary Realism, Whether you work from objects, the figure, or secondary sources, this is an opportunity to explore working more loosely, using oils or acrylics.

Justine will guide you through drawing and painting exercises to help loosen you up, and will discuss art historical techniques that may be relevant to your individual artistic style and context.

This course will increase your ability to represent perceived objects in a dynamic, painterly way. You will be guided through drawing and painting exercises to help you achieve accuracy of form, working loosely with oils and acrylics to create fresh contemporary paintings. The emphasis is on working with your chosen source material to create a `next level’ painting. This course is for those who have explored some of the basics of painting such as mixing colours, blending etc, but want to find a process that best expresses your unique approach and ideas. Skills learnt in class can be applied across all genres.

Materials are not included in this course. Please bring your preferred range of oils, brushes and supports (paper, canvas, or board). A good basic set of oil paints would include cad and lemon yellow, ultramarine and cerulean blue, and cad red and alizarin crimson. Also, black and white. Inverlochy will supply Liquin and odourless turps. Please also bring a photocopied reference image in both black and white and
colour.

Lunch break - 30 minutes. Bring a water bottle and packed lunch to enjoy in the historic Inverlochy house or explore the local cafes in Te Aro.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Topless Picking Flowers Release Tour // LEVIN, Topless Picking Flowers Release Tour // LEVIN
Sophie Songbird makes her solo debut this spring, stepping into the spotlight with a voice and vision all her own. Known for her work with the beloved band Dr. Reknaw, Sophie now unveils a fresh chapter — touring in celebration of her first solo release and sharing a collection of unreleased, vintage-inspired originals that blend nostalgic charm with a modern twist.

Drawing from the rich traditions of jazz, blues, and country — with a touch of psychedelic flair — Sophie’s songwriting is both timeless and distinctly her own. Her stories are laced with wit, warmth, and a hint of mischief, offering a refreshing take on classic genres.

Her debut single, “Topless Picking Flowers” — set for release on September 19th — is a dreamy fusion of classic country and smooth Hawaiian tones. On stage, Sophie captivates with exceptional rhythm guitar work and a honey-toned voice that soars effortlessly.

with support from ABBEY EVE
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Ziggy Alberts tickets, Presented by: Commonfolk
ARIA-accredited and APRA Award-winning artist Ziggy Alberts will return to New Zealand this November as part of his New Love World Tour, following three years of extensive touring across Europe, the UK, North and South America, Asia, and regional Australia. Celebrating the release of his seventh studio album, New Love, Ziggy will return to New Zealand for the first time since 2023, with three special shows in Christchurch, Wellington, and Auckland.
From his early days busking the streets of Byron Bay to selling out venues like London’s Royal Albert Hall, Ziggy’s journey has been defined by grassroots touring, heartfelt songwriting, and an unwavering independent spirit.
The New Zealand leg of the tour kicks off on Thursday 13 November at Christchurch Town Hall, followed by Meow Nui in Wellington on Friday 14 November, and concludes at Auckland’s Powerstation on Saturday 15 November. This tour will showcase Ziggy’s signature solo style - spirited, raw, and deeply authentic - the kind of direct connection that has earned him over one billion streams, multiple awards, and a loyal global fanbase.
Fans can look forward to favourites like ‘Days in the Sun’ and ‘Runaway’, which recently surpassed 100 million streams, alongside new tracks from New Love - an album crafted for live performance. Featuring hit singles 'New Love’, 'Where Does the Love Go?' and latest single, ‘I’m With You’ the record marks a return to simplicity and authenticity, blending folk, rock, and country influences to create a cohesive yet dynamic listening experience.
Alberts’ year of New Love is not one to miss. This leg of the world tour will celebrate connection, authenticity, and music’s ability to bring people together. Don’t miss the chance to see Ziggy Alberts live on the New Love World Tour 2025
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Yoko–Zuna: A Live Tribute to KAYTRANADA tickets, This October, Aotearoa electronic/progressive hip-hop powerhouse Yoko-Zuna will make their long anticipated return to Pōneke, presenting the music of KAYTRANADA in the city's magnificent Meow NUI. Over the past decade Yoko-Zuna have firmly established themselves as one of the country’s most exciting live acts and a favourite on the festival circuit. Just back from a world tour with hip-hop multihyphenate CHAII, the four piece made up of Swap Gomez, J.Y Lee, Kenji Iwamitsu-Holdaway, & Frank Eliesa once again join forces to perform their live tribute to a genre-defying beat wizard.
Louis Kevin Celestin aka KAYTRANADA is a Haitian-Canadian record producer and DJ. He first made waves in 2010 with a steady stream of mixtapes, remixes, and original tracks released under the name Kaytradamus. By 2013, reintroducing himself as KAYTRANADA, he was turning heads across the global music scene. The momentum only grew—by 2014, he landed a deal with the influential label XL Recordings. In 2016, he dropped his debut studio album, 99.9%, which was met with widespread critical acclaim. 2019’s Bubba—a genre-blurring triumph earned him two Grammy Awards, including Best Dance/Electronic Album, solidifying his place as one of the most innovative voices in contemporary music.

description:
A Dialogue with a Movements Catalyst (Wellington), Discover What God Is Doing in Movements Around the World
Join us for an inspiring session with Ryan A., missionary, church planter, and movements catalyst.
For the past ten years, Ryan and his family have served among unreached peoples in South Asia and Southeast Asia. In 2017, Ryan helped catalyze a church-planting movement that has since multiplied into 10,000+ churches and 100,000+ baptisms—and continues to grow rapidly.
Today, Ryan serves as a mentor to movement leaders across Asia, helping ordinary believers multiply disciples and churches. His experience spans both the unreached world and the urban Western context, giving him a unique perspective that speaks powerfully into the New Zealand setting.
Why Attend?
Ryan’s message directly addresses two urgent needs in New Zealand today:
Reaching our lost communities with the good news of Jesus.
Revitalizing overseas missions sending, which has significantly declined in recent years.
If you long to see disciples and churches multiply—both here and to the ends of the earth—this workshop is for you.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description:
Aussie medium, Simon Hay at the Palmy Conference and Function Centre, Aussie medium, Simon Hay at the Palmy Conference and Function Centre
An Evening of Live Mediumship and Healing with Aussie Medium, Simon Hay

Simon is a psychic medium, medical intuitive and healer. He travels throughout Australia and New Zealand doing private sessions and events. His down-to-earth style of mediumship is accurate, surprising, and entertaining.
At these events, Simon shares messages and accurate information from spirit, but he's passionate about educating about energy healing and mediumship so he also answers audience questions about his career. If you’re curious about communicating to spirit and energy healing, you’ll love this event.
Enjoy…
• A demonstration of psychic mediumship readings in the Elwood Room
• Q and A — ask questions about spirit and energy healing
Arrive to be seated by 7:15 pm.
$55/ticket
Re ticket purchasers, we have a no refund policy. Be certain about attending before purchasing.
Not all attendees will receive readings (attendance doesn’t guarantee you’ll get a reading)
This is an adults only (16 years +) event. Parents, be aware that I often talk about topics suitable only for adults.
To be polite and respectful, turn off your phone during the event, and do not video or record any part of the event.
Prior to attending this event, visit Simon Hay's website, read all the information there and the disclaimer in its entirety. Thank you.

Aotearoa Interfaith Forum 2025, Aotearoa Interfaith Forum 2025
Please join us for our hybrid Interfaith Forum, with in-person meetings in Wellington, Christchurch, Dunedin, and further hubs!

Saturday, 13 September 2025 from 5:30 to 8:30PM


The Wellington Interfaith Council is hosting a hybrid online national forum for our community this year. We understand travel costs can be a barrier to in-person gatherings, so we're creating a unique way to connect!

The forum will be opened by two accomplished speakers. Then, each regional council will host their own in-person meeting, simultaneously linking up online for a shared discussion (kaupapa). This allows local interfaith members to gather in a convenient local location, connecting to the national screen and video via Zoom.

description:
CTRL_ALT_DEL, CTRL_ALT_DEL
Can we CTRL ourselves? ALT our reality? Or must we DEL everything else?

About this Event


Strap in for this emotional rollercoaster! Let voice, music and movement take you through a journey of resilience and self-discovery, to a wild, high-energy house party, to a powerful exploration of love, grief, and revenge. Three stories; one powerful connection.

Note to God - Jjohn Nickle
Note to God follows five individuals in therapy, each facing personal struggles. As they bond through shared pain, healing begins — until a twist tests their trust. A moving musical about connection, resilience, and finding hope in life’s darkest moments.
My House - Olivia Watts
My House is a high-energy show that takes you on a Saturday night and shows the heart of a house party. From the first guest to the final beat, experience explosive choreography, unforgettable characters, and music that moves your soul. It’s more than a party, it’s My House.
No Way Back? - Bryce Blackmore
No Way Back? explores one man’s experience with loss and what it means for his humanity. When everything is ripped away, how do we respond? In the wake of tragedy, we all face a choice: confront the pain and move forward or let it consume us.
label: Religion & Spirituality

Wellington Crack Chicken x Heinz Fried Chicken Sauce Pop-Up, Heinz’s fan-favourite Fried Chicken Sauce has finally landed in Aotearoa, and it’s making its NZ debut in style – with a limited-time pop-up collab at Crack Chicken. Already a hit with fried chicken fans overseas for its creamy, sweet and spicy kick, the sauce is now hitting Crack Chicken menus nationwide for one week only.

On the special menu:
- The Supreme Chicken Burger (crispy fried chicken, slaw, pickles and a generous layer of sauce)

- Crack Chicken’s golden Blooming Onion made for dipping,

- Plus the option to add the new Heinz Fried Chicken Sauce to anything and everything on the menu.

When: Friday 3 – Sunday 12 October 2025

Where:
- Crack Chicken Ponsonby – 168 Ponsonby Road, Auckland
- Crack Chicken Hamilton - Made Mess Hall - 401 Grey Street, Hamilton East
- Crack Chicken Willis Lane – 1 Willis Street, Wellington Central
- Crack Chicken North City - North City Mall – Porirua

Hot tip: Sauce lovers and fried chicken fans won’t want to miss this limited-time pop-up – once it’s gone, it’s gone.

description:
Celebrate the Fabric, Exquisite pieces of needlework are on display and in use every day at Wellington Cathedral of
St Paul: beautifully decorated fabrics that hang at the front of the altars, spectacular robes and
stoles worn by priests at services, and fine linens used at every service of Holy Communion.

You’ll learn much about this remarkable fabric artistry when Jo Dixey talks to the Friends of
Wellington Cathedral of St Paul and guests on Wednesday, 24 September at 10.30 am.
Jo is an internationally regarded professional embroiderer who graduated from the Royal
School of Needlework and now lives permanently in New Zealand. She teaches, exhibits and sells
her work, as well as accepting commissions from churches, fashion designers and private
individuals. She has also had contracts from the film industry, working on the Disney film Mulan
and most recently on season 1 of Lord of the Rings TV series. Jo’s collection of embroidered
3D viruses, created during the 2020 Covid lockdown, are now on display in The Museum of
New Zealand Te Papa Tongarewa.

Venue: Loaves and Fishes Hall, Wellington Cathedral of St Paul.

description:
From Source 2025, From Source 2025
From Source
A space to activate and remember your innate, divine connection to Source. This is an invitation to access your unique blueprint and align with what is required for your evolution. Through alchemical technology, sound vibrations, and breathwork, we inspire a divine collaboration within the cells of your mind, body, and soul.

Our last event was an incredible success, and due to the deep transformations that unfolded, we are bringing it back in October 2025 for another powerful gathering.

We are honored to have an incredible lineup of contributors, each weaving their threads of wisdom and magic to co-create a weekend of deep activation and restorative integration. The modalities and offerings will include:

✨ Triple Cone Orgonite Technology, Merkabar Activation & Sound Healing – Jason Hotton

✨ Voice Activation & Live Medicine Music – Joydah Mae

✨ Breathwork & Meditation – OM Shanti Shanti

✨ Crystal Bowls – Lucine Sounds

✨ Cacao – Awa Aroha

✨ Nourishing Food – Anthea Carr

✨ Space Holder – Leah Pomeroy

Together, we will journey through these realms of wisdom—let’s see what Source has in store for us this weekend.

Event Details
📅 Two-Day Immersion – Your ticket includes both days
🕚 Saturday, Oct 11 | 11:00 AM - 8:00 PM
🕙 Sunday, Oct 12 | 10:00 AM - 4:00 PM

Ticket Tiers
🎟 First Round – $222 (15 passes only) - SECURE ASAP
🎟 Second Round – $333
🎟 Final Round – $444

What to Bring
✅ Yoga Mat
✅ Cushion/Blanket
✅ Journal
✅ Water Bottle
✅ BYO Cup for Cacao
✅ BYO Plates, Bowls & Cutlery for shared meals
✅ A plate of nourishing kai to share at the end of Saturday as we ground together

Please Note
This event is designed for deep inner work and integration, making it unsuitable for young children and no dogs are permitted in the hall. We encourage you to take this time for yourself to fully immerse in the experience.

💌 Any questions? Email us at
📍 Stay connected – Follow us on Facebook (@FromSource) for updates!

We can't wait to share this sacred space with you once again. 🌿✨

description:
Harmonic Sound Journey at Space with Claudio, Harmonic Sound Journey at Space with Claudio
We invite you to a special evening of Sacred Harmonic Sound with multi-instrumentalist Claudio Escutia. This immersive sound journey offers a deeply restorative experience that invites you to settle into stillness, reconnect with the heart, and explore a sense of inner spaciousness through vibration and tone.
Claudio skilfully layers the sounds of gongs, crystal and Tibetan singing bowls, Native American flutes, and other traditional instruments, enhanced through high-quality audio equipment so the sound can be both heard and felt throughout your body.
Harmonic sound and vibration offer the nervous system a chance to truly rest. In this state of relaxation, the thinking mind softens, and we find connection to citta — the heart-mind. From this place, silence arises naturally through the vehicle of sound.
This experience is open to everyone. No previous yoga or meditation practice is needed.

What to bring:
You are welcome to bring your own yoga mat, though studio mats are also available. We will provide bolsters, blankets, and eye pillows for your comfort.

Booking is essential — spaces are limited and this event often fills quickly.

About Claudio
Claudio is a multi-instrumentalist musician originally from Mexico City and now based in Wellington. Born into a family of musicians, he began playing music at a young age and later studied classical guitar. His journey led him to Montreal, where he explored jazz, world music, and spiritual sound traditions.

Extensive travels in Asia and Europe deepened his connection with Indian music and yogic philosophy. He studied Tibetan singing bowls in Kathmandu and Varanasi, and has since worked with a wide range of instruments including the sitar, esraj, bansuri, harmonium, flutes, gongs, and voice.

Claudio’s work blends technical skill, deep presence, and a profound respect for the healing power of sound.

Learn more or listen to Claudio’s music here:
SoundCloud https://soundcloud.com/claudioescutiasounds
Instagram https://www.instagram.com/claudio_yoga_sound_healing
Facebook https://www.facebook.com/soundhealingyogamusicclaudio
label: Religion & Spirituality

description:
EYA Presents: The Bible and the Sacraments Bible Study, What are the Sacraments? Where do they come from? What do they mean? And why are they so central to our Catholic Faith?
In The Bible and the Sacraments, you’ll discover the deeply biblical roots of the Seven Sacraments and how they are more than mere Church rituals, but streams of life flowing from the living Body of Christ.
Throughout this study, you’ll discover how God has always dealt with His people through “sacraments,” and how the sacraments of the Old Testament find their ultimate fulfillment in the Seven Sacraments instituted by Christ and celebrated in the Catholic Church to this day.
Eucharistia Young Adults (EYA) introduces our second Bible study for 2025! This eleven-lesson Bible study by St Paul Center will delve into the beauty of the sacraments of the Catholic Church.
Please bring your Bible, journal, pen - and of course, your lovely self! Bring your friends, co-workers, family members, the more the merrier!
__________________
Every Wednesday | 16 July 2025 - 08 October 2025
St Mary's of the Angels Parish Hall
Everyone is most welcome!
label: Religion & Spirituality

description: Healing Power of the Holy Eucharist, You are warmly invited to a special retreat led by Fr. Joseph Edattu VC, Director of the Divine Retreat Centre UK. Come and experience a powerful time of spiritual renewal bring your family and friends, and see the change in your life.

We are excited to invite your teenager to be part of our Encounter Summit - a two-day event designed for our next generation, from Year 7 to Year 13, filled with faith, fun, and fellowship. This summit is a powerful opportunity for young people to grow spiritually, encounter God in a fresh way, build lasting friendships, and create unforgettable memories.
We are thrilled to welcome Brodie McDowell, Youth Pastor at Elim Tauranga and the Elim National Youth Leader. Brodie is an inspiring communicator with a passion for reaching young people, and we believe his ministry will have a significant and lasting impact on our next generation.

description:
Māori Sidesteps – Māori Made Mischief, Contemporary showband The Māori Sidesteps are serving crooning and comedic goodness. With soulful harmonies, satirical skits, and superb song parodies, these fullas have won rave reviews, alongside their hit webseries and TV show – and now you can catch them live on stage at Circa Theatre!

The Sidesteps flip comedic nostalgia on its head and weave stunning harmonies with theatrical play, skewering social idioms and shining a cheeky light on what it means to be Māori in 2025.

Celebrating connection and the richness of our differences, The Māori Sidesteps bring pride in identity, the strength of mana motuhake, and the reminder that joy is the best antidote to division. From government blunders to policies ripe for the picking, these top-notch entertainers take aim at the kaupapa of the moment. Expect fearless satire, wickedly subversive humour, and a refreshing dose of truth-telling disguised as hilarity.

If you’ve ever wished someone would sing what you’ve been thinking about the current political climate, The Māori Sidesteps are here to deliver Māori made mischief through waiata that wink!

Reviews:
“Never did satire and self-deprecation go hand in hand and so cleverly and entertainingly” Alan Scott – Theatreview
“A night of whakawhanaungatanga – aroha, not (too much) hōhā.” Flat City Field Notes
label: Arts & Theatre

Susan Crystal Diamond is inviting you to join her circle for a sound and light language multidimensional transmission that will guide you to a deeper inner alignment through channeled light codes and wisdom to receive more peace and love.

In this sacred seated space you will be guided through gentle breath opening you to receive source energy, practice a fun intuitive exercise, choose an oracle card, receive a channeled light language activation to either release, activate, expand or heal for your highest good.

Experience this journey with Susan, which will support your inner strength and invite you into a state of divine neutrality. This relaxing, uplifting experience is designed to help you navigate the changes we are all facing offering a new template for peace and balance and return to your true nature.

Please note this is a seated event however you are welcome to bring a mat and blanket to lay down for the transmission, wear layered clothing for comfort and bring a water bottle.

Energy exchange $30 021 608913 To book
Transfer payment to 06-0773-0271726-00

Susan is a seasoned practitioner and channel of light with decades of experience in the healing arts bringing experience, wisdom and compassion to her work. Over the last 10 years Susan has refined her unique gifts of light language which she brings through for private clients and in group sessions. Her light language is a powerful tool working on subtle energetic levels to assist individuals in transforming on a cellular level and connecting to their higher selves. Paired with sound instruments Susans sessions are always unique and intuitively guided.

Susans’ commitment to guiding souls with humility and compassion has made her a trusted source of support and wisdom in the healing community. Allow her to help you navigate your own journey with grace and light.

In the circle we will weave our unique soul essence together to experience the oneness of our new earth frequency.

description:
Win More As a Tradie in 2026!, Win More As a Tradie in 2026!
Get ready to level up your tradie game and learn how to win more jobs, clients, and money in 2026!

About this Event

Win More As a Tradie in 2026!
Come join us at the Stokes Valley Rugby Football Club for an exciting event tailored just for tradies like you! Learn valuable tips and tricks to boost your business and increase your success in 2026. Network with fellow tradies and industry experts to gain insights and grow your professional circle. Don't miss out on this opportunity to take your trade to the next level!



Key Topics & Talking Points
Quote Smarter, Win More
How to make your quotes stand out from the competition with simple, professional templates.
Using free/low-cost quoting tools to speed up response time (and why speed wins jobs).
Adding small touches (images, guarantees, payment links) that boost acceptance rates.

Lead Tracking Made Easy
Simple ways to track every enquiry so none fall through the cracks.
Using a basic CRM or spreadsheet to stay on top of follow-ups.
How to automate reminders so you never forget to reply.

Booking Without the Back-and-Forth
How to let customers book jobs or quotes online, even outside work hours.
Tools to sync bookings with your calendar automatically.
Why offering easy booking options can double your conversion rates.

Boosting Your Online Presence
Making Google Reviews work for you — and how to get them without pestering.
Setting up a simple “digital business card” (or Quickr app) for instant credibility.
Quick wins on Facebook & Instagram that take 10 minutes a week.

Following Up Like a Pro
The 3-day rule for follow-ups — and why it secures more jobs.
Automating polite reminders for quotes and overdue invoices.
Staying front-of-mind without being pushy.

Why It’s Impactful for 2026

Customers expect fast, simple communication — these tools make it effortless.
You can compete with bigger companies without hiring extra staff.
Every strategy here is low-cost or free, and takes less than 1 hour to set up.

This event is free, with an Open Bar & Nibbles provided by the Stokes Valley Rugby Club.

Registration for the event is recommended so we can determine numbers.
label: Business & Networking

Monk and munchies, Monk & Munchies is where plant-based eats meet meaningful conversation.

We’ve got mantra music to set the vibe, a live Q&A with Chaitanya Charan on Living Spirituality, and a plant-based dinner. Think stuffed-crust pizza, wedges, Hawaiian skewers, fresh salad, topped off with chocolate mudcake with ice cream and mocktails!


We’re super stoked to host Chaitanya Charan in Wellington! He’s a monk, global speaker, and author of over 25 books, and has shared his insights at top universities like Yale and Princeton, as well as companies including Microsoft and Intel. What really sets him apart is how practical and relatable his wisdom is—making timeless teachings easy to apply to everyday life. Take this chance to meet a monk in person and hear his insights firsthand!
Good food, live beats, and insights that will leave you with something to think about.

description:
Palmistry: Exploring Planetary Energies, Palmistry: Exploring Planetary Energies
Learn the art of palmistry and enjoy a plant-based dinner afterwards - all included in your ticket!
In this workshop, we’ll explore how the mounts of your hand reveal the influence of different planetary energies, such as Jupiter’s connection to ambition and Saturn’s role in discipline. Each mount reflects unique qualities and patterns of behaviour, offering insight into your personal traits and how you navigate challenges.
By the end of the session, you’ll have a good understanding of how these planetary energies can be identified and interpreted in your own hands. You’ll leave with practical tools to start reading these energies, providing a deeper appreciation for how planetary forces shape different aspects of your life
Whether you're new to palmistry or looking to broaden your knowledge, this workshop will offer valuable insights into the planetary dimension of palm reading.
Plant-based dinner included in your ticket!

description:
Pastor From Gaza, St John’s is collaborating with Central Baptist to host this Pastor from Gaza, as he shares about being the Church amidst conflict.
Born and raised in Gaza, he now ministers across the Gaza and Middle East, providing pastoral support and practical aid to persecuted Christians, refugees, orphans, and widows.
This tour is not political—it is about the Body of Christ. The Pastor will share his own testimony, speak to the ongoing challenges faced by Christians in Gaza, and highlight his wider ministry in the Middle East. It is a message of hope, forgiveness, and perseverance—one that will challenge the Church in Aotearoa.
This event is to raise awareness of the spiritual and practical needs of believers in Gaza and the Middle East, as well as invite us to give in support of his ministry, with funds going directly to help persecuted Christians with food, shelter, and outreach.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description:
Sound Bath Experience: Ngā Wā o te Tau, Sound Bath Experience: Ngā Wā o te Tau

Experience Sound Bath Experience: Ngā Wā o te Tau, a journey through the seasons inspired by the natural rhythms of Aotearoa. “Ngā Wā o te Tau” means “The Seasons,” and this sound bath, guided by Smita and Peter with the rich tones of taonga pūoro and waiata, invites reflection on the cycles of nature and our connection to the world around us.

This immersion takes you from winter’s stillness, through spring’s blossoms, summer’s warmth, and autumn’s release, attuning to the changing energies of each season. Unique sounds encourage reflection, connection, and inner calm, while gentle karakia and mindful intention weave the journey together, creating a meditative space to pause and breathe.

After the sound bath, enjoy a nourishing plant-based dinner and dessert included in your ticket — a wholesome way to close the evening in good company.

Meet your hosts & musicians, Smita & Peter, Smita (Ngāi Te Rangi) was born and raised in Aotearoa. From a young age she was drawn to music as a means for reflection and self-expression. During her music studies at university, she was introduced to taonga pūoro, and this sparked a personal journey of reconnection to te ao Māori and her own whakapapa. Following university, she lived in an ashram for several years where she was introduced to the wonderful practice of bhakti yoga. She now lives with her husband in the Wellington region, where they regularly participate in kirtan (mantra music meditation) at Bhakti Lounge.

Peter is Pākehā, with grandparents from England and Ireland, and has been on a four-year journey learning the art of taonga pūoro — the traditional Māori musical instruments of Aotearoa. Guided by the wisdom and generosity of expert makers and players, he has learned both to craft and to play these unique instruments. For Peter, taonga pūoro offer a way to connect deeply with sound, story, and the natural world, and he is excited to share their voices as part of this sound bath experience.

What’s on the menu?
Jackfruit Rendang

Satay Seitan Skewer

Gado Gado salad with peanut sauce

Rice

Banana cake with caramel sauce

Hot "chocolate"
label: Religion & Spirituality

description:
Sound Healing Experience with Claudio Escutia, Sound Healing Experience with Claudio Escutia
Immerse Yourself in a Journey of Sound & Stillness

Join us for a special evening of harmonizing pure sounds, inspiring music, and deep relaxation at our beautiful space. Let the transformative power of sound guide you into a state of peaceful awareness and inner connection.

- 5:00 PM – 7:00 PM, Saturday, 4th of October
- Investment: $49
- Book here: https://www.wellnessliving.com/rs/event/wild_wellbeing?k_class=100000004277

What to Expect
Give yourself the gift of stillness as you surrender to the healing vibrations of:
- Gongs • Tibetan & Crystal Singing Bowls
- Native American Flutes • Harmonium • Sitar & Esraj
- Bells • Mantra chanting • Sacred Silence

Claudio’s high-quality amplification ensures you *feel* the sound as much as you hear it, creating a fully immersive experience. Allow the waves of resonance to:
- Release physical, mental & emotional tension
- Guide you into deep meditation & heart-centered awareness
- Restore balance & invite inner peace

How to Prepare
- Bring a pillow, blanket, or anything to ensure comfort
- Come with an open heart and an intention (optional)
- Wear loose, cozy clothing

About Claudio Escutia
A 3rd-generation multinstrumentalist from Mexico City, Claudio’s journey spans classical guitar, jazz, and global spiritual traditions. Trained in Indian classical music and Tibetan sound healing (studied in Nepal and India), he brings over a decade of expertise as a Sound Healing practitioner. His music is a bridge between ancient wisdom and modern therapeutic soundscapes.

description:
Sound Journey - PALMERSTON NORTH, Sound Journey - PALMERSTON NORTH
This powerful experience is like a soundtrack that is crafted to go with your life.
Something between an ancient ceremony and a movie soundtrack.
Please bring a yoga mat, pillow and blanket. Be prepared to drop into a deep space.
Door sales will be available if there is space. Advanced booking is recommended.
Sika's Sound Journeys are truly unique. They are sonic explorations that feature didgeridoos, drums, flutes, voice and orchestral elements. A collection of foraged sounds from objects he has recorded in nature, add even more textures. Many of his sounds are completely unrecognisable and abstract. Immersed in this cocoon of abstract sound, we can find ourselves in the most surprising places in our mind. In this timeless realm, beyond the normal limitations of rational reality, anything is possible.
An epic adventure deep inside yourself.
Journey to worlds within worlds on incredible sound waves.
Sika creates a safe space to relax deeply and connect with our inner guidance. This Sound Journey begins and ends with a short guided visualisation.
There will be two journeys with an interval. Most people choose to lie down, so once again, please bring a yoga mat, pillow and blanket to get really comfortable.
A journal is also recommended.
label: Religion & Spirituality

Te Huarahi Passionfest, Te Huarahi: The Pathway of Faith + Justice
Te Huarahi Passionfest is a grassroots festival for young adults chasing after Jesus and justice in Aotearoa. It’s about camping under the stars, worship and kōrero, music and art, shared kai and whanaungatanga.
We want to form a new generation of Jesus-followers who care deeply about people and creation. Alongside you will be families and older adults who’ve walked this path for decades — cheering you on and sharing the journey.

description:
Sika Sound Journey, This powerful experience is like a soundtrack that is crafted to go with your life.

Something between an ancient ceremony and a movie soundtrack.

Please bring a yoga mat, pillow and blanket. Be prepared to drop into a deep space.

Door sales will be available if there is space. Advanced booking is recommended.

Sika's Sound Journeys are truly unique. They are sonic explorations that feature didgeridoos, drums, flutes, voice and orchestral elements. A collection of foraged sounds from objects he has recorded in nature, add even more textures. Many of his sounds are completely unrecognisable and abstract. Immersed in this cocoon of abstract sound, we can find ourselves in the most surprising places in our mind. In this timeless realm, beyond the normal limitations of rational reality, anything is possible.

An epic adventure deep inside yourself.

Journey to worlds within worlds on incredible sound waves.

Sika creates a safe space to relax deeply and connect with our inner guidance. This Sound Journey begins and ends with a short guided visualisation.

There will be two journeys with an interval. Most people choose to lie down, so once again, please bring a yoga mat, pillow and blanket to get really comfortable.

A journal is also recommended.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description:
Pebble - Love In Every City, Poems and Songs from the Road

After seasons of wandering through foreign cities, sharing songs with strangers, and capturing stories from the road. PEBBLE has spent the past few years on an open-ended journey: traveling across continents in search of the deepest stories, the wildest love, the purest expression of what it means to be human. From late-night train stations to hidden cafés, from sunlit rooftops to candlelit stages—PEBBLE has been gathering moments and melodies from everywhere he goes, transforming them into songs and poems that reflect a life lived wide open.

“Love in Every City” is the next chapter in that journey—a stripped-back, soul-forward performance that brings those stories home.
Backed by a vision to build a global movement of traveling artists who choose authenticity over perfection, connection over isolation, and creative ownership over compromise, PEBBLE’s work invites us to remember what we’re really here for: to live, to feel, to share.

This show is a moment of reflection and reconnection—
Join us for an intimate night of music, poetry, and storytelling at Moon in Newtown, Pōneke. A suitcase full of songs. A guitar by the table. A heart full of cities.

As always, free entry & all pizzas $15!
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Sound Healing Experience, Sound Healing Experience
Sound Healing Experience with Claudio Escutia

It’ll be a transcendent evening of Sacred Harmonic Sounds, where multi-instrumentalist Claudio Escutia will guide you through a deeply restorative sonic experience. Plus - there will be an amazing plant-based dinner & dessert included in your ticket!

Let the vibrations of Gongs, Crystal and Tibetan singing bowls, Native American flutes, and other ancient instruments wash over you—melting away tension, quieting the mind, and opening a doorway to inner stillness.

With Claudio’s masterful soundscapes, you’ll not only hear the music but feel it resonating through your body, inviting profound relaxation and a reconnection to your heart. No prior meditation or yoga experience is needed—just come as you are and let the sound carry you into a space of deep peace.

What to Bring?
Yoga mats, blankets & cushions are provided but you are also welcome to bring your own yoga mat and any extra cushions or any other comforts for the ultimate experience!

Why You Won’t Want to Miss This

A rare opportunity to experience Claudio’s unique fusion of world music traditions and healing sound

A deeply immersive, meditative experience—perfect for relaxation and renewal

Limited spaces

Meet Claudio Escutia, your host
Born into a musical family in Mexico City, Claudio’s lifelong passion for sound has taken him across the globe—from studying jazz in Montreal to mastering Tibetan singing bowls in Kathmandu. His music weaves together classical training, world instruments (Sitar, Esraj, Harmonium, and more), and a deep reverence for sound as medicine.

Ready to unwind and recharge through the magic of vibration?

Learn more or listen to Claudio’s music here:

SoundCloud Claudio Escutia
Instagram Claudio Escutia Yoga and Sound Healing (@claudio_yoga_sound_healing)
Facebook Claudio Escutia Yoga - Sound Healing- Music

description:
Wesley Huff | Leaders Lunch | Wellington, Wesley Huff | Leaders Lunch | Wellington
This September Wesley Huff is joining Thinking Matters for the Truth Matters Tour in Dunedin, Christchurch, Wellington and full-day Conference in Auckland.

While in Wellington, he will be doing his only Christian Leaders Lunch.

Proceedings
Doors will open 11:15 am
11:30 am - the event will begin with a short powhiri/mihi whakatau
11:50 am - Kai
12:20 pm - Wes will present his talk and do q and a
1:30 pm - Conclusion of event
About Wesley Huff
Wesley Huff was born in Multan, Pakistan, and spent a portion of his childhood in the Middle East. After being diagnosed with a rare neurological condition at the age of eleven that left him paralyzed from the waist down, Wes experienced a miraculous recovery for which the doctors themselves had no medical explanation. This experience, along with a great deal of study and soul searching in his later teen years, solidified his interest in faith and in engaging the beliefs and worldview perspectives of others. He spent his high school years in Northern Ontario and currently lives in Toronto, Canada, with his wife and three children.

Wesley is currently the Central Canada Director for Apologetics Canada and has been a guest on a variety of public platforms, from The Joe Rogan Experience and Piers Morgan Uncensored, to Apologia Radio and Daily Dose of Wisdom. He has participated in numerous public dialogues, debates, and interfaith events on issues of belief and religion globally.

He holds a BA in sociology from York University, a Masters of Theological Studies from Tyndale University, and is currently doing a PhD in New Testament at the University of Toronto’s Wycliffe College.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description:
Embody Your Flow - Reconnect to the wisdom of your menstrual cycle, Embody Your Flow - Reconnect to the wisdom of your menstrual cycle
Explore how to recognise your body’s rhythms, needs and strengths throughout your menstrual cycle, and discover supportive practices grounded in somatic and embodied awareness.

Attuning to the wisdom of the menstrual cycle offers a meaningful way to honour your natural rhythms, nurturing ease, creativity, and deeper connection.

This course is trauma-informed and inclusive. No prior somatics experience is necessary, and all who menstruate are welcome.

Amy Richards is a yoga teacher based in Pōneke, with a Certificate in MindBody Therapy. She is drawn to the ways intentional movement and embodied awareness can shape our inner experience and relationships. Grounded in a trauma-informed approach, her work invites exploration of connection with sensation and emotion through the body.

Her practice is influenced by Tantric Shaivism, contact improvisation, Open Floor dance, Hakomi somatic psychotherapy, Somatic Experiencing, Authentic Relating, and Nonviolent Communication.


Photo credit: Image by pikisuperstar on Freepik

description:
Oops! All Donkeys, Oops! All Donkeys
Directed by Christine Brooks

Make. Pull. Carry. Work. Repeat.

Donkeys! Are you not tired? Atomised and alienated? It’s time to lay down your burdens and join us at our retreat. Be among friends. Feel the cool gleam of the moon upon your ears. Find and then heal your inner donkey. A most rare vision awaits.

From the creator of Love Isthmus: Dystopia Edition (“a truly bizarre and apocalyptic hour of improv” - The Wellingtonista), Murder on a Boat (“really, really, really good” - Regional News), and The Solarpunk Archives (“creative antics that leave the audience howling with laughter” - Theatreview) comes this festival premiere of the show concept that came to the director in a dream.

As this show is improvised, we cannot guarantee the presence or absence of specific content or themes beyond what is in the description above. The show may contain mature themes and language, but not gratuitously. The show may contain voluntary audience interaction, such as giving a suggestion for a scene.

description:
simple animal, Wellington favourites simple animal are set to light up the stage with their signature mix of raw emotion, funky rhythms, and irresistible energy.

Featuring many Wellington musicians who have long been at the heart of the capital’s music scene, simple animal has roots in bands such as The Hulamen, funk outfit The Tombolas, and the Holidaymakers, best known for their chart-topping single ‘Sweet Lovers’.

Singer/songwriter John McDougall is joined by keyboard maestro John Niland, guitarist Steve Jessup, bassman Murray Costello, drummer Tim Robinson, and powerhouse vocalist Annie Ruddock, to draw on that influence with songs that span heartache, protest, love, and silliness, reflecting the wide, wild, and weird lives we live. They’ll also be revealing new tracks like ‘Things Are Looking Up,’ ‘Hate Is The Question – Love Is The Answer,’ and ‘I Love Whisky (And Whisky Loves Me).’
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Sound Healing Experience with Claudio at Pause Yoga 6th of December, Sound Healing Experience with Claudio at Pause Yoga 6th of December
Join us for this special evening of harmonising pure sounds, inspiring music and relaxation in the beautiful Pause Yoga studio in Eastbourne.
Give yourself a peaceful moment and space of quiet awareness. Discover the power of your own voice, mantra and silence working to find inner peace and contentment. Bring an intention, get comfortable and let the sound waves take over. Invite the sound to take you into a journey within, into your heart, to rest, to release physical, mental and emotional tension.

Surrender to the sound of Gong, Tibetan and Crystal Bowls, Native American flutes, Harmonium, Sitar ,Esraj, Bells etc..Claudio brings high quality amplification so you can feel the sound in your body and take into a immersive experience.

Feel free to bring a pillow and blanket to assure comfort.


About Claudio: Claudio is a 3rd generation Multinstrumentalist Musician from Mexico City now based in Wellington. Claudio comes from a musicians family he started playing music since very early years. When he finished music school as a classical guitarist he moved to Montreal, Canada and explored new genres such a Jazz, World Music, and Spiritual Music. Traveling he discovered Indian Music and the Yoga Tradition and they became a very important influence on his career and lifestyle, and allowed him to study Music and Yoga with teachers in Europe and Asia. He learnt to play the Tibetan Singing Bowls in Kathmandu Nepal and Varanasi India.He explored many instruments and music styles such as Classical Guitar, Sitar, Esraj, Bansuri, Harmonium, Flutes, Gongs and Voice.Claudio is an active Sound Healing practitioner and performer. He has been playing the Tibetan bowls for more than 10 years now.
label: Religion & Spirituality

The Coveted Team x

description:
Iron, Iron
By Rona Munro
Directed by Campbell Wright
27th August - 8th September
The Gryphon Theatre
Iron follows the rekindling of a relationship between Josie and her estranged mother Fay who is currently serving a life sentence for killing Josie's father. Josie seeks to understand the events that she barely has any memory of, while Fay attempts to live life vicariously through her. As the play develops, we discover how incarceration has affected all of the parties involved, including the prison guards.
The Cast
Faye - Karen Anslow
Josie - Ivana Palezevic
Guard 1 - James Bayliss
Guard 2 - Helen Mackenzie-Hughes

description:
Westpac Smarts: Go from asking to automating with AI, Many of us have tried asking questions of AI and seen the potential that this technology brings. But there’s a more important question being asked: Now what?

AI’s potential goes beyond being a Q&A tool. Businesses can use AI to start automating existing processes or remove seemingly endless admin jobs – the question now is how you make it happen.

In this second Westpac Smarts event on AI, John-Daniel Trask – founder of Raygun – will help you take the next step forward and explore how to start accelerating your business with AI automations and agents. This practical session will give you the key insights you need to know for streamlining your business.

1:15pm – Wrap-up

description:
It's in the Ballot-CDC-Thursday 4th September Production Day Pass-In-studio, Contestants of 'It's in the Bag' become political candidates in 'It's in the Ballot' Meet the Candidates.
Candidates choose a numbered box which has a question that has been submitted online by voters before the show.
It’s in the Ballot” is a community-led awareness and participation initiative. We aim to increase voter interest in the general and council elections nationally.
By using broadcasting and web-based technologies to deliver in-studio; online on Facebook, YouTube and Twitch; and edited as YouTube videos we aim to enable voters to make informed voting decisions.
This means you can send the weblink of the YouTube Video of your electorate show to your friends and whanau to encourage them to watch the show before they cast their votes.
Voting papers are sent to voters on Tuesday 9th September 2025 and must be delivered into a voting dropbox by 12pm Saturday 11th October 2025

description:
✨ Chiron: The Wise Centaur – Myth, Medicine, and Sky WELLINGTON, ✨ Chiron: The Wise Centaur – Myth, Medicine, and Sky
Discover the story of Chiron, the immortal centaur unlike any other: healer, teacher, prophet, and guide to heroes from Achilles to Asclepius. We’ll explore Chiron’s legendary skills in medicine, music, hunting, prophecy, and ethics, and why ancient storytellers remembered him as the gentlest of the centaurs.Follow the centaur’s path through your own chart in this astrological gathering of thought-provoking discussion, exploration and discovery.
About The Planet Mechanic (aka Sousa)
Sousa is the only New Zealand graduate of Kepler College of Astrological Arts & Sciences in the USA. With 30 years experience, she is a passionate and insightful interpreter of the signs and seasons of the sky. www.theplanetmechanic.co.nz
New to Astrology?
Consider taking the Crash Course in Astrology - a one day event of self-discovery studying the fundamentals of your astrology chart. This is available online, taught in small groups of ten or less participants. https://events.humanitix.com/crash-course-in-astrology-online

Social Animal, Created by Stephen Papps and Damon Andrews. Performed by Stephen Papps.

You can’t teach an old dog new tricks... can you? Biting satire and theatre wizardry fuse in a comically inventive roller-coaster about the fear of irrelevance and the healing power of an animal. Award-winning actor, writer, and solo performer, Stephen Papps, plays twelve characters with beguiling virtuosity, in this gloriously funny solo tour de force about a man who loses face in a desperate attempt to regain his relevance.

“It’s impressive for a performer to embody a big range of characters ... well-written and full of humorous insights and revelations ... glorious!” – Cate Prestige, Theatreview.

Audience care: Recommended for audiences aged 13+
