description:
A Dialogue with a Movements Catalyst (Wellington), Discover What God Is Doing in Movements Around the World
Join us for an inspiring session with Ryan A., missionary, church planter, and movements catalyst.
For the past ten years, Ryan and his family have served among unreached peoples in South Asia and Southeast Asia. In 2017, Ryan helped catalyze a church-planting movement that has since multiplied into 10,000+ churches and 100,000+ baptisms—and continues to grow rapidly.
Today, Ryan serves as a mentor to movement leaders across Asia, helping ordinary believers multiply disciples and churches. His experience spans both the unreached world and the urban Western context, giving him a unique perspective that speaks powerfully into the New Zealand setting.
Why Attend?
Ryan’s message directly addresses two urgent needs in New Zealand today:
Reaching our lost communities with the good news of Jesus.
Revitalizing overseas missions sending, which has significantly declined in recent years.
If you long to see disciples and churches multiply—both here and to the ends of the earth—this workshop is for you.

description:
Celebrate the Fabric, Exquisite pieces of needlework are on display and in use every day at Wellington Cathedral of
St Paul: beautifully decorated fabrics that hang at the front of the altars, spectacular robes and
stoles worn by priests at services, and fine linens used at every service of Holy Communion.

You’ll learn much about this remarkable fabric artistry when Jo Dixey talks to the Friends of
Wellington Cathedral of St Paul and guests on Wednesday, 24 September at 10.30 am.
Jo is an internationally regarded professional embroiderer who graduated from the Royal
School of Needlework and now lives permanently in New Zealand. She teaches, exhibits and sells
her work, as well as accepting commissions from churches, fashion designers and private
individuals. She has also had contracts from the film industry, working on the Disney film Mulan
and most recently on season 1 of Lord of the Rings TV series. Jo’s collection of embroidered
3D viruses, created during the 2020 Covid lockdown, are now on display in The Museum of
New Zealand Te Papa Tongarewa.

description:
Sound Healing Experience, Sound Healing Experience
Sound Healing Experience with Claudio Escutia

It’ll be a transcendent evening of Sacred Harmonic Sounds, where multi-instrumentalist Claudio Escutia will guide you through a deeply restorative sonic experience. Plus - there will be an amazing plant-based dinner & dessert included in your ticket!

Let the vibrations of Gongs, Crystal and Tibetan singing bowls, Native American flutes, and other ancient instruments wash over you—melting away tension, quieting the mind, and opening a doorway to inner stillness.

With Claudio’s masterful soundscapes, you’ll not only hear the music but feel it resonating through your body, inviting profound relaxation and a reconnection to your heart. No prior meditation or yoga experience is needed—just come as you are and let the sound carry you into a space of deep peace.

What to Bring?
Yoga mats, blankets & cushions are provided but you are also welcome to bring your own yoga mat and any extra cushions or any other comforts for the ultimate experience!

Why You Won’t Want to Miss This

A rare opportunity to experience Claudio’s unique fusion of world music traditions and healing sound

A deeply immersive, meditative experience—perfect for relaxation and renewal

Limited spaces

Meet Claudio Escutia, your host
Born into a musical family in Mexico City, Claudio’s lifelong passion for sound has taken him across the globe—from studying jazz in Montreal to mastering Tibetan singing bowls in Kathmandu. His music weaves together classical training, world instruments (Sitar, Esraj, Harmonium, and more), and a deep reverence for sound as medicine.

Ready to unwind and recharge through the magic of vibration?

Learn more or listen to Claudio’s music here:

SoundCloud Claudio Escutia
Instagram Claudio Escutia Yoga and Sound Healing (@claudio_yoga_sound_healing)
Facebook Claudio Escutia Yoga - Sound Healing- Music

Discover the story of Chiron, the immortal centaur unlike any other: healer, teacher, prophet, and guide to heroes from Achilles to Asclepius. We’ll explore Chiron’s legendary skills in medicine, music, hunting, prophecy, and ethics, and why ancient storytellers remembered him as the gentlest of the centaurs.Follow the centaur’s path through your own chart in this astrological gathering of thought-provoking discussion, exploration and discovery.
About The Planet Mechanic (aka Sousa)
Sousa is the only New Zealand graduate of Kepler College of Astrological Arts & Sciences in the USA. With 30 years experience, she is a passionate and insightful interpreter of the signs and seasons of the sky. www.theplanetmechanic.co.nz
New to Astrology?
Consider taking the Crash Course in Astrology - a one day event of self-discovery studying the fundamentals of your astrology chart. This is available online, taught in small groups of ten or less participants. https://events.humanitix.com/crash-course-in-astrology-online

description:
Paint and Wine Night in Wellington - Magical Dragonflies, The concept is simple - take a brush in one hand, a drink in the other and let’s paint a masterpiece!

Join us for a creative night of drinking and painting in the heart of Wellington! No previous painting experience necessary. Get your creative juices flowing and your brush strokes going!

Drinks: NO DRINKS are included in the ticket price, but drinks are available for purchase.

Food: A delicious menu will be available to purchase throughout the event.

What is Paintvine?
It’s a fun social painting class where our artists will run you through step-by-step instructions on how to create your very own masterpiece in a fun and relaxed bar setting. Perfect for dates, catching up with mates or for meeting new friends!

We provide all the materials you need (high-quality canvas, acrylic paint, brushes). All you need to bring is your creative spirit (or find some at the bottom of a glass). At the end of the night you will leave with your own painting ready to hang up on your wall.

For tickets, future events, FAQs and more info head to the Paintvine website.

Bell Ringing Open Day, Join us for an exclusive open day in the bell tower of Wellington Cathedral of St Paul, to uncover its unique history and see the bellringers come out to play.

Discover the secret world of bells and bellringing, something the public doesn't normally get to see. You may have never known that people are pulling on the ropes to make the bells ring!

Please take a tour through our ringing room and belfry, and see our 140-year-old bells up close. You will have a chance to watch the ringers in action, and maybe even have a go at chiming our 1500kg tenor bell, the largest swinging bell in New Zealand!

What are you waiting for? You needn't fear a long climb as we are one of only a handful of towers to boast a lift to the ringing area!

We’ll provide you with music for the evening. Meet our fun and creative Music Director Jonathan Berkahn and talented pianist Phillip O’Malley plus our friendly choir, for an enjoyable evening of singing.

We start the evening with our vocal warm ups at 7.15pm, sing beautiful music together, stop for a delicious supper half way through, then continue singing until 9.15pm. If you would like to return, you can join us for up to four free visits. After that time, you can decide whether you would like to join Hutt City Chorale as a member.

description:
Book Group: Uncle Tom's Cabin by Harriet Beecher Stowe, Do you keep meaning to read more of the great classics of literature? At Wellington Classic Literature Group we read novels that have stood the test of time, whether they were written in 1780, 1880 or even 1980. The group has been running for more than a decade and we have a great bunch of regulars as well as readers that come along for particular books or simply when it suits. We meet on the first Tuesday of the month.

Our October book is Harriet Beecher Stowe's 1852 abolitionist novel Uncle Tom's Cabin; or, Life Among the Lowly. The work changed American hearts and minds about slavery.

The influence of Uncle Tom's Cabin was so immense that the story arose that when Abraham Lincoln welcomed Stowe to the White House during the American Civil War he reportedly declared, "So this is the little lady who started this great war."

In the US, it was the best-selling novel of the 19th century and the second best-selling book of all after the Bible.

Project Gutenberg link for those e-reading:
https://www.gutenberg.org/ebooks/203

VENUE
We meet in the ‘Games Room’, The Library bar's private area overlooking Courtenay Place. After you enter the bar, head to your right (up the step) and through a smaller space with booths to the large carpeted space beyond.

description:
Unity Book Club October 2025 | Cursed Daughters, About the book: 
No man will call your house his home. And if they try, they will not have peace...

So goes the family curse, long handed down from generation to generation, ruining families and breaking hearts. And now it's Eniiyi's turn - who, due to her uncanny resemblance to her dead aunt, Monife, is already used to her family's strange beliefs, as well as their insistence that she is a reincarnation. Still, when she falls in love with the handsome boy she saves from drowning, she can no longer run from her family's history. Is she destined to live out the habitual story of love and heartbreak, or can she escape the family curse and the mysterious fate that befell her aunt?

Melissa and Eden will be hosting our monthly book club to discuss some of the excellent recently released books.

In October we will be discussing Cursed Daughters by Oyinkan Braithwaite.

We have limited tickets available so grab a ticket sooner rather then later and tell your friends and whānau.

Book Group: Heart of A Dog By Mikhail Bulgakov, Wellington Classic Literature Group meets on the first Tuesday of the month. We read novels that have stood the test of time, whether they were written in 1780, 1880 or even 1980. It's a public group so feel free to come along when it suits.

Our September book is Heart of a Dog (or A Dog's Heart), a 1925 novel by Mikhail Bulgakov, described as a biting satire of Bolshevism. The book wasn't officially published in the Soviet Union until 1987.

Our group very much enjoyed Bulgakov's masterpiece The Master and Margarita back in 2018, so looking forward to reading another of his works...

description:
Ōtari Glow Worm Tour, Ōtari Glow Worm Tour
Take a guided night tour through Ōtari-Wilton’s Bush and discover some of the fascinating night-time residents on your way to see the titiwai/glowworms. Enjoy the tranquil beauty of the bush after dark and witness the magical glow of these unique creatures.

This outdoor night-time tour takes just over an hour.
If bringing children, we find it most suitable for those aged 5 years and older.
The tour requires a moderate level of fitness, the route includes numerous steps to and from the glowworms.

Meet at the Ōtari Visitors Centre, 150 Wilton Road. Bring warm clothes, walking shoes, and a torch.

This tour is operated by the Ōtari-Wilton’s Bush Trust. Join the Trust from just $20 a year and the glow worm tour is free, plus you’ll be supporting the amazing work the Trust does. Join today at owbt.nz/membership-donations/

Glow Worm Tour Ticket Refund Policy
• No Refunds: We do not offer refunds for Glow Worm Tour tickets.
• Ticket Transfers: If you can’t attend your booked tour, we will put you on a future tour, subject to availability. Please contact us as soon as possible to arrange this.
• Weather Conditions: Tours operate rain or shine. In the event of extreme weather or unsafe conditions, we will reschedule your tour or provide a refund.

For any changes or inquiries, please get in touch with us in advance at or call 04 499 1400.

description:
Dance Night - OUT HOUSE #1: Benny Salvador / Class War on the Dance Floor / UMU, Get yr dancing shoes on and come on down for the first instalment of OUT HOUSE, Pyramid Club's new, semi-irregular dance night showcasing the work of local creative musicians and producers. Skipping along the intersection of dance music and experimental sounds, Out House aims to get your feet moving, your body shaking and your brain waves oscillating. We are kicking things off with three exciting acts, Benny Salvador, Class war on the Dance Floor and Riki Gooch and Daniel Beban's new duo UMU.
---
One of the most exciting young talents in his home country's revitalised dance music underground, Benny Salvador is a DJ, multi-instrumentalist and producer from Wellington whose music finds common threads between house, techno, electro, disco-funk, dub, boogie and beyond.
---
Class War on the Dance Floor is solo project of Pōneke musician, Marika Pratley. A tapestry of vaporwave, chiptune, ambient, lo-fi, retro synthwave and hip hop. Marika is inspired by artists from Wendy Carlos to Peaches, Eno to Merzbow.
---
UMU is a duo of Riki Gooch and Daniel Beban. Silver Apples meets Kuduro with Riki's deep grooves played on an 80s Roland electronic drum kit which are manipulated and dubbed out by Dan on two Tama Techstar drum synths.
$17.50 presales available via UTR
Special thanks to CNZ for supporting Pyramid Club's programme

description:
The King's Singers, C L O S E H A R M O N Y
For over half a century, The King’s Singers have been synonymous with impeccable blend, radiant tone, and joyful music-making. Formed in 1968 by six choral scholars from King’s College, Cambridge, the group quickly earned an international reputation for their unique approach to “close harmony” — a seamless weaving of voices across centuries and styles. Today, their performances continue to enchant audiences from London to Los Angeles, and now, back in Aotearoa.
This bespoke programme, created especially for their March 2026 tour, offers a journey through The King’s Singers’ remarkable musical history. Beginning with their earliest repertoire from the late 1960s, the evening will move through Renaissance sacred music, English folksong, jazz standards, pop classics, and contemporary works. Expect Byrd alongside Billy Joel, madrigals alongside The Beach Boys, Disney magic alongside dazzling new arrangements from the songwriters of today.
The concert also carries a special significance — it will be one of the final New Zealand appearances for long-standing baritone Chris Bruerton. A proud Kiwi, Chris has been a cornerstone of The King’s Singers for over a decade, touring the world and helping shape their modern sound. His farewell tour offers Wellington audiences a rare chance to celebrate his artistry on home soil.
A highlight of the night will be the “Something Borrowed” segment, where the ensemble will present a pair of songs chosen especially for Wellington — a personal gift to the local audience, performed in their signature style.
With wit, warmth, and unparalleled musicianship, The King’s Singers promise an evening that is both a celebration of their legacy and a showcase of their continuing innovation. Whether you’ve followed their journey for decades or are hearing them for the first time, Close Harmony at Wellington Cathedral will be a night to remember.

Hailing from Portland Oregon, The Decemberists is an indie-alt folk rock band that write epic songs and have 9 studio albums to their credit. They are renowned for their musical style and unique storytelling with many song lyrics based on historical incidents and folklore. Perhaps drawing musical influence from the likes of The Beatles, Tom Waits, REM, Morrisey, their songs are exquisitely constructed and effortlessly combine folk-rock with elements of pop creating the infectious sound that is The Decemberists.
And who is BANDIT QUEEN? Experienced Christchurch based musos - Tim Kent (vocals, acoustic guitar); Justin 'Rusty' White (lead guitar); Jo-Anne Davern Fuller (vocals, keyboard); Chiara Lowe (violin, vocals); Adam Lowe (bass); Mark Newburn (drums, percussion).
The members of BANDIT QUEEN are passionate about this project and invite you to come experience and enjoy the eclectic music of USA indie-rock band THE DECEMBERISTS.

description:
Techno Taster, Techno Taster
This year for the first of our annual pre-parties we’ve gone around the country to gather a lineup of creators working at the intersections of techno, delving into influences from bass, breaks, psychedelia, club music and beyond, all underpinned by elements of dance music's most enduring genre.

We believe each one of these acts is currently pushing the needle forward for underground club culture in Aotearoa, and are thrilled to host them all together at Valhalla to push their vision across the almighty Third Eye Hi-Fi soundsystem.


ELI HØFF — Abyssal Soundworks / PHTM

Producer and DJ, Eli is undoubtedly at the forefront of Aotearoa’s underground dance scene.
Those who have kept their ears tuned to the innovative underground have no doubt stumbled upon the tribalistic, psychedelic, and focused sounds emanating from the mind of Auckland-based producer Eli Høff. With a string of releases on Berlin-based PHTM, Tāmaki Makaurau-based Gypnotica, and an impressive catalog of self-releases, he consistently showcases his singular and original interpretation of dance music.

Instagram.com/e.li
elihoff.bandcamp.com
abyssalsoundworks.bandcamp.com


HUNTER — Hang the Saints / Haven

Raised in Kaikōura, Aotearoa, Hunter's dark and atmospheric sound often contrasts the beautiful environment she grew up in. Her direct approach to techno draws influence from heavy percussion, bold rhythm and industrial soundscapes. After spending two years finding inspiration in clubs overseas, she has returned to Ōtautahi with a refined style that’s ready to make people dance. As the co-founder of “Hang The Saints” and resident of “Haven”, Hunter is all about creating safe, inclusive spaces for people to connect through the music she loves.

https://www.instagram.com/sspoonsnake/
https://soundcloud.com/hunter-mccrory-334790608
https://on.soundcloud.com/bC3qeA6pUxBoMo7P9


LUDUS & RIZZO — Tonic Collective

Tonic Collective is the recent endeavour of Ludus and Rizzo, inspired by the people, places and spaces of their experience touring China with BIRDPARTY and Vera Ellen. Both acts are individually known for their versatile and innovative sound, bringing a wide range of influences and inspirations to the dancefloor. In the short time since establishing the collective, they’ve already hosted Kaishandao and Bone Chapel, established a space, and debuted a monthly radio show on Mouthfull that explores sound from across the genre spectrum, both in the club and out.

https://www.instagram.com/ludus.etc/
https://www.instagram.com/alicerizzoofficial
https://www.instagram.com/tonic.collective/
https://soundcloud.com/l-s-rizzo/416life-support-cl1n1c-chengdu
https://soundcloud.com/racquetclub-info/mix-series-016-ludus


SHLI — Echo Train Records / Warehouse Rave / Holding Hands

Shli is the alias of Ōtautahi-via-Pōneke DJ and Producer Tim Ward. Steadily releasing works over recent years through local labels like Echo Train and the Big Fresh Collective, he is carving out a sound of his own.

Stitching together infectious rhythms layered over low-end pressure, Shli’s sets draw influence from across the hardcore continuum and beyond. Creating dancefloor moments from trippy rhythmic states to unleashing sheer bass weight.

description:
The Grogans - 'Stagger' Tour NZ 2025 | Wellington, The Grogans - 'Stagger' Tour NZ 2025 | Wellington
Ready to take these new tracks on the road, The Grogans new album Stagger is out, plus the band are excited to announce a headline tour across New Zealand. Exploring another side of The Grogans' music, Stagger is a patchwork of different sounds and sonic inspirations that all come together in the one album, "it came from this idea that it was a jagged and stylistically different album track to track", explain The Grogans.
Kicking off their tour at Loons in Christchurch on Wednesday 3 September, the band then head to Yonder in Queenstown on Thursday 4 September, San Fran in Wellington on Friday 5 September before wrapping up at Double Whammy Auckland on Saturday 6 September. Prior to their Aotearoa dates, the trio will also be playing a seven date tour throughout Australia along with stops in LA and New York for North American shows this June.

Capturing the magnetic energy of their live shows, Stagger touches on themes of mental health, taking care of yourself and your loved ones, the occasional love song, and more. As the catchy chorus first single and album opener ‘Oh Boy’ leads into
sonic powerhouse of a tune ‘Come Up (Goes Down)’, ‘In My Heart’ slows it down to a new easy listening direction, followed by ‘Have a Little Dream’ - as dreamy as the title suggests - and the big open echoed instrumentation of ‘Once In A While’. Adding new textural effects in ‘Roll Back’ and last single ‘Roundabout’, ‘Happier Man’ dips into a heavier psych realm with a reminder that "striving to be a better and happier person should be a goal for everyone." ‘Worry About Everything’ is an upbeat tune sure to have you worrying about nothing, and feel good album closer ‘All My Days’ ends on a more serious note that outlines the beauty and the beast of live music and the personal struggles that come with the lifestyle and touring.

Tickets go on sale 12pm, Wednesday 28 May.

description:
Elton John vs Billy Joel *NZ Tribute* Petone Club, NZ’s Award-winning hit tribute show “Elton John vs. Billy Joel” are coming to perform an intimate show at the Petone Club Udy Street as part of their NZ-WIDE TOUR!

Doors 7pm , show starts 7.30pm sharp

After wildly successful sell-out shows across New Zealand, join Cam and Sam for an intimate night out as they wow audiences both young and old performing the greatest hits of Elton John and Billy Joel LIVE! Piano Man, Rocket Man, Uptown Girl, Goodbye Yellow Brick Road, We didn’t start the fire, Bennie and the Jets, She’s always a woman, Crocodile Rock and many many more.

Your favourite Elton and Billy songs are in safe hands with Cam and Sam, these professional touring NZ musicians have performed on live national television, commercial radio and featured in the NZ Music Charts in careers spanning two decades. This amazing Piano Man extravaganza features astonishing costumes, two grand pianos in black and white, plus plenty of banter and all the songs you love.

Let's face it, Elton John and Billy Joel require little introduction, their music has provided a soundtrack for generations of loving fans. Englishman Sir Elton John has sold over 300 million records, making him one of the best-selling music artists of all time. He has more than fifty Top 40 hits on the UK Singles Chart and US Billboard Hot 100, including seven number-ones in the UK and nine in the US, as well as seven consecutive number-one albums in the US.

American Billy Joel has sold more than 150 million records and ranks as one of the most popular recording artists and respected entertainers in the world. Joel has had 33 Top 40 hits and 23 Grammy nominations. In 1999 he was inducted into the Rock & Roll Hall of Fame and has received the Recording Industry Association of America Diamond Award, presented for albums that have sold over 10 million copies.

description:
Wendyhouse / DSLB / vegetable.machine.animal, Wendyhouse / DSLB / vegetable.machine.animal
Wendyhouse are Bryce Galloway and Daniel Powell (AKA Mr Pudding and EE monk). The pair met at the Elam School of Fine Arts. Wendyhouse got their name from debut performances at Art Space (Tāmaki Makaurau) where they sang songs set in the year 2032 from inside a Wendy house (Soundwatch ’92). A prolific creative period followed before EE monk relocated to Europe in 1995. Wendyhouse output has been somewhat sporadic ever since, but with EE monk’s recent return, the pair have returned to performing live.

Wendyhouse music was initially played on toy musical instruments, the kind that fit inside a Wendy house. Real instruments were added as the band moved out of the house and onto the stage.

The music is best described as lo fi inverted pop music, with lyrics about unlikely topics. For example, the two newest songs in the Wendyhouse are an existential treatise on real estate and a love/hate ode to Futurist Luigi Russolo. Guitar, toy keyboard and vocals are the Wendyhouse instruments of choice.

---


DSLB

DSLB is the solo project of Chrissie Butler (the shouty bass playing half of the now sleeping duo, mr sterile Assembly). An offshoot from Chrissie's other band Ditzy Squall, DSLB (Ditzy Squall's Lunch Box) is a showcase for a love of long endings and the hum things make when you hold them close to your ear. Performed live, DSLB is an improvised mash-up of ancient record players, purring keyboards, kitchen utensils and found objects. Soundtracks for short films and hand drawn comics are also residents in the lunch box. Recordings are released by skirted Records.

https://skirtedrecords.com/dslb/

---

vegetable.machine.animal

New solo project courtesy of Mr Sterile, in which living fungal and plantlife inform a modular synthesiser with biofeedback. This signal acts upon the synth changing the pitch, tone, rate and more in the delivery of sound. These ‘curated’ sounds are then responded to with percussion. VMA explores the intersections between spontaneous playing, electronic music, and science-informed inter-species collaboration.

https://mrsterileassembly.bandcamp.com/album/my-daughter-the-spider


$17.50 presales available via UTR

Special thanks to CNZ for supporting Pyramid Club's programme
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Original Sin (UK) | Wellington, Original Sin (UK) | Wellington
FULL TIME SENDERS & JUICED UP PRESENT: ORIGINAL SIN - SATURDAY 20 SEPTEMBER | EVA, WELLINGTON


The jump-up king himself touches down in Wellington for the very first time. From tearing up the UK underground as one half of G Dub alongside Sub Zero, to unleashing solo anthems like Don’t Be Silly, Haunted and DNB Forever (Soz Nan), Original Sin has carved his name into the core of drum & bass.


With releases on RAM, Playaz, Souped Up, Crucast and Elevate, his sound is heavy, high-energy, and built for chaos. Having torn through festivals like Let It Roll and Boomtown, it’s finally Wellington’s turn to feel the full force of his basslines.


This one’s gonna be nasty. Backing him up is a stacked local roster, keeping the energy high from doors to close:


🎧 Molly (AKL) & Gusty
🎧 Procy (TIU) & Nos (TGA) + HP
🎧 Storm & Scholten
🎧 Freeman x Chano
🎧 Dkav
🎧 Stems


––––––––––––––––––


Welly… brace yourself. 👀
label: Music & Concerts

description:
CMNZ Series Four Last Songs, Composed in the year before his passing, the 'Four Last Songs' are held by many to be Richard Strauss’ most beautiful, sensuous, and moving composition. They are songs of farewell and of gentle heartbreak. The words of the final song, 'Im Abendrot', speak of an elderly couple walking hand in hand, at rest from their wanderings, away from life. The final verse:

O weiter, stiller Friede! O vast and silent peace!
So tief im Abendrot So deep in sunset glow,
Wie sind wir wandermüde- How weary we are with wandering-
Ist dies etwa der Tod? Could this perhaps be death?

For this special premiere performance, Salina Fisher has arranged the 'Four Last Songs' for NZTrio and celebrated Australian soprano Emma Pearson.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Liam Cooper’s King of the Keys, He’s a modern-day piano man singing the songs of famous piano men. Australian Liam Cooper intends to thrill an audience at The Opera House with a concert of famous songs. In Liam Cooper’s show King of the Keys, the entertainer will celebrate the music of Elton John, Peter Allen, Billy Joel, Stevie Wonder, Freddie Mercury, Ray Charles, and more. A killer live band will help him negotiate a nostalgic catalogue of 40 classic songs from 15 musical legends. 
Along with faithful renditions of many songs, Liam will captivate you with the stories behind them. Learn about who Paul McCartney wrote ‘Let It Be’ for, and what Elton John’s ‘Bennie & The Jets’ satirises. You’ll get a new appreciation for the songs that have become anthems for generations. 
In a final twist, the audience gets to choose how the show ends. You’ll be able to use your phone to vote live in the theatre. Decide who is the one true ‘King of the Keys’ to influence the show’s unique conclusion.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
The Racket Lounge: Session Four, Grab a spot on our couch and enjoy the noise at The Racket Lounge, a chill classical music series featuring up-and-coming Pōneke classical and jazz musicians.

Last year the NZSQ Trust launched the Racket Lounge, a concert series for classical and jazz musicians with experience ranging from students to pros to freely express their creativity in a non-traditional concert setting. It was a huge success, with over 250 audience members and 52 artists over our four sessions. Audiences were raving about the musical variety and great talent they found at the Racket Lounge, and as one audience member commented; “Well done…do it again!” So, we listened, and the Racket Lounge is back for round two! Once again hosted at Bedlam & Squalor (above the Rogue & Vagabond), we welcome audiences, composers and performers back for another four concerts full of innovative, fun, and chill music. From classical to pop covers, video game soundtracks to original compositions, there's something for everyone to sink their teeth into at The Racket Lounge!

Even if you've never been to a classical music concert before, this one is for you. With a 'Choose your price' model you can afford to give it a go - and you might even find something you like!

A Flexible Price, So You Can Take A Chance on Something New:
Our prices range from $5 to $100, just pick the ticket price you feel like paying. At The Racket Lounge, we believe everyone should have access to high-quality but affordable art. If you're a bit strapped for cash right now, but still want a good night out, no worries! Just book yourself a $5 ticket! If you can afford to pay a little more and want to do some good for your community, then pick one of our higher ticket prices and rest assured that your dollars are going towards funding great, accessible art in your city.

All proceeds from ticket sales will go directly into presenting the next Racket Lounge, including paying musicians and artists, hiring instruments and marketing costs. Plus, by choosing a higher price point, you're ensuring that we're able to continue to offer tickets at a lower price point for those who need it.

Please note: Bedlam & Squalor is a licenced venue, so under 18s must be accompanied by a parent or legal guardian. Everyone must bring ID.
Supported by Wellington City Council.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
AWE Partnership Masterclass for Violists and Violinists with Yura Lee, Join us for a Masterclass!
As part of our 2025 partnership with At the World’s Edge Festival, Orchestra Wellington will host AWE 2025 Festival Artist Yura Lee to present a masterclass for violinists and violists in Wellington.
Anyone can register to attend and observe the masterclass!
Visit https://orchestrawellington.co.nz/event/awe-masterclass-2025 to register to attend and observe the masterclass for FREE!
Violinist/violist Yura Lee is a multifaceted musician, as a soloist and as a chamber musician, and one of the very few that is equally virtuosic on both violin and viola. Her career spans three decades and takes her all over the world, captivating audiences through various musical mediums from baroque to modern, and enjoying a career that spans three decades and takes her all over the world. She has performed with major orchestras including those of New York, Chicago, Baltimore, Cleveland, San Francisco, Los Angeles, and given recitals in London’s Wigmore Hall, Vienna’s Musikverein, Salzburg’s Mozarteum, the Palais des BeauxArts in Brussels, and the Concertgebouw in Amsterdam.
At age 12, she became the youngest artist ever to receive the Debut Artist of the Year prize at the Performance Today awards given by National Public Radio. She is the recipient of a 2007 Avery Fisher Career Grant; she has received numerous other international prizes, including top prizes in the Mozart, Indianapolis, Hannover, Kreisler, Bashmet, and Paganini competitions. Yura Lee was the only first prize winner awarded across four categories at the 2013 ARD Competition in Germany.
An Incredible Partnership with At The World's Edge Festival!
As part of our 2025 partnership with At the World’s Edge (AWE) Festival, Orchestra Wellington is presenting a three-part series featuring AWE 2025 Festival Artist Yura Lee and AWE Artistic Director Benjamin Baker for a mini-series of concerts and a masterclass here in Wellington in addition to featuring these incredible artists' live performances with us on our subscription series concerts in September and October!

description:
Soundscape Series: Rameka Tamaki, People can expect a level of artistry and mastery over the guitar. Rameka will be playing a selection of Classical Guitar pieces which include places like Spain, Japan, South America, and also his own compositions. These will range from Baroque, to Romantic, and Modern, with elements of different genres that encompass different cultures and time periods from around the world.

Rameka Tamaki (Tūhoe, Maniapoto, Samoan, Tongan, Irish) is a Classical Guitarist from Aotearoa, New Zealand who has performed in festivals and shows around the world. With a passion for the guitar and Māori culture he completed his Bachelor of Music with First Class Honours at The New Zealand School of Music, Victoria University. His performances include ASIA Topa, The New Zealand Opera Company, Performance Space at Carriageworks Sydney, the Matariki Ahi Kā Festival, Gardens Magic, and Los Angeles for Kapa Haka.

About the Mostly Music Soundscape Series

A curated series of intimate live music experiences showcasing the depth, texture and emotion of sound. Each performance invites you to immerse yourself in a new soundscape, informed by genre, sonic craft, and music as an art form. Designed for music lovers who want more than a background soundtrack, this series celebrates live performance with a diverse range of acclaimed performers.

Saturday 21 June — Nick Granville Trio

Saturday 26 July — Seth Boy Trio

Saturday 30 August — Michelle Velvin Harpist

Saturday 20 September — The Weather Machine

Saturday 27 September — Rameka Tamaki

Saturday 25 October — Danica Bryant

Doors 7:30pm, with events starting at 8pm. Each event will be 60—90 minutes in two sets.

These events will take place inside at The Bond Store, Paraparaumu and are seated with general admission.

The Bond Store is located at 21 Birmingham Street, Paraparaumu. It operates as The Tasting Room which serves food and beverages.

Access information: The New Zealand Portrait Gallery is an accessible venue, all on one level. There is an accessible wharepaku (toilet) at the back of the venue. The gallery has automatic sliding doors and glass doors that can be pushed or pulled to enter. We have a wheelchair available for use within the gallery, and there is low stool seating throughout. Woodblock Artwork + Mixed Media

description:
Jewellery Making In 4 Weeks - Sunday Afternoons, This inspiring Sunday afternoon jewellery blocks are the best way for beginners to get into jewellery making in a lively, warm and friendly environment! The course starts on Sun 2 November and runs for 4 weeks until Sun 23 November, 2pm-5pm.

Beginners will practice the basic techniques in copper or brass and then move on quickly to working in silver. An excellent first project for beginners in this class is to create a simple textured ring band - but once you have the basics down, it is fun to create earrings, pendants or other simple items.

Learning to cut, heat, form and texture metal - to solder using a jeweller's torch and silver solder, and finally to polish your work up to a beautiful finish: these classes are super satisfying.

These blocks are also a great way for existing students or more advanced makers to join into a class in our well-equipped warm and bright studio!

Basic materials are supplied and there are extra materials available to purchase as you need in class.

description:
Cheers Dad! Pottery, Paint & a Pint!, We're excited to bring you a Father's Day pottery painting event in collaboration with the finest brewery on the coast, Duncan's!

Come along for an afternoon creative session of painting a piece of pottery for Dad - or with Dad, whilst sipping on your choice of brew. This is your opportunity to get sorted for Father's Day (Father's Day NZ is Sun 7th September).

Book a ticket for yourself, your family and your dad, enjoy a creative session altogether, each turning a mug or tumbler into work of Picasso. No family dramas just a fun old time.

If Dad can't make it, make him a custom gift. Bring along your partner or your beer loving bestie!

You will be guided through the process of painting (let's get our facts straight its actually underglaze not paint!) your Mug/Tumbler. Dad will treasure his custom made piece or you could make matching family mugs!

All materials supplied. 
This Pottery painting workshop is absolutely suitable for anyone...even the least creative people!

Ticket price includes:
Your own ceramic Mug/Tumbler ready for decorating 
One Beverage (Beer or non alcoholic)
All the materials needed
Guidance from me to create a piece Dad will treasure forever
1 Kiln firing ~ this makes the piece strong, shiny and food and drink safe

Please note: Your piece will be carefully taken back to my studio and glazed with a clear glaze, this will not only make it look profesh but will make it safe to use everyday.  You can then collect your finished piece from Duncan's the following Friday (05.09)

Disclaimer:

I will take every care with your finished piece but I can not be held responsible for cracks or glaze issues once fired...I'm afraid we put our trust in the kiln gods.

description:
Chess - Learn to Play, Chess – Learn to Play
Starting from the beginning you will discover how to play the 3000-year-old game of Chess. You will learn the principles that guide decision making in all parts of the game, learn algebraic notation and the ability to not only play a game anywhere, anytime, but also knowledge of where and how to play - both online and in person.

Description
Chess is an ancient game of strategy and analysis that hones concentration and focus, as you master the skills allowing you to win at this competitive recreation.

Join tutor, Ryan Hill to learn how to play this game from the beginning.

You will quickly go from understanding the basics to being able to engage in playing confidently and discover where to go for further training or to carry on playing – both in person and online.

Over 600 million people play this game that has remained popular throughout the ages – why don’t you become one of them!

Bring pen and paper to take notes.

By the end of this course you will be able to:

*Be able to use all of the chess pieces to play the game
*Be able to recount and use some of the most common openings and traps
*Recognise where to go for further training or to play
*Develop increasing levels of confidence in your ability to play and possibly win

Note: Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel. We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly. description:
Professor Brian Cox: Emergence, It’s a stage show that covers vast rivers of galaxies in the cosmos, the ecosystems of Earth, and the structure of the human brain. Emergence is the latest show by English physicist, presenter, and personality Professor Brian Cox. He takes to the stage at TSB Arena to contemplate the dazzling complexity of the universe and how it’s built on profoundly simple principles. 
Emergence is also a scientific history of 400 years of human discovery. How did we come to understand so much about the cosmos? Guided by mathematics, curiosity, and an aesthetic sense of symmetry, our species has begun to read the story of the Universe. We’ve started to carry our spacecraft to the edge of the solar system and outwards to the stars. Brian’s engaging style makes these questions come to life. The audience will be left awestruck and thrilled as the show covers vast topics in an accessible way. 
Brian has appeared in many landmark science programs for BBC radio and television over the last 15 years, from the Peabody Award-winning Wonders of the Solar System to the worldwide hit series The Planets. His previous touring show, Horizons, was performed to nearly half a million people across the world.

Draw it Out - Re-finding Your Spark, Guided drawings to re-find your spark and what it is that's driving you.

Join us for a DRAW IT OUT drawing for wellness workshop. Practice the ‘art’ of drawing and writing for wellness. This 1.5 hour workshop takes you through guided cues (similar to meditation or journaling) to draw out where you are at, draw out how you are feeling, and draw out your own inner guidance.

We all have the resources within to guide us, this workshop creates the space to access this by using a modality called Interactive Drawing Therapy. Facilitated by Lara Phillips, this is not therapy rather drawing for wellness; a guided workshop to build one’s relationship with oneself, to strengthen self-reflection and self-care.

No drawing skills required, this is more mark making not art making. Materials supplied.

description:
Māori, Christianity & the Spirit World — Public lecture by Bradford Haami, Māori, Christianity & the Spirit World — Public lecture by Bradford Haami
In lecture theatre 2 (GBLT2) in the Law School at Victoria University / Te Herenga Waka.

Ramsey Library presents a public lecture by Bradford Haami.

What happens when vastly different ways of being meet? Dame Anne Salmond writes of ‘competing cosmologies’ and ‘ontological collisions’ — European missionaries arriving in Aotearoa in the early 19th century brought a Biblical cosmology that began such a collision. In this public lecture Bradford Haami will explore the interactions between Biblical and Māori cultural and spiritual worldviews that continue to evolve up to the present.

* How do Biblical and Māori cultural and spiritual beliefs and thought relate?
* How 19th century rangatira negotiate between traditional beliefs and the Biblical narratives?
* Where do Christian and Māori ways of knowing and seeing clash, compete or enrich each other?
* What does being Māori and Christian look like today?


Bradford Haami (Ngāti Awa) is a Māori historian, researcher and author with research interests in Māori worldviews, spirituality, Christianity and cultural preservation. He is Pou Amorangi (Māori Director) at Laidlaw College in Auckland, New Zealand, where he lectures in biculturalism and sits on the governing board of the college. Haami has written several books on Māori history, culture and spirituality, with recent works including Urban Māori: The Second Great Migration (Oratia Media 2018) and Bringing Culture into Care (Huia 2019). He was the Māori curator/expert on the acclaimed Te Taiao / Nature exhibition at Te Papa Tongarewa Museum.

--
To browse the Ramsey Library catalogue, and sign up to borrow books (free), go to https://library.chaplaincyvuw.org.nz

Cost: $5 (cash only, please). or free for Friends.

This is part of the regular walks run by the Friends of the Wellington Botanic Garden, they run monthly throughout the year with a different topic every time.
Join the Friends for only $30 a year and all the walks will be free, as well as other great benefits.

description:
Wellington Foraging Workshop 14th September 2025, Wellington Foraging Workshop 14th September 2025
Join expert forager Felicity Joy of Wild Botanica for a comprehensive Wild Edible Weeds Foraging Workshop in the beautiful community gardens of Mount Victoria, Wellington.

This inspiring experience will open your eyes to the abundance of edible wild plants growing right under your nose.

We’ll unlock the secrets of foraging, connecting with the land, and turning humble "weeds" into delicious, nourishing food. You’ll gain confidence in identifying common edible plants, learn their botanical names, and understand their medicinal and nutritional benefits. We’ll also explore ethical foraging practices, how to spot toxic lookalikes, and share simple, practical ways to incorporate wild foods into your daily meals.

This isn’t just about food: it’s about sustainability, resilience, and reconnecting with the environment in a meaningful way. You'll leave with a deeper appreciation for the land, new skills to support local food security, and the knowledge to make your own simple meals from wild ingredients.

Class sizes are limited, so book early to secure your spot.
For more details and bookings, visit

www.wildbotanica.co.nz
follow @wild.botanica.nz on social media.

For questions, email .

Always wanted to capture the Milky Way but don't know where to start? Or you've tried and the results haven't been amazing?
We've designed this workshop for beginner astro photographers: to take you from zero astro knowledge to being able to capture at least one awesome astro photo to impress friends and family.
Wellington-based astro and landscape photographer Chris McKeown, and supported by Sony Advocate Rebecca McMillan, will guide you through what's required to plan, shoot, and process stunning images of the incredible night sky in Wellington.
We will start with an online introductory tutorial briefing on Sunday 17th August (evening), to discuss settings and camera gear, answer questions and confirm the meetup location for the Thursday evening workshop.
On Saturday 23 August we will meet from 7.30pm on Wellington's South Coast to capture the night sky. (A rain check date will be advised if required. The following evening we will host an online tutorial to demonstrate how to process your images, with time for Q&A.
We also have the opportunity to access Sony cameras for the workshop: please get in touch with the organisers at least two weeks ahead of the event if you would like to borrow gear for this workshop.
This is a ticketed workshop via Sony Scene.

description:
Pre order Thai foods, NEXT WEEK'S THAI COMFORT SPECIAL IS HERE!

Get ready for our Kin Favorite: Beef Mince Pad Kaprao with Fried Egg
!
This is the ultimate Thai street food classic, and here's why you need to pre-order:
Tender, savory beef mince is wok-tossed with a fiery, fragrant blend of fresh chilies, garlic, and aromatic fresh basil. The high heat of the wok creates a spicy-sweet, intensely savory glaze that is totally addictive.
Served hot over jasmine rice and crowned with a crispy-edged, runny-yolked fried egg. Break that yolk and mix it all together for a bite of pure happiness!
PLUS! Our signature Chicken or Tofu Satay is still on the menu for the perfect side.
Delivery Dates:
Dinner: Wednesday, October 8th
Lunch: Friday, October 10th
Order Cut-Off: Monday, October 6th, 9 PM
Pre-order now to secure your Thai feast!
#ThaiFood #BeefLover #thaicomfortfood #supportlocal #toobusytocook #busyparents #wellingtonfood #thaifoodwellington #kineatwellington

description:
Maille Sunday Kai, Escape the winter chill and head along to Cuba St Tavern for some Sunday Kai with Maille Mustard, running every Sunday of August. Each week features a different delectable roast, served with either a Maille Dijon Bloody Mary or warming mulled wine, and finished with a house-made dessert. Sunday has never tasted so good! Bookings available from 1pm.

$50 for 2 courses
$65 for 2 courses inc a Maille Bloody Mary or House made Mulled wine

Menu
Every Maille Sunday Kai event will offer a vegetarian option of eggplant parmigiana with buffalo mozzarella, Maille Dijon mustard, tomato ragù, garlic potato and broccolini.

3 August
Free-range roast porchetta served with garlic potato, creamed spinach, broccolini, Yorkshire pudding, Maille wholegrain mustard jus and apple sauce.
Dessert: Sticky toffee pudding with custard.

10 August
Roast duck breast served with duck fat roast potatoes, Chinese broccoli, mushrooms, Yorkshire pudding, and Maille Dijon mustard and onion cream.
Dessert: Dark chocolate torte with orange mascarpone.

17 August
Conscious Valley roast lamb shoulder with garlic roast potatoes, honey-glazed carrots, minted peas, Yorkshire pudding, Maille wholegrain mustard jus and mint sauce.
Dessert: Bread and butter pudding with ginger gelato and crème anglaise.

24 August
Half a roast chicken with duck fat roast potatoes, garlic green beans, cavolo nero, Yorkshire pudding, chicken schmaltz and Maille mustard gravy.
Dessert: Steamed honey pudding with custard and honey gelato.

31 August
First Light roast sirloin served with honey-glazed carrots, duck fat roast potatoes, cabbage and bacon, Yorkshire pudding, horseradish, Maille Dijon mustard and jus.
Dessert: Chocolate fondant with vanilla bean gelato.
label: Food & Drink

description:
Sconnoisseur, Get ready to master the art of making Wellington's iconic cheese scones at Pravda Café. Widely regarded as the home of the city's best cheese scones, Pravda's creations are so beloved, they often sell out before you can blink. Now, you can learn the secrets behind their mouthwatering scones firsthand.

In this hands-on workshop, you’ll be guided through mixing and preparing your own batch of Pravda’s famous cheese scones. Once your dough is ready, you'll hand them off to be baked to crispy flaky perfection. While they cook, relax with a cup of tea or coffee, and once your scones are ready, you’ll enjoy the fruits of your labour fresh from the oven.

The best part? You’ll get to take home the coveted recipe, allowing you to recreate these legendary scones in your own kitchen whenever you want. This is a perfect opportunity to learn a piece of Wellington’s culinary history and enjoy a deliciously rewarding experience.
label: Food & Drink

description:
Urban Wine Walk | Pōneke Wellington (NZ), ON SALE TIMES
Presale Access - Thursday 11 September, 12pm NZT - Register Here
General Access - Thursday 11 September, 2pm NZT
----
The streets and laneways of Pōneke Wellington are set to come alive this Spring as a line-up of eight venues each play host to an incredible winemaker, who'll be there ready to pour and chat you through an unforgettable afternoon.
HOW IT WORKS
Kick things off at your chosen starting spot with something to eat, and then let the adventure unfold. Wander at your own pace, glass in hand, discovering incredible wines and venues along the way.
With a stellar line-up of winemakers, good vibes at every stop, and a guaranteed sell-out crowd, the Urban Wine Walk is the ultimate self-guided tasting experience you and your crew won’t want to miss!
PARTICIPATING VENUES & WINEMAKERS
1 - Choice Bros Ft. Coney Wines (NZ)
2 - Glou Glou Ft. Halite (NZ)
3 - Little Beer Quarter Ft. Hopes Grove & Aard (NZ)
4 - Lulu Bar Ft. Margrain Vineyard (NZ)
5 - Noble Rot Ft. VALLI (NZ)
6 - Panhead Tory St Ft. The Good Way (NZ)
7 - The Arborist Rooftop Bar Ft. Matawhero (NZ)
8 - The Tasting Room Ft. Tettonica Wines (NZ)
*Please note that traditional venue menus may vary due to the nature of the event.
TICKETS
Vino Lover Pass – $79 + Booking Fee (Limited Availability)
WHAT’S INCLUDED
Wine Tastings – Up to 3 wines per winemaker along the trail
$10 Food Voucher – Redeem at your nominated starting venue (before 1pm)
$25 Wine Voucher – Put towards event-day wine orders (six-pack minimum, participating producers only)
Event Essentials – Your official wristband & keepsake tasting glass
EVENT REGISTRATION & COLLECTION
Before heading to your nominated starting venue, swing by the official registration point to collect your wristband, tasting glass & vouchers.
📍 Where: Panhead Tory St (1 Tory St)
🗓️ When: Saturday 18th October | 11am – 1pm
Please note: The Urban Wine Walk officially runs from 12-4pm. Arrive early to grab your event pack and avoid the rush!
REFUND POLICY
Tickets are non-refundable (we’re all in for good times rain, hail or shine!). The only exception is if the event is cancelled or postponed by the organisers – then we’ve got you covered.
GETTING AROUND
One of the best parts about the Urban Wine Walk...? It’s totally self-guided! After checking in at your nominated starting venue, the day is yours! Wander at your own pace, discover new spots and sip your way through the trail however you like.
**Sorry kids, Urban Wine Walk is strictly 18 Years and Over!
----------

description:
Tītahi Bay Spring Community BBQ, Tītahi Bay Spring Community BBQ
It's (nearly) summer so it's time for a BBQ! Come and join us at 43 Kapiti Crescent (St Matthew's Hall) for a BBQ on the lawn. If it's bad weather, we will move into the hall.

All welcome! Dinner will be served from 5pm; we will make dinner, so just bring yourselves!



FAQ

Who is this for? Can I come along?

Yes absolutely, please come, we would love to have you. This dinner is for all the people who live in the beautiful community of Tītahi Bay!

What if I can't make it until a bit later?

That's all good, we will be serving a rolling dinner from 5 to 6.30pm so come whenever suits you. If you can only come a little later than 6.30pm, we will likely have more than enough so come anyway!

Can I bring my kids along?

Yes! In fact, please bring your kids along. We will have some games in the room and some options for crafts on the tables along with the food.

Do I need to bring anything?

Nope! Just yourselves, all are welcome just as you are.

But I really want to bring something to contribute?

If you would like to bring a salad to contribute to the BBQ, feel free to email us at and we can chat! We really just don't want this to be a barrier to anyone coming along.

Can I help?

Yes absolutely, this is a community event so help is always appreciated. It is also a great time to meet some other people. We will have some tasks for set up and also some for packing down and cleaning up. If you are interested in helping, flick us an email at

Will my dietaries be met?

We will make sure there will be options for these dietaries: vegan, gluten free, dairy free, and nut free.

If you have a dietary that isn't on there, feel free to check and flick us an email.

Can I bring my friend(s) along?

Yes, please bring your friends along, especially if they live in Tītahi Bay!

Who is this hosted by?

This idea is hosted by us, the crew who run Tītahi Bay Anglicans, but it is run with the help of our friends around Tītahi Bay. The hope is that this can become a recurring community event where others can join in on hosting this.

This is at a church, will I be preached to?

No, we promise that this isn't a Tupperware party bait and switch. While we definitely are a church, this event is for the Tītahi Bay community as a whole to be able to come eat together and connect.
label: Food & Drink

description:

Mac 'n' Cheese pop-up! Kaibosh X Everybody Eats collab for Welly On A Plate, We
Mac 'n' Cheese! We
Welly! Celebrate comfort food & community on the last day of winter
where every bowl makes a difference. Kaibosh X EE team up to serve 2,000 bowls of mac 'n' cheese on the final day of Visa Wellington On a Plate. Help us set a record for Welly while enjoying a bowl of the ultimate comfort food
At just $10 per serve, every bowl will help raise funds for Everybody Eats and Kaibosh - two of Wellington’s legendary food rescue and community dining champions. Help us hit our target of 2,000 bowls in one day!
WHEN: Sunday 31 August, 1-8pm (or sold out)
WHERE: 60 Dixon Street (upstairs)
COST: $10 per bowl (pay-what-you-can options available).
Walk-in only, dine-in or takeaway.
Vegan and Gluten Free options available.
Bring your friends, whānau, or the whole flat!
You'll be able to customise your mac 'n' cheese with a range of toppings and flavours which have been made with rescued food, showcasing just how delicious food recovery can be. From rainbow pickles to herby crunchy crumb, extra #FoodRescue flavour bombs to spice up your mac!
As official charity partners of the Wellington On A Plate Festival, Everybody Eats and Kaibosh turn comfort food into real impact for our communities.
We
kai. We
Welly.
Share your
with Welly.
Pay-it-forward to help us share hearty kai with more people in Pōneke: https://donorbox.org/welovemacncheese-donation
Thank you to Fonterra's Doing Good Together programme, PAK'nSAVE Kilbirnie, Harrington's and All Good for supporting us with this event which is a joint fundraiser for our two charities.

description:
Art Flow: Dine & Discover, Join us for another exclusive evening celebrating art and cuisine at DoubleTree by Hilton Wellington. Experience the perfect blend of creative expression and culinary excellence as we bring together the artists behind our successful 'Art Flow' exhibition for an intimate dining experience.

Your evening begins at Grazie Italian restaurant with a welcome drink, followed by a carefully curated three course dinner. Our featured artist, Min Kim, will share insights into her beautiful art and offer a unique perspective on her creative process and inspiration with a live art demonstration between the main course and dessert. The journey continues when you’ll indulge in a dessert presented by Le Cordon Bleu, followed by the demonstrated artwork being auctioned towards the end of the evening. This intimate setting provides the perfect opportunity to engage with Min Kim while enjoying exceptional cuisine followed by a guided tour through our hotel’s art-adorned interior.

Event Details:
- Welcome drink on arrival
- Mix & Mingle – meet Min Kim
- A live art demonstration by Min Kim with the completed artwork being auctioned the same night
- Three-course dinner at Grazie Italian Restaurant with the dessert prepared by Le Cordon Bleu
- Guided art tour with our featured artists

Don't miss this unique opportunity to experience art beyond the canvas and celebrate the intersection of visual and culinary artistry.
label: Food & Drink

description:
Michelin Star to Martinborough, Join celebrated Chef and Union Square owner Adam Newell for a once-in-a-lifetime culinary experience. Take a journey through four decades of his exceptional career, including his Michelin-starred tenure at the renowned Fulham Road Restaurant in London. This exclusive event will offer an intimate exploration of Chef Newell's evolution as a chef and restaurateur, showcasing iconic dishes from four pivotal periods in his career.

Set in the elegant Napoleon dining room inside the historic Martinborough Hotel, each course represents a defining moment in Chef Newell’s career. Paired with fine wines selected by in-house Sommelier Carl Fraser, this evening is designed to be a feast for both the palate and the mind.

Course 1: 1980s – Claridge’s Hotel, London
A taste of the refined sophistication from one of London’s most prestigious hotels.
Course 2: 1990s – Le Gavroche, London
A nod to the classic French techniques that helped shape Chef Newell's early career.
Course 3: 2000s – Zibibbo, Wellington
A celebration of New Zealand’s finest ingredients and a significant step in his culinary journey.
Course 4: 2010s – Union Square Bistro, Martinborough
Reflecting his achievements at Union Square, the course that represents his current culinary vision.

This evening offers guests a unique chance to experience the evolution of one chef's journey through extraordinary dishes paired with wines that elevate each moment.
label: Food & Drink

description:
Mischief Night Murder Mystery Feast with Chef Max Gordy, 30 October, 🎃 Step inside, if you dare... on the eve of Halloween. It's a Mischief Night* full of tricks and frights!
👻 A chilling murder mystery unfolds over a hauntingly good three-course Halloween dinner by Chef Max Gordy.
Gather your cleverest friends... who will crack the case first: the detectives or the villains?
Expect twists, laughter, and a touch of fright, with spot prizes through the night — plus a reward for the best-dressed.
🍽️ Award-winning chef Max Gordy (Graze Wine Bar) will conjure up a frightfully delicious Halloween-themed feast.
🥂 Your ticket includes one complimentary alcoholic beverage (with more available to purchase on the night).
TICKET TYPES
Round up your squad of six to solve the mystery and devour a fiendishly good feast for $666.
Have a frightening four-some? Book a table for $444.
Spooky single seats available for $111... we will seat you at a mystery table for some mischief!
VENUE
60 Dixon Street is up a flight of steep steps – with only one way in.
FUNDRAISING
Every ticket sold helps Kaibosh ensure that no good food is left to die.  
By joining us for this night of spooky fun, you’ll be directly helping us rescue quality surplus kai and get it to those who need it most.
*What is Mischief Night? In parts of Pennsylvania and New Jersey in the eastern USA, 30 October is called “Mischief Night.” The tradition refers to the eve of Halloween in which children and teenagers celebrate the holiday one night early with pranks, tricks and more. While in New England, some call it Cabbage Night...
Join us to experience Chef Max Gordy's culinary take on Mischief Night in Pōneke!
label: Food & Drink

description:
5 Course Dinner at Le Cordon Bleu | 6 SEPTEMBER 2025, This 5-Course dinner expertly prepared by our Intermediate Cuisine & Diplôme Avancé Culinaire students is not to be missed.
Ticket Information

Date: Saturday 6th September
(We are hosting additional dinner sessions, to purchase tickets for these events please click here and select your chosen date. Tickets are non-transferable, please ensure you purchase tickets for the correct date.)
Price: $99 per person
Booking Times: 5:30pm | 6:00pm | 6:30pm | 7:00pm
Matched Wine Option: If you would like to add matched wines to your dining experience you can do so on the day by paying an additional charge. Alternatively, we have a selection of wines to purchase by the glass or bottle as well as beers and soft drinks. We are a fully licensed restaurant and do not offer BYO.
Dietary Requirements: Our menu is set and we are unable to make any menu alterations or cater to any specific dietary requirements (including religious diets) or food allergies. We apologise for any inconvenience this may cause.
The Menu: will not be released before the event. Please be aware that the menu will include fish, meat and shellfish components.
Tickets are allocated for specific seating times, please ensure you arrive promptly at the time indicated on your ticket.
The estimated time to enjoy the full Le Cordon Bleu 5 course dining experience is 2 hours. We invite you to sit back, relax and enjoy our students' creations.
What is Brasserie Le Cordon Bleu?
Brasserie Le Cordon Bleu is our training restaurant where our students get practical experience in a real restaurant environment - all under the expert guidance of their chef lecturers. In the kitchen, we have students from our Diplôme de Cuisine programme. In the dining room we have our Bachelor of Culinary Arts and Business students serving you and putting their theory skills into practice.
Brasserie & High Tea Refund Policy

description:
Macaron Masterclass, MACARON MASTERCLASS
Presented by Le Ciel Bakery
Whisk, pipe, and finesse your way to perfect Parisian macarons

Join us for a hands-on masterclass where you’ll learn the secrets to mastering this delicate French treat — from glossy meringue to flawless feet. Led by Chef Shuchi Bhardwaj, this is your golden ticket to boujee baking greatness.

- Create & take home your own box of beautifully filled macarons
- Learn foolproof techniques, flavour infusions, and piping styles
- Start your evening with a complimentary glass of bubbles and a decadent Black Forest cake for two—because love (and baking) should always begin on a sweet note.

What you’ll learn:
- Mastering macaronage & piping flawless heart shapes
- Avoiding common meringue mishaps

description:
Urban Wine Walk - Pōneke Wellington, The streets and laneways of Pōneke Wellington are set to come alive this Spring as a line-up of eight venues each play host to an incredible winemaker, who'll be there ready to pour and chat you through an unforgettable afternoon.


HOW IT WORKS
Kick things off at your chosen starting spot with something to eat, and then let the adventure unfold. Wander at your own pace, glass in hand, discovering incredible wines and venues along the way.

With a stellar line-up of winemakers, good vibes at every stop, and a guaranteed sell-out crowd, the Urban Wine Walk is the ultimate self-guided tasting experience you and your crew won’t want to miss!


PARTICIPATING VENUES & WINEMAKERS
1 - Choice Bros Ft. Coney Wines (NZ)
2 - Glou Glou Ft. Halite (NZ)
3 - Little Beer Quarter Ft. Hopes Grove & Aard (NZ)
4 - Lulu Bar Ft. Margrain Vineyard (NZ)
5 - Noble Rot Ft. VALLI (NZ)
6 - Panhead Tory St Ft. The Good Way (NZ)
7 - The Arborist Rooftop Bar Ft. Matawhero (NZ)
8 - The Tasting Room Ft. Tettonica Wines (NZ)

*Please note that traditional venue menus may vary due to the nature of the event.


TICKETS
Vino Lover Pass – $79 + Booking Fee (Limited Availability)

WHAT’S INCLUDED
Wine Tastings – Up to 3 wines per winemaker along the trail
$10 Food Voucher – Redeem at your nominated starting venue (before 1pm)
$25 Wine Voucher – Put towards event-day wine orders (six-pack minimum, participating producers only)
Event Essentials – Your official wristband & keepsake tasting glass


EVENT REGISTRATION & COLLECTION
Before heading to your nominated starting venue, swing by the official registration point to collect your wristband, tasting glass & vouchers.

Where: Panhead Tory St (1 Tory St)
When: Saturday 18th October | 11am – 1pm

Please note: The Urban Wine Walk officially runs from 12-4pm. Arrive early to grab your event pack and avoid the rush!


REFUND POLICY
Tickets are non-refundable (we’re all in for good times rain, hail or shine!). The only exception is if the event is cancelled or postponed by the organisers – then we’ve got you covered.


GETTING AROUND
One of the best parts about the Urban Wine Walk...? It’s totally self-guided! After checking in at your nominated starting venue, the day is yours! Wander at your own pace, discover new spots and sip your way through the trail however you like.


Sorry kids, Urban Wine Walk is strictly 18 Years and Over!


----------

description:
Club Tropicana, This August, Beach Babylon becomes Club Tropicana, a retro, romantic escape inspired by 1960s tropical honeymoons, classic tiki bars and vintage beach glamour. Picture golden sunsets, flamingos, thatched umbrellas and the carefree buzz of a sun-soaked getaway, right in the heart of Wellington. No passport required.

The menu is vibrant and full of escapist flair. Start with coconut prawns and banana blossom kokoda, then dive into mains like mango glazed  pork rib rack or the tropical tofu paneer curry. Save room for dessert: pineapple upside-down pudding or a coconut rum fondue to bring the tropical fantasy to a sweet finale. Behind the bar, the tiki and kava-spiked cocktails flow freely, from Blue Hawaiian’s to retro rum punches, all dressed to impress with flamingo stirrers, umbrellas and tropical garnishes.

A golden-age soundtrack sets the mood, featuring the smooth calypso of Harry Belafonte, beachy vibes from The Beach Boys, and sun-drenched classics by Astrud Gilberto.

Club Tropicana is a winter getaway, fun and fabulously over the top.

description:
Aurora Distillery Gin Experience, Create, make and take home your own gin with us at our Gin Experience sessions at our beautiful Wairarapa site, just 10 minutes from Martinborough. Our experienced distillery staff are on hand throughout to guide you through the process and give as much or as little advice as you want. We have hundreds of satisfied customers who have made some really exciting gins.

You’ll begin by foraging in the distillery gardens then we move to the gin-making room to learn about the gin making process and the ingredients involved. You’ll sample loads of botanicals then you will choose what you want to put in your very own gin recipe. After weighing out your recipe, you’ll move to your very own still and begin distilling!

While your gin is distilling, we’ll do a gin tasting of some of our own Arrival brand gins and some surprises from our other spirits.

At the end of the session you’ll bottle and seal your own 500ml bottle of gin to take home!

Please note each Experience attendee must have their own ticket. To ensure all participants have a great time and get our full attention we cannot accept spectators.

description:
NZIFF: Lesbian Space Princess, Set in a gay-laxy far, far away this crowd pleasing and proudly queer Aussie adult animation delights with its vivid, candy-coloured palette, kinky sense of humour and catchy, upbeat musical numbers.

Dumped on her 23rd birthday for being too clingy, anxious Princess Saira (Shabana Azeez) may yet again endure the humiliation of standing in the Singles Zone at the annual Lesbian Ball. The young space princess has led a sheltered life and even holds the title of Most Boring Royal in the History of Clitopolis, where she lives with her glamorous Queen mums. But when a trio of Straight White Maliens kidnaps her ex, Kiki (Bernie Van Tiel), Saira must leave the safety of gay space to rescue her by bringing the Maliens the most powerful weapon known to lesbian kind, the Royal Labrys. However, there is a slight problem… she doesn’t have it.

Travelling in a bigoted spaceship from the 21st century, Saira’s inter-gay-lactic quest is a laugh-out-loud, kinky adventure.

Fans of Adventure Time and Steven Universe will adore the vibrant animation and captivating characters in this rip-roaring debut feature, which won top LGBTQIA+ honours at Berlin this year. — Madison Marshall

description:
Terror-Fi Presents: THE TOXIC AVENGER (NZ Premiere - Wellington), Be the first in New Zealand to see THE TOXIC AVENGER, starring Peter Dinklage, Kevin Bacon, and our favourite adopted Kiwi Elijah Wood.
Comically violent, absurdly gory, and extremely entertaining ... Toxie is the radioactive antidote to superhero fatigue. 92% on Rotten Tomatoes and not to be missed on the big screen – especially as it almost didn’t make it to our cinemas!
“When a downtrodden janitor, Winston Gooze, is exposed to a catastrophic toxic accident, he’s transformed into a new kind of hero: The Toxic Avenger. Now, Toxie must rise from outcast to saviour, taking on ruthless corporate overlords and corrupt forces who threaten his son, his friends, and his community. In a world where greed runs rampant … justice is best served radioactive.”

description:
NZIFF: Dreams (Sex Love), A teenage girl recounts her crush for her teacher through the pages of a memoir. The winner of the Golden Bear 2025 is a lucid and tender chronicle of the unforgettable experience of first love.

Originally intended as the second chapter in his trilogy and released in Norway as such, Dag Johan Haugerud’s Dreams ended up premiering internationally as the last. But it secured a fitting crown to the trilogy, by winning the Best Film at the 2025 Berlinale, thus inducting Haugerud among world class auteurs.

Dreams emanates from two of Haugerud’s passions: literature, as he first gained prominence in his homeland as writer, and the cinema of French master Éric Rohmer, distinguished by sentimental skirmishes brimful of finely written dialogues.

The film’s protagonist and narrator is Johanne, a 17-year-old student who falls for her new French teacher Johanna. Johanne manages to get close to her crush, who nonchalantly ignores how her student’s devotion is veering into affection. Yet, this chronicle of first love is told in a voice over reflecting the memoir that Johanne wrote on her experience – meaning that things may or may not have happened as she says. The memoir is also read by the girl’s mother and grandmother who muse on the girl’s literary talent and provide a layer of irony and melancholy to an unfathomably lucid and tender chronicle of the universal and unforgettable experience of first love. — Paolo Bertolin
label: Film & Media

description:
NZIFF: War Stories Our Mothers Never Told Us, Seven women reflect on the emotional cataclysm of World War II in Dame Gaylene Preston’s landmark contribution to the collective memory of Aotearoa, which has lost none of its raw power on its 30th anniversary.

When young New Zealanders were mobilised as soldiers and sent across the globe to join the frontlines of Britain’s fight against Nazi Germany, the turbulence of the Second World War travelled back into South Pacific living rooms. Distance and death became everyday realities for Kiwis at home – and caused griefs that were at times taboo and suppressed.

Dame Gaylene Preston frames seven women, including her own mother, against a black background that creates a stage for their candid, unadorned and surprisingly intimate wartime recollections, as they look back from the 90s in interviews conducted by oral historian Judith Fyfe. The acclaimed documentary, which combines these shared testimonies with personal photographs and newsreel clips, conveys the immense pressure to conform to the value of stoic sacrifice for the cause under the scrutinising eye of neighbours, and reveals lesser-seen layers of resilience.

Marriages in the first flush of romance were cut short, pregnancies were navigated alone, conscientious objectors were met with ostracisation and American servicemen scorned, in a nation united around support of their boys in combat overseas – a state of affairs in which women were often granted little voice, as they took on more labour, and absorbed life-changing losses. — Carmen Gray
label: Film & Media

description:
Wellington Timebank fundraiser screening of Tinā, Wellington Timebank fundraiser screening of Tinā
Get your tickets here - https://events.humanitix.com/wtb-fundraiser-screening-of-tina

Join us for this special screening of this award winning Aotearoa-made film - Tinā (2024). If you missed it in the cinemas the first time round, you can now watch it from the comfort of the Newtown Community Centre!

Doors open at 5pm
Film starts at 6pm (running time is 2 hours 4 minutes)

Tickets are just $25 waged / $20 unwaged (all tickets include snacks) and proceeds go toward keeping your Timebank in operation.

About the film:
Award-winning writer/director Miki Magasiva (The Panthers, We Are Still Here) makes his feature debut with Tinā (Samoan for "mother"). Samoan music teacher Mareta (Anapela Polataivao) is plunged into grief after losing her daughter in the Christchurch quakes. Mareta takes a relieving role at an elite private school, where she inspires her students to perform at a big choral competition. In the trailer Mareta faces a condescending interview at Saint Francis, and her growing relationship with "spoiled, rich kids" annoys a family member. Tinā was chosen to open the 2024 Hawai’i International Film Festival.

The Guardian says "It’s a big-hearted tear-jerker about the power of art – and it’s already breaking records in its home country, where it’s received the widest-ever release for a local film and become the sixth-highest grossing New Zealand film of all time."

This film is rated M (contains violence, offensive language and suicide references).

Halloween Film Night 2025

Get ready for a night of cinematic chills and festive frights! Since 2022, Film Talks’ Halloween Film Night has brought Wairarapa audiences together to celebrate classic horror in a fun, immersive atmosphere.

This year, join us on Halloween night for James Whale’s masterpiece, The Bride of Frankenstein (1935). Widely regarded as one of the greatest horror films ever made, it combines unforgettable imagery, Gothic atmosphere, and a surprising touch of dark humour.

Doors open at 6:45 pm, and the movie begins at 7 pm at Aratoi, 12 Bruce Street, Masterton. Running time: 75 minutes.

Costumes encouraged! Spot prizes will be awarded for the best dressed, adding to the spirit of the night. Bring friends, family, or come on your own and join a community of film lovers for playful scares, shared laughs, and a celebration of classic cinema.

description:
War on Drugs Film Screening, In remembrance of the victims of human rights violations and extrajudicial killings during the War on Drugs in the Philippines, please join us for a free/koha screening of "On the President's Orders" documentary in Te Whanganui-a-Tara.

NOTE: For a list of trigger warnings, please see this document. Since we will be viewing and discussing potentially sensitive topics, the event will have an Open Door Policy, which means that you may leave the venue any time, for any reason, and will not be judged for doing so.
WHAT IS THE WAR ON DRUGS?
Spearheaded by the former Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte, the War on Drugs is a violent anti-drug campaign which killed nearly 30,000 Filipinos, most of which were urban poor (Karapatan, Amnesty International, Human Rights Watch).
WHAT ARE EXTRAJUDICIAL KILLINGS?
"Extrajudicial killings, or extrajudicial executions, happen when someone in an official position deliberately kills a person without any legal process" (World Organisation Against Torture).
WHY IS IT IMPORTANT TO TALK ABOUT TODAY?
Human rights violations and extrajudicial killings are still on-going in the Philippines under President Bongbong Marcos, the son of the dictator Ferdinand Marcos Sr. who proclaimed Martial Law in 1972, and Vice President Sara Duterte, the daughter of former President Rodrigo Duterte (Karapatan).
WHY WOULD I WANT TO JOIN THE FILM SCREENING?
The film screening is for anyone who is keen to learn about the War on Drugs, wants to share their experience during the War on Drugs (or something similar) through group discussion, wants to meet new people, wants to watch a Philippine film/documentary, or just wants to have snacks.
I WANT TO JOIN BUT I'M FROM TĀMAKI MAKAURAU / CHRISTCHURCH / THE PHILIPPINES.
We will stream the film through Zoom for viewers outside Te Whanganui-a-Tara, however, there may be internet and other technical difficulties during the event itself. Also please make sure to select the "Online" ticket option when RSVPing.
HOW MUCH IS THE TICKET?
The film screening is free but we appreciate koha for the venue/snacks/donations to Philippine non-governmental organisations (NGOs).
NOTE: This is an LGBTQ+ friendly event.
label: Film & Media

description:

Directed by Joe Johnston
Starring Robin Williams, Kirsten Dunst, Bonnie Hunt
30th Anniversary

While exploring an old mansion, the youngsters find a curious, jungle-themed game called Jumanji in the attic. When they start playing, they free Alan Parrish (Robin Williams), who's been stuck in the game's inner world for decades. If they win Jumanji, the kids can free Alan for good -- but that means braving giant bugs, ill-mannered monkeys and even stampeding rhinos! ---
